Holding the ⚒ Use / Attack button after use directs the projectile's general path, although it also continuously moves on its own and ricochets off blocks. As such, it may require a little practice to be used properly. The Flying Knife has a 1/4 (25%) chance of being dropped by Hallowed Mimics.

Its best modifier is Godly or Demonic. Both modifiers increase the average damage output by the same amount. However, Ruthless might be preferred if the player already has very high critical strike chance. However, the bonus knockback granted by the Godly modifier is not always beneficial and makes it tricky to damage the same targets. For example, the knife will not necessarily be knocking enemies away from the player. Alternatively, modifiers that reduce knockback (the best being Ruthless) can be beneficial, reducing the distance enemies are knocked away from the cursor.
The Broken Bat Wing is a rare Hardmode crafting material used solely to craft Bat Wings. It has a 1/40 (2.5%) chance of being dropped by Vampires during a Solar Eclipse.

The Sailor set is a Hardmode vanity set that includes the Sailor Hat, Sailor Shirt and the Sailor Pants. All three pieces can be dropped by the Pirate Corsair, Pirate Deckhand, Pirate Deadeye, and the Pirate Crossbower with a chance of 1/500 (0.2%) for any piece.
These items are to be equipped in the Social Slots as they only provide a visual appearance.

Arrows are a form of ammunition fired from a bow or repeater. Most arrows are crafted, but some can be dropped from enemies, purchased from NPCs, or found in Chests and Pots. Like with all other automatically consumed items, the type of arrow to use is determined by its position in the inventory : Top-left is the highest, bottom-right the lowest rank.

Fruit Juice is a food item that grants the Well Fed buff when consumed. This lasts for 15 minutes, but can be canceled at any time  by right-clicking the icon,  by selecting the icon using Cycle Next/Previous Buff and then pressing Remove Buff, or  by double-tapping the buff icon.
Fruit Juice can be crafted from any variety of fruit, making it a viable source of food early on.
Like all other food items, the Fruit Juice can be placed on a Plate :

The Orichalcum Chainsaw is a Hardmode chainsaw that is obtainable after crafting a Mythril Anvil or an Orichalcum Anvil, and is the chainsaw alternative to the Orichalcum Waraxe. Along with its slightly weaker alternate the Mythril Chainsaw, it is stronger than the Cobalt or Palladium Chainsaw but weaker than the Adamantite or Titanium Chainsaw which can be obtained later. Like all axes and chainsaws, it is used to cut down trees, cacti and giant glowing mushrooms.

Its best modifier is Godly or Demonic. Both modifiers increase the average damage output by the same amount. However, Ruthless might be preferred if the player already has very high critical strike chance.

The Band of Regeneration is an accessory that can be found in Gold Chests in the Underground and Cavern biomes and in Living Mahogany Trees in the Underground Jungle. When equipped, it regenerates (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) 1 / (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) 0.5 health every second. This effect stacks with the player's natural health regeneration, but unlike the natural regeneration, does not slow or stop when the player is moving or being attacked.

The Black Slime is a variety of slime that only spawns in the Cavern layer. When a Black Slime attacks, it has a chance to inflict the Darkness debuff, which decreases the radius that light sources will illuminate, making it more difficult to see.
Like most other slimes, the Black Slime will be passive towards any player with the Royal Gel (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) accessory equipped.
On Desktop, Console, Mobile, and 3DS, they can rarely be found carrying bonus drops, which the player receives upon the slime's death.

Jungle Spores are crafting materials acquired by destroying green glowing orbs that grow randomly on Jungle grass in the Underground Jungle, in or below the Cavern layer. Each orb drops 2-3 Jungle Spores. Harvested Jungle Spores cannot be replanted.
Crafting all items requires a total of (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) 122 / (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) 62 Jungle Spores.

Luminite Pickaxes are four Hardmode, post- Moon Lord endgame pickaxes. The four types are the Solar Flare Pickaxe, the Vortex Pickaxe, the Nebula Pickaxe and the Stardust Pickaxe. All types of Luminite pickaxes share the same stats. They are the alternate versions of the Luminite Drills, having a slower mining speed but longer range and benefiting from mining speed bonuses.

These four pickaxes are the second-strongest mining tool in the game, each with 225% pickaxe power. The current strongest is the Laser Drill with 230% pickaxe power. They require Luminite and Lunar Fragments to craft, obtainable from the Moon Lord and Celestial Towers, respectively.
Their best modifier is Legendary. However, due to rounding, Legendary, Light, Deadly, Agile, Quick, and Nasty provide equal boosts to mining speed for these tools.

The Oasis Crate is a pre-Hardmode crate that can only be fished in the Desert biome. Oasis Crates contain items found in standard crates, and always contain one item normally found in a Sandstone Chest in the Underground Desert. It has a texture resembling that of the Ancient set. Its Hardmode counterpart is the Mirage Crate.

The Key of Light is a craftable item which spawns a Hallowed Mimic when placed in any slot of any empty Chest. The world must be in Hardmode and the only item inside the Chest must be a single Key of Light.
The Hallowed Mimic is spawned as soon as the Chest is closed, consuming both the Key of Light and the Chest.

The Radar is an informational accessory which displays the number of nearby enemies in a 125-tile radius around the player. The Radar has a 1/10 (10%) chance of being obtained from looting regular Chests found on or near the surface, or a 1/100 (1%) chance from Wooden and Pearlwood Crates obtained via fishing. The Radar can also be purchased from the Skeleton Merchant during a Waxing Gibbous for 2 GC 50 SC.

The Radar is one of the three parts necessary to make the R.E.K. 3000, with the others being the Tally Counter and the Lifeform Analyzer, and as such is a required ingredient in crafting the Shellphone.
The Iron Broadsword is an early game metal broadsword. Its alternate ore counterpart is the Lead Broadsword.
Like all broadswords, this sword is swung in an arc motion, which is more useful for killing flying and jumping enemies than shortswords.
Its best modifier is Legendary.
Gem Bunnies are harmless critters that can only spawn in the cavern layer, and have a higher spawn chance during rain.
Gem Bunnies have only 5 health and no defense, and can be damaged by other enemies and players.

Gem Bunnies can be caught with any Bug Net to be carried around in the inventory and released later, or crafted into animated decorative furniture (Gem Bunny Cages). Once crafted, the Gem Bunnies cannot be released again, unless the furniture item is de-crafted via Shimmer (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions).
Star Royale Brick Wall is a type of background wall crafted from Star Royale Bricks.

The Tesla Turret is a Hardmode enemy found only during the Martian Madness event. It is built by Martian Engineers and is completely immobile. Every three seconds, it will fire an Electric Bolt at the player, which has a 2/3 (66.67%) chance to inflict the Electrified debuff for 5 seconds. The Tesla Turret will continue to stay in place until it is destroyed by the player.

The Pink Horseshoe Balloon is an accessory that grants immunity to fall damage, increases jump height by 33% and jump speed by 30%, grants a double jump, and grants +0.05 luck. The height of the first jump is increased from 6 blocks to 10.5 blocks (~75% increase), while the double jump's height is increased from 7 blocks to 13 blocks, reaching a total of 23.5 blocks with both jumps.
Jump height is oddly reduced when underwater, reducing total underwater jump height from 17.5 blocks (8 blocks + 9½ blocks from Tsunami jump) to 15 blocks (7 blocks + 8 blocks from Tsunami jump).

The Spore Sac is a Hardmode, post- Plantera accessory that continuously spawns multiple stationary floating spores around the player that act as homing mines. When an enemy comes within range, they slowly swarm the enemy and cause small explosions on contact, dealing 70 classless damage. Spores have the ability to pass through blocks to reach enemies and will inflict the Poisoned debuff for 5-10 seconds. They have a small area of effect that can hit multiple targets. The Spore Sac is always dropped from Plantera 's Treasure Bag in Expert Mode.

Spores can only spawn near blocks, or on background walls, that are up to 25 tiles away from the player. Each spore fades after 20 seconds and is replaced by a new one while a valid area exists in range. Flying in open areas (eg. via Wings or Mounts) with no walls or blocks in range will not result in any spores spawned. When spawning near blocks, with no background walls, only a single layer of spores spawns, floating within about 3 tiles of the blocks. On background walls, spores can spawn anywhere in mid-air.

The Herb Bag is a consumable grab bag item, which when opened with ⚷ Open / Activate from within the player's inventory, contains 2-5 different herbs and herb seeds in stacks of 2-8. Herb Bags can be found in Chests on the surface.
Kites are miscellaneous novelty items that can be held by the player.

A kite can be flown during Windy Days or if the player runs fast enough while holding it. It can be raised higher with ⚒ Use / Attack and lowered with ⚷ Open / Activate. Lowering a kite back to the player will make them put it away.
There are 24 different kites, either dropped by certain enemies on Windy Days or purchased from NPCs.

Water fountains are mechanisms that change the color of all nearby water. They can be activated via ⚷ Open / Activate or wire. There are currently (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) 10 / (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) 8 different obtainable fountains, all of which are purchased from the Witch Doctor for 4 GC each at any time. On the Old-gen console version and Nintendo 3DS versions, they are able to be purchased for free, but are only available after Plantera has been defeated. (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) The range of a Fountain is (when measured from the edges of the sprite) 60 tiles left, 53 tiles up, 60 tiles right, and 53 tiles down.

The Weapon Rack is a furniture item that can be placed on background walls. By pressing the ⚷ Open / Activate button on it, a player can mount any weapon -type item for display, including damage-dealing tools.

Displayed items are oriented the same way the rack was placed, and large item graphics may be resized to fit on it. A pickaxe or drill will remove the displayed item before freeing the Weapon Rack itself.

The Phantasm is a Hardmode, post- Lunatic Cultist bow that auto-fires four arrows at once, while only consuming a single arrow from the player's inventory. Arrows are loosely grouped and can fire with varied velocities and ranges (similar to the Chlorophyte Shotbow). Constantly shooting with the Phantasm will gradually increase its fire rate from once per 24 ticks up to once per 18 ticks, regardless of use time, meaning that the Phantasm does not benefit from speed bonuses. Stopping the attack or switching to another item will reset this effect immediately, making switching weapons inefficient.

In addition, each successful hit on an enemy causes three Phantasm Arrow projectiles to fire and home in on the target that was hit initially, each one dealing 30% of the original projectile's damage, without any additional ammo or mana cost. The rate of fire of these projectiles depends on the current rate of fire of the Phantasm. The Phamtasm also has a 2/3 (66.67%) chance of not consuming ammunition.
Its best modifier is Unreal. Since it does not benefit from speed modifiers, Godly and Demonic provide the same DPS bonus as Unreal. However, Unreal still has the velocity bonus.

Skiphs' set are vanity developer items that can be obtained rarely (5% chance) from Treasure Bags dropped from Hardmode bosses (except Queen Slime 's). It is the vanity set made for Skiphs, one of the programmers who develops Terraria and its official website.
These items are to be equipped in the Social Slots as they only provide a visual appearance.
Skiphs' equipment also includes these non-vanity items, which will drop in addition to his clothing set:
Skiphs' Paws Skiphs' Blood
The Ash Wood Bow is a pre-Hardmode bow. It is an alternate version of the Wooden Bow crafted using Ash Wood.
Its best modifier is Demonic, as it does not have any knockback and thus cannot get modifiers that affect it.
Damage reduction is a hidden player statistic that decreases damage taken. All boosts (except Warmth Potion) affect damage taken after defense.

The Hoplite is a pre-Hardmode enemy that spawns in Marble Caves. It throws piercing Javelins at the player, which deals immense damage, especially in Expert Mode or Master Mode. The Javelins they throw are also fairly accurate and are more likely to hit the player than most other enemy-fired projectiles. This makes the Hoplite an enemy to avoid early on in the game until players are properly equipped and ready to face them.

The Fairy Glowstick is a consumable light source sold by the Zoologist for 75 CC when all three fairies have been recorded in the Bestiary. The Fairy Glowstick functions like a regular Glowstick when thrown. However, upon colliding with solid blocks, it will hover to a maximum of approximately 7 tiles above where it had landed.
The Fairy Glowstick provides more illumination compared to a regular Glowstick while in liquids.

The Brain in a Jar is a pet-summoning item that spawns a Spider Brain pet, a miniature version of the Brain of Cthulhu, to follow the player around. The Brain in a Jar has a 1/4 (25%) of being dropped by the Brain of Cthulhu in Master Mode.

The Lesser Healing Potion is a recovery potion that restores 50 health and inflicts Potion Sickness for 60 seconds when used. This duration can be reduced via the Philosopher's Stone or Charm of Myths. As its name suggests, it heals the least amount of health out of the four healing potions.

In addition to being crafted, Lesser Healing Potions can also be found naturally in pots (only in pre-Hardmode), generated chests, Wooden and Pearlwood Crates, or dropped from most early pre-Hardmode bosses.
Lesser Healing Potions can also be purchased for 3 SC from the Merchant, or from the Skeleton Merchant (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) during moon phases 2, 4, 6, and 8:

Naturally-placed Lesser Healing Potions appear frequently on platforms in the Dungeon (along with Lesser Mana Potions). When encountered in placed form, they function as Placed Bottle crafting stations. They also show the "bottle" tooltip on the map. They can be freed with a pickaxe or ⚷ Open / Activate and retrieved, (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) and can be placed by the player by crafting them into Decorative Healing Potions.
It is the first tier of healing potion, preceding the Healing Potion, Greater Healing Potion, and Super Healing Potion (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions).

The Poisoned Knife is a consumable ranged weapon that has a 1/2 (50%) chance to inflict the Poisoned debuff. It otherwise behaves exactly like the Throwing Knife, except for having slightly better stats overall and auto-use. It can pierce up to 1 target, hitting a total of 2 targets.
The High Velocity Bullet is a type of bullet obtainable after at least one mechanical boss has been defeated. It is the fastest-traveling bullet in the game.

On the Desktop version, Console version, and Mobile version, the High Velocity Bullet can pierce up to 2 targets, hitting a total of 3 targets. The damage of the High Velocity Bullet decreases by 15% for each target it pierces.
The cost of a stack of 50 High Velocity Bullets is 9 SC 50 CC, which is 19 CC per bullet. The cost of crafting 1000 High Velocity Bullets (20 stacks of 50) is 1 GC 90 SC.

The Excalibur is a Hardmode sword which is capable of autoswing and can be crafted with Hallowed Bars. When swung, it emits yellow light particles typical of the Hallowed theme. It can be upgraded into the True Excalibur.

The sword has a large aura of bright yellow energy around the blade when swung, which significantly increases the range at which the weapon can deal damage to enemies, including coverage behind the player. If an enemy is struck by the blade or its aura, a yellow flash is created.
Its best modifier is Legendary.

The Chlorophyte Chainsaw is a Hardmode chainsaw that is crafted from Chlorophyte Bars, and is the chainsaw alternative to the Chlorophyte Greataxe. Like all axes and chainsaws, it is used to cut down trees, cacti and giant glowing mushrooms.

Its best modifier is Godly or Demonic. Both modifiers increase the average damage output by the same amount. However, Ruthless might be preferred if the player already has very high critical strike chance.

The Iridescent Brick Wall is a type of background wall which can be found naturally generated in Jungle Shrines in some worlds. It drops as an item when destroyed, and can also be obtained via crafting. It is always considered a safe wall.
Iridescent Brick Walls reflect the color of the light that they are lit with.
The Soaring Insignia is a Hardmode, post- Plantera accessory that boosts the player's flight and movement abilities. It has the following effects:
Increases acceleration by 75%, from 0.3 tiles/second² to 0.525 tiles/second², grants infinite flight time, and increases jump speed by 1.8 Increases movement speed by 7.5%

Additionally, it increases flight ascent speed with wings or Rocket Boots. With the Soaring Insignia equipped, the player will reach maximum movement speed much quicker and will be able to stop, change directions, and go from flying upwards to falling or vice versa very quickly. The Soaring Insignia is always dropped from the Empress of Light 's Treasure Bag in Expert Mode.

Living Trees are large tree-shaped structures generated at world creation. Unlike regular trees, Living Trees are constructed from solid foreground Living Wood and Leaf Blocks, rather than being background objects that characters can pass through.

Living Trees are very large and often (but not always) contain an internal, vertical tunnel structure which leads down to a "treasure room", which contains Living Tree-themed furniture and a Living Wood Chest, all of which can be looted. The chest can contain either a Living Wood Wand (for placing Living Wood), a Leaf Wand (for placing Leaf Blocks), or a Living Loom (for crafting Living Wood furniture).

On the Desktop version, Console version, and Mobile version, Living Trees have larger and rounder tops and can generate in groups （see Generation section for details). They also have horizontal tunnels that can connect to other trees or lead outside of them. Chests can be generated inside these tunnels. The treasure room will be located underneath one of the trees, and contain a Living Loom instead of a Living Wood Table. The entrance to their internal tunnels are enclosed, requiring a pickaxe to enter them. Gnomes can also be found more often within Living Trees.
(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) Smaller, Living Mahogany Trees are found deep in the Underground Jungle. They are always hollow with an Ivy Chest at their base, containing Jungle Shrine items.

Ambrosia is a permanent booster item that permanently increases the player's mining, tile, and wall placement speed by 5%. It can only be used once per player and is obtained by throwing any type of fruit into Shimmer.
The Sail is a type of background wall purchased from the Pirate for 50 CC each. It is considered a valid wall for housing.

The Fossil Pickaxe is a pickaxe crafted from Sturdy Fossils found in the Underground Desert. It can mine ores up to Demonite Ore and Crimtane Ore. It is slightly faster than both the Gold Pickaxe and Platinum Pickaxe in terms of mining speed.
Its best modifier is Light for harvesting purposes and Legendary for combat purposes.
The Gold Squirrel is a harmless critter. It is a golden recolor of the ordinary Squirrel, with a 1/400 (0.25%) chance of spawning in place of the ordinary version.
The Gold Squirrel has only 5 health and no defense, and can be damaged by other enemies and players.

The Gold Squirrel can be caught with any Bug Net to be carried around in the inventory and released later, or crafted into animated decorative furniture (Gold Squirrel Cage). Once crafted, the Gold Squirrel cannot be released again, unless the furniture item is de-crafted via Shimmer (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions). The Gold Squirrel itself or the crafted furniture can be sold for 10 GC.
It is one of the few entities that can be detected by the Lifeform Analyzer or its upgrades.

The Mouse is a critter that spawns in the Underground and Cavern layers. Its small size and speed can make it difficult to spot even in well-lit conditions, although it occasionally squeaks. The Mouse has only 5 health and no defense, and can only be damaged by players.

The Mouse can be caught with any Bug Net to be carried around in the inventory and released later, or crafted into animated decorative furniture (Mouse Cage). Once crafted, the Mouse cannot be released again, unless the furniture item is de-crafted via Shimmer (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions).
The Mouse can be spawned by the Mouse Statue, however statue-spawned critters cannot be caught with any Bug Net, and will disappear in a puff of smoke when the player attempts to do so.
On the Desktop version, Console version, and Mobile version, there is a 1/400 (0.25%) chance for a Gold Mouse to spawn in place of an ordinary one.

Bouncy Dynamite is the opposite of Sticky Dynamite, and will bounce much more than ordinary Dynamite before it explodes. Its bouncing makes it much more difficult to hit specific enemies or tiles in contrast to Sticky Dynamite, but if utilized correctly, can be used to hit targets much farther away.
Bouncy Dynamite has the same explosive properties as Dynamite, and also has the same use time and throw distance (not including bounces).
A world in Terraria is divided into five layers, each appearing at different depths, or elevations. Each layer has its own characteristics, and most layers contain multiple biomes.
Depth can be determined via a Depth Meter or any of its derivative accessories:

On the Desktop version, Console version, and Mobile version, depth is measured in feet, with one tile equaling two feet. On the Old-gen console version, depth is measured in meters, with two tiles equaling one meter. On the Nintendo 3DS version, depth cannot be measured, as informational tools are not available.

The Depth Meter numbers feet or meters above Level Surface, then feet or meters below Level Surface. Each reading includes a layer name: Space, Surface, Level Surface, Underground, Caverns, and Underworld. The range of numbers depends on platform, world size, and the randomized world generation of each world.

The Spider Staff is a Hardmode summon weapon that spawns a Spider minion that follows the player and attacks by latching on to enemies. If enough of them attack the same enemy, it can be stun-locked. The spiders inflict the Acid Venom debuff for 2-4 seconds, can climb background walls, and jump high. Like other minions, the summoned Spider is invincible and follows the player until they die, summon a replacement minion, cancel the buff, or leave the world.

Its best modifier is Ruthless. The Mythical modifier provides the widest array of stat bonuses, but these primarily affect the initial summon rather than the resulting minion. Additionally, minions cannot deal critical hits. The only lasting advantage a Mythical Spider Staff has over a Ruthless one is knockback.

The Demon Heart is a Hardmode permanent booster item that permanently grants the player an extra accessory slot, for use only within Expert and Master Mode worlds. This effect does not stack and may only be used once per player. The Demon Heart is always dropped from the Wall of Flesh 's Treasure Bag in Expert Mode. If a player opens the Wall of Flesh's Treasure Bag after they have already consumed a Demon Heart, another one will not be obtained.

When a player who consumed a Demon Heart is in a Classic Mode world (a non-Expert or Master world), the extra accessory slot is disabled, removing all functional or display effects from any items equipped in the slot, and darkening the slot itself. Players in Classic worlds are also prevented from equipping items in the sixth or seventh slot, though an equipped item in the slot may still be taken out, and placed back into the inventory.

The Biome Sight Potion is a buff potion which grants the Biome Sight buff when consumed. The buff highlights all tiles that are Corrupted, Crimsoned, or Hallowed in purple, red, and pink respectively, while in the dark. This lasts for 5 minutes, but can be canceled at any time  by right-clicking the icon,  by selecting the icon using Cycle Next/Previous Buff and then pressing Remove Buff, or  by double-tapping the buff icon.
Guns are ranged weapons that fire bullets or Candy Corns as ammunition.

All guns can benefit from the damage bonus of the Shroomite Mask and are applicable for the Rifle Scope or its upgrades' zoom ability. Possession of any bullet-firing gun or bullets fulfills the spawning condition of the Arms Dealer NPC, see detailed criteria here.

The Flare Gun uses ammunition, however it does not inflict ranged damage ; several items are also referred to as "guns" in-game (e.g. Piranha Gun, Space Gun, or Water Gun), but none of these require ammunition, nor do they benefit from Shroomite Mask or Rifle Scope, so they are not categorized as "guns" on this wiki.
The best modifier for guns is Unreal, with the exception of guns without knockback.

The Phasic Warp Ejector is an unimplemented and incomplete item. All that remains of it is an item ID and an image. No stats or behaviors exist for this item, making it impossible to know exactly what it would have done had it been finished.
The Phasic Warp Ejector has an associated projectile named the "Phasic Warp Disc", although its intended function is unknown.

The Demon Scythe is a pre-Hardmode magic weapon that fires a circular, spinning purple sickle projectile when used. The projectile can pierce up to 4 targets, hitting a total of 5 targets. The sickle is motionless when summoned before gradually accelerating, and dissipates upon contact with solid blocks. The Demon Scythe has a 1/35 (2.86%) chance of being dropped by Demons and Voodoo Demons.
Its best modifier is Mythical.

The Fries are a food item that grant the Plenty Satisfied buff when consumed. This lasts for 10 minutes, but can be canceled at any time  by right-clicking the icon,  by selecting the icon using Cycle Next/Previous Buff and then pressing Remove Buff, or  by double-tapping the buff icon. The Fries have a 1/50 (2%) chance of being dropped by Flying Fish.
Like all other food items, the Fries can be placed on a Plate :

The Lunatic Cultist is a Hardmode, post- Golem boss summoned by killing the Cultists that spawn at the Dungeon 's entrance after Golem is defeated. Defeating the Lunatic Cultist initiates the Lunar Events, and also causes the Clothier to begin selling the Solar and Lunar Cultist sets depending on the time of day.

After all four Celestial Pillars have been destroyed, the Moon Lord will spawn and the Cultists will respawn at the Dungeon entrance, allowing the player to refight the Lunatic Cultist and initiate the Lunar Events again. Unlike most bosses, the Lunatic Cultist does not drop any weapons, accessories, or materials. However, it does drop the Ancient Manipulator, a placeable crafting station used to craft many endgame items.

While the Lunatic Cultist is alive, the music Golem https://terraria.wiki.gg/wiki/File:Music-Golem.mp3 will play. When Otherworldly music (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) is enabled, the track Boss 2 (Otherworldly) https://terraria.wiki.gg/wiki/File:Music-Boss_2_(Otherworldly).mp3 will play instead.

Vanity items are wearable items that can be equipped in social slots next to the armor and accessories slots in a character's inventory. Wearing them will change a character's appearance, but will not provide any functionality. Vanity items placed in the armor slots will also cover all armor appearances. Many of these vanity items are references to popular culture and other video games.

The Crawdad is a pre-Hardmode enemy found in the Cavern layer, and has two color variants that share identical stats and behavior. The Crawdad acts like a Crab, walking along the ground and jumping at the player when in close enough proximity, though it is slightly faster. It is also capable of moving through water unhindered. When a Crawdad is right next to the player, it will attack with its claw, dealing large amounts of damage per hit.

Crawdads are unique in that their ability to spawn is connected to two other enemies: the Giant Shelly and the Salamander. Of these three enemies, a world will choose two types that it can spawn, leaving the third inaccessible. Crawdads will never spawn in a world that features both Giant Shellies and Salamanders together. This is taken into account by the Bestiary progression logic (the missing enemy will register as unlocked when the other two exclusive creatures are unlocked) and the banner acquisition (any two of the trio's banners can be used to craft the banner of the missing member of the trio).
Mythril Brick Wall is a background wall crafted from Mythril Bricks.

The Meowmere is a Hardmode, post- Moon Lord projectile sword that fires a cat head projectile with a visual rainbow trail every 0.23 seconds when used. The cat head deals 125% of the weapon's damage (250 base damage), is affected by gravity, and can pierce enemies or bounce off solid blocks up to four times before dissipating (upon hitting a fifth enemy or block). Upon bouncing off a block, the cat head makes a "meow" sound and emits damaging rainbow-colored explosions that grow in size with each bounce. The Meowmere has a 2/9 (22.22%) chance of being dropped by the Moon Lord.
Its best modifier is Legendary.

Jellyfish Diving Gear is an accessory crafted by combining Jellyfish Necklace and Diving Gear at a Tinkerer's Workshop. It combines the functionalities of its ingredients, granting the ability to swim, breathe for an extended time, and emit light underwater (in the Desktop version, Console version, and Mobile version, it gives a very faint glow out of water and honey and its brightness is significantly increased when submerged) and additionally slowing the rate at which damage from drowning is taken. Apart from combining these effects into a single accessory, it does not have other unique properties.
The Football is a novelty item that players can throw to each other, or to themselves. It is sold by the Party Girl for 20 CC, after the player has accumulated a golf score of at least 501.
Holding the Football and pressing ⚒ Use / Attack throws the Football. It can then be "caught" and picked up again, even while in flight, by another player, or by the same player.

A player who takes any damage while a Football is anywhere in their inventory will automatically drop the Football, and it can again be picked up by another player, or by the same player. If multiple Footballs are in the player's inventory at the time, they all drop.

The Fish Costume set is a vanity set composed of the Fish Costume Mask, Fish Costume Shirt, and Fish Costume Finskirt. The complete set can be acquired randomly as a reward for completing a Fishing quest from the Angler NPC. These items are to be equipped in the Social Slots as they only provide a visual appearance.
(Old-gen console and 3DS versions) Its male and female variants look identical.

The Solar Fragment is a projectile NPC fired by the Solar Pillar during the Lunar Events. It is shot upwards from the top of the pillar and gradually falls to the ground, being destroyed upon contact with blocks or the player. It can also be destroyed by being hit with any weapon.

Reflective Silver Dye is a dye acquired by giving a Strange Plant to the Dye Trader. When equipped, it will give the selected accessory/armor a silver-plated, "shiny" effect, reflecting the surrounding light around the player. The reflection is more pronounced the closer the player is to a light source. The dye will prioritize light from the sun when the player is outside. From some perspectives, the player may look 3D when this dye is equipped all over.

As with other reflective dyes, this dye is not animated when standing still, but the shading on a dyed piece of equipment will change according to the surrounding light, giving it the appearance of light reflecting off of a shining metallic object.

The Blazing Wheel is an indestructible enemy found in the Dungeon that resembles a ring of fire, traveling along solid blocks on the walls and floors of the Dungeon. Blazing Wheels move quicker than most Dungeon enemies and produce orange light.
Blazing Wheels spawn most often in areas of the Dungeon backed by tiled walls. They can also spawn in other areas, but with a significantly reduced chance.

The Sniper Rifle is a Hardmode, post- Plantera gun that fires a bullet with extremely high damage and velocity, though at a far slower rate of fire than most ranged weapons. It cannot auto-fire on the Old-gen console and 3DS versions. It also has a "zoom" ability, which is functionally identical to that of the Binoculars and the Rifle Scope and its upgrades. It allows the screen to scroll temporarily in the direction of the cursor, essentially extending the viewing range in one direction.
Zoom is activated via one of the following methods:

Desktop version : Hold the right-click (⚷ Open / Activate) button. Console version : Hold the ⚷ Open / Activate button. Mobile version : Tap-hold. Old-gen console version : Move the right stick. Nintendo 3DS version : Move the C-Stick (users only).

The Sniper Rifle has a base (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) 29% / (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) 19% critical strike chance, as opposed to the usual 4%. It is one of the few weapons lacking auto-fire on the Nintendo 3DS version. The Sniper Rifle has a 1/12 (8.33%) / 23/144 (15.97%) chance of being dropped by Skeleton Snipers in the post-Plantera Dungeon.
Its best modifier is Unreal.

The Lightning Carrot is a pet-summoning item that spawns a Volt Bunny pet to follow the player around. While flying to keep pace with the player, the Volt Bunny dashes and releases a series of spherical blue sparks, which emit a decent amount of light while moving erratically and can spread light over an area. If there are no available tiles for the pet to "sit" on, like when climbing walls or flying, the Volt Bunny will constantly jump around. The Lightning Carrot can be purchased from the Zoologist for 50 GC after completing 50% (270 entries) of the Bestiary.

The Safe is a portable storage item with 40 slots to store other items. The Safe, Piggy Bank, Defender's Forge (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), and Void Vault (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) have the unique ability to be carried while they contain items. The Safe can be purchased from the Merchant for 20 GC after Skeletron has been defeated.
The Safe functions identically to the Piggy Bank. However, it can also be placed on blocks in addition to platforms or on other flat furniture pieces.

Velocity is a hidden statistic that defines the travel speed of a projectile, i.e. the number of pixels that it moves forward on its trajectory every tick (e.g. a value of 1 is 3.75 tiles/second). It is not to be confused with use time, which is the delay between subsequent uses of an item (e.g. "Fast", "Average", "Slow"). The higher the weapon's velocity, the faster the projectile travels, and the less the player will need to "lead" shots ahead of a moving target. This is an advantage that may prove very useful when fighting fast-moving enemies or when attacking from a long distance.

The Bloody Spine is a boss-summoning item used to summon the Brain of Cthulhu. The Bloody Spine can only be used in the Crimson or Underground Crimson, and attempting to use it outside of the Crimson will have no effect and will not consume it.

The moon in Terraria moves through a cycle of eight different phases, with the next phase in the cycle appearing each night. The current phase is indicated by the amount of the moon that is visible during the night. The phase of the moon affects many things, some being the shop inventory of certain NPCs, certain enemy spawn rates, and the player's Fishing Power.

It takes eight in-game nights for the moon to move through all of its phases. The cycle begins with the full moon upon world creation, where the entire circular moon is visible, and four nights later, after three waning phases, reaches the new moon, where no moon is visible. Another four nights later, after three waxing phases, the cycle ends with the return of the full moon.

Each moon phase starts at dawn (4:30 AM) and lasts until the next dawn. Therefore, a moon phase also encompasses the day preceding the night of that moon phase. This is important because most phase-dependent content and effects are not limited to nighttime.
The current moon phase can be determined using the Sextant, an informational accessory which can be obtained from the Angler NPC as a fishing quest reward, or any of its upgrades.
A Blood Moon can occur during any moon phase except for a new moon. A Pumpkin Moon or Frost Moon can be summoned by the player on any night.

Sponges are tools used to erase liquids by pressing the ⚒ Use / Attack button on them. This causes the liquid to disappear from the environment without storing it. There are four different types of sponges:
Super Absorbant Sponge for absorbing water and shimmer Lava Absorbant Sponge for absorbing lava Honey Absorbant Sponge for absorbing honey Ultra Absorbant Sponge for absorbing all kinds of liquid
Attempting to use a sponge on a different type of liquid has no effect.

Sponges can be used limitlessly and are never depleted. They are also slightly faster at draining liquids when compared to using a standard Empty Bucket (especially when moving the cursor around while draining).
The Tam O' Shanter is a Hardmode vanity item purchased from the Clothier for 2 GC 50 SC, during the third quarter moon phase.

Pink Gel Dye is a dye that is crafted from Gel Dye. The Gel Dye can be acquired from the Dye Trader, and can be combined with Pink Gel, a crafting material dropped by Pinky, at a Dye Vat. Just like the Gel Dye, the Pink Gel Dye will produce an effect similar to the Slime debuff caused by the Slime Gun, though it will be displayed in a color that's more pink than blue.

The Trident is a pre-Hardmode spear that has a (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) 9/40 (22.5%) / (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) 7/30 (23.33%) chance of being found in Water Chests, Ocean Crates (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), and Seaside Crates (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions). It has slightly more base damage than the Spear.

(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) If the Trident is held while submerged in water or lava, the player moves faster through that liquid and has an increased jump height. The Trident also generates light when swung underwater. These effects do not work in honey or shimmer.

Its best modifier is Godly or Demonic. Both modifiers increase the average damage output by the same amount. However, Ruthless might be preferred if the player already has very high critical strike chance.
Ancient Mythril Brick Wall is a type of background wall crafted from Ancient Mythril Bricks. Its appearance is based on the sprite of Mythril Brick Wall prior to 1.2.

The Maggot Zombie is a pre-Hardmode enemy and a Zombie variant that spawns in the Graveyard mini-biome. When a Maggot Zombie is killed, up to three Maggots will be spawned. Maggot Zombies have a more dreadful and rotten appearance than other Zombies, and is implied that it is missing an eye, due to its sprite depicting a Maggot crawling through it.

On Fire! is a debuff which prevents regeneration and causes the afflicted NPC or player to lose 4 health per second. When an enemy is Oiled (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), it will lose an additional 25 health per second, totaling to a loss of 29 health per second.

The debuff can be canceled by jumping into water, or by pouring a Water Bucket over the player's head. The Obsidian Skin Potion also grants immunity to this debuff for the duration of its effect. (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) Molten armor provides immunity to the debuff while worn.

The Hoverboard is a Hardmode wing -type accessory that allows the player to fly and glide, as all wings do. It also offers the added ability to "hover" by holding ↷ Jump and ▼ Down. Hovering offers a horizontal speed boost, and otherwise operates similarly to the Flying Carpet, allowing horizontal movement while remaining at a fixed height in the air. Hovering consumes flight time, just like flying would.
The Hoverboard has a flight height of 94 (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) / 86 (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) tiles, and a hover speed of 52 mph.

The Derpling is a Hardmode, insect-like enemy which spawns on the surface Jungle during the day in place of the Giant Flying Foxes which spawn at night. It jumps high, can strafe to the sides in mid-air, and attempts to land on top of the player. Derplings should be defeated quickly, as they spawn fast and can easily overwhelm the player.
Sandstone Bricks are brick -type blocks that spawn naturally in Pyramids and can also be crafted manually.

The Stynger is a Hardmode, post- Golem launcher that auto-fires Stynger Bolts as ammunition. Stynger Bolts travel at high velocity and explode upon impact with an enemy or solid tile, dealing area-of-effect damage. They then release 2-5 shrapnel fragments that separate from the initial bolt, travel in long horizontal arcs, and cause additional smaller explosions.
(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) A Stynger Bolt deals double damage (124 base damage) if it directly hits a single target.

The Stynger has a (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) 1/7 (14.29%) / (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) 1/8 (12.5%) chance of being dropped by Golem. When dropped, the Stynger is always accompanied by 60 to 99 Stynger Bolts. Additional Stynger Bolts can be purchased from the Witch Doctor, Arms Dealer (75 CC per bolt) and on Old-gen console and 3DS, the Demolitionist (10 CC per bolt), as long as the Stynger is in the player's inventory.
Its best modifier is Unreal.

The Flask of Nanites is a Hardmode, post- Plantera flask that causes melee weapons and whips (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) to inflict the Confused debuff for 1-3 seconds on enemies hit. Melee weapons that fire projectiles will also inflict the debuff on enemies hit by the projectiles (except for the Flairon 's bubbles).

The Flask of Nanites cannot be used in conjunction with other flasks, and using it will remove any existing flask effects. (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) Like all other flasks, the effect will not be canceled when the player dies.
The Flask of Nanites will inflict the Confused debuff in PvP scenarios.

The Peddler's Satchel is a permanent booster item that permanently increases the number of items sold by the Traveling Merchant by 1. It can only be used once in the world and is obtained by throwing a Peddler's Hat into Shimmer.
Consuming the item displays the status message " The Traveling Merchant's satchel deepens! ".
Grass is a type of block which covers most of the above-ground landscape. It enables many different plants to grow on it.

Tungsten Ore is an early game ore which spawns in the Underground and Cavern layers as well as on Floating Islands. Its primary use is to make Tungsten Bars, which can be used to make the Tungsten tier of equipment. The equivalent of Tungsten Ore is Silver Ore, which will sometimes replace Tungsten in a world. (Desktop, Console, Mobile and 3DS versions) Tungsten Ore has a small chance to appear as a bonus drop from slimes.

The Carrot is a pet-summoning item which spawns a Bunny pet to follow the player around. The color of the bunny's fur is defined by the shirt color chosen for the character at the point of their creation. The Carrot is only available to players in the Terraria Collector's Edition, and will automatically appear in the inventory of any newly generated characters.

The Dirtiest Block is a pet-summoning item that spawns The Dirtiest Block to follow the player around. It can be found extremely rarely as a block that looks identical to Dirt Blocks. Upon world generation and depending on world size, up to 3 (in small worlds), 6 (medium), or 9 (large) random Dirt Blocks will be replaced with The Dirtiest Blocks.

The Solar Tablet Fragment is a post- Plantera Hardmode crafting material used to craft the Solar Tablet, which summons the Solar Eclipse event. Solar Tablet Fragments have a 4/5 (80%) chance of being found in Lihzahrd Chests, and also have a 1/7 (14.29%) chance of being dropped by Lihzahrds and Flying Snakes in the Jungle Temple.
The Haemorrhaxe is a Hardmode hamaxe that has a 1/8 (12.5%) chance of being dropped by Hemogoblin Sharks and Blood Eels.
Its best modifier is Light for harvesting purposes and Legendary for combat purposes.

The Eyebrella is a vanity item that has a 1/3 (33.33%) chance of being dropped by Deerclops. When equipped, it summons a raincloud that constantly produces raindrops above the player's head. This effect is purely visual; it does not deal any damage.
Mimics are rare Hardmode enemies disguised as chests, appearing as the appropriate chest type for the environment.
Mimics can be spawned by the player using the Chest Statue, even in pre-Hardmode. However, Mimics spawned this way only drop the Mimic Banner.
Rarer Corrupt, Crimson, and Hallowed Mimics can also be spawned manually by players via a Key of Light or Key of Night (see the Biome Mimic section below).

They are some of the few entities that can be detected by the Lifeform Analyzer (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) or its upgrades. Corrupt, Crimson, and Hallowed Mimics require 25 kills to be awarded completion of their Bestiary entry and corresponding banner, as opposed to the usual 50 kills.

The Bananarang is a Hardmode boomerang. It returns to the owner once it hits an enemy, comes in contact with a block, or reaches its maximum range. The Bananarang can be dropped by Clowns, which spawns during Blood Moons.

On the Desktop version, Console version, and Mobile version, the Bananarang is not stackable, and can be thrown rapidly, with a maximum of 10 Bananarangs being thrown out at the same time. Its drop chance is 1/10 (10%). Its best modifier is Godly or Demonic. Both modifiers increase the average damage output by the same amount. However, Ruthless might be preferred if the player already has very high critical strike chance.

On the Old-gen console version and Nintendo 3DS version, Bananarangs can be stacked up to 10 in one slot. The bigger the stack is, the more can be thrown out at the same time. Their drop chance is 1/30 (3.33%), and they drop in stacks of 1-4. The Bananarang cannot be reforged, and therefore cannot have modifiers.

Silver Brick Walls are a type of background wall crafted from Silver Bricks. Enemies will not spawn where they are placed, and they can be used for NPC houses. They resemble a darker texture of Silver Bricks themselves.
The Ancient Dungeon Brick Walls are types of walls that are crafted from their respective Ancient Dungeon Brick.

The Mini Volcano is a decorative animated furniture item, whose animation can be toggled on and off with wires. It has a 19/100 (19%) chance of being dropped when opening Obsidian and Hellstone Crates.

The Tungsten Hammer is an early-game hammer, it is tied with the Wooden Hammer as the slowest hammer in the game. Like all hammers, it is used to remove background walls and create sloped tiles and half tiles.
Its best modifier is Light for harvesting purposes and Legendary for combat purposes.
Magic weapons are weapons which are used in medium- to long-ranged combat. The defining trait of magic weapons is their consumption of mana upon every use.

Due to their unusual and unique forms of attack, the majority of magic weapons can hardly be categorized into different types. Note that minion- and sentry-summoning weapons, which also consume mana, are not considered magic weapons due to the fact that they deal summon damage, not magic damage.

The following lists present all magic weapons along with their damage and how to acquire them. The intention of this is to convey an idea of their strength and the approximate time during gameplay at which they can be obtained. For a sortable list that displays all statistics of all magic weapons, see List of magic weapons.
The Mechanical Wagon Piece is one of three parts needed to craft the Minecart Upgrade Kit, and is always dropped from The Destroyer 's Treasure Bag in Expert Mode.
The Mandible Blade is a powerful pre-Hardmode sword capable of autoswing. The Mandible Blade has a 1/50 (2%) chance of being dropped by Antlion Chargers and Antlion Swarmers.
Its best modifier is Legendary.
Flat-surface items are furniture items on which other items can be placed or which fulfill a house 's requirement for a flat-surface item. Some belong to both groups.
The Stylish Scissors are a pre-Hardmode sword that have a 1/8 (12.5%) chance of being dropped by the Stylist.
Its best modifier is Legendary.

FoodBarbarian's set are vanity developer items that can be obtained rarely (5% chance) from Treasure Bags dropped from Hardmode bosses (except Queen Slime 's). It is the vanity set made for FoodBarbarian, one of the production assistants at Re-Logic.
These items are to be equipped in the Social Slots as they only provide a visual appearance.
FoodBarbarian's equipment also includes a non-vanity item, which will drop in addition to his clothing set:
FoodBarbarian's Tattered Dragon Wings

The Onyx Blaster is a Hardmode gun that, as a direct upgrade to the Shotgun, fires a spread of 4 bullets while only consuming one unit of ammunition, while also firing a single dark energy crystal projectile. The dark crystal explodes upon impact with an enemy or a block, or after traveling for 0.67 seconds (35 tiles by default; more with higher velocity). The explosive projectile deals 48 base damage, twice the listed damage of the weapon.
Its best modifier is Unreal.

The Venom Staff is a Hardmode magic weapon which, as a direct upgrade of the Poison Staff, fires 4-7 Venom Fang projectiles per use (4.78 on average) which inflict the Acid Venom debuff for a duration of 30 seconds.
Its best modifier is Mythical.

The Megashark is a Hardmode gun that fires bullets. It is a stronger version of the Minishark and is one of the strongest pre- Plantera guns in the game. It has one of the lowest use times of all weapons at 7 and has a 50% chance not to consume ammo.
Its best modifier is Unreal.

Darkness is a debuff that decreases the player's light vision. The effect is much like the Night Owl buff in reverse, dimming rather than amplifying provided light. Debuffed entities will also gain a bluish tint.
Equipping the Blindfold makes the player immune to the debuff.
The Cowboy set is a Hardmode vanity set that includes the Cowboy Hat, Cowboy Jacket, and Cowboy Pants. It is purchased from the Clothier for 15 GC (set), during the first-quarter moon phase.
These items are to be equipped in the Social Slots as they only provide a visual appearance.
The Ancient Manipulator is a Hardmode, post- Lunatic Cultist crafting station mainly used to craft items from Luminite and Lunar Fragments. It is always dropped by the Lunatic Cultist.

Mythril Bars are Hardmode bars made from Mythril Ore. They are necessary to make the Mythril Anvil, which in turn is needed to make most Hardmode equipment. Mythril Bar are the Orichalcum Bar's counterpart. The Mythril Drill and Mythril Pickaxe are the first tools acquired that are capable of harvesting all but two block types in the game (exceptions being Chlorophyte Ore and Lihzahrd Bricks).
On the Old-gen console version and Nintendo 3DS version, Mythril Bars drop from Shadow Hammers.

To craft all Mythril equipment, the player needs to acquire (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) 153 / (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) 155 bars, or a total of (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) 612 / (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) 620 ores.

The Cobalt Chainsaw is a Hardmode chainsaw that is obtainable after defeating the Wall of Flesh, and is the chainsaw alternative to the Cobalt Waraxe. Although the Cobalt Waraxe and Cobalt Chainsaw have equal axe powers, the chainsaw chops down trees at a faster rate due to its lower tool speed of 7. It is one of the earliest available axe tools upon entering Hardmode, along with its slightly stronger ore alternative, the Palladium Chainsaw. Like all axes and chainsaws, it is used to cut down trees, cacti, and Giant Glowing Mushrooms.

Its best modifier is Godly or Demonic. Both modifiers increase the average damage output by the same amount. However, Ruthless might be preferred if the player already has very high critical strike chance.

Demonite Brick is a brick crafted from Demonite Ore and Ebonstone. A box of it also appears after the Wall of Flesh has been defeated on a Corruption world ((Old-gen console and 3DS versions) in any type of world). It is not resistant to explosions, and gives off a faint glow.

The Bubble Wand is an auto-swing novelty item that produces rainbow-colored bubbles. The bubbles are purely visual, have no functional effect, and can be produced infinitely at no cost. The Bubble Wand is purchased from the Party Girl for 5 GC.

Each bubble is of a random size, and a random one of four possible colors: Pink, purple, green, or blue. With no obstacles in the way, bubbles last for random durations. They will pop on contact with characters or foreground blocks.

Coal is an item with no use. It can drop from Presents obtained during the Christmas seasonal event, with a chance of 1/30 (3.33%) in pre-Hardmode and 7/225 (3.11%) in Hardmode. It also has a 1/3 (33.33%) chance to be dropped from Jungle Mimics, which only spawn in Celebrationmk10 and Get fixed boi worlds.

The Zombie is a common pre-Hardmode surface enemy that appears at night, and is a primary reason newer players will want to build a shelter before night arrives. Along with Demon Eyes, they are generally among the first nighttime enemies a player will encounter, as they appear in areas a player first spawns.

Zombies follow the Fighter AI and walk towards the player, dealing damage on contact. They can jump and navigate platforms. Zombies will seem to hit closed doors in their path repeatedly, though most of them cannot open doors unless it is a Blood Moon (any regular and Blood Zombies (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) that spawn during which are all able to open doors); Spore Zombies and Maggot Zombies (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) can open doors at any time.

In Expert Mode (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), Armed Zombies that carry disembodied arms will spawn. When they are close to the player, they will stop to perform a special "claw attack" which extends their attack range and deals more damage to the player. These arm-wielding zombies are unable to open or interact with doors at any time. The Armed Zombie Statue can spawn regular Armed Zombies in any difficulty.
Bone Blocks are blocks that are placed by the Bone Wand at the cost of 1 Bone per block.
On the Desktop version, Console version, and Mobile version, mining them will drop Bones. There is no way to obtain the block as an item in these versions.

On the Old-gen console version and Nintendo 3DS version, mining them will drop the Bone Block as an item. There is no way to convert them back into regular Bones. The block item cannot be used to craft Bone Block Walls or Bone furniture, which are instead made from raw Bones themselves, at a Bone Welder.

The Man Eater is a pre-Hardmode enemy found in the Underground Jungle, and is nearly identical in appearance and behavior to the above-ground Snatcher. Man Eaters spawn anchored to blocks, with an extendable stem topped by a pincher. The stem itself is a passive component and can be walked through safely without incurring damage; only the pincher inflicts or takes damage.
Ancient Hellstone Brick is a type of brick obtained by throwing Hellstone Brick into Shimmer. Its appearance is based on the sprite of Hellstone Brick prior to 1.2.

Like plain Hellstone Bricks, players without an Obsidian Skull or one of its upgrades in their accessory slot will receive the Burning debuff from making contact with the brick. Mining the block or carrying it in one's inventory incurs no negative effect, however. As with most damaging blocks, NPCs and enemies are immune to this damage.
The Chef set is a set of Vanity items made up of the Chef Hat, the Chef Uniform, and the Chef Pants. It is purchased from the Traveling Merchant for 7 GC 50 SC (set).

Frost armor is a Hardmode armor set that provides a combination of melee and ranged damage bonuses. Crafting the full set requires 3 Frost Cores and 46 Titanium Bars or Adamantite Bars. On the Old-gen console version, Hallowed Bars are required instead.
A full set of Frost armor provides the following bonuses:

+43 defense (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) +26% / (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) +16% melee and ranged damage +11% melee and ranged critical strike chance +8% movement speed +10% melee speed

While wearing the full set, the player's melee and ranged weapons gain the ability to inflict the Frostbite (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) / Frostburn (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) debuff on enemies for 5-14 seconds, causing affected weapons to give off bright blue light and particles.

Visually, wearing the full set causes a "snow trail" to be left behind the player as they walk, similar to running with Hermes Boots. Also, the sound when the player takes damage is replaced with the shattering sound https://terraria.wiki.gg/wiki/File:Item_27.wav heard when breaking through Thin Ice.

The Blowgun is a pre-Hardmode ranged weapon that auto-fires Seeds and darts as ammunition, and is a stronger version of the Blowpipe. When a Blowgun is in a player's inventory, there is a chance that any vegetation growing on normal grass, in Clay Pots, and in Planter Boxes (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) will yield some Seeds. Flowers typically drop 4 Seeds at a time, while tall grass typically drops 1-2 Seeds. The Blowgun can be purchased from the Witch Doctor for 5 GC.
Its best modifier is Unreal.
The Silver Pickaxe is an early-game pickaxe. Its alternate ore counterpart is the Tungsten Pickaxe.
Like other low-tier pickaxes, the Silver Pickaxe can only mine blocks and ores weaker than Meteorite (which requires a pickaxe with at least 50% pickaxe power, e.g. a Tungsten Pickaxe).
Its best modifier is Light for harvesting purposes and Legendary for combat purposes.
Dark Artist armor is a Hardmode, post- Golem armor set purchased from the Tavernkeep for 1500000* 150 in total, and provides summon as well as magic damage bonuses.
The set consists of the Dark Artist's Hat, Dark Artist's Robes, and Dark Artist's Leggings.
A full set of Dark Artist armor provides the following bonuses:
+42 defense +25% magic damage +60% summon damage +25% magic critical strike chance +15% mana cost reduction +20% movement speed +3 extra sentry slots

Equipping the full set will increase the attack range of Flameburst sentry summons by 50%, allowing them to attack up to 84 tiles away. It also increases their projectiles' velocity by 40%, increases the projectile's explosion radius from a 6x6 to 13x13-tile rectangle, and increases these sentries' field of view significantly. Wearing the full set also increases the explosion area of the Phantom Phoenix 's Phoenix projectile from 6x6 to 13x13-tile rectangle.
The Dark Artist armor can be considered a direct upgrade of the Apprentice armor.

The Archaeologist's set is a vanity set composed of the Archaeologist's Hat, the Archaeologist's Jacket and the Archaeologist's Pants. These items are to be equipped in the Social Slots as they only provide a visual appearance.
While two of the pieces are crafted, the Archaeologist's Hat is not, but rather has a guaranteed chance to drop from Doctor Bones.

It is possible to craft these items in a world that has The Crimson instead of The Corruption only by creating an artificial Corruption or by simply bringing leather to the Crimson world (or using a Corrupt Statue to spawn Eater of Souls).

The Hornet Staff is a pre-Hardmode summon weapon that spawns a Hornet minion which follows the player and attacks enemies with a ranged stinger attack, similar to the attacks of Hornet enemies. The stingers travel in a straight line, do not pierce, and inflict the Poisoned debuff for 4-7 seconds. Like other minions, the summoned Hornet is invincible and follows the player until they die, summon a replacement minion, cancel the buff, or leave the world.

(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) Its best modifiers are Mythical, Furious, or Godly. Rounding reveals that these modifiers provide the same increase to damage as the Ruthless modifier, increasing it from 12 to 14.

(Old-gen console version) Its best modifier is Ruthless. The Mythical modifier provides the widest array of stat bonuses, but these primarily affect the initial summon rather than the resulting minion. Additionally, minions cannot deal critical hits. The only lasting advantage a Mythical Hornet Staff has over a Ruthless one is knockback.

The Seedling is a Hardmode, post- Plantera pet-summoning item that spawns a Pet Sapling to follow the player around. When the player is far enough away or in midair, it will sprout leaflets from its arms and use them as makeshift wings to fly towards them. The Seedling has a 1/20 (5%) / 1/15 (6.67%) chance of being dropped by Plantera.

The Solar Flare is a projectile NPC shot by Drakomires that spawn near the Solar Pillar during the Lunar Events. Similarly to other projectile NPCs such as the Water Sphere, it can be destroyed by hitting it with any weapon. It is somewhat similar in appearance to the Nebula Sphere fired by Evolution Beasts, but is easier to avoid as it can be destroyed before it hits the player.

The Maroon Graduation set is a Hardmode vanity set consisting of the Maroon Graduation Cap and the Maroon Graduation Gown. They are purchased from the Clothier for 20 GC (set) during a Waxing Crescent.
These items are to be equipped in the Social Slots as they only provide a visual appearance.
Heavenforge Brick is a type of decorative brick obtained by throwing Luminite Brick into Shimmer during a Full Moon.

The Monk's Belt is a Hardmode accessory that increases the maximum number of sentries by one and increases summon damage by 10%.  The Monk's Belt is dropped by Ogres during the Old One's Army event with a 1/6 (16.67%) / 1/4 (25%) chance during Tier 2, and a 1/12 (8.33%) chance during Tier 3.

The Panic Necklace is an accessory, that, when equipped, grants the player the Panic! buff for (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) 8 / (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) 5 seconds when harmed by any source of damage besides fire blocks, increasing movement speed by 100%. The Panic Necklace has a (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) 1/5 (20%) / (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) 1/4 (25%) chance of being obtained from destroying Crimson Hearts found in the Crimson or a 1/5 (20%) chance from Crimson Crates (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) and Hematic Crates (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), which are fished in the Crimson. On the Desktop version, Console version, and Mobile version, it can furthermore be crafted.

The Cosmic Skateboard is a Hardmode, post- Golem pet-summoning item that spawns an Alien Skater to follow the player around. When the player is far enough away or in midair, the Alien Skater turns its skateboard into a rocket-powered hoverboard to catch up to them. The Cosmic Skateboard has a 1/4 (25%) chance of dropping from the Martian Saucer in Master Mode.
Iron armor is the third-lowest tier of metal armor set. It consists of an Iron Helmet, Iron Chainmail and Iron Greaves.
Its alternate ore counterpart is the Lead armor.

It takes a total of (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) 60 / (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) 75 Iron Bars to craft a full suit, this translates to (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) 180 / (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) 225 Iron Ore per player to craft all the necessary bars for this armor.

The Ancient Iron Helmet is functionally identical to the Iron Helmet. The two helmets are interchangeable, with no bonus loss. The Ancient Iron Helmet has a 1/100 (1%) chance of being dropped by Skeletons and Spore Skeletons (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), and can also be obtained by dropping an Iron Helmet into Shimmer (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions).
A full set grants 7 defense plus a set bonus of 2 defense, which equals a total of 9 defense.

The Bone Feather is a rare Hardmode, post- Plantera crafting material used solely to craft Bone Wings. It has a (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) 1/300 (0.33%) / (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) 1/450 (0.22%) chance of being dropped by any Armored Bones variant (Blue, Rusty, or Hell Armored Bones) in the Dungeon after Plantera has been defeated.

The Shiny Black Slab was a pet -summoning item that spawned an Android. It was obtainable from Chests in the surface layer, but only on the Google Play version. It was obtainable on other mobile devices via trading.
This item was removed alongside all other mobile-exclusive content in the Mobile 1.3.0.7 update.
Players on Windows Phone who acquired the Shiny Black Slab via trading continue to have access to it.

The Desert is a biome which consists predominantly of Sand Blocks and cacti. Every world contains a main Desert area (which houses the Underground Desert (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) biome beneath it) and, possibly, additional small Desert patches called Dunes (which only contain layers of Sand Blocks on the surface and do not have underground parts). Pyramids and small pools of water can rarely appear in Dunes. On the Desktop version, Console version, and Mobile version, objects in the Desert appear slightly hazy due to heat distortion, and  water has a unique turquoise color. A Desert can also be generated with an Oasis (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) mini-biome, featuring Palm trees and a large pool of water in the center.

An area is considered a Desert biome if there are at least (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) 1500 / (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) 1000 Sand Blocks, Hardened Sand Blocks or Sandstone Blocks, causing the water and background to change. Cacti and Desert enemies can spawn on even a single block of sand, however. Deserts are overridden by most other biomes, including the Ocean. Rain will occur in Deserts just as in any other surface biome. A Sandstorm (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) may occur when wind speed is over 30 mph, which causes special enemies to spawn and pushes the player in the direction of the wind.

The Desert can be infected by the Corruption, the Crimson, or the Hallow. Corruption/Crimson Deserts may already spawn upon world creation. The enemies from the main biome (the evil biome or the Hallow) can spawn in an infected Desert alongside the normal Desert enemies (except for Mummies and Sand Sharks (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), which have special biome-specific variants), and the music from the main biome is played. The sand in an infected Desert is replaced by Ebonsand, Crimsand, or Pearlsand Blocks, respectively. Although their color will change, cacti still drop Cactus when cut, and Waterleaf are also able to grow in a Hallowed Desert.
Corrupted Desert Crimson Desert Hallowed Desert Oasis
A Pyramid is a Desert structure composed of Sandstone Bricks. Pyramid is a relatively rare structure, and most generated worlds will not contain any.

The bulk of the Pyramid is buried underground, with its tip sometimes protruding slightly from the Desert surface. A Pyramid contains a single zigzagging tunnel leading to a treasure room, which can contain unique loot. In addition to unique treasures, they are furnished with unique decorative banners and a variety of Pots and Coin Stashes.

The Silly Balloon Machine is a novelty furniture mechanism that produces red, blue, and green balloons continuously once placed. It can be activated and deactivated via wire, but is always on by default when first placed. Once placed, balloons are produced at short random intervals, and rise in the air until they encounter an obstacle like a block or platform. Balloons do not burst or disappear upon colliding with objects, but those do hinder their movement. All balloons fade away after approximately 10 seconds.
The balloons are purely visual, with no functional effect, and can be produced infinitely at no cost. The Silly Balloon Machine is purchased from the Party Girl for 5 GC.

Moonglow Seeds are a type of seed that can be obtained from harvesting Moonglows while they are blooming or using the Staff of Regrowth on naturally grown Moonglows while they are fully grown. Moonglow will only bloom at night, and will glow and give off blue orbs of light. Each plant drops 1-3 Moonglow Seeds when harvested while blooming.

Moonglow Seeds can be placed on Jungle grass, empty Clay Pots, or any types of Planter Boxes (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), and will grow into harvestable Moonglows. They will grow anywhere, not just in the Jungle, but will only yield seeds when blooming.

Booster Tracks are placeable furniture -type blocks that can be placed next to Minecart Tracks to automatically boost the speed of a Minecart that rides over it. The direction of the boost is indicated by the animated red arrow it displays, which can be toggled using a Hammer or wire. Each Booster Track increases speed by 20 mph, regardless of the Minecart variant used. The Booster Track can be purchased from the Mechanic for 50 SC.

The Creature from the Deep is a Hardmode enemy that spawns during the Solar Eclipse event. They attack like most other fighter-type enemies on land, but they also have the ability to swim. While they are in water, their speed and maneuverability increase dramatically. It is also capable of jumping out of the water towards the player, doing so with maneuverability similar to a Unicorn.
The Bride of Frankenstein set is a vanity set that can be obtained from a Goodie Bag with a 2/57 (3.51%) chance. It consists of a Bride of Frankenstein Mask and Bride of Frankenstein Dress.
These items are to be equipped in the Social Slots as they only provide a visual appearance.

The Pwnhammer is a Hardmode hammer that is able to destroy Demon Altars and Crimson Altars with a few hits, blessing the world with one of the six Hardmode ores. It has a sparkle effect when used which gives off a good deal of light, even in complete darkness. The Pwnhammer is always dropped by the Wall of Flesh.
Its best modifier is Legendary. However, due to rounding, Legendary, Light, Deadly, Agile, Quick, and Nasty provide equal boosts to mining speed for this tool.
The Molten Pickaxe is a pre-Hardmode pickaxe.

It is the most powerful pre-Hardmode pickaxe, being able to break nearly every block in one hit. It is capable of mining Cobalt Ore and Palladium Ore, which makes it an essential tool for early Hardmode. It also has the benefits of emitting light and occasionally inflicting the On Fire! debuff on enemies struck.

Although the Molten Pickaxe can destroy most blocks in one hit, its mining speed is very slow, meaning many lower tier pickaxes can mine the weakest block types faster than the Molten Pickaxe. However, it is still the fastest pre-Hardmode pickaxe when mining stone tiles and above. See the chart below for more details.
Its best modifier is Light for harvesting purposes and Legendary for combat purposes.
Weak is a debuff which causes multiple ability penalties. Equipping Vitamins or anything derived from it will make the player immune to this debuff.
Weak causes the following effects:
-4 defense -5.1% melee damage -5.1% melee attack speed -10% movement speed

Nebula Dye is a Hardmode, endgame dye crafted using Nebula Fragments dropped by the Nebula Pillar in the Lunar Events. The dye gives the player a pink/purple shiny look on armor, equipment or accessories and looks like stars are moving rapidly upward on anything with the dye. As with the other lunar dyes, the Nebula Dye can not be combined with any other dyes.

The Ankh Shield is a Hardmode shield and immunity accessory which provides immunity to (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) 12 / (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) 10 different debuffs, knockback immunity, and an additional 4 defense. It is crafted from an Obsidian Shield and an Ankh Charm at the Tinkerer's Workshop.
When equipped, the Ankh Shield provides immunity to all of the following debuffs:
The Repaired Mana Crystal is a furniture item that places down a decorative Mana Crystal. It drops a Mana Crystal when destroyed.

Frostbite is a Hardmode debuff that is a stronger version of Frostburn, preventing health regeneration and causing afflicted entities to lose damage over time. Afflicted enemies lose 25 health per second, while afflicted players lose 8 health per second. If affected by the Oiled debuff, all afflicted entities will also take an additional 25 damage per second, totaling 50 or 33 damage per second.

The Star Cloak is a Hardmode accessory that causes three stars to fall around the player whenever the player takes damage. It consumes no mana. The stars pass through blocks until reaching the player's altitude, at which point they continue falling until hitting blocks. They pierce once hitting two targets in total. The Star Cloak has a (Desktop, Console, Mobile and 3DS versions) 1/6 (16.67%) / (Old-gen console version) 1/7 (14.29%) chance to be dropped by Mimics.

On the Desktop version, Console version, and Mobile version, the stars deal 75 / 150 / 225 damage which is not classified as any of the four damage types and therefore cannot be modified by any buffs or equipment. Furthermore, the stars have 25 armor penetration.
On the Old-gen console version and Nintendo 3DS version, the stars deal 30 magic damage.

The Golden Shower is a Hardmode magic weapon that fires arcing, piercing golden ichor stream projectiles, similar to the Aqua Scepter. The projectile can pierce up to 4 targets, hitting a total of 5 targets. The Golden Shower fires three projectiles per use, and the player can change the direction of aim between projectile fires. Enemies hit will be inflicted with the Ichor debuff, which (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) adds 15 armor penetration / (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) lowers their defense by 20, and causes them to glow gold even in complete darkness for a duration of 10 seconds. However, this attribute cannot be used to explore the map, as ichor-coated enemies do not actually emit light.

The Golden Shower is the Crimson counterpart to the Corruption 's Cursed Flames and the Hallow 's Crystal Storm, all of which require a Spell Tome and ingredients exclusive to their underground biome counterparts.

Crafting the Golden Shower requires ingredients found only in worlds containing the Crimson. In worlds originally generated with the Corruption, Crimson Seeds can be purchased from the Dryad while in a Graveyard (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) in a Hardmode world in order to create the Underground Crimson biome in which Ichor can be obtained. On the Desktop version, Console version, and Mobile version, it also has a 1/3 (33.33%) chance to be dropped by Jungle Mimics, which spawn in Celebrationmk10 and Get fixed boi worlds.
Its best modifier is Mythical.

Anvils are crafting stations used to craft metal bars into tools, weapons, armor, and other items. Anvils are 2 tiles wide, 1 tile high, and must be placed on top of solid blocks or platforms. There are 4 types of anvils in the game.

The Apprentice's Scarf is an accessory that increases the player's maximum number of sentries by one and increases summon damage by 10%. It is dropped by the Dark Mage with a 1/4 (25%) / 1/2 (50%) chance.

The Tablet Fragment is a Hardmode, post- Lunatic Cultist pet-summoning item that spawns a Phantasmal Dragon pet to follow the player around. The pet resembles the Phantasm Dragon spawned during the Lunatic Cultist's battle, and the only difference between the two is that the pet itself is smaller. The Tablet Fragment has a 1/4 (25%) chance of being dropped by the Lunatic Cultist in Master Mode.
Balloon furniture are furniture items crafted from Silly Balloons, which are sold by the Party Girl during a Party. There are 20 different Balloon furniture items.

The Bramble Crate is a Hardmode crate that can only be fished in the Jungle. Bramble Crates contain items found in standard crates, and they always contain an item normally found in Ivy Chests within Jungle Shrines. Its pre-Hardmode counterpart is the Jungle Crate.

The Bone Welder is a crafting station used to craft Bone furniture out of Bones, and can also craft Dungeon Shelves when combined with Ecto Mist (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions). The Bone Welder can be found found in the Dungeon, either inside Locked Gold Chests (1/8 (12.5%) chance for each chest) or placed on the ground. On the Desktop version, Console version, and Mobile version, it is also sold by the Steampunker when in a Graveyard.

The Anklet of the Wind is an accessory that gives a 10% bonus to movement speed. The effect also stacks with the movement speed bonus of the Aglet. It can be found in Jungle and Bramble (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) Crates with a 19% chance, and also in Ivy Chests located in Jungle Shrines and at the base of a Living Mahogany Tree in the Underground Jungle with a 9/40 (22.5%) chance.
Grass Seeds are used to plant regular grass on Dirt Blocks. They are purchased from the Dryad for 20 CC each, while a Blood Moon is not occurring.
Aside from crafting, Grass Seeds become almost obsolete once the player acquires a Staff of Regrowth as it has the same effect for free and with unlimited uses.

Potions are consumable items that either recover the user's health and/or mana either instantaneously or over time, or grant temporary buffs or debuffs to the user. Potions are commonly found in natural Chests and Pots, can be dropped by enemies, purchased from NPCs, or crafted. Most potions can be crafted at a Placed Bottle or Alchemy Table, but flasks must be crafted at an Imbuing Station.

By pressing Quick Buff, Quick Heal, Quick Mana, the player can quickly consume respective potions (buff potions, health potions, and mana potions) from their inventory or open Void Bag (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), without actually opening their inventory.
