Explosive Powder is a Hardmode crafting material purchased from the Demolitionist for 12 SC each, once the Wall of Flesh has been defeated. It is solely used to make Exploding Bullets, an ammo type with strong knockback.

The Turtle is a critter which can spawn in bodies of water in the Forest during the day. They move slowly on land and swim at the surface of water. The Turtle has only 5 health and no defense, and can be damaged by other enemies and players.

The Turtle can be caught with any Bug Net to be carried around in the inventory and released later, or crafted into animated decorative furniture (Turtle Cage). Once crafted, the Turtle cannot be released again, unless the furniture item is de-crafted via Shimmer (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions).
The Turtle can be spawned by the Turtle Statue, however statue-spawned critters cannot be caught with any Bug Net, and will disappear in a puff of smoke when the player attempts to do so.

The Snow Wall is a type of background wall which can be found naturally generated in the Snow biome, considered unsafe. It does not drop as an item when destroyed, and can only be obtained on Desktop, Console, and Mobile, via crafting. It is considered a safe wall when placed by the player.
Benches are decorative furniture items that can take the place of chairs for the comfort requirement in NPCs ' housing.

Firework Rockets are consumable Hardmode mechanisms that produce colorful effects. Once placed, a Firework Rocket can be activated via wire or by pressing the ⚷ Open / Activate button on it directly, which causes it to launch upwards and explode into a colorful effect. Each rocket can only be used once. Firework Rockets are purchased from the Party Girl during Hardmode for 15 SC each.
Although their effect is primarily visual, Firework Rockets also deal 150 ranged damage. They only fire directly upward and players are not harmed.

The Pearlstone Wall is a type of background wall which can be found in Corruption / Crimson chasms that have been taken over by the Hallow, considered unsafe. It does not drop as an item when destroyed, and can only be obtained on Desktop, Console, and Mobile, via crafting. It is considered a safe wall when placed by the player.
The Clentaminator / Terraformer (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) (using Blue Solution) and Holy Water convert Stone Walls to unsafe Pearlstone Walls.
Pearlstone Walls can spread The Hallow to nearby pure walls. See Biome spread for further information.
The Princess set is a Hardmode vanity set consisting of the Tiara and the Princess Dress. It is purchased from the Clothier for 35 GC (set), during a New Moon.
These items are to be equipped in the Social Slots as they only provide a visual appearance.

The Battle Potion is a buff potion which grants the Battle buff when consumed. The buff increases the spawn rate and maximum number of enemies and critters that can be on-screen at once by 100%, effectively doubling these rates. This lasts for 7 minutes, but can be canceled at any time  by right-clicking the icon,  by selecting the icon using Cycle Next/Previous Buff and then pressing Remove Buff,  by selecting the icon and canceling it in the equipment menu,  by double-tapping the buff icon, or  by canceling the buff from the buffs screen.

The Magma Stone is an accessory that causes the wearer's melee attacks to inflict the Hellfire debuff on enemies. The duration of the debuff varies according to the table on the right; it lasts 3.75 seconds on average. The Magma Stone also adds orange flame particle effects on the sprites of both the weapon and its projectiles that give off light. It has a 1/50 (2%) chance to be dropped by Lava Bats and a 1/150 (0.67%) chance to be dropped by Hellbats in The Underworld.
The Fast Clock is a Hardmode immunity accessory that grants the player immunity to the Slow debuff. It has a 1/100 (1%) / 1/50 (2%) chance to drop from Pixies, Mummies, and Wraiths.
It is one of the ingredients required to make The Plan, which is a crafting material required to make the Ankh Charm, an accessory further required to make the Ankh Shield.

The Party Bullet is one of six types of craftable ammunition made from Empty Bullets, which are sold by the Arms Dealer in Hardmode. It releases a cloud of confetti upon contact with an enemy or a solid block, but has no other special properties.
The cost of a stack of 50 Party Bullets is 4 SC 50 CC, which is 9 CC per bullet. The cost of crafting 1000 Party Bullets (20 stacks of 50) is 90 SC.

On the Desktop version, Console version, and Mobile version, they can also be dropped by a Pigronata, with a 1/9 (11.11%) chance. Pigronatas can be bought from the Party Girl during a Party (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions). This makes Party Bullets obtainable pre-Hardmode.

The Sleepy Octopod is a Hardmode melee weapon that is swung continuously in a 360° radius around the player when used. After swinging the Sleepy Octopod for about 1 second, green particles appear at the tip of the weapon, signifying that it is ready to deliver its secondary attack: If the head hits a block at the end of the swing, it causes a 3x12-tile tall explosion. Between explosions, the Sleepy Octopod acts as a swung melee weapon, dealing regular damage to enemies that make contact with the staff.

The explosion deals 300% or three times the weapon's base damage (150 damage) and will damage enemies through blocks. Because of the distance that the head is at when the swing finishes, the explosion will not hit enemies closer than two blocks from the player, though the weapon itself will hit these enemies, dealing regular damage. The Sleepy Octopod is dropped by Ogres during the Old One's Army event, with a 1/10 (10%) / 1/5 (20%) chance during Tier 2, and a 1/20 (5%) chance during Tier 3.

Its best modifier is Godly or Demonic. Both modifiers increase the average damage output by the same amount. However, Ruthless might be preferred if the player already has very high critical strike chance.

Platinum Ore is an early-game ore that spawns in the Underground and Cavern layers, as well as on Floating Islands. Its primary use is in crafting Platinum Bars, which are used to make the fourth tier of equipment and several other items. Platinum Ore is the counterpart to Gold Ore, which can generate in its place in some worlds. (Desktop, Console, Mobile and 3DS versions) Platinum Ore has a small chance to appear as a bonus drop from slimes.
The Stopwatch is an informational accessory that displays the player's current movement speed in miles per hour, e.g. " 34 mph ". The Stopwatch can be purchased from the Traveling Merchant for 5 GC.
The Stopwatch is one of the three parts necessary to make the Goblin Tech, with the others being the Metal Detector and the DPS Meter, and as such is a required ingredient in crafting the Shellphone.

The Sunfury is a pre-Hardmode, post- Skeletron flail, that, when used, emits light and has a 1/4 (25%) chance to inflict the On Fire! debuff for 3 seconds. The Sunfury deals the most damage out of all pre-Hardmode flails and has a base 11% critical strike chance, as opposed to the usual 4%. The Sunfury has a (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) 1/5 (20%) / (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) 1/6 (16.67%) chance of being found in Shadow Chests in the Underworld, as well as a 1/5 (20%) chance of being found in Obsidian Lock Boxes (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) obtained from Obsidian Crates (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) and Hellstone Crates (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions).

Its best modifier is Godly or Demonic. Both modifiers increase the average damage output by the same amount. However, Ruthless might be preferred if the player already has very high critical strike chance.

The Jester's Arrow is a type of arrow that is unaffected by gravity and can pierce an infinite number of enemies. It emits an ample amount of light when fired, making it useful for lighting up dark areas like caves. When hitting an enemy or block, it vanishes in a shower of non-damaging sparks. In addition to being crafted, Jester's Arrows can be found in Gold Chests in the Underground and Cavern layers.

Jester's Arrows can be considered an upgrade of Unholy Arrows. Their unlimited piercing makes them efficient against enemies with multiple segments such as the Eater of Worlds, and may occasionally render them stronger than otherwise better arrows, such as the Hellfire Arrow.
The damage of a Jester's Arrow decreases by 10% for each target it pierces.

Abigail's Flower is a pre-Hardmode summon weapon that summons the Abigail minion. Abigail attacks by floating towards enemies, turning red, and flashing a light on them, similar to the Medusa Head. Like other minions, the summoned Abigail is invincible and follows the player until they die, summon a replacement minion, cancel the buff, or leave the world. When idle, Abigail will still deal damage to entities upon contact.

Abigail's Flower is special in that if used more than once, multiple Abigails do not spawn - instead, the spawned Abigail becomes stronger and faster for each additional summon. Like the Stardust Dragon and the Desert Tiger, Abigail has a visual indicator for the number of times she is summoned, as the flower on her head will change shape and hue for each stage.

Abigail's Flower can be uncommonly found as a plant growing on grass near a placed Tombstone, regardless of world progression. Its spawn chance is increased in The Constant secret world seed. The flower breaks in one hit when mined, and makes a grassy sound https://terraria.wiki.gg/wiki/File:Grass.wav when doing so.

Its best modifiers are Mythical, Furious, or Godly. Due to its low base damage, all damage-improving modifiers +10% or greater improve its damage by the same amount. A Ruthless Abigail's Flower has no lasting advantage over one with other modifiers, as it deals less knockback.

The Portable Cement Mixer is an accessory that increases the speed at which the player can place background walls by 50%. The Portable Cement Mixer can be purchased from the Traveling Merchant for 10 GC.

The Sparkling Honey is a pet-summoning item that spawns a Honey Bee pet, a large bee which follows the player around. The Sparkling Honey has a 1/4 (25%) chance of being dropped by the Queen Bee in Master Mode.
The Pixie set is a vanity set that can be obtained from Goodie Bags with a 2/57 (3.51%) chance. It consists of a Pixie Shirt and Pixie Pants.
These items are to be equipped in the Social Slots as they only provide a visual appearance.

Obsidifish are a type of pre-Hardmode ((Desktop, Console and Mobile versions)) / Hardmode ((Old-gen console and 3DS versions)) fish which are found very rarely by fishing in any biome in any layer, but only in lava. They are used to craft Seafood Dinners, Inferno Potions, and Potions of Return.

Crimson armor is a pre-Hardmode armor set consisting of the Crimson Helmet, Crimson Scalemail, and Crimson Greaves. Equipping the full set grants a greatly increased health regeneration rate, represented by faint red pulses around the player: Each pulse represents one health point regenerated. These become more frequent the longer the player avoids damage, and even more frequent while standing still. Each piece also provides a (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) +3% / (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) +2% weapon damage boost, the entire set providing a total of (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) +9% / (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) +6%  damage.

Crimson armor is the Crimson equivalent of Shadow armor and leaves a similar trail of red bubbles during motion when the full set is equipped. However, unlike Shadow armor, it does not have an interchangeable Ancient version.
Crafting the full set requires 60 Crimtane Bars and 45 Tissue Samples.

Beetle Might is a buff granted to the player upon dealing damage with a full set of Beetle armor with the Scale Mail equipped. Damaging an enemy with the armor equipped will increase damage and melee speed by increments of 10%. This is increased to 20% and finally 30% if combat is continued for long enough. Each increase in strength causes an additional beetle to fly around the player. After the player stops doing damage, the beetles will disappear one by one, and their respective combat bonuses will be lost.

Purple Ooze Dye is a dye acquired by giving a Strange Plant to the Dye Trader. When equipped, it gives the player a purple tone, with parts of the dye distorting and varying in different shades of purple.
The Hallowed Crate is a crate that can only be fished in The Hallow. It contains items found in standard crates.

The Hallowed Crate can be obtained by throwing a Divine Crate into Shimmer.
It can also be obtained by building an artificial Hallowed biome in a pre-Hardmode world and fishing for it there. When fishing in the Hallow in Hardmode, only Divine Crates will be caught, the Hallowed Crate's Hardmode counterpart.

The Hellstone Crate is a Hardmode crate that can only be fished in lava. Opening Hellstone and Obsidian Crates is the only way to obtain the Obsidian Lock Box, and therefore any Underworld-exclusive items normally found in locked Shadow Chests, once the Underworld has been fully looted. Its pre-Hardmode counterpart is the Obsidian Crate.

The Plantera Seedling is a Hardmode, post- Plantera pet-summoning item that spawns a Plantera Seedling to follow the player around. When the player is far enough away or in midair, the Plantera Seedling flies by twirling its petals like a propeller to catch up to them. The Plantera Seedling has a 1/4 (25%) chance of being dropped by Plantera in Master Mode.

The Breaker Blade is a Hardmode sword and is the third largest sword in the game, giving it an extraordinary melee reach. On the Desktop, Console, and Mobile versions, it will also deal 250% damage (175 base damage) to enemies with over 90% health. The Breaker Blade has a 1/4 (25%) chance of being dropped by the Wall of Flesh.
Its best modifier is Legendary.

The Ice Tortoise is a Hardmode enemy that spawns in the Ice biome. It walks around slowly, and occasionally retracts into its shell. It then starts spinning and hurls itself at the player, gaining increased defense and dealing high contact damage.
A functionally identical variant of the Ice Tortoise, the Giant Tortoise, can be encountered in the Jungle and Underground Jungle.

The Vicious Goldfish is a pre-Hardmode enemy that results from a Goldfish being corrupted, either by the player using Vicious Powder on it or when a Goldfish spawns during a Blood Moon in a Crimson world.

The Boreal Wood Sword is a broadsword crafted from Boreal Wood. It is similar to the Wooden Sword, but it deals 1 more damage and 1 more knockback, and has a lower use time. Because Snow biomes are usually not too far from the initial spawn point, a Boreal Wood Sword can be a superior alternative to its standard counterpart.
The Boreal Wood Sword's damage is equivalent to that of a Copper Broadsword, though it would be wise to craft this instead due to how cheap it is to obtain.
Its best modifier is Legendary.
The Laser Rifle is a Hardmode magic weapon that fires fast-moving purple lasers which can hit up to three enemies. It has a 1/4 (25%) chance of being dropped by the Wall of Flesh.
Its best modifier is Mythical.

The Ocean Crate is a pre-Hardmode crate that can only be fished in the Ocean. Ocean Crates contain items found in standard crates, and always contain one item normally found in Water Chests. Its Hardmode counterpart is the Seaside Crate.

The Weather Pain is a pre-Hardmode magic weapon which casts a Hurtnado upon use, a small tornado projectile that vanishes after 9.5 seconds or after piercing 14 enemies. The Hurtnado possesses 10 armor penetration, ricochets off solid blocks, and quickly homes in on nearby enemies, attempting to hover in front of them to deal continuous damage. However, only one Hurtnado can exist at a time. If the Weather Pain is used again while another Hurtnado is already active, the existing Hurtnado dissipates as soon as the new one is summoned. The Weather Pain has a 1/4 (25%) chance of being dropped by Deerclops.
Its best modifier is Mythical.
Star Royale Brick is a type of decorative brick obtained by throwing Luminite Brick into Shimmer during a Waxing Crescent.

The Marrow is a Hardmode bow that converts any type of arrow into special Bone Arrows, which is not to be confused with the visually similar Bone Arrow item. These Bone Arrows fire at higher velocities than average arrows and suffer minimal drop along their course, giving the Marrow a much straighter shot than most bows. However, while the used arrow's base damage is accounted for, the special properties of converted arrows are entirely lost. The Marrow has a base 9% critical strike chance, as opposed to the usual 4%. On the Desktop version, Console version, and Mobile version, it is also capable of autofire. The Marrow has a 1/200 (0.5%) chance to be dropped by Skeleton Archers.
Its best modifier is Unreal.

The Paintball Gun is a pre-Hardmode ranged weapon that fires a three-shot burst of slow-moving, arcing multicolored projectiles which consume no mana or ammunition, dissipating upon contact with an enemy or surface. The Paintball Gun has a 1/10 (10%) chance of being dropped by the Painter.
Its best modifier is Unreal.

The Firefly is a harmless critter that gives off a tiny amount of light. Fireflies will spawn near grass on the surface at night, except inside houses. Their spawn rate will be randomly set everyday, making their spawn amount varying greatly each night.
The Firefly has only 5 health and no defense, and can be damaged by other enemies and players.

The Firefly can be caught with any Bug Net to be carried around in the inventory and released later, or crafted into animated decorative furniture (Firefly in a Bottle). Once crafted, the Firefly cannot be released again, unless the furniture item is de-crafted via Shimmer (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions).
The Firefly can be used as bait for fishing, with 20% bait power.
The Firefly can be spawned by the Firefly Statue, however statue-spawned critters cannot be caught with any Bug Net, and will disappear in a puff of smoke when the player attempts to do so.
Its Hallow counterpart is the Lightning Bug.

The Crystal Slime is a Hardmode enemy and a slime variant frequently summoned by Queen Slime alongside Bouncy Slimes and Heavenly Slimes. It fires a Crystal Spike projectile every 0.83 seconds. In Expert Mode, it fires three projectiles at once every 0.42 seconds, but only if there are fewer than four other Crystal Slimes alive. Otherwise, it behaves like in Classic Mode.

The Crab is a weak pre-Hardmode enemy found in Oceans, walking along the bottom and occasionally jumping. They may also walk on land, and whether or not they are in water has no effect on their behavior.

The Blessed Apple is a Hardmode mount-summoning item that summons a rideable Unicorn Mount, capable of an extra jump as well as the ability to sprint and charge through enemies, damaging them in the process. The Blessed Apple has a 1/40 (2.5%) / 1/30 (3.33%) chance of being dropped by Unicorns.

Once a high speed is reached, the Unicorn emits a sparkle effect, and from that point on, it will be able to damage enemies on contact. The invulnerability is granted for 1/10th of a second when the player and the Unicorn dash through an enemy, much like the brief invulnerability after taking damage.
The Gravedigger's Shovel is a tool that can be used to dig up "soft" blocks (see below) more efficiently than a pickaxe or drill, in a 3x3-tile rectangle centered on the cursor.
Its best modifier is Light for harvesting purposes and Legendary for combat purposes.

The Antlion Charger is an enemy similar in appearance to the Antlion, and is found in the Underground Desert or on surface Deserts during pre-Hardmode Sandstorms. Unlike the Antlion, the Antlion Charger will, as its name suggests, charge at the player instead of remaining stationary. It can jump over blocks and will gradually build up speed while moving before charging the player. It can rarely drop the Mandible Blade.

Paintings are decorative furniture items that can be placed on background walls. Each one is a framed image that depicts a particular scene, usually Terraria -related. Their tooltips generally contain a person's name, intended to credit each painting's artist; although the names appear to be fictional, most of them correspond to known Terraria developers, artists, testing staff, and community members (see Trivia below). (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) Paintings are highlighted by Spelunker Potions, the Magic Lantern, Spelunker Glowsticks, and Spelunker Flares.

There are a total of 173 paintings, 24 of which are sold by the Painter, 7 by the Princess (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), 4 by the Golfer (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), 1 by the Zoologist, 1 by the Clothier, 1 by the Truffle, and 22 are randomly sold by the Traveling Merchant. 32 paintings are found placed naturally in Underground Cabins, another 14 in the Underground Desert (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), 25 in the Dungeon, 12 in The Underworld, 6 from Floating Islands, 2 obtained by fishing, 1 from the Jungle Temple, 5 randomly acquired from Goodie Bags, 8 dropped by Solar Eclipse enemies, and 8 awarded randomly by the Angler for completing fishing quests.

The Life Booster is one of the three power-ups occasionally dropped when striking enemies while wearing a full set of Nebula armor. When picked up, it grants the Life Nebula buff which immediately increases the player's health regeneration rate by 3 health per second for 8 seconds. When a Life Booster is picked up while the Life Nebula buff is already in effect, it stacks with the previous Life Nebula, for up to 3 stacked boosts. Every 8 seconds, one stacked Life Booster expires, and the Life Nebula buff decreases by one level.
Life Boosters, like all Nebula boosters, float in the air and have a pickup range of 8.875 tiles. They cannot legitimately appear in a player's inventory.

The Pogo Stick is a mount-summoning item that summons a Pogo Stick Mount. Jumping again while in the air causes the player to do a front flip. The Pogo Stick Mount doubles the speed at which the player falls, and reduces fall damage by 60%. It has a max speed of 28 mph, and also has a certain amount of momentum while airborne, meaning it continues traveling in the last horizontal direction the player inputted while in the air, rather than slowing. The Pogo Stick can be purchased from the Party Girl for 25 GC.

The North Pole is a Hardmode, post- Plantera spear that fires a frozen spear projectile that costs no mana or ammunition. The spear projectile travels in a straight line in midair for half a second before being affected by gravity and can pierce up two enemies before dissipating upon contact with a solid block or upon impacting a third enemy. Additionally, the icy spear leaves behind a trail of damaging snowflakes which fall downwards and dissipate upon contact with an enemy or surface.
The North Pole is dropped by the Ice Queen during the Frost Moon event with a 5.19%-10.37% (15.56%-31.11%) chance depending on the current wave.

Its best modifier is Godly or Demonic. Both modifiers increase the average damage output by the same amount. However, Ruthless might be preferred if the player already has very high critical strike chance.
Not the bees is a secret world seed. It generates a world dominated by bee-themed biomes and bee-related items and structures.
The following seeds can be used to generate a Not the bees world (case-insensitive):
Jim's Cap is an vanity item. It will always drop from the Painter, but only when his name is Jim.

The War Table is an animated furniture item that is dropped by the Dark Mage during the Old One's Army event, with a 1/2 (50%) / 1/1 (100%) chance during Tier 1, and a 1/8 (12.5%) / 1/4 (25%) chance during Tier 3.

Placing and pressing ⚷ Open / Activate on the War Table grants the Strategist buff, which increases the player's sentry capacity by 1. This lasts until the player dies or leaves the world, but can be canceled at any time  by right-clicking the icon,  by selecting the icon using Cycle Next/Previous Buff and then pressing Remove Buff, or  by double-tapping the buff icon.

Unlike equipment buff items, the War Table must be placed in order to activate the buff. It can be mined with a pickaxe or drill and picked up again, even while the buff is active, which will not cancel the buff. Placement is only dependent on an adequate space of 5x4 tiles being available.

The Pink Fairy, Green Fairy, and Blue Fairy are critters which will attempt to lead the player to valuable treasures, such as Life Crystals, Chests, or ore deposits. They spawn in the bottom half of the Underground layer and in the Cavern layer, but only if at least one Fallen Log is present in the world on the surface (see Fallen Log § Notes for the exact area). If all Fallen Logs have been destroyed, they will no longer spawn independently. The three fairy variants all function identically.

Fairies can also spawn at Fallen Logs and from shaken Pearlwood trees on the surface at night. In this case, they will not lead players to treasure; instead, when approached, they try to flee much like Birds or Faelings. Unlike fairies spawned underground, these fairies can be caught with a Bug Net and carried around in the inventory. If released again, they act like naturally spawned fairies and will attempt to lead the player to treasure. They can also be crafted into animated decorative furniture (Fairy Jars). Once crafted, the fairies cannot be released again.
They are some of the few entities that can be detected by the Lifeform Analyzer or its upgrades.

The Gold Bow is a strong type of bow crafted using Gold Bars, and is one of the strongest types of ore bows before one is able to obtain Demonite or Crimtane. Its sole purpose is to fire arrows from a distance at enemies and deal damage to them.Its alternate ore counterpart is the Platinum Bow.

Its best modifier is Demonic, as it does not have any knockback and thus cannot get modifiers that affect it. (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) It can also get the Deadly modifier, which, while the Demonic modifier may provide the greatest damage per hit, grants a higher increase to the overall DPS.
The Umbrella Hat is a vanity item that has a 1/45 (2.22%) chance to drop from Umbrella Slimes during the Rain event.

The Hardened Sand Wall, Hardened Ebonsand Wall, Hardened Crimsand Wall, and Hardened Pearlsand Wall are types of background walls which can be found naturally generated in the Underground Desert, considered unsafe. Underground Deserts generate by default the normal Hardened Sand Wall which may be converted into the respective variant if exposed to the Corruption, Crimson, or Hallow. Converted Hardened Sand Walls may further spread conversion; see Biome spread for more information. Unsafe Hardened Sand Walls do not drop as items when destroyed, and can only be obtained via crafting. They are considered safe walls when placed by the player.
The Treacherous Hardened Sand Wall is an item that places an unsafe Hardened Sand Wall. It is visually identical and is obtained by throwing a Hardened Sand Wall into Shimmer.

The Eyezor is an uncommon Hardmode enemy that spawns during the Solar Eclipse event, and primarily attacks by advancing toward the player while firing high-velocity purple laser beams at them. It also travels faster than normal Zombies and is highly resistant to knockback. As the Eyezor takes damage, its movement speed and the rate at which it fires lasers increase exponentially.
It is one of the few entities that can be detected by the Lifeform Analyzer (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) or its upgrades.

Styles are chosen during character creation and determine the character's base clothing style, which is displayed when no armor or vanity items are equipped, or when the player is wearing Familiar clothes. This style of a character can be changed at any time at a dresser, and a character's gender can be changed at any time with the Gender Change Potion.

The Nailhead is an uncommon Hardmode, post- Plantera enemy that spawns during the Solar Eclipse event. In addition to dealing high contact damage, the Nailhead has a 1/3 (33.33%) chance to fire three to five Nail projectiles in a wide spread when attacked. He has significantly more health than most other Solar Eclipse enemies and has a high resistance to knockback.

He is one of the few entities that can be detected by the Lifeform Analyzer or its upgrades. The Nailhead requires 25 kills to be awarded completion of his Bestiary entry and corresponding banner, as opposed to the usual 50 kills.

The Molten Skull Rose is an immunity accessory that represents the final upgrade of the Obsidian Skull. It grants 7 seconds of immunity to lava, immunity from fire blocks, and reduces damage taken from lava. When worn, the item can be seen on the players head.
This item can also be crafted in three different ways.
The Toucan is a critter that spawns in the Jungle during the daytime. The Toucan has only 5 health and no defense, and can be damaged by other enemies and players.

The Toucan can be caught with any Bug Net to be carried around in the inventory and released later, or crafted into animated decorative furniture (Toucan Cage). Once crafted, the Toucan cannot be released again, unless the furniture item is de-crafted via Shimmer (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions).
The Toucan can be spawned by the Toucan Statue, however statue-spawned critters cannot be caught with any Bug Net, and will disappear in a puff of smoke when the player attempts to do so.

The Boomstick is a pre-Hardmode gun. It can occasionally be found in Ivy Chests (22.5% chance) in the Underground Jungle, and also in Jungle Crates (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) (16.67% chance). It fires a spread of (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) 3-4 / (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) 3 bullets per shot, but only consumes one ammo.
The Boomstick has a stronger and less accurate pre-Hardmode upgrade, the Quad-Barrel Shotgun (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), and a Hardmode upgrade, the Shotgun.
Its best modifier is Unreal.

A Windy Day is an event that occurs when the wind speed surpasses 20 mph. The event will stop when the wind speed decreases past 16 mph. The wind can either come from the east or the west, making background objects like trees, vines, plants, banners and lanterns sway in the same direction.

Windy Days have a few unique entities that only spawn during daytime, such as Ladybugs, slimes attached to flying balloons, and Angry Dandelions. During the event certain enemies have a chance to drop Kites and the Merchant will sell the Pin Wheel.

The Nebula Floater is a Hardmode, post- Lunatic Cultist flying enemy that spawns in the area of the Nebula Pillar during the Lunar Events. The Nebula Floater periodically spawns up to three Nebula Eyes that float around it. If it has a clear line of sight to the player, it will hover in place and start firing pink Nebula Lasers from one of the Nebula Eyes at the player, otherwise, it will move towards the player through all tiles. It can also do random teleports around the player periodically, and will also attempt to do so with a small chance if it is hit.
The Lead Shortsword is an early game metal shortsword. Its alternate ore counterpart is the Iron Shortsword.

Like all shortswords, the Lead Shortsword has a very limited range and attacks with a stabbing motion at any direction on Desktop, Console, and Mobile, and horizontally in front of the player on Old-gen console and 3DS, instead of an arc. This makes it almost useless against flying or jumping enemies, although its high attack rate makes it somewhat effective against weaker fighter type enemies.
Its best modifier is Legendary.

The Toxic Flask is a Hardmode, post- Plantera magic weapon that throws a flask with low velocity and a heavy arc that explodes into a cluster of small, damaging toxic clouds upon colliding with an enemy or surface. The clouds last for one to two seconds and cannot pass through blocks. The Toxic Flask has a 1/40 (2.5%) / 79/1600 (4.94%) chance to be dropped from Dr. Man Flies during the Solar Eclipse event.
Its best modifier is Mythical.
Cactus armor is an early-game set of armor which can be crafted with 75 Cactus.
Equipping a full set of Cactus armor provides a thorns effect, dealing 15 / 30 / 45 damage and inflicting a knockback of 10 (Extremely strong) on enemies that come into contact with the wearer.
The Platinum Hammer is an early-game hammer. It has an alternate ore version, the Gold Hammer. Like all hammers, it is used to remove background walls and create sloped tiles and half tiles
Its best modifier is Legendary. However, due to rounding, Legendary, Light, Deadly, Agile, Quick, and Nasty provide equal boosts to mining speed for this tool.

The Marshmallow on a Stick is an item that is used to create a Cooked Marshmallow by holding it over any lit Campfire, i.e. the Marshmallow must overlap with the 2x3-tile rectangle of the Campfire. It must be held for up to 15 real-world seconds (15 in-game minutes). The Marshmallow on a Stick must be held by the player, either by attaching it to the cursor in the inventory or selecting it in the hotbar, for the entire duration over the Campfire in order for it to be cooked. Selecting a different item in the hotbar, moving/turning away from the Campfire, or turning the Campfire off resets the timer.
The exact cooking duration is randomized and can last between 7.5 seconds and 15 seconds. The average cooking duration is 12.5 seconds.

The Flower of Frost is a Hardmode magic weapon that launches a non-piercing Ball of Frost that ricochets up to seven times (but not off of platforms), dissipating on the eighth. Balls of Frost have a (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) 100% / (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) 1/2 (50%) chance of inflicting the (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) Frostbite / (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) Frostburn debuff upon damaging an enemy for 5-14 seconds. The Flower of Frost has a 19/60 (31.67%) chance of being dropped by Ice Mimics.
Its best modifier is Mythical.
The Ranger Emblem is a Hardmode accessory that increases ranged damage by 15%. It has a 1/4 (25%) chance to drop from the Wall of Flesh.

Arkhalis' set are vanity developer items that can be obtained rarely (5% chance) from Treasure Bags dropped from Hardmode bosses (except Queen Slime 's). It is the vanity set made for Arkhayla, a former Quality Director at Re-Logic.
These items are to be equipped in the Social Slots as they only provide a visual appearance.
Arkhalis' equipment also includes these non-vanity items, which will drop in addition to her clothing set:
Arkhalis' Lightwings Arkhalis

The Ice biome, also known as the Underground Tundra or Underground Snow biome, is a biome that is the underground version of the Snow biome, starting at the Cavern layer and stopping at the lava layer. On the Nintendo 3DS version, the Ice biome starts at the Underground layer. It is composed mainly of Snow Blocks and Ice Blocks. Thin Ice can be found generated over water and breaks when a character falls over 4 tiles onto it (unless using the Ice Skates or another accessory crafted from them). The Ice biome is the only place where Frozen Chests ((Old-gen console and 3DS versions) Ice Chests) can be found naturally.

An area is considered to be Ice biome if it is below the border between the Underground and Cavern layer, and there are at least (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) 1500 / (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) 300 Snow or Ice Blocks nearby.
In Hardmode, the Corruption, Crimson, and Hallow can spread through it, generating Purple, Red, and Pink Ice Blocks respectively. They are unable to spread through Snow Blocks.

On the Nintendo 3DS version, normal-sized worlds only have a 1/3 chance of containing a snow biome, and their respective underground. Furthermore, Armored Vikings, Snow Flinx, Icy Mermen, Ice Tortoises and Ice Mimics will spawn much more rarely than on the Desktop version, Console version, Old-gen console version, and Mobile version.

The Cell Phone is a post- Skeletron informational item and tool that displays fishing power, weather, moon phase, elevation, distance from the center of the world, time, nearest valuable environment item, movement speed, current DPS, total kills of the last enemy attacked, rare creatures nearby and total number of nearby enemies. It can also teleport the player home, similar to a Magic Mirror.

Unlike most other informational items (e.g. its constituent parts), the Cell Phone does not double as an accessory, and cannot be equipped in accessory slots. It instead functions solely from the player's ordinary inventory slots, which puts it into the tool category.

While the inventory screen is open, all Cell Phone information is hidden. Instead, an icon is displayed for each information type, each of which are toggles that can be clicked to toggle their display on or off.
In multiplayer, information from the Cell Phone will be shared with other nearby players on the same team.
The Cell Phone can be used to make the Shellphone with a Demon Conch and a Magic Conch.

The Greater Healing Potion is a (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) Hardmode / (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) pre-Hardmode recovery potion that restores 150 health and inflicts Potion Sickness for 60 seconds when used. This duration can be reduced via the Philosopher's Stone or Charm of Myths.

Greater Healing Potions can be crafted or obtained from most Hardmode bosses as well as from Biome Mimics (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) and Martian Saucers (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions). On the Old-gen console version and Nintendo 3DS version, they can be obtained from Golden Crates, but on the Desktop version, Console version, and Mobile version, they cannot be obtained outside of Hardmode.
It is the third tier of healing potion, succeeding the Lesser Healing Potion and Healing Potion, and preceding the Super Healing Potion (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions).

The Light Shard is a Hardmode crafting material used in the crafting of the Dao of Pow and the Sky Fracture. It has a 1/10 (10%) chance to drop from Light Mummies and Spectral Mummies (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) which spawn in Hallowed deserts.

On the Desktop version, Console version, and Mobile version, the Light Shard also has a 1/15 (6.67%) chance to drop from Dreamer Ghouls in the Hallowed Underground Desert, and a 1/25 (4%) chance of dropping from Crystal Threshers.
Its Corruption/Crimson counterpart is the Dark Shard.

The Tsunami is a Hardmode bow that autofires five arrows arranged in a wave-like formation in a single shot while only consuming one arrow per use. The Tsunami has a 1/5 (20%) chance of being dropped by Duke Fishron.
Its best modifier is Unreal.

Gems are valuable crafting materials found underground. There are currently 7 gem types. Gems can also be placed on any side of a block after being mined. They are found in any underground layer, except for The Underworld.
Gems are found in the following forms:

Embedded within Stone Blocks, (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) as the craftable Gemstone Blocks. In placed form on blocks underground, including sometimes in Underground Cabins, rarely in the Dungeon, and (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) Amber in the Underground Desert. As gem stashes, which are breakable background objects (similar to Coin Stashes), each resembling a rock with gems protruding. These will drop 1-3 respective gems when destroyed. (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) As a drop from a thrown Geode. (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) As a drop from a Gem tree, which can be replanted with Gemcorns. This makes gems farmable.
Gems can also be found in higher concentrations in rare gemstone caves, which can contain multiple gem types lining and embedded within their Stone Blocks.
On the Nintendo 3DS version, mining gems also has a chance of yielding a Broken Heart during Valentine's Day.

Minecarts are mounts that allow players to ride on Minecart Tracks. When the player is near a Minecart Track, pressing the Quick Mount hotkey or pressing the ⚷ Open / Activate key on a point on the track causes a Minecart to spawn, which the player is automatically placed in. Once inside, the ▶ Right and ◀ Left direction keys either accelerate, decelerate, or reverse the cart's movement. The cart will maintain its current speed and direction if no keys are pressed and no obstacles are reached. The cart can also "jump" with the ↷ Jump key.

Weapons and tools, as well as most other items except hooks, can be used while riding a Minecart. The Minecart will deal damage to enemies it collides with and knock them back, with higher potency at higher speeds (see below for details).

To exit the Minecart (which causes the Minecart to despawn), the player can use a hook, press the Quick Mount hotkey, or cancel the buff by right-clicking the icon,  by selecting the icon using Cycle Next/Previous Buff and then pressing Remove Buff, or  by double-tapping the buff icon. The Minecart will also despawn if the player jumps off the tracks, lands on blocks, and attempts to move sideways.

By default, a Wooden Minecart is spawned for the player. This can be overridden by equipping other Minecart items in the Minecart equipment slot of the player's inventory. The corresponding dye slot allows dyeing the Minecart.

Using a Minecart Upgrade Kit will significantly boost the speed of all Minecarts, equip them with a laser that fires at nearby enemies, and increase the player's defense while moving. The boost effect is permanently available after using the item, though it can be toggled on and off through a probe icon next to the Minecart slot.

Unicorn Wisp Dye is a Hardmode, post- Plantera dye that can be acquired by bringing a Strange Plant to the Dye Trader. When equipped, it turns the affected item into a deep shade of pink, and produces a glow effect similar to that of the Wisp in a Bottle.

The Butcher's Chainsaw is a Hardmode, post- Plantera chainsaw that, upon striking an enemy or critter, emits 1-4 sparks akin to the projectiles produced by the Wand of Sparking, dealing damage to nearby enemies as well. The Butcher's Chainsaw's sparks pierce up to two enemies, deal 50% of the weapon's damage (60 base damage), and inflict 20% of its knockback (base knockback of 1.6 (Very weak)). Sparks also have a 1/2 (50%) chance to inflict the Hellfire debuff onto damaged enemies for 1-4 seconds. The Butcher's Chainsaw has a 1/40 (2.5%) / 79/1600 (4.94%) chance to drop from Butchers during the Solar Eclipse event.

Its best modifier is Godly or Demonic. Both modifiers increase the average damage output by the same amount. However, Ruthless might be preferred if the player already has very high critical strike chance.

Gray Brick is a basic brick. It is often used in construction, as it requires only common Stone blocks to produce and, unlike its constituent materials, is resistant to the spread of Corruption, Crimson, and Hallow. Although it can be painted with Deep Paint, most colors turn out extremely dark and indistinguishable from others.
(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) Moss can spread to and be planted on Gray Bricks, but Gemcorns may not be planted on them.

Advanced Combat Techniques: Volume Two is a Hardmode permanent booster item that permanently increases the defense of Town NPCs by 6 and attack damage by 20%, similar to the increases after each type of boss is defeated. It can only be consumed once per world and is obtained by throwing a Spell Tome into Shimmer.
When used, the status message " The book's knowledge empowers your villagers! " is displayed.
The Stone Accent Slab is a block which is visually identical to the Stone Slab, except that it does not blend with any blocks other than itself and Smooth Marble Blocks.

Iron Ore is an early-game ore that generates upon world creation on the surface, as well as in the Underground and Cavern layers. Its primary use is in crafting Iron Bars, which can then be used to craft the Iron tier of tools, weapons, and armor, as well as Buckets, Chains, and several other items. (Desktop, Console, Mobile and 3DS versions) Iron Ore has a small chance to appear as a bonus drop from slimes. Furthermore, it can be obtained from all types of crates.
Its alternate ore counterpart is the Lead Ore.

As Iron Bars are needed to create an Iron Anvil, Iron Ore must usually be obtained before any weapons or armor can be created out of metal bars. While this can be circumvented by purchasing an Iron Anvil from the Merchant, that is generally inefficient, as it is not difficult to find 15 Iron Ore early on in the game.
Grab bags are items that contain loot chosen at random when they are opened. They can be opened from within a player's inventory by pressing the ⚷ Open / Activate button on their inventory icons.

A modifier, also known as a prefix (although in some languages it becomes a suffix), applies permanent changes to an item's statistics. It changes the name of an item by adding a prefix to the item's name (displayed when selected in the hotbar and in its tooltip), such as "Adept", "Godly", or "Broken" (e.g. "Demonic Minishark "). A complete list of all 83 modifiers can be found below. Hovering the cursor over an item with a modifier in an inventory slot will show the modification details beneath the item's description.

Accessory modifiers will grant a bonus to one of the player's stats, such as defense, movement speed, or maximum mana. The modifier is applied as long as the accessory is equipped. Certain accessory-like items that cannot be placed in an accessory slot (e.g., a Cell Phone), cannot receive modifiers. Weapon modifiers alter the statistics of that particular weapon, and can affect up to five statistics. The effects of a given modifier can be all positive, all negative, or mixed. Tools that damage enemies, such as pickaxes and hammers, may also have these modifiers. Weapon-like items that do not inflict damage (e.g., a Bug Net) and consumable weapons (e.g., Shurikens) cannot gain modifiers. On Old-gen console and 3DS, Bananarangs and Light Discs are stackable and thus cannot gain modifiers either.
Most but not all weapons and accessories will receive a modifier upon the item's creation. Modifiers can be added or changed afterwards by the Goblin Tinkerer 's Reforge function.

The Cursed Hammer is a rare Hardmode enemy which spawns in the Underground Corruption. It hovers and spins before lunging at the player, traveling through any blocks to reach them. Any knockback stops its attack, forcing it to pause and spin up again. It can inflict the Cursed debuff.
On the Old-gen console version and Nintendo 3DS version, the Shadow Hammer acts as an exclusive version of the Cursed Hammer, featuring increased defense and the chance to drop Hardmode ore bars.
Armor Bracing is a Hardmode immunity accessory that combines the functions of the Vitamins and the Armor Polish. This item provides immunity from the Weak and Broken Armor debuffs.
It is one of the ingredients required to make the Ankh Charm, which is further required to make the Ankh Shield.

Bubbles are animated background furniture blocks, which have special behavior regarding liquids, interacting as if the Bubble was a solid block. When Bubbles are placed together in groups, they connect to make a larger Bubble or more complex structures.
Bubbles are purchased from the Party Girl for 2 SC each during Hardmode.
Grates function as the opposite of Bubbles, acting as solid blocks but allowing liquids to flow through.

Attack speed in Terraria refers to the rate at which a weapon can attack. Despite many modifiers and effects showing changes to attack or melee speed, attack speed is not an in-game statistic and is instead determined by its reciprocal, known as use time. This is the amount of ticks it takes to swing (attack with) or use an item. If use time increases, attack speed decreases, and vice versa. For example, a weapon with a use time of 30 will have a lower attack speed (slower rate of fire) than a weapon with a use time of 10. As such, any attack speed modifiers will in actuality act as a variable within the use time equation. However, as shown below, for many melee weapons a change in attack speed (and therefore use time) will have effects other than a change in use time.
While almost all weapons can receive attack speed modifiers, such as Quick or Legendary, accessories will only ever provide bonuses to melee speed.

The term world refers to Terraria 's virtual world system which all of the gameplay takes place in. The world holds the entirety of the game content, such as items, enemies, objects, and so on. Terraria worlds are two-dimensional and navigated in a platform game -like manner. World appearance is subject to some settings.
The term map is partly synonymous with "world" but also refers to the minimap, the in-game map system.

The Sticky Grenade is an explosive consumable ranged weapon. It can be made by combining Grenades with Gel. Like the Sticky Bomb, it will not roll, and will instead stick to the first block it touches until it explodes.
Like normal Grenades, they will detonate upon touching an enemy, or the player that threw it.

The Space Creature set is a vanity set consisting of the Space Creature Mask, Space Creature Shirt, and Space Creature Pants. Its male and female variants look identical. It has a 2/57 (3.51%) chance to drop from Goodie Bags during Halloween.
These items are to be equipped in the Social Slots as they only provide a visual appearance.

The Mana Booster is one of the three power-ups occasionally dropped when striking enemies while wearing a full set of Nebula armor. When picked up, it grants the Mana Nebula buff which immediately increases the player's mana regeneration rate by 10 mana per second for 8 seconds. When a Mana Booster is picked up while the Mana Nebula buff is already in effect, it stacks with the previous Mana Nebula, for up to 3 stacked boosts. Every 8 seconds, one stacked Mana Booster expires, and the Mana Nebula buff decreases by one level.
Mana Boosters, like all Nebula boosters, float in the air and have a pickup range of 8.875 tiles. They cannot legitimately appear in a player's inventory.
The Gold Watch is a high-tier watch. Its alternate ore counterpart is the Platinum Watch.

When equipped in an accessory slot or simply held in the inventory, a clock will appear in the upper-right corner of the playing screen, revealing the in-game time accurate to the last minute. A minute of Terraria game time is equivalent to a second of real-world time.

The Gold Watch (or Platinum Watch) is one of the three parts necessary to make the GPS, with the others being the Compass and the Depth Meter, and as such is a required ingredient in crafting the Shellphone (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions). The Gold Watch can also be used to craft the 1 Second Timer.

The Lucky Coin is an extremely rare Hardmode accessory that causes enemies to drop extra coins when damaged and grants the player +0.05 luck (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions). It has a (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) 1/2000 (0.05%) / (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) 1/4000 (0.025%) chance to be dropped by pirates (except Parrots) during Pirate Invasions, with a (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) 1/500 (0.2%) / (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) 1/1000 (0.1%) chance from the Pirate Captain. It also has a 1/15 (6.67%) chance to be dropped by the Flying Dutchman (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions).

With the Lucky Coin equipped, there is a 1/5 (20%) chance that 1 to 10 extra coins will drop each time the player damages an enemy. Each time extra coins drop, the following probabilities determine the coin type:
89.1% chance for Copper Coins 9.9% chance for Silver Coins 1% chance for Gold Coins

The Star Cell is a Hardmode, post- Lunatic Cultist enemy that spawns in the area of the Stardust Pillar during the Lunar Events. It floats slowly towards the player but can move at a faster rate if the player begins moving away from it.

Upon death, it splits into multiple Mini Star Cells. If these Mini Star Cells are not dealt with, they will grow into a full-sized Star Cell, that can also split into more Mini Star Cells. Mini Star Cells do not contribute to the kill count required to break the Stardust Pillar's shield, though after growing back, they do.

The Blood Lust Cluster is an axe crafted from Crimtane Bars. It is stronger than both the Gold and Platinum Axe, but is weaker than the Meteor Hamaxe. It has a Demonite counterpart, the War Axe of the Night. Like all Axes, it can be used to cut down trees, cacti and Giant Glowing Mushrooms.
Its best modifier is Light for harvesting purposes and Legendary for combat purposes.
The Rat is a harmless critter that spawns in the Graveyard biome. The Rat has only 5 health and no defense, and can only be damaged by players.

The Rat can be caught with any Bug Net to be carried around in the inventory and released later, or crafted into animated decorative furniture (Rat Cage). Once crafted, the Rat cannot be released again, unless the furniture item is de-crafted via Shimmer (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions).
The Warrior Emblem is a Hardmode accessory that increases melee damage by 15%. It has a 1/4 (25%) chance to drop from the Wall of Flesh.

The Moon Shell is a Hardmode accessory that can be crafted at the Tinkerer's Workshop. It combines the effects of the Moon Charm and the Neptune's Shell : Equipping it will turn the player into a Merfolk when entering water or honey (at any time), or into a Werewolf at night. The Merfolk form replaces the Werewolf form if entering water at night.
The buffs from the Moon Charm:

+2% melee critical strike chance +5.1% melee damage +5.1% melee speed +5% movement speed +3 defense Slightly increased jump height and jump speed +0.5 HP regeneration per second (similar to the Band of Regeneration, but with half the speed)
The buff from the Neptune's Shell:

Entering applicable liquids with this accessory equipped transforms the player into a merperson and grants the Merfolk buff. While in this form, the breath meter will refill as if the player is in open air, therefore effectively preventing drowning. The player will be able to move freely in water.

The Terraspark Boots are a pre-Hardmode accessory crafted by combining Frostspark Boots and Lava Waders at a Tinkerer's Workshop, providing the benefits of both items. They are the final upgrade of the Hermes / Sailfish / Flurry / Dunerider and Water Walking Boots.

The White Horseshoe Balloon is an accessory that grants immunity to fall damage, increases jump height by 33% and jump speed by 30%, grants a double-jump, and grants +0.05 luck (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions). The height of the first jump is increased from 6 blocks to 10.5 blocks (~75% increase), while the double-jump's height is increased from 8 blocks to 14.5 blocks, reaching a total of 25 blocks with both jumps.
Jump height is oddly reduced when underwater, reducing total underwater jump height from 19 blocks (8 + 11 from Blizzard jump) to 16 blocks (7 + 9 from Blizzard jump).
The Wooden Hammer is the lowest tier of hammer available, just below the Copper Hammer.

It offers beginning players an easily obtainable means of removing background walls and shaping blocks, as players are not automatically given a hammer on character creation (except on Journey Mode, in which they are given an Iron Hammer), the way they are for the other essential construction tools (axe and pickaxe).
Its best modifier is Light for harvesting purposes and either Agile or Forceful / Strong for combat purposes, due to its unusually low base damage.

The Hellfire Treads are a pre-Hardmode accessory that combines the effects of the Spectre and Flame Waker Boots. It grants the player the ability to fly and to gain increased movement speed when running continuously, and causes the player's feet to leave trails of fire while moving on blocks, which is a purely visual effect.

Pets are creatures that follow the player around. They are completely invincible and have no set duration. When summoned, they will give the player a buff with the same name as the pet. A pet will follow the player until they die, summon a different pet, leave the world, or cancel the associated buff. On Desktop version, Console version, and Mobile version, the equipped pet can be seen on the player selection menu with the character.

Most pets are purely cosmetic, except Chester (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) and some of the Old-gen console and 3DS -exclusive pets that can do minimal damage to enemies. A few pets emit small amounts of light, but on Desktop version, Console version, and Mobile version, there are special Light Pets available with their own dedicated slot.
Summoned minions operate similarly, but are primarily intended to aid combat rather than being cosmetic. Pets do not count against a player's current minion limit.
In total, there are 59 pets. There are 48 on the Desktop version, Console version, and Mobile version, 27 on the Old-gen console version, and 31 on the Nintendo 3DS version.

There are also 10 light pets on the Desktop version, Console version, and Mobile version, 3 of which are Master Mode (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) -exclusive, and 4 on the Old-gen console version and Nintendo 3DS version.

Apple Juice is a food item that grants the Well Fed buff when consumed. This lasts for 10 minutes, but can be canceled at any time  by right-clicking the icon,  by selecting the icon using Cycle Next/Previous Buff and then pressing Remove Buff, or  by double-tapping the buff icon.
Like all other food items, the Apple Juice can be placed on a Plate :

The Cosmic Car Key is a Hardmode, post- Golem mount-summoning item. When used, it summons a rideable UFO Mount that allows the player to fly and hover indefinitely. The Cosmic Car Key has a 1/6 (16.67%) chance of being dropped by the Martian Saucer during the Martian Madness event.
The Companion Cube is a pet-summoning item that spawns a Companion Cube pet to follow the player around. The Companion Cube has a rare chance of being sold by the Traveling Merchant for 5 PC.

Normally, the Companion Cube follows the player by hopping towards them. However, when the player and the Companion Cube are in complete darkness (including the absence of light sources), the Cube can occasionally "stab" the player, inflicting 3 damage.

When the Companion Cube falls into lava, it emits the Lunatic Cultist 's death sound https://terraria.wiki.gg/wiki/File:NPC_Killed_59.wav. When submerged in lava for long enough, there is a chance it may make the Moon Lord 's death sound https://terraria.wiki.gg/wiki/File:NPC_Killed_61.wav. The Companion Cube will also occasionally emit the flatulence sound https://terraria.wiki.gg/wiki/File:Item_16.wav normally produced by the Whoopie Cushion.

The Topaz Staff is a pre-Hardmode magic weapon and is the second tier of gem staff. It fires a non-piercing yellow bolt (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) and is the most powerful gem staff which cannot autofire.
(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) Its best modifier is Mythical.

(Old-gen console and 3DS versions) Its best modifier is either Masterful for mana conservation or Godly / Demonic for higher damage output. It cannot get the Mythical modifier due to its low mana cost.

The Hive Pack is a pre-Hardmode accessory that, when equipped, grants a 1/2 (50%) chance of replacing friendly Bee projectiles with larger "Giant Bees". The Hive Pack is always dropped from the Queen Bee 's Treasure Bag in Expert Mode.
The Gold Hammer is an early-game hammer. It has an alternate ore version, the Platinum Hammer. Like all hammers, it is used to remove background walls and create sloped tiles and half tiles.
Its best modifier is Legendary. However, due to rounding, Legendary, Light, Deadly, Agile, Quick, and Nasty provide equal boosts to mining speed for this tool.

Flying enemies are enemies that can move freely in both x and y axis while in air. Some of them can be difficult to fight, especially in pre-Hardmode, before the player can obtain wings. These enemies can be more easily fought with ranged weapons like guns and bows.

The Wandering Eye is a Hardmode enemy that spawns at night and attacks like a Demon Eye. It initially resembles a larger Demon Eye, but at half health (150 / 300 / 450), its pupil will peel off and reveal a mouth with teeth, similarly to the Eye of Cthulhu. Its attack pattern does not change, although its movements get faster. On the Nintendo 3DS version, it can pass through blocks and is completely resistant to knockback in this second form.
Wandering Eyes will flee when the sun rises. They appear more often during a new moon.
The Temple Key is dropped by Plantera and is used to unlock the door to the Jungle Temple. It is consumed upon use, like Golden Keys.

The Shadowflame Knife is a Hardmode melee weapon that auto-fires small flaming knife projectiles that consume no mana or ammunition. The projectiles ricochet twice off enemies only (not blocks), dissipating upon their third impact. They also inflict the Shadowflame debuff for between 1 and 3 seconds, which deals an additional 15 damage per second. The Shadowflame Knife also has a base 7% critical strike chance as opposed to the usual 4%.
The Shadowflame Knife has a 1/6 (16.67%) / 1/3 (33.33%) chance to drop from Goblin Warlocks during a Hardmode Goblin Army.

Its best modifier is Godly or Demonic. Both modifiers increase the average damage output by the same amount. However, Ruthless might be preferred if the player already has very high critical strike chance.
Vines are crafting materials dropped by Man Eaters in the Underground Jungle biome with a 1/2 (50%) / 100% drop chance.

The Tackle Box is an accessory that decreases the chance of bait consumption while fishing. The Tackle Box can be acquired as a 1/34 (2.94%) chance reward for completing a fishing quest for the Angler NPC, depending on the number of completed quests and other factors (for details, see Angler).

The Angler will not give the player a Tackle Box as a reward if they already have one in their inventory or in any of their portable storage items or loadouts. However, if the player has all of the Angler's fishing and informational accessories (or their upgrades like the Angler Tackle Bag and Fish Finder) in their inventories, this rule will be ignored.

The Gelatinous Pillion is a Hardmode mount-summoning item that summons a friendly Winged Slime Mount. Similar to the pre-Hardmode Slime Mount, the Winged Slime offers increased jump height, provides boosted movement speed, negates fall damage, and allows continuous auto-jump by holding the ↷ Jump key. It also shares the Slime Mount's abilities to deal 40 summon damage to enemies when jumping on them from above, and floating when entering liquids.

The Winged Slime Mount grants 2.66 seconds of flight time, similar to low-tier wings, allowing the player to fly up to a height of 73 tiles, as well as gliding while holding the ↷ Jump key after flight time has been exhausted. It can also hover by holding ▼ Down, similar to the Hoverboard.
The Gelatinous Pillion has a 1/4 (25%) chance of being dropped by Queen Slime in Classic Mode, or a 1/2 (50%) chance of being found in Queen Slime's Treasure Bag.

The Shiren set is a vanity set exclusive to the Japanese Console and Wii U versions of the game that looks like the character of the same name from the game series Shiren the Wanderer. It consists of Shiren Hat, Shiren Shirt, and Shiren Pants. The Shiren Hat has a 1/250 (0.4%) chance to be dropped by Fire Imps and the Shiren Shirt and Shiren Pants are purchased from the Clothier during a full moon.

Hanging herbs are placeable decorative furniture items craftable with one Hanging Pot and one herb. They can only be placed on the ceiling and breaking one of the blocks above a hanging herb will drop the item.

Lava is a glowing red-orange liquid found deep in the Cavern layer and throughout The Underworld, appearing instead of water at depths below approximately 950 feet (475 tiles) in a small world, 1,450 feet (725 tiles) in a medium world, or 1,950 feet (975 tiles) in a large world (on average). Tiny pools can frequently be found on the outskirts of the Underground Desert (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) as well, even as high as 200 feet below the surface.

Contact with lava deals damage and inflicts the On Fire! debuff. Players take 80 damage and the debuff lasts for 7 / 14 / 17.5 seconds, whereas enemies, NPCs, and critters take 50 damage and the debuff lasts for 7 seconds. Various items make the player immune to this damage, such as the Lava Charm and its derivatives. Lava also slows movement of entities submerged in it, similarly to water.

Lava flows downwards and horizontally, settling and taking the shape of any block formations below and beside it, the way water does. However, lava is more viscous than water, flowing more slowly. After flowing 50 tiles in a direction, lava will begin to evaporate, causing the source to be lost. Unlike with water, the color of lava does not depend on the biome the player is in. It also emits a medium amount of flickering light.

Most dropped items of 00* rarity (which includes all coins) will be destroyed when submerged in lava past their vertical midpoint. Furthermore, many types of placed furniture and almost all placed platforms are destroyed upon contact with lava. Blocks cannot be placed directly within lava, but falling blocks like silt and sand can fall into it, resulting in placement at its bottom. Lava can be moved by the player via a bucket or pump.

In addition to naturally generated lava, it may be produced in a few other ways. Hellstone produces half a block's volume of lava when mined in the Underworld (a full block's volume in Expert Mode (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions)). Lava Slimes create a small amount of lava when slain in Expert Mode (except in Don't dig up (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) and Get fixed boi (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) secret world seeds). Hellbats and Lava Bats create a small amount of lava when slain in a Get fixed boi secret world seed.

The Eternia Crystal Stand is a furniture item that initiates the Old One's Army event when an Eternia Crystal is placed on it with ⚷ Open / Activate. The Eternia Crystal Stand can be purchased from the Tavernkeep for 1 GC.

Town Slimes are a type of town pet. There are 8 different Town Slimes; different from the Town Bunny, Town Cat, and the Town Dog, all kinds of Town Slimes can all exist at the same time, with each Slime having different move-in conditions. As with most other NPCs, the condition only needs to be fulfilled once; the Town Slimes will respawn on their own should they be killed.
Like other NPCs, Town Slimes also require a valid standing point in the house (a home tile). They may not be able to share a house with another NPC if the house is too small.

The Bladed Glove is a rare pre-Hardmode sword with a short range, but an exceptionally low use time (in other words, an exceptionally high attack speed). The Bladed Glove has a 1/2000 (0.05%) chance of being dropped by any weak enemy during the Halloween seasonal event. The Fetid Baghnakhs (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) can be considered its Hardmode upgrade.
Its best modifier is Legendary.

Nebula Fragment Blocks are blocks made from Nebula Fragments which are dropped by the Nebula Pillar. The blocks have a crystal-like appearance with intense shades of pink and purple. They can be crafted with the Ancient Manipulator. Walls cannot be crafted with them.
Cobalt Brick Wall is a background wall crafted from Cobalt Bricks.
Living Ocean Dye is a Hardmode dye acquired by giving a Strange Plant to the Dye Trader. It is only obtainable after defeating any mechanical boss.

The Roasted Duck is a food item that grants the Plenty Satisfied buff. This lasts for 10 minutes, but can be canceled at any time  by right-clicking the icon,  by selecting the icon using Cycle Next/Previous Buff and then pressing Remove Buff, or  by double-tapping the buff icon.
Like all other food items, the Roasted Duck can be placed on a Plate :
The Autohammer is a Hardmode crafting station used to craft Shroomite Bars as well as Mini Nuke I and II. It can be purchased from the Truffle for 1 PC after Plantera has been defeated.
Silly Balloon Walls are background Walls crafted from Silly Balloons, which are purchased from the Party Girl during a party.

The Bundle of Balloons is an accessory that allows the wearer to perform a quadruple jump, as well as increasing the player's jump duration by 33% and jump speed by 30%. Each of the jumps has an effect from the different combined items: sandstorm jump, then blizzard jump, then cloud jump.

Crafting this item requires three of the variants of Cloud in a Balloon, which in turn requires a total of 3 Shiny Red Balloons. In particular it requires the relatively rare Sandstorm in a Bottle, which, on Old-gen console and 3DS, can only be found in a Pyramid.
The Old One's Skeleton is an enemy which is spawned by the Dark Mage during the Old One's Army event.
The Old One's Skeleton requires 150 kills to be awarded completion of its corresponding banner, as opposed to the usual 50 kills.

The Seagull is a critter that spawns in the Ocean. Unlike Birds, it will not fly away when a player approaches. It will occasionally make typical seagull sounds, walk passively on land, and swim on the water's surface until they fall a certain distance or are approached while swimming, at which point they will switch to their alternative flying form. In their flying form, they will fly in a given direction for a certain amount of time before landing and switching back to their passive form. Despite their spawn conditions, they do not prioritize water whenever landing.
The Seagull has only 5 health and no defense, and can be damaged by other enemies and players.

The Seagull can be caught with any Bug Net to be carried around in the inventory and released later, or crafted into animated decorative furniture (Seagull Cage). Once crafted, the Seagull cannot be released again, unless the furniture item is de-crafted via Shimmer (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions).
The Seagull can be spawned by the Seagull Statue, however statue-spawned critters cannot be caught with any Bug Net, and will disappear in a puff of smoke when the player attempts to do so.
Hamaxes are a type of tool that work both as an axe and a hammer. They are notably practical tools as they save an inventory slot one would normally need for an additional hammer or axe.

The Fish Finder is an informational accessory that provides the information displayed by the Fisherman's Pocket Guide, which displays the player's current fishing power, Weather Radio, which displays the current weather, and Sextant, which displays the moon's current phase, all of which are acquired randomly by completing quests for the Angler NPC.

Armored Cavefish are a type of fish which are found uncommonly by fishing in the Underground, Cavern, and Underworld layers, in any biome (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) except the Desert. They are used to craft Seafood Dinners and Endurance Potions.

Tungsten Brick is a type of Brick and an aesthetic building material. Like the ore it is made of, placed Tungsten Bricks will sparkle. It is not recommended that it be used for building unless the player has tungsten to spare. Despite being made of Tungsten, it has no sell value. It can be crafted into Tungsten Brick Walls.

The Capricorn set is a vanity set consisting of the Capricorn Helmet, the Capricorn Chestplate, the Capricorn Hooves, and the Capricorn Tail. It is one of the six sets that were added as part of the Journey's End Vanity Contest ; the original concept was submitted by R-MK.
These items are to be equipped in the Social Slots as they only provide a visual appearance.
The leggings of this vanity have the unique feature of being able to switch from tail to legs and vice-versa via the ⚷ Open / Activate key when they are not equipped.

Silver armor is an armor set crafted from Silver Bars. Crafting the entire set requires a total of (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) 60 / (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) 75 Silver Bars ((Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) 240 / (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) 300 Silver Ore).
It consists of the Silver Helmet, Silver Chainmail, and Silver Greaves.
The individual Silver armor pieces grant a total of 10 defense. Wearing a full set additionally grants a set bonus of 3 defense, for a grand total of 13 defense.
Replacing the Silver Greaves with the Boots of Ostara (3DS version) will still grant the set bonus of 3 defense. The Boots of Ostara will also, when placed on a mannequin, become Silver Greaves.

The Bee set is a vanity set consisting of the Bee Hat, the Bee Shirt, and the Bee Pants. All three pieces are dropped by the Queen Bee, with a 1/9 (11.11%) chance each. In Expert Mode (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), each piece instead has a 1/3 (33.33%) chance to be dropped from her Treasure Bag, and one piece is always dropped.

The Cursed Flames is a Hardmode magic weapon that auto-fires ricocheting green fireballs that move quite similarly to those from the Flower of Fire or Flower of Frost, are affected by gravity, and set enemies on fire with the Cursed Inferno debuff for a duration of 7 seconds. The Cursed Flames auto-fires at a rate of (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) 4 / (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) 3 attacks per second. Its fireballs can ricochet four times, dissipating on their fifth impact, and pierce enemies one time before dissipating on the second enemy hit.

The Cursed Flames is the Corruption counterpart to the Crimson's Golden Shower and the Hallow's Crystal Storm, all of which require a Spell Tome and ingredients exclusive to their underground biome counterparts.

Crafting the Cursed Flames requires ingredients found only in worlds containing the Corruption. In worlds originally generated with the Crimson, Corrupt Seeds can be purchased from the Dryad while in a Graveyard (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) in a Hardmode world in order to create the Underground Corruption biome in which Cursed Flames can be obtained.
Its best modifier is Mythical.

The Celestial Sigil is a Hardmode, post- Lunatic Cultist boss-summoning item crafted from all four of the Lunar Fragments, and is used to summon the Moon Lord without having to complete the Lunar Events. Rather than summoning the Moon Lord immediately after the item is used, it takes 12 seconds before the Moon Lord appears.
The Celestial Sigil can only be used under the following circumstances:

The world is in Hardmode. Golem has been defeated. There is no invasion event active, including the Lunar Events. There is no boss alive. The Moon Lord is not already being summoned. The Mysterious Tablet is not visible to any player.

Bottled Water is a recovery potion and crafting material that restores 20 health and inflicts Potion Sickness for 60 seconds when used. Bottled Water can be crafted at a sink or a body of water. Crafting it does not lower the water level and it cannot be emptied on a block like a Water Bucket.

The Bottled Water serves as the basis of almost every craftable Potion in the game and is also necessary for crafting flasks, cosmetic jars like Jellyfish Jars, and Thrown Water, making it an essential, versatile crafting material.
The Wither Beast is a Hardmode enemy that spawns during the Old One's Army event. It spawns during Tier 2 during waves 6-7, and Tier 3 during waves 5-7.

When a Wither Beast is within 25 tiles of a player, it will briefly dig its way into the ground for approximately three seconds before burying itself and emitting a 50x50-tile aura of purple crystals, visually similar to the Dryad's Blessing. This aura inflicts the Withered Armor debuff, which halves the player's defense for as long as the player is within the aura's radius, and disappears immediately when the player leaves the zone. While buried, the Wither Beast will also regenerate its health when damaged, healing at a rate of 25 / 50 / 63 (in Tier 2) or 70 / 140 / 178 (in Tier 3) health every second.
It is one of only two enemies from the Old One's Army that requires the usual 50 kills to obtain its corresponding banner, the other being the Etherian Lightning Bug.

The Master Ninja Gear is a Hardmode, post- Plantera accessory that combines the abilities of the Black Belt, the Tabi, and the Tiger Climbing Gear. It allows the player to cling to and slide down vertical walls, quickly dash short distances by double-tapping either the ◀ Left or ▶ Right key, and offers a 1/10 (10%) chance to automatically dodge enemy attacks. There is a one-second cooldown period between dashes.

Slime furniture are furniture items crafted from Slime Blocks, which in turn are crafted from Gel at a Solidifier. On the Desktop version, Console version, and Mobile version, the Solidifier is dropped by King Slime, and on the Old-gen console version and Nintendo 3DS version, it is purchased from the Steampunker. There are 20 different Slime furniture items.

The Phantom Phoenix is a Hardmode bow that fires two arrows at a time, spreading randomly similarly to the Chlorophyte Shotbow, and also fires a large Phoenix projectile with a waving arc once per every third shot. The Phoenix projectile deals double the weapon's base damage. (64 base damage) The Phoenix can pierce an infinite number of targets. The damage of the Phoenix decreases by 5% for each target it pierces. Upon colliding with solid tiles, the Phoenix explodes, dealing damage within a 6x6-tile rectangular area centered around the point of impact. The Phantom Phoenix also converts regular Wooden Arrows into Flaming Arrows, similar to the Molten Fury, while the Phoenix projectile inflicts the Hellfire debuff for eight seconds to damaged enemies.
The Phantom Phoenix is dropped by Ogres during the Old One's Army event, with a 1/10 (10%) / 1/5 (20%) chance during Tier 2, and a 1/20 (5%) chance during Tier 3.
Its best modifier is Unreal.

Trophies are decorative furniture items which usually have a 1/10 (10%) chance to be dropped from most bosses. While they can be considered the "boss version of banners ", they are purely cosmetic and do not provide any bonuses. Some trophies can only be rewarded by the Angler for completing fishing quests. In total, there are (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) 33 / (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) 24 trophies.

Poo is a type of decorative block obtained by sitting on a toilet while any tier of the Well Fed buff is active. The time until Poo is produced is random, though it averages to 10 seconds. Producing Poo will remove the food buff, and the number of blocks dropped increases with the type of the buff and its remaining duration. The maximum number of Poo blocks acquirable at once is 141, from a Golden Delight with 47 minutes of buff time remaining.

When Poo is placed down, small flies will continuously fade in and out around it as a visual effect. The quantity of flies scales with the amount of Poo blocks placed in one area. Additionally, Poo blocks apply 3 seconds of the Stinky debuff to all players standing on them.
