Poo blocks create a squelchy sound when stepped on, and landing on top of them will also not inflict fall damage.

Spikes are a type of trap block that deal (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) 60 / (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) 40 damage to players who come in contact with them. On the Desktop version, Console version, and Mobile version, they additionally inflict the Bleeding debuff for 10 / 20 / 25 seconds. They can be found in the Dungeon and can be broken with a drill, pickaxe, or explosive. This is the only way to obtain them, as they are not craftable.

The Blizzard Staff is a Hardmode, post- Plantera magic weapon that rains four damaging, non-piercing icicles from above which are directed in the general location of the cursor per every use. Modifiers that boost speed by 10% or more will make it shoot six icicles per use. The Blizzard Staff is dropped from the Ice Queen during the Frost Moon event with a 5.19%-10.37% (15.56%-31.11%) chance depending on the current wave.
Its best modifier is Mythical.

The Slimer is a Hardmode enemy and a slime variant that spawns in The Corruption and Underground Corruption. It spawns as a winged slime, attacking the player using the Bat AI pattern. Once "killed" for the first time, the slime body drops to the ground, continuing to fight using the Slime AI pattern.
Like most other slimes, the Slimer's both forms will be passive towards any player with the Royal Gel (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) accessory equipped.
The Valkyrie Yoyo is a Hardmode, Expert Mode -exclusive yoyo that can be obtained from any Hardmode boss 's Treasure Bag (except Queen Slime 's) as part of Lazure's set.
It has an infinite spin duration and can reach up to 23 tiles.

Its best modifier is Godly or Demonic. Both modifiers increase the average damage output by the same amount. However, Ruthless might be preferred if the player already has very high critical strike chance.
The Robot Hat is a vanity item equipped in the Social Helmet Slot. It has a 1/250 (0.4%) chance to drop from Piranhas and Angler Fish.

The Paint Scraper is a tool which is used to remove paint off tiles and walls, eliminating the need of breaking and re-placing a tile to remove its paint. The Paint Scraper is purchased for 1 GC from the Painter. Its upgrade, the Spectre Paint Scraper, grants a bonus to range. Paint removed by a scraper can never be recovered.
On the Desktop version, Console version, and Mobile version, the Paint Scraper can be used to obtain moss by removing it from tiles.
The Paint Scraper cannot be reforged, and therefore cannot have modifiers.

Luminite Bars are a type of bar used to craft all four sets of endgame armor and tools as well as other endgame items. The only way to obtain it is to craft it from Luminite, which is dropped from the Moon Lord, at an Ancient Manipulator. Each time the Moon Lord is killed, it drops enough Luminite for 17-22 / 22-27 bars.

Crafting all items (excluding ammunition, dye, and bricks) requires a total of 362 Luminite Bars and 25 Luminite (1,473 Luminite; requires defeating the Moon Lord 17-22 / 14-17 times). Crafting all items pertaining to one type of Lunar Fragment (i.e., armor, wings, pickaxe, and hamaxe) requires 68 Luminite Bars (272 Luminite) in addition to 85 of the Lunar Fragment; this requires defeating the Moon Lord only 4 / 3-4 times.

The Flamarang is a pre-Hardmode boomerang and is the upgraded version of the Enchanted Boomerang, which deals more damage and has a (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) 1/2 (50%) / (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) 1/5 (20%) chance of inflicting the On Fire! debuff to enemies for 3 seconds. It travels faster than the Enchanted Boomerang and emits more light. The light particles also travel through walls.

Its best modifier is Godly or Demonic. Both modifiers increase the average damage output by the same amount. However, Ruthless might be preferred if the player already has very high critical strike chance.

The Xenopopper is a Hardmode, post- Golem gun that uses bullets as ammunition, but fires a small initial cloud of four to five simultaneous purple bubbles. The bubbles themselves do no damage and will bounce off solid blocks, but then pop after a short delay, firing bullets (one per bubble) that converge at the cursor's location. Each firing consumes only one bullet but produces four to five projectiles each. The Xenopopper has a 1/6 (16.67%) chance of being dropped by the Martian Saucer during the Martian Madness event.
Its best modifier is Unreal.

The Pearlwood Crate is a Hardmode crate that can be obtained by fishing in any biome, at any height. It is the lowest tier of standard crate, having the least value if sold directly. Its pre-Hardmode counterpart is the Wooden Crate.
Gem Squirrels are harmless critters that only spawn in the cavern layer, and have a higher spawn chance during rains.
Gem Squirrels have only 5 health and no defense, and can be damaged by other enemies and players.

Gem Squirrels can be caught with any Bug Net to be carried around in the inventory and released later, or crafted into animated decorative furniture (Gem Squirrel Cages). Once crafted, the Gem Squirrels cannot be released again, unless the furniture item is de-crafted via Shimmer (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions).

The Tartar Sauce is a pet-summoning item that spawns a Mini Minotaur to follow the player around. When the player is far enough away or in midair, the Mini Minotaur will fly by twirling a hammer in order to catch up to them. The Mini Minotaur's yellow eyes glow in the dark, but it produces no other light. The Tartar Sauce has a 6/125 (4.8%) of being dropped from Iron and Mythril Crates (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions).

The Alien Queen is a Hardmode, post- Lunatic Cultist flying enemy that spawns in the area of the Vortex Pillar during the Lunar Events. It attacks by shooting Alien Goop projectiles that have a 1/2 (50%) / 100% chance to inflict the Distorted debuff for 6-12 / 5-9 seconds. The debuff causes the player to randomly rise and descend in wave-like motions based on their horizontal position, practically preventing them from falling downwards. It makes controlled descent impossible, but hooks and teleporting with the Rod of Discord can somewhat counteract this effect.
Upon death, it spawns two to three Alien Larvae. These can quickly grow into Alien Hornets which can then grow into more Alien Queens.
Streamer items are items that were made for particular Terraria streamers.

Pedguin's set The set is a reference to Terraria streamer/YouTuber Pedguin. Each piece has a 1/150 (0.67%) chance to drop from Corrupt or Vicious Penguins, referencing the penguin theming of the channel. Chippy's Couch The couch is a reference to Terraria streamer/YouTuber ChippyGaming 's second YouTube channel, ChippysCouch. The item has a 1/7 (14.29%) chance to be dropped by Skeletron, referencing Chippy's characters often resembling the Clothier. 0x33's Aviators The aviators are a reference to Terraria streamer 0x33 who defeated the Moon Lord in Expert Mode with a Hardcore character. The item is dropped by Eye of Cthulhu in Master Mode. Prior to the introduction of Master Mode, it was dropped by the Eye of Cthulhu when killed by a Hardcore character in Expert Mode, referencing 0x33's accomplishment. Badger's Hat The hat is a direct reference to Terraria Twitch streamer Badger. The item is dropped by the Eye of Cthulhu or Wall of Flesh when the other has been defeated in the same day (specifically 7:30 PM to 7:30 PM the next day, in contrast to the usual 4:30 AM that normally defines a new day). This is in reference to his speedrun playthroughs, where doing so is an expected strategy. Waffle's Iron It is a reference to Terraria YouTuber WaffleTime. The item is dropped by Mechdusa, a reference to WaffleTime's tutorials on how to defeat the mechanical bosses, and his series where he beats secret world seeds in Master Mode.

The Pumpkin Moon Medallion is a Hardmode, post- Plantera event-summoning item used to summon the Pumpkin Moon event. It can only be used at night. Attempting to use it during the day will not begin the event, and the item will not be consumed from the player's inventory.

The Armor Polish is a Hardmode immunity accessory that grants the player immunity to the Broken Armor debuff. It has a 1/100 (1%) / 199/10000 (1.99%) chance to drop from Armored Skeletons and Blue Armored Bones.
It is one of the ingredients required to make the Armor Bracing, which is a crafting material required to make the Ankh Charm, an accessory further required to make the Ankh Shield.
Planked Wall is a background wall that naturally spawns in Underground Cabins. They can be crafted at a Sawmill with one Stone Block and one Wood.

The Jousting Lance is a Hardmode melee weapon purchased from the Zoologist for 6 GC after filling out 30% (162 entries) of the Bestiary. When attacking using ⚒ Use / Attack, the lance will extend, and holding ⚒ Use / Attack will keep it extended at a fixed angle. The damage and knockback will increase depending on the player's movement speed, making mounts, sprinting accessories, or dash abilities (such as those granted by Shield of Cthulhu, Tabi / Master Ninja Gear, or Solar Flare armor) useful for maximizing damage. When the player takes damage, the Jousting Lance will stop being active.
It is the precursor to the Hallowed and Shadow Jousting Lances.

Its best modifier is Godly or Demonic. Both modifiers increase the average damage output by the same amount. However, Ruthless might be preferred if the player already has very high critical strike chance.

Sports are a group of Items that are used for certain activities in Terraria. These activities have almost no impact on progression, they mostly just help to pass the time. This guide will help to come up with ideas on how to use these items in fun ways.

The Bee Hive is a natural trap which spawns over time under Jungle grass ceilings of the Jungle and Underground Jungle. When a Bee Hive is hit, it falls to the ground, breaking upon impact and releasing 2-5 Bees. It can be crafted and placed manually.
Molten armor is an armor set consisting of the Molten Helmet, Molten Breastplate, and Molten Greaves. It has the highest defense of any pre-Hardmode armor set.
A full set of Molten armor provides the following benefits:

+25 defense +17% melee damage (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) +7% melee speed (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) +7% melee critical strike chance (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) Immunity to the On Fire! debuff If the full set is visible, it will leave a fire trail similar to that of the Meteor armor.
It takes a total of 45 Hellstone Bars to craft a full set of Molten armor, or 135 Hellstone and 45 Obsidian.

The Hammush is a Hardmode hammer that is purchased from the Truffle for 40 GC after at least one mechanical boss has been defeated. When swung, the Hammush produces spinning mushrooms like that of the Mushroom Spear, which hurt enemies, even through walls. Like the Pwnhammer (and higher-tier hammers), it can also be used to destroy Altars, and shares its tooltip.
Its best modifier is Legendary. However, due to rounding, Legendary, Light, Deadly, Agile, Quick, and Nasty provide equal boosts to mining speed for this tool.
The Pocket Mirror is a Hardmode immunity accessory that grants the player immunity to the Stoned debuff. It has a 1/40 (2.5%) / 1/20 (5%) chance of being dropped by Medusas.
It is one of the ingredients required to make the Reflective Shades, which are a crafting material required to make the Ankh Charm, an accessory further required to make the Ankh Shield.
The Party Girl is an NPC vendor who sells festive novelty items and furniture.

Unlike other town NPCs, the Party Girl only has a 1/40 (2.5%) chance to be eligible for spawning every 2-minute interval, during which she is subject to regular NPC spawn rate, once the criteria below are met. In other words, she will take on average 40 times longer to spawn than regular NPCs. Along with this percentage chance, she will move in once the following criteria are met:

There is an available vacant house. (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) 14 / 12 / (Old-gen console version) 8 other town NPCs are in the world. Note that while the Old Man, Traveling Merchant, and town pets (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) count towards this total, the Skeleton Merchant (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) does not.

On the Desktop version, Console version, and Mobile version, if the Party Girl is killed, she will respawn with normal spawn chances instead of being rarer. On the Old-gen console version and Nintendo 3DS version, she will still follow the lower chance when respawning.

On the Desktop version, Console version, and Mobile version, the Party Girl will defend herself against nearby enemies by throwing Happy Grenades at them, dealing 30 / 45 / 52 damage at the start of the game, and as players progress she will gain various stat increases. The Party Girl also has a 1/4 (25%) chance of dropping 30-60 Happy Grenades upon death.
On the Desktop version, Console version, and Mobile version, when talked to during a natural Party, she will give the first player to talk to her a Slice of Cake.
The Etherian Lightning Bug is a Hardmode, post- Golem enemy that spawns during Old One's Army event. It spawns during Tier 3 in waves 2 and 6.

Upon gaining line of sight with the player, an Etherian Lightning Bug flies towards them and attempts to position itself slightly beyond the melee reach of the player (or a distance less than 10 tiles away from the player). Afterward, it fires short-ranged Withering Bolts approximately once every half second which deal high damage and inflict the Withered Weapon debuff, which halves player-inflicted damage for 5 seconds.
It is one of only two enemies from the Old One's Army that requires the usual 50 kills to obtain its corresponding banner, the other being the Wither Beast.

Critical hits occur randomly when striking enemies. By default, each successful hit on an enemy has a 4% chance of being a "critical hit", dealing approximately double the usual damage of the weapon in use with 40% more knockback. A small number of weapons have a base critical strike chance that is higher than the default 4%. In addition, certain modifiers, armor bonuses, accessories, and buffs can boost the player's effective critical strike chance.

Visually, critical hits are displayed as slightly exaggerated bold damage numbers that linger on-screen for a longer period, have deeper color, and travel slightly higher than damage numbers from ordinary hits.

The Golden Seaweed was used to summon a pet Golden Turtle. It lasted until the player manually canceled the buff by using the Golden Seaweed again. It was obtained from Chests, but only on the Amazon Fire TV. It was obtainable on other mobile devices via trading.
This item was removed alongside all other mobile exclusive content in the Mobile 1.3.0.7 update.
Players on Windows Phone who acquired the Golden Seaweed via trading continue to have access to it.

Lead Ore is an early-game ore that generates upon world creation on the surface, as well as in the Underground and Cavern layer. Its primary use is in crafting Lead Bars, which can then be used to craft the Lead tier of tools, weapons, and armor, as well as Buckets, Chains, and several other items. (Desktop, Console, Mobile and 3DS versions) Lead Ore has a small chance to appear as a bonus drop from slimes.
Its alternate ore counterpart is the Iron Ore.

As Lead Bars are required to craft the Lead Anvil, Lead Ore is usually obtained before any tools, weapons, or armor can be crafted from bars. While this can be circumvented by purchasing an Iron Anvil from the Merchant, that is generally inefficient, as it is not difficult to find 15 Lead Ore early on in the game.
The Chlorophyte Jackhammer is a Hardmode hammer crafted with 18 Chlorophyte Bars at a Mythril or Orichalcum Anvil. It is the hammer with the lowest use time in the game.

Its best modifier is Godly or Demonic. Both modifiers increase the average damage output by the same amount. However, Ruthless might be preferred if the player already has very high critical strike chance. Mechanical tools can only have universal prefixes, because they cannot have their speed modified.

The Monomi set is a vanity set exclusive to the Japanese Console version of the game that looks like the character of the same name from the video game franchise Danganronpa. It consists of Monomi Head, Monomi Body, and Monomi Legs. The set can be purchased from the Clothier during a Blood Moon during different moon phases, alongside Toro's set. Monomi Body is obtained during the First Quarter phase.
The Etherian Javelin Thrower is an enemy that spawns during the Old One's Army event. It spawns during Tier 1 during waves 3-5, Tier 2 during waves 1-4 and 6-7, and Tier 3 during waves 1-4 and 6.
As its name implies, the Etherian Javelin Thrower attacks by throwing javelins approximately every two seconds if it is within 37 tiles of the player or the Eternia Crystal.
The Etherian Javelin Thrower requires 200 kills to be awarded completion of its corresponding banner, as opposed to the usual 50 kills.

The Prismatic Punch is a Hardmode food item that grants the Plenty Satisfied buff when consumed. This lasts for 20 minutes, but can be canceled at any time  by right-clicking the icon,  by selecting the icon using Cycle Next/Previous Buff and then pressing Remove Buff, or  by double-tapping the buff icon.
Like all other food items, the Prismatic Punch can be placed on a Plate :

The Unicorn set is a vanity set consisting of the Unicorn Mask, Unicorn Shirt, and Unicorn Pants. It can be obtained from Goodie Bags, which are dropped by enemies with a 2/57 (3.51%) chance during the Halloween seasonal event.
These items are to be equipped in the Social Slots as they only provide a visual appearance.
The Gold Goldfish is a harmless critter. It is a golden recolor of the ordinary Goldfish, with a 1/400 (0.25%) chance of spawning in place of the ordinary version.
The Gold Goldfish has only 5 health and no defense, and can be damaged by other enemies and players.

The Gold Goldfish can be caught with any Bug Net to be carried around in the inventory and released later, or crafted into animated decorative furniture (Gold Fish Bowl). Once crafted, the Gold Goldfish cannot be released again, unless the furniture item is de-crafted via Shimmer (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions). The Gold Goldfish itself or the crafted furniture can be sold for 10 GC.
It is one of the few entities that can be detected by the Lifeform Analyzer or its upgrades.
Golf trophies are decorative furniture items that can be purchased from the Golfer for 1 GC each once the player has reached a certain golf score.
The Spider Fang is a Hardmode crafting material dropped by Black Recluses in Spider Nests with a 1/2 (50%) / 9/10 (90%) chance. It can be used to craft several minion -related items and armor.

Red's set are vanity developer items that can be obtained rarely (5% chance) from Treasure Bags dropped from Hardmode bosses (except Queen Slime 's). It is the vanity set made for Redigit, lead developer of Terraria.
These items are to be equipped in the Social Slots as they only provide a visual appearance.
Redigit's equipment also includes these non-vanity items, which will drop in addition to his clothing set:
Red's Wings Red's Throw

The Venus Magnum is a Hardmode, post- Plantera gun that converts Musket Balls and Tungsten Bullets (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) (as well as Silver Bullets on Old-gen console and 3DS) fired from it into High Velocity Bullets. They gain the increased speed, (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) ability to pierce targets (along with the damage reduction on subsequent hits), and visual appearance of High Velocity Bullets, but retain their original damage. The Venus Magnum has a (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) 1/7 (14.29%) or (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) 1/6 (16.67%) chance of being dropped by Plantera.
Its best modifier is Unreal.

The Rotted Fork is a pre-Hardmode spear. (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) It creates a small shockwave at the end of its tip when used. The Rotted Fork has a (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) 1/5 (20%) / (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) 1/4 (25%) chance of being obtained from destroying Crimson Hearts found in the Crimson or a 1/5 (20%) chance from Crimson Crates (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) and Hematic Crates (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), which are fished in the Crimson.

Its best modifier is Godly or Demonic. Both modifiers increase the average damage output by the same amount. However, Ruthless might be preferred if the player already has very high critical strike chance.

The Royal Gel is a pre-Hardmode accessory that pacifies most slimes when equipped, causing them to no longer pursue the player, and will deal no contact damage or fire projectiles, even if the player deals damage to them. The Royal Gel is always dropped from King Slime 's Treasure Bag in Expert Mode.
This does not apply to the following slimes:
King Slime and his Spiked Slimes, though the normal Blue Slimes that King Slime spawns remain docile. Queen Slime and her Bouncy Slimes, Crystal Slimes, and Heavenly Slimes.
Golf Balls are items sold by the Golfer NPC for 1 GC. They can be dyed using the Dye Vat to be any color.

Platforms are a special type of block that can be walked on, but also allow movement through the space they occupy. The player normally stands and walks on platforms as if they were ordinary blocks, and they can move down through a platform by pressing the ▼ Down key while standing on one. Players can also walk or jump horizontally through the space occupied by platforms, only treating the platform as "solid" when landing on them from above.

Walking enemies can similarly walk on or pass through platforms. Flying enemies like bats will fly up through them, but not down. Other enemies, including Harpies, ignore them entirely. NPCs will always climb up platforms.

Weapons and their projectiles will travel through platforms. Liquids flow through platforms, and lava will destroy all platforms upon contact, with the exception of Obsidian, Stone and Ash Wood Platforms. Gravity-affected blocks like Sand will be supported by platforms.

Because of the high mobility provided by platforms, they can be used in a variety of ways: as a bridge across gaps that players can descend through without destroying, for roof access that keeps some enemies from getting through, or to create a fighting area above most enemies that players can fire down through while keeping out of reach. Also, since Piggy Banks, Chests, crafting stations and most other furniture can be placed on them like on ordinary blocks (exceptions include gems and Crystal Shards), they can be used as a shelving to pack furniture into a confined space without restricting player movement.

The Harpoon is a unique pre-Hardmode ranged weapon that auto-fires an arcing spear projectile connected to the player via a chain and returns after reaching a maximum distance or upon impact with an enemy or surface. Its physics are similar to launched flails, though it is highly affected by gravity. The Harpoon has a 1/200 (0.5%) chance of being dropped by most enemies during a Goblin Army.

The Harpoon has no cooldown period; its auto-fire rate dependent only on the distance to its impact, meaning that an enemy or object in close range will cause a faster auto-fire rate. The projectile also deals damage and knockback to multiple enemies on its return trip, similar to a flail or boomerang, making it effective for crowd control.

Its best modifier is Godly or Demonic. Both modifiers increase the average damage output by the same amount. However, Ruthless might be preferred if the player already has very high critical strike chance.

Well Fed, Plenty Satisfied, and Exquisitely Stuffed are buffs granted to the player when they consume food, and provide general stat bonuses which vary in potency and duration depending on the food item consumed. Additionally, in Expert Mode (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), health regeneration will only be fully effective while the player is under the effects of one of these buffs. While one of these buffs is active in a Constant (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) or Get fixed boi (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) secret world seed, the player will also be temporarily immune to hunger for the buff's duration.

This lasts for 1 to 48 minutes (depending on the item used), but can be canceled at any time  by right-clicking the icon,  by selecting the icon using Cycle Next/Previous Buff and then pressing Remove Buff,  by selecting the icon and canceling it in the equipment menu,  by double-tapping the buff icon, or  by canceling the buff from the buffs screen.
Only one of these buffs may be active at a time and therefore do not stack. The buff that was most recently applied takes priority.

The Firework Fountain is a placed novelty mechanism that, when activated, produces one of four colorful "sparkle fountain" effects. Once placed, the Fountain can be activated via wire, or by right-clicking the Fountain directly. Its effect is purely visual, causes no damage, and can be used infinitely at no cost. It is purchased from the Party Girl for 3 GC.

The Pupfish is a critter that spawns infrequently in bodies of water in the Desert biome. Unlike many critters, Pupfish are capable of spawning on-screen. The Pupfish has only 5 health and no defense, and can be damaged by other enemies and players.

The Pupfish can be caught with any Bug Net to be carried around in the inventory and released later, or crafted into animated decorative furniture (Pupfish Bowl). Once crafted, the Pupfish cannot be released again, unless the furniture item is de-crafted via Shimmer (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions).

The Shellphone is a post- Skeletron informational item and tool that combines the functions of the Cell Phone, Magic Conch, and Demon Conch. The player can press ⚷ Open / Activate to cycle through four teleport locations: the world's spawn point, the Ocean, the Underworld, and the player's spawn point set via a Bed.
The Steampunk Goggles are a vanity item sold from the Steampunker for 3 GC during the Halloween seasonal event.

The Endless Musket Pouch is a Hardmode item that acts as ammunition, and can be placed in the ammo slots of the player's inventory. While in the inventory, it acts as a single Musket Ball that can be fired from any appropriate gun infinitely. Guns with unique shot types will fire their special attacks as well, including those that specifically require Musket Balls for their specialized shot types to work, such as the Uzi.

The Pink Prickly Pear is a dye material which can grow on top of a regular or Hallowed Cactus, and can also be found on top of a Corrupted or Crimson Cactus. It can only be harvested using a pickaxe, drill or explosives. Its sole purpose is to craft Pink Dye.

Balloons are accessories that increase the player's jump height by 33% and jump speed by 30%, increasing the height that the player can jump from 6 blocks (12 feet) to ~10½ blocks (21 feet), effectively a ~75% boost. However, it oddly reduces jump height when underwater, from 8 blocks (16 feet) to ~7 blocks (14 feet). Balloon upgrades offer various extra abilities, such as an extra jump or immunity to fall damage.

Silver Ore is an early game ore which spawns in the Underground and Cavern layers as well as on Floating Islands. Its primary use is to make Silver Bars, which can be used to make the Silver tier of equipment. The equivalent of Silver Ore is Tungsten Ore, which will sometimes replace Silver in a world. (Desktop, Console, Mobile and 3DS versions) Silver Ore has a small chance to appear as a bonus drop from slimes.

Aaron's set are vanity developer items that can be obtained rarely (5% chance) from Treasure Bags dropped from Hardmode bosses (except Queen Slime 's). They are acquired simultaneously. They are the set made for AaronC, an artist who formerly developed graphics for Terraria. Equipping the full set produces a glow effect similar to Spooky armor and grants an after-image movement effect similar to Ninja armor.
Unlike the other developer sets, Aaron's does not include wings. These items are to be equipped in the Social Slots as they only provide a visual appearance.

A Bee Hive is a mini-biome located in the Underground Jungle. The hive itself is made from Hive blocks ; on the interior, it contains pools of honey and typically one Larva. Destroying the Larva summons the Queen Bee. Any projectile, tool, weapon, or enemy will destroy the Larva with a single hit, so caution should be taken around the Larva if the player is not ready to fight the Queen Bee.
The number of Bee Hives per world is dependent on world size : there are usually 6-8 hives in Small or Medium worlds, and 11-16 hives in Large worlds.
The Engineering Helmet is a vanity item equipped on the Social Helmet Slot. It is purchased from the Mechanic for 1 GC.

Blinkroot is a type of herb that appears as stems with glowing dots. It grows naturally on Dirt or Mud Blocks, regardless of lighting or elevation, as long as the blocks bear no grass of any kind. Blinkroot can be harvested with virtually any weapon or tool, and can be planted manually using Blinkroot Seeds in Clay Pots and Planter Boxes (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), or on suitable soil tiles.

Blinkroot enters and exits its bloom state randomly. Its blooming is indicated by the yellow dots and pulsating yellow light emitted. Harvesting blooming Blinkroot yields 1 Blinkroot item and 1-3 Blinkroot Seeds. Harvesting mature or blooming Blinkroot with the Staff of Regrowth or Axe of Regrowth (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) yields 1-2 Blinkroots and 1-5 Blinkroot Seeds instead. Note that these tools can only directly harvest mature stage herbs planted on soil ; see Herbs § Growth for details.
Both Blinkroot and Blinkroot Seeds have a chance to be obtained from the Herb Bag (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions).
The Etherian Goblin Bomber is an enemy that spawns during the Old One's Army event. It spawns during Tier 1 during waves 2-5, Tier 2 during waves 3 and 5-7, and Tier 3 during waves 1-2 and 5-7.

As its name implies, it attacks by hurling bouncy Goblin Bomb projectiles at its target, similar to Clowns. While they might not pose the biggest threat to players with decent equipment, they can easily gain the upper hand against an early-game defender, especially if the Tavernkeep was discovered directly after defeating the Eater of Worlds or Brain of Cthulhu. Like many other enemies from the event, its appearance and stats change, depending on what point in the game the player has reached.
The Etherian Goblin Bomber requires 500 kills to be awarded completion of its corresponding banner, as opposed to the usual 50 kills.

Butterflies are small critters that can be found in Forests during daytime. They can be caught with a Bug Net (except for the Hell Butterfly (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions)) and carried in the inventory or crafted into Butterfly Jars. They can also be used as bait for fishing. The Underworld variant, Hell Butterfly, can be found in the Underworld during daytime.

The Hell Butterfly (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) can only be caught with the Lavaproof Bug Net (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) or the Golden Bug Net (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions). Attempting to catch it with a standard Bug Net will not work, and the player will take 1 damage and be inflicted with On Fire! for 5 seconds / 10 seconds / 12.5 seconds.
Rock Lobsters are a type of fishing catch which are found plentifully by fishing in the Desert biome. Their sole use is to craft Lobster Tails.

The Ice Rod is a Hardmode magic weapon that autofires blocks of ice, which have the unique ability of placing solid, temporary Ice Blocks at the location of the cursor and which last for (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) 15 / (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) 5 seconds before shattering. These Ice Blocks are translucent, cast a dim, flickering blue light, and are slippery like normal Ice Blocks. The Ice Rod can be purchased from the Wizard for (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) 50 GC / (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) 1 PC.

The location of the cursor must be unoccupied in order to form an Ice Block. If the tile is occupied either by blocks or background objects, the fired Ice Block acts as an ordinary projectile, flying in a straight line and unaffected by gravity, and shatters when it hits an enemy or other foreground objects. If the cursor is on an existing Ice Block from a previous casting, it will cause the next projectile to pass through the existing Ice Block.
Its best modifier is Mythical.
The Glass Slipper is a vanity accessory sold by the Princess for 1 PC. It will leave sparkling particles when the player walks around.
The Glass Slipper cannot be reforged, and therefore cannot have modifiers.
Hallowed armor is a Hardmode armor set crafted from Hallowed Bars, which are dropped by the mechanical bosses.

The set consists of the Hallowed Plate Mail and Hallowed Greaves, as well as four different headpiece variants: the Hallowed Mask, Hallowed Helmet, Hallowed Headgear, and Hallowed Hood, which grant specialized bonuses towards melee, ranged, magic, and summon damage respectively.

Wearing the full set will grant the Holy Protection buff, which allows the player to dodge the next attack dealt by an enemy or other damage source. It has a cooldown of 30 seconds, starting from the moment of the dodge. Wearing the full set with the Hallowed Hood additionally increases minion capacity by 2 as a set bonus, making the total minion capacity of the Hallowed Hood set 3, for a total minion count of 4. Additionally, wearing the full set also gives off a faint pulsing aura around the player and displays an after-image effect while in motion.

Crafting a full set with one headpiece requires 54 Hallowed Bars, or 90 Hallowed Bars for the full set including all four headpieces. To acquire the necessary Hallowed Bars for a full set with one helmet, the player will need to kill at least 2 mechanical bosses, and all four helmets will require 3-5 kills.

It shares identical stats with Ancient Hallowed armor, but differs in appearance. Furthermore, Ancient Hallowed and Hallowed armor pieces can be mixed and matched while still providing their set bonus.

The Milkshake is a Hardmode food item that grants the Exquisitely Stuffed buff. This lasts for 16 minutes, but can be canceled at any time  by right-clicking the icon,  by selecting the icon using Cycle Next/Previous Buff and then pressing Remove Buff, or  by double-tapping the buff icon. The Milkshake has a 1/75 (1.33%) chance of being dropped by Ice Tortoises and Icy Mermen.
Like all other food items, the Milkshake can be placed on a Plate :
Wind is a mechanism in Terraria which influences the movement of various objects, as well as the occurance of Windy Days (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) and Sandstorms.

Wind speed ranges between 0 and 60 mph. The wind can blow from either the west or east. Informational accessories such as the Weather Radio show the direction the wind is blowing from, not towards (so for example, "25 mph W" means that the wind is blowing 25 mph from the west).

Wind primarily affects things that have no effect on gameplay, such as cloud movement speeds, blizzard and sandstorm background effects, and the animations of the surface of water and trees. However, it occasionally plays a part in how the game plays, such as its effects on Detonating Bubbles and its effects on players afflicted with Mighty Wind. The UFO Mount summoned by the Cosmic Car Key also seems to be slightly pushed by wind, but it is unnoticeable unless firing a weapon that bounces at a corner for a long period of time.
(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) The Windy Day event occurs when the wind speed is 20 mph or higher, and ends when wind speed decreases below 16 mph.
The Weather Radio, Fish Finder, PDA, Cell Phone, and Shellphone all list the wind speed in the upper right corner of the screen.

An evil biome is a naturally spreading, hazardous biome that has generally negative effects on entities inside or around it. The two evil biomes are The Corruption and The Crimson, only one of which will always spawn in a world. Upon world creation, there is a 1/2 (50%) chance for either one to generate. On the Desktop version, Console version, and Mobile version, a player can choose whether they want Corruption or Crimson to generate in their world or they can leave it to be determined randomly.
Corruption or Crimson is saved as the world's naturally generated evil biome, and determines:

whether Shadow Orbs or Crimson Hearts are generated; whether Demon Altars or Crimson Altars are generated; whether a Corruption Chest or Crimson Chest is generated in the Dungeon ; whether Underground Corruption or Underground Crimson is created when the Wall of Flesh is defeated; (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) whether Corruption- or Crimson-related blocks are seeded as Altars are smashed in Hardmode ; whether some NPCs will sell Corruption- or Crimson-related items during a Blood Moon or Solar Eclipse ; and (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) which Biome Mimic is spawned when a Key of Night is placed in a chest.

It is possible to create an artificial Corruption/Crimson, seeding an area with the opposite evil biome. While this is traditionally done with materials brought over from another world, there is another option on the Desktop version, Console version, and Mobile version : If the Dryad is housed in a Graveyard during Hardmode, she will sell grass seeds from the other evil biome's. This allows, for instance, obtaining the Biome Key (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) / Biome Key Mold (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) of the opposite evil biome, as that is dependent on the biome the enemy is killed in, regardless of whether it is a "natural" biome or "artificial" biome. This will not however provide a Dungeon chest to go with the key.

The evil biome is predominately comprised of chasms made from infected stone (Ebonstone or Crimstone). However, the biome can overlap other biomes, providing corrupted versions of the Forest, Desert, Snow, Jungle, or Ocean biomes. This can be evidenced by the presence of purple/red grass and Ebonwood / Shadewood trees, purple/red Cacti and Ebonsand / Crimsand, Purple Ice / Red Ice, or purple/red Palm Trees. Infected Jungle areas turn into Corrupt Jungle grass / Crimson Jungle grass or Forest ((Old-gen console and 3DS versions) with the Mud Blocks converted to Dirt Blocks).
While in pre-Hardmode, the only biome capable of spreading the evil biomes is infected surface Forest, via infected grassy blocks (see below for details).
The Compass Rose is a decorative item that can be placed on background walls. It is randomly awarded by the Angler NPC for completing quests.
On the minimap, it is referred to as a trophy.
The minimap is a scale-size live overview of the world around the character. By default, it is displayed in a square frame in the upper-right corner of the screen.

As the world is explored, areas appear on the minimap with the greatest brightness with which the character has ever seen them. Even if the tiles return to darkness, they will remain visible on the minimap. The rate at which the minimap logs new data is dependent on the current video quality - the higher it is, the faster it will be logged.

Areas explored without a light source will not be mapped. If a location's appearance is updated (e.g. a meteor landing or biome spread during Hardmode), the map will only update if the player has gone there since it occurred.

In addition, players, friendly NPCs (except the Skeleton Merchant and Old Man), and bosses appear on the minimap as icons of their heads, which show their name when the cursor moves over them. This makes it easy to find NPCs, keep track of other players in multiplayer, and aid in locating and fighting bosses. In PvP, only players on the same team can see each other on the minimap.

Minimap data is saved with the character data instead of the world data. This means that if one character explores the world, other characters do not automatically see it on their maps. Minimap data is saved to a subfolder of the My Documents\My Games\Terraria\Players folder with the character's name.
The minimap can be disabled from the settings screen.
The Blue Chicken Egg is a pet-summoning item that spawns a Blue Chicken to follow the player around. The Blue Chicken Egg can be purchased from the Traveling Merchant for 25 GC.

The Tree Globe is a thrown consumable item sold by the Zoologist for 3 GC after 50% of the Bestiary (270 entries) has been filled out. When a Tree Globe is thrown and shatters on a surface, all of the trees in the current biome will switch to another random style.

The Icemourne was an unobtainable weapon from the 1.2 update. It was entirely removed from the Desktop version in the 1.2.4 update although it still exists as an unobtainable item on the Nintendo 3DS version.

Hearts (or Candy Apples during Halloween and Candy Canes during Christmas) are common power-ups which can be dropped by slain enemies, broken pots, or as a bonus drops from slimes. Enemies and pots will only drop Hearts when the closest player does not have full health. They are not inventory items, but are instead instantly consumed and restore 20 health. They emit a faint red light.

If the player does not have full health but has full mana, the chance of an enemy dropping a Heart is 1/12 (8.33%). If the player also does not have full mana, then this chance becomes 1/24 (4.17%), as Hearts and Stars cannot be dropped at the same time. See Notes for more details. For the Heart drop chance from pots, see Pot § Upon breaking.
It is also possible to spawn Hearts (and their seasonal counterparts) with a Heart Statue.
Hearts can be collected within a range of 2.625 tiles, which can be increased with a Heartreach Potion to 18.25 tiles.

The Minishark is a pre-Hardmode gun that can be purchased from the Arms Dealer for 35 GC. It uses bullets as ammunition and is capable of autofiring, with each shot having a 1/3 (33.33%) chance of not consuming any ammunition. The Minishark also has the lowest use time of all pre-Hardmode ranged weapons.

Its best modifier is Agile, as it does not have any knockback and thus cannot get modifiers that affect it. On the Old-gen console version and Nintendo 3DS version It can also get the Deadly modifier, which grants a higher increase to the overall DPS.

Melee weapons are weapons dealing melee damage which are used in close- to medium-ranged combat. The defining trait of melee weapons is the fact that they do not consume ammunition or mana upon use, so the player can continue to use melee weapons whenever they desire.

Melee weapons are roughly categorized into swords, spears, flails, boomerangs, and yoyos (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions). There are several other melee weapons that do not fit into any of these types.

Tools such as pickaxes, drills, axes, chainsaws, and hammers inflict melee damage and can be used as melee weapons, but many are far weaker than actual melee weapons of corresponding tiers. As such, they are usually not considered melee weapons.

The following lists present all melee weapons along with their damage and how to acquire them. The intention of this is to convey an idea of their strength and the approximate time during gameplay at which they can be obtained. For a sortable list that displays all statistics of all melee weapons, see List of melee weapons.
Mode could refer to:

Hardmode, a change to all worlds that occurs after the defeat of the Wall of Flesh Expert Mode, a setting that makes a world’s enemies more difficult, changes drops of enemies there, and holds a host of other small changes Cursor modes, different modes of the cursor which change the way it interacts with different blocks and NPCs Lighting mode (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), a setting which can be toggled between four modes, affecting the way furniture and other objects cast light Camera mode (Desktop version), a feature which allows capturing different areas of the screen The Settings of the Desktop version Difficulty, a setting on all characters which changes what happens when they die Journey Mode, a setting that enabled certain features within the power tools Master Mode, a setting that makes the world's enemies much more difficult, changes drops of enemies there, and holds a host of other small changes
The Super Mana Potion is a recovery potion that restores 300 mana and inflicts the Mana Sickness debuff upon use. It is the most potent of all mana restoration items.
It is the fourth and final tier of mana potion, succeeding the Lesser Mana Potion, Mana Potion, and Greater Mana Potion.
The Large Volcano is a decorative animated furniture item, whose animation can be toggled on and off with wires.

Gravity applies a constant downwards acceleration to the player, affecting vertical speed and how quickly the maximum falling speed is reached. The default gravitational acceleration is 123 mph per second, with falling speed capping at 51 mph. Certain sources may add modifiers to both gravity and the maximum falling speed to increase or decrease their effects.
The Gradient is a Hardmode yoyo that can be purchased from the Skeleton Merchant for 20 GC during moon phases 1-4.
It has a spin duration of 10 seconds and can reach up to 15.5 tiles.

Its best modifier is Godly or Demonic. Both modifiers increase the average damage output by the same amount. However, Ruthless might be preferred if the player already has very high critical strike chance.
The Mythical set is a removed unimplemented vanity set that was intended to be dropped by the Mythical Wyvern during the Chinese New Year seasonal event.

As the Mythical Wyvern was unimplemented, the Mythical set was unobtainable. The Mythical Wyvern had an ID and was fully coded, but was never able to spawn naturally nor be summoned with an item. It was the only set of which only one of the pieces had a sell value.

The Bee's Knees is a pre-Hardmode bow that, when consuming Wooden Arrows as ammo, fires special Bee Arrow projectiles which resemble lines of bees. Bee Arrows are unaffected by gravity and disperse upon impact with an enemy or solid block, spawning three small homing bee projectiles with three independent 1/3 (33.33%) chances to spawn an extra bee. The bee projectiles deal 1/3 (33.33%) of the weapon and ammo's damage (9 base damage) before dissipating after a 10-second duration or upon contact with water or lava, and have a 1/2 (50%) chance to deal 1 extra damage. Individual bees can pierce one enemy or ricochet off of blocks once, but never both simultaneously. The Bee's Knees has a 1/3 (33.33%) chance of being dropped by the Queen Bee.
Its best modifier is Unreal.

The Crimson Crate is a pre-Hardmode crate that can only be fished in The Crimson. It contains items found in standard crates and always contains an item normally dropped by destroying a Crimson Heart. Its Hardmode counterpart is the Hematic Crate.

The Arapaima is a Hardmode enemy that spawns in pools of water within the Jungle and Underground Jungle biomes. It swims much faster than most fish and deals high damage, but it has no knockback resistance, so high-knockback weapons are useful. The Arapaima can jump from the water and therefore is able to attack players on land close to the water. It will not die naturally outside of the water, despite being a fish.

The Teleporter is a travel mechanism purchased from the (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) Mechanic / (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) Steampunker for 2 GC 50 SC. When two Teleporters are wired together with a triggering mechanism, they can exchange players, NPCs, and most enemies between them. Teleporting is always instantaneous, has no load time or cooldown, no Mana or coin cost, and no limit on distance.
Unlike most furniture, Teleporters are foreground objects. They consist of three inseparable blocks which, like all block types, can individually be shaped with a hammer or actuated.
The Toxikarp is a Hardmode ranged weapon that can be rarely obtained by fishing in the Corruption biome in any layer.

When used, it fires greenish bubbles that travel in the direction aimed for a short distance before ascending rapidly and inflict the Poisoned debuff for 10-29 seconds. If the bubbles do not strike a creature or a block, they will eventually ascend into space. The bubbles can pass through platforms without breaking. If they come into contact with water, they will instantly start to ascend instead. The Toxikarp has infinite ammunition and will continue to launch bubbles as long as the player is firing it.
It is the Corruption counterpart to the Crimson 's Bladetongue and the Hallow 's Crystal Serpent.
Its best modifier is Unreal.

Moss is a grass -like plant that grows on Stone Blocks. It comes in (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) 11 / (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) 5 different variants. Mossy stone requires one more hit to break than clean stone. Moss will be destroyed if the Stone Block it is on converts to Ebonstone, Crimstone, or Pearlstone. Moss sprouts fuzz that can be cut like grass weeds.

On the Desktop version, Console version, and Mobile version, moss fuzz can be harvested using a Paint Scraper or Spectre Paint Scraper, which has a 1/9 (11.11%) chance of dropping as a plantable moss item when using either scraper, the rest will simply disappear as usual. Collected moss can be placed on Stone Blocks and Gray Bricks, or used to craft mossy walls.

There are 5 types of regular moss: Green Moss, Brown Moss, Red Moss, Blue Moss, and Purple Moss. One of each regular moss can be found throughout each third of a given map (three variants per world). They can be found either randomly on cave surfaces or in moss chambers with a matching mossy wall.

Glowing mosses are special variants of moss that glow in vibrant colors. These include the Lava Moss, Krypton Moss, Xenon Moss, Argon Moss, Neon Moss, and Helium Moss. (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) Lava Moss can be found in patches around the lava layer of the Caverns. (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) Krypton, Xenon, Argon, and Neon moss grow in glowing moss biomes and in much larger areas than other mosses, and only one type among these can be found in each world. Up to two (small world) / three (medium world) / four (large world) glowing moss biomes will be generated in the Cavern layer, mostly above the lava layers, but not under the spawn point area. (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) Helium Moss does not spawn naturally and can instead be obtained by throwing any other Glowing Moss into Shimmer.

On Desktop version, Console version, and Mobile version, mosses that did not naturally spawn in a world can be obtained by putting any Glowing Moss in an Extractinator, which produces regular mosses; or a Chlorophyte Extractinator, which produces all variants of mosses.
Hades Dye is a Hardmode dye acquired by giving a Strange Plant to the Dye Trader. When equipped, it turns the dyed armor, accessory, or equipment blue, also adding a blue flames effect.

The Frozen Banana Daiquiri is a food item that grants the Well Fed buff when consumed. This lasts for 15 minutes, but can be canceled at any time  by right-clicking the icon,  by selecting the icon using Cycle Next/Previous Buff and then pressing Remove Buff, or  by double-tapping the buff icon.
Like all other food items, the Frozen Banana Daiquiri can be placed on a Plate :
The Desert Fossil Wall is a type of background wall that can be crafted from Desert Fossils.

Betsy's Wrath is a Hardmode, post- Golem magic weapon that shoots three fireballs that travel in arcs through the air, exploding upon impact with an enemy or solid block and inflicting the Betsy's Curse debuff, which adds 40 armor penetration against affected entities for 10 seconds. The Betsy's Curse debuff cannot be applied to other players. Betsy's Wrath has a 1/4 (25%) chance of being dropped by Betsy during Tier 3 of the Old One's Army event.
Its best modifier is Mythical.

The Candy Cane Pickaxe is a third-tier pickaxe that has the same pickaxe power as the Gold Pickaxe, and therefore is capable of mining Demonite and Crimtane Ore. It is obtained from Presents dropped during the Christmas event, with a chance of 0.634% in pre-Hardmode and 0.592% in Hardmode.
Its best modifier is Legendary. However, due to rounding, Legendary, Light, Deadly, Agile, Quick, and Nasty provide equal boosts to mining speed for this tool.

The Bubble Gun is a Hardmode magic weapon that rapidly fires a short-range spread of three bubble projectiles per shot. Bubble projectiles linger in midair and dissipate upon contact with an enemy or solid block. The Bubble Gun has a 1/5 (20%) chance of being dropped by Duke Fishron.
(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) Its best modifier is Mythical.

(Old-gen console and 3DS versions) Its best modifier is either Masterful for mana conservation or Godly / Demonic for higher damage output. It cannot get the Mythical modifier due to its low mana cost.

Aetherium Blocks are blocks formed when Shimmer comes into contact with any other liquid besides itself. Similarly to Ice Blocks, Aetherium Blocks have low friction, causing a player walking over them to slide when stopping or changing directions. This effect can be mitigated by equipping Ice Skates or other accessories crafted from them. Aetherium Blocks emit light when placed.
Platinum Brick Wall is a background wall crafted from Platinum Bricks. It stops enemies from spawning on the tile where it is placed. It can be used to make houses for NPCs.

Hooks are a class of tools which aid the player in traversing terrain. When used, hooks fire a chain that latches to a surface or platform and pulls the player towards it. A hook is an essential tool which offers significant freedom from terrain height restrictions as well as being a fast movement option, and will often be the first major mobility tool a player acquires. A variety of hooks are available at all stages of the game (see table below).

The Grapple hotkey activates the equipped hook in the player's equipment slot, or the first hook from the inventory (from left to right, top to bottom) without requiring it to be in the player's hotbar.

Several higher-tier hooks, such as the Ivy Whip, allow the player to grapple multiple surfaces simultaneously. If the character grapples one surface, then fires the hook a second time, another chain extends from the player without dislodging the first. Upon grappling a second surface, the player will be suspended in midair at a point midway between the two surfaces. This allows players more freedom during construction, or for navigating hazardous areas, such as above lava or Meteorite.
(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) All Journey Mode characters will spawn with the basic Grappling Hook already in their inventory.

The Lihzahrd is an enemy that spawns in the Jungle Temple and initially behaves like an ordinary walking fighter. However, as soon as its health is reduced to below 55% (220 / 440 / 660), it enters its second, crawling form, causing it appear like a more lizard-like quadrupedal creature. In this form, the Lihzahrd is much faster, gains additional damage and defense, and becomes immune to knockback, but has reduced jump height.
The Skeleton is a pre-Hardmode enemy that frequently spawns in the Cavern layer as one of many variants. Regular Skeletons can be spawned by the Skeleton Statue.

Like many other enemies that follow the Fighter AI, Skeletons can open doors and Tall Gates (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), albeit only during Blood Moons or rarely in Graveyards (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions). On Old-gen console and 3DS, they can open doors at any time.

In Expert Mode (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), certain Skeletons are able to throw bones when they are close to the player. Regular bone-throwing Skeletons can be spawned by the Bone Skeleton Statue in any difficulty.
The Multicolor Wrench is a tool that can place down any combination of wire color, and also remove it. It can be used at any part of the screen, regardless of block placement range.

When pressing ⚷ Open / Activate with the tool, a menu with five different buttons will be displayed, four for selecting the four colors of wires, one for toggling between placing or harvesting selected colors of wires.
The menu will pop up at the cursor's position, with buttons in a radial pattern. The menu will pop up above the ⚷ Open / Activate button, with buttons listed in two rows.

Throughout most biomes and layers, various ambient objects are randomly scattered on world creation. These are naturally-placed background objects that can be broken with a pickaxe or drill, but otherwise cause no effects, and do not drop items. They function primarily as visual ambiance and cannot be collected by players, and unlike several other naturally-generating objects, cannot be crafted with the help of Ecto Mist. Apart from icicles and Jungle plants, ambient objects do not regenerate over time.
On the Desktop version, Console version, and Mobile version, the Rubblemaker can be used to place ambient objects.
On the Old-gen console version and Nintendo 3DS version, ambient objects cannot be placed by the player.

Destroying natural ambient objects on the Surface or in the Underground Jungle has a chance to spawn various bait critters (Worm, Grasshopper, Grubby, Sluggy, or Buggy) that can be collected with a Bug Net.

The Stargazer is a Hardmode, post- Lunatic Cultist enemy that spawns in the area of the Stardust Pillar during the Lunar Events. It walks slowly until it is within the line-of-sight of the player, which will then cause it to stop in place and fire a large Stardust Laser at the player once every three seconds. The laser momentarily appears as a harmless thin beam before quickly widening and damaging the player. The Stargazer may move while firing the laser, but it cannot change the angle.
The Ray Gunner is a Hardmode, post- Golem enemy that spawns during the Martian Madness event. It fires red laser projectiles, at a maximum fire rate of once every 0.67 seconds (40 ticks).
The Sun Mask is a vanity helmet dropped by Lamias in normal Underground Deserts with a 1/25 (4%) chance.

A string is an offensive accessory that increases the range of any yoyo -type weapon when put into an accessory slot. While this item is equipped, the weapon's reach becomes 125% of its base value, plus an additional 2-tile range bonus. White String is first crafted by the player with 30 Cobwebs at a Loom, and can be combined with certain dyes to form colored variants. These colored strings will be displayed as the color of the yoyo's string when it is thrown in addition to providing the additional range. However, they will also apply their color changes in a vanity slot.
The Heavenly Slime is a Hardmode enemy and a slime variant frequently summoned by Queen Slime alongside Crystal Slimes and Bouncy Slimes. It flies around trying to ram into the player.

The Greedy Ring is a Hardmode accessory that combines the Discount Card 's 20% discount off at any NPC shop, the Lucky Coin 's 20% chance of spawning 1-10 extra coins whenever an enemy is hit and +0.05 luck, and the Gold Ring 's increased coin pickup range.

The Hellwing Bow is a pre-Hardmode, post- Skeletron bow that fires arrows in a ~30° cone, which causes it to be very inaccurate at long distances. In addition, Wooden Arrows are converted into Hellwings, flaming bat projectiles that travel in a semi-straight line, can pierce infinitely, and will dissipate once hitting a surface. All other arrow types are not converted and will retain their special properties. The Hellwing Bow has a 1/5 (20%) chance of being found in Shadow Chests in the Underworld, as well as a 1/5 (20%) chance of being found in Obsidian Lock Boxes obtained from Obsidian Crates and Hellstone Crates.
Its best modifier is Unreal.

Desert Fossil is a type of block found in the Underground Desert biome in medium to large veins. Desert Fossils can be used with an Extractinator or Chlorophyte Extractinator to produce Sturdy Fossils, along with regular Extractinator drops.
Desert Fossil can be mined with a Copper Pickaxe or equivalent/higher mining level, or with explosives.

The Beam Sword is a rare Hardmode sword which intermittently fires a gold-colored Sword Beam projectile when swung. It costs no ammunition or mana, emits a small amount of light, deals the same damage as the sword, is not affected by gravity, and dissipates upon hitting an enemy or solid block. The Beam Sword has a 1/150 (0.67%) chance of being dropped by Armored Skeletons.
Its best modifier is Legendary.

The Hellbat is a pre-Hardmode bat enemy that spawns in The Underworld, and are pesky creatures that can kill characters who are using early-game gear. Though they cannot fly underwater or through lava, they take no damage from making contact with either.
In the Get fixed boi (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) secret world seed, it drops lava upon death.

Bleeding is a debuff that prevents natural health regeneration. The character can still use Healing Potions and any other form of food, including Bottled Water. Visually, a character affected by this debuff will continuously release small drops of blood from its body.
The small drops of blood will not appear if Blood and Gore is disabled in the game settings.
(Old-gen console and 3DS versions) When an enemy has this debuff inflicted on them (only possible via Tizona), they lose health since they do not naturally regenerate.

The debuff can be prevented by equipping the Adhesive Bandage (including its crafting derivatives), although the debuff only affects natural regeneration, so regeneration bonuses, such as those granted by the Band of Regeneration or a full set of Palladium armor, will not be affected.
Iridescent Brick is a cheap brick. It can be mined with any pickaxe or drill. It and its walls can either be crafted, or collected from Jungle Shrines in the Underground Jungle.

The Lemon is a food and fruit item that grants the Well Fed buff when consumed. This lasts for 5 minutes, but can be canceled at any time  by right-clicking the icon,  by selecting the icon using Cycle Next/Previous Buff and then pressing Remove Buff, or  by double-tapping the buff icon.
It has a small chance of dropping when shaking a Forest tree.
Like all other food items, the Lemon can be placed on a Plate :
The Amber Robe is an armor item that can be worn in the shirt slot. It is part of the Wizard set and is the second strongest type of gem robe, only being weaker than the Diamond Robe.

Wearing the Wizard Hat alongside the Amber Robe provides a set bonus of +10% magic critical strike chance, whereas wearing a Magic Hat alongside it provides a set bonus of +60 mana. Any leg-slot equipment can be worn with these set bonuses remaining intact.

The Queen Spider Staff is a Hardmode sentry summon weapon. It can summon the Spider Turret sentry, which lasts for (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) 10 minutes / (Old-gen console version) 2 minutes, remains stationary, and does not count against the player's minion capacity. The Spider Turret fires short-range Spider Eggs at enemies once per second, which can bounce, roll, and are heavily affected by gravity. The Spider Eggs deal no damage themselves, and upon colliding with enemies or after 1 second, they will break and spawn 2-4 Baby Spiders that attack enemies. The Baby Spiders will disappear upon hitting an enemy, dealing damage and inflicting the Acid Venom debuff for (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) 2-4 / (Old-gen console version) 4-6 seconds. If there are no enemies within range, the Baby Spiders will persist for 5 seconds before vanishing.
The Spider Turret can be summoned in any area of the visible screen, even if blocks completely separate the player from the point chosen. It requires blocks or platforms to stand on.

Its best modifier is Ruthless. The Mythical modifier provides the widest array of stat bonuses, but these primarily affect the initial summon rather than the resulting minion. Additionally, minions cannot deal critical hits. The only lasting advantage a Mythical Queen Spider Staff has over a Ruthless one is knockback.
The Bunny is a harmless critter that spawns in the Forest biome. They are the most common critters in Terraria, and are usually the first ones a new player will see.
Bunnies have only 5 health and no defense, and can be damaged by other enemies and players.

Bunnies can be caught with any Bug Net to be carried around in the inventory and released later, or crafted into animated decorative furniture (Bunny Cage). Once crafted, the Bunnies cannot be released again, unless the furniture item is de-crafted via Shimmer (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions).
Bunnies can be spawned by the Bunny Statue, however statue-spawned critters cannot be caught with any Bug Net, and will disappear in a puff of smoke when the player attempts to do so.
On the Desktop version, Console version, and Mobile version, there is a 1/400 (0.25%) chance for a Gold Bunny to spawn in place of an ordinary one.

During a Blood Moon, or when hit with Vile Powder or Vicious Powder (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), Bunnies will turn into Corrupt Bunnies or Vicious Bunnies (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), which are hostile enemies.

During the Halloween seasonal event, Bunnies spawn wearing Green Slime costumes, during Christmas, Bunnies will spawn wearing Santa costumes, and during a Party (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), Bunnies can spawn with Party Hats.
(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) Gem Bunnies spawn near towns in the Cavern layer.

The Bone Sword is a pre-Hardmode sword that, while rare, can be a useful weapon if obtained early in the game. Compared to other early-game swords, it swings slower and has slightly less knockback, but deals significantly more damage. The Bone Sword has a 1/200 (0.5%) chance of being dropped by Skeletons and Spore Skeletons in the Cavern layer.
Its best modifier is Legendary.

The Volcano is a pre-Hardmode sword crafted from Hellstone Bars. It lacks autoswing and has a slow swing speed, but it has the second-longest reach and second-highest damage of all swords in pre-Hardmode.

The Volcano creates an explosion upon hitting an enemy, dealing 75% base damage (30 base damage) to the enemy and all targets in an area around the enemy, and has a 1/2 (50%) chance of inflicting the On Fire! debuff for 3 seconds. Each explosion creates a tall plume of fire and smoke particles.
The Volcano is one of the key ingredients in crafting the Night's Edge.
Its best modifier is Legendary.

The Witch's Broom is a Hardmode, post- Plantera mount-summoning item that summons a rideable Witch's Broom, allowing the player to fly and hover indefinitely in any direction. The Witch's Broom is dropped by the Mourning Wood in Expert Mode with a 1/20 (5%) - 1/5 (20%) chance depending on the current wave.
Mercury Brick is a type of decorative brick obtained by throwing Luminite Brick into Shimmer during a New Moon.
No traps is a secret world seed. Its name is a sarcastic reference to how it generates significantly more traps in the world than usual.
The following seeds can be used to generate a No traps world (case-insensitive):

Liquid rockets are rocket ammunition items which place or remove liquids in addition to dealing damage. There are four different types of liquid rockets: Dry Rocket, Wet Rocket, Lava Rocket, and Honey Rocket.

When a liquid rocket is fired, it will explode upon contact with enemies or blocks similarly to normal rockets, and additionally apply its special effect (see below). If, however, the rocket touches any liquid while in flight, it will immediately explode and apply its effects. All liquid rockets deal damage to nearby players, enemies, and critters.
Dry Rockets are purchasable from the Cyborg for 50 SC each at any time. They can be used to craft the other three rockets, and those can be crafted back into Dry Rockets (see below).

The Lifeform Analyzer is an informational accessory that displays the name of rare enemies, critters, and undiscovered NPCs (see list below) within 81.25 tiles around the player. The Lifeform Analyzer can be purchased from the Traveling Merchant for 5 GC.

The Lifeform Analyzer is one of the three parts necessary to make the R.E.K. 3000, with the others being the Tally Counter and the Radar, and as such is a required ingredient in crafting the Shellphone.
The Chlorophyte Warhammer is a Hardmode hammer that can be crafted from Chlorophyte Bars. Like all hammers, it can be used to remove background walls and to create half- blocks and slopes.
Its best modifier is Legendary. However, due to rounding, Legendary, Light, Deadly, Agile, Quick, and Nasty provide equal boosts to mining speed for this tool.

The Mudstone Brick Wall (called Mudstone Block Wall on the Old-gen console version) is a type of background wall which can be found naturally generated in Jungle Shrines in some worlds. It drops as an item when destroyed, and can also be obtained via crafting. It is always considered a safe wall.
Dark Celestial Brick is a type of decorative brick obtained by throwing Luminite Brick into Shimmer during a Waning Crescent.

The TNT Barrel is a trap which explodes immediately when hit by virtually any weapon or tool. The explosion does not destroy any tiles, deals 800 / 1600 / 2400 damage to players Verify (200 damage to NPCs, enemies, and critters), and inflicts a knockback of 10 (Extremely strong) to all entities that are within 8.125 tiles horizontally and vertically. The TNT Barrel is not a mechanism and cannot be triggered by wires.
TNT Barrels are naturally generated in No traps and Get fixed boi worlds, in particularly large numbers in the Jungle Temple.
Black Ink is a dye material that is dropped by Squids, which only spawn in the Ocean biome. Its sole purpose is to make Black Dye.

The Palm Wood Sword is an alternate version of the Wooden Sword. It is crafted from Palm Wood, which is obtained by cutting down palm trees in the Ocean or Oasis (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) biomes.
Its best modifier is Legendary.

The Wire Bulb is a light source that has multiple colors. It is purchased from the Mechanic for 5 GC. Each corner can be lit up by wires. Each color of wire lights up a different corner. As there are four wire colors, there are four corners with four separate colors. The Wire Bulb can be placed in midair, without the need for support.
The Platinum Pickaxe is an early-game pickaxe. Its alternate ore counterpart is the Gold Pickaxe.

The Platinum Pickaxe is able to mine blocks and ores weaker than Ebonstone, Crimstone, Hellstone, and Pearlstone (which requires a pickaxe with at least 65% pickaxe power, e.g. a Nightmare Pickaxe). Most notably, it can mine Meteorite.
(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) The Platinum Pickaxe can also mine Obsidian.
Its best modifier is Light for harvesting purposes and Legendary for combat purposes.

The Hel-Fire is a Hardmode yoyo that inflicts the Hellfire debuff for 3-8 seconds upon contact with an enemy. The Hel-Fire has a 1/400 (0.25%) chance of being dropped from any enemy in the bottom half of the Caverns or Underworld.
It has a spin duration of 12 seconds and can reach up to 17 tiles.

Its best modifier is Godly or Demonic. Both modifiers increase the average damage output by the same amount. However, Ruthless might be preferred if the player already has very high critical strike chance.

The Hornet is a pre-Hardmode flying enemy found in the Underground Jungle. They follow the Flying AI, floating just out of reach and then charging the player, while also firing stinger projectiles (at an increased rate in Expert Mode (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions)). The stingers cannot be destroyed with weapons and travel at about the same speed as the darts from a Dart Trap. Stingers have a 1/3 (33.33%) chance to inflict the Poisoned debuff on the player for 10 seconds. In Expert Mode, the chance is 1/3 (33.33%) for 20 seconds and 2/3 (66.67%) for 2-10 seconds.

The Blood Rain Bow is a pre-Hardmode bow which rains 1-3 streams of blood from the sky instead of arrows. Each shot consumes one arrow from the player's inventory. The streams fall in a widespread area where the cursor is pointed, but dissipate upon contact with an enemy or solid block. The Blood Rain Bow has a 1/8 (12.5%) chance of being dropped by Wandering Eye Fish and Zombie Mermen.
Its best modifier is Unreal.

The Hallowed Grass Wall is a type of background wall which can be found in The Hallow, considered unsafe. It does not drop as an item when destroyed, and can only be obtained on Desktop, Console, and Mobile, by purchasing it from the Dryad in Hardmode for 2 SC 50 CC each. It is considered a safe wall when placed by the player.

The Clentaminator / Terraformer (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) (using Blue Solution) and Holy Water convert Grass Walls, Flower Walls, and Jungle Walls (both safe and unsafe) to unsafe Hallowed Grass Walls.
Hallowed Grass Walls can spread The Hallow to nearby pure walls. See Biome spread for further information.

Stone Slab Wall is a background wall that can be used for housings. It takes on the appearance of Stone Slab. It is more efficient than Gray Brick Walls to craft because of the Stone Slab's recipe. They can only be painted white, black or brown.
The Etherian Goblin is an enemy that spawns during the Old One's Army event. It is by far the event's most common enemy, spawning during every wave regardless of the current tier.

The Etherian Goblin attacks by slowly approaching its target, hacking away with its weapon when it is close to the player or the Eternia Crystal, similar to Armed Zombies in Expert Mode. Like many other enemies from the event, its appearance and stats change, depending on what point in the game the player has reached. Like most other ground-based enemies of the Old One's Army, if an Etherian Goblin's target is too far away or obstructed, it will enter an ethereal state, allowing it to pass through tiles. It is also unaffected by Teleporters or Lava.
The Etherian Goblin requires 1000 kills to be awarded completion of its corresponding banner, as opposed to the usual 50 kills.
Variegated Lardfish are a type of fish which are found uncommonly by fishing in the Underground Jungle. They are used to craft Seafood Dinners and Summoning Potions.

The Celestial Magnet is an accessory that greatly increases the pickup range for Stars. The increase in pickup range is 18.75 tiles, extending the base range of 2.625 tiles to 21.375 tiles. This effect does not stack with that of any of the Celestial Magnet's upgrades.

On the Desktop version, Console version, and Mobile version, the Celestial Magnet has a 1/4 (25%) of being found inside Skyware Chests on Floating Islands, as well as a 1/4 (25%) chance of being obtained from Sky Crates (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) and Azure Crates (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions). On the Old-gen console version, it is instead purchased exclusively from the Traveling Merchant for 15 GC.
Copper Brick Walls are a type of background wall crafted from Copper Bricks. Like most walls, they will stop enemy spawning, and can be used for NPC houses.
The Honeyed Goggles is a pre-Hardmode mount-summoning item that summons a rideable Bee Mount. The Honeyed Goggles have a 1/20 (5%) / 11/100 (11%) chance of being dropped from the Queen Bee.

While the Bee Mount is slow on the ground, it is capable of flying and will greatly increase in speed while doing so. While flying, the player's vertical speed is kept constant. The Bee Mount can fly in the air for 10 seconds before it enters a "tired" state, during which it slows and glides down. The glide can be accelerated using the ▼ Down key. Afterwards, it requires a 3-second rest period on the ground in order to begin flying at full speed again. If the player takes off again immediately after landing an exhausted bee, it will fly, but much slower than usual. Its rest period is indicated by a "heavy breathing" animation that stops when the Bee Mount has fully recovered.

Halloween is a seasonal event which lasts from around mid-October until around the start of November. During this time, several enemies wear costumes that change their appearance, unique enemies spawn, and new items become available via enemy drops or via purchase. Goodie Bags also drop, offering random Halloween-themed items, mostly decorative or vanity. Pumpkins grow naturally on grass during Halloween.
The duration of the event depends on the game platform :
(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) Reaching the end of the Pumpkin Moon, after beating the 15th wave, starts one in-game day of the Halloween event, regardless of the date.

The Depth Meter is an informational accessory that displays the player's depth. Depth is relative to the boundary between the Surface and Underground layers, which has a depth of 0 and is displayed as " Level ". The display shows the vertical distance to this line and the name of the current layer. Depth is always measured at the level of the player's feet. Depth is measured in feet, with one tile equaling two feet.

The Depth Meter has a 1/100 (1%) chance of being dropped by Cave Bats, Jungle Bats, Ice Bats, Giant Bats, and Spore Bats. Furthermore, it has a 1/80 (1.25%) chance of being dropped from Crawdads (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), Giant Shellies (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), and Salamanders (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions).

The Depth Meter is one of the three parts necessary to make the GPS, with the others being the Compass and the Gold Watch or Platinum Watch, and as such is a required ingredient in crafting the Shellphone (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions).
The Stinkbug is a harmless critter which spawns on the surface. The Stinkbug has only 5 health and no defense, and can be damaged by other enemies and players.

The Stinkbug can be caught with any Bug Net to be carried around in the inventory and released later, or crafted into animated decorative furniture (Stinkbug Cage). Once crafted, the Stinkbug cannot be released again, unless the furniture item is de-crafted via Shimmer (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions).
The Stinkbug can be used as bait for fishing, with 10% bait power.
Stinkbugs can also be used to craft the Flymeal and Stinkbug Blockers.
The Titanium Trident is a Hardmode spear. Its alternate ore counterpart is the Adamantite Glaive.
(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) Unlike the pre-Hardmode Trident, the Titanium Trident does not improve the player's underwater mobility.

Its best modifier is Godly or Demonic. Both modifiers increase the average damage output by the same amount. However, Ruthless might be preferred if the player already has very high critical strike chance.

The Portal Gun is a Hardmode, post- Moon Lord tool that launches projectiles capable of creating up to two portals (one fired by hitting ⚒ Use / Attack, the other by hitting ⚷ Open / Activate) upon impact with blocks.
