On the Desktop version, Console version, and Mobile version, they can be crafted back into their Stone Block forms at a Heavy Work Bench in a Graveyard biome, and can be obtained by cutting down a Topaz Gem Tree. They also have a 2/7 (28.57%) chance to be dropped by Geodes.
Like all other gems, Topaz can be placed on blocks.

The Lihzahrd Brick Wall is a type of background wall which can be found naturally generated in the Jungle Temple, considered unsafe. It drops as an item when destroyed, and can also be obtained via crafting. It is considered a safe wall when placed by the player.

The Forbidden Lihzahrd Brick Wall (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) is an item that places an unsafe Lihzahrd Brick Wall. It is visually identical and is obtained by throwing a Lihzahrd Brick Wall into Shimmer (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions).

The Shadowflame Hex Doll is a Hardmode magic weapon that fires three curving purple tentacle projectiles per use at a decent range, inflicting the Shadowflame debuff onto damaged enemies for 1-3 seconds. While it only fires three tentacles per shot, it can be used continuously to fire up to nine projectiles at once. The Shadowflame Hex Doll also has a base 7% critical strike chance as opposed to the usual 4%.
The Shadowflame Hex Doll has a 1/6 (16.67%) / 1/3 (33.33%) chance to drop from Goblin Warlocks during a Hardmode Goblin Army.
Its best modifier is Mythical.

The Hercules Beetle is a Hardmode, post- Plantera accessory that increases the damage of summon weapons by 15% and increases their knockback by 2. The Hercules Beetle can be purchased from the Witch Doctor for 40 GC if he is spoken to in the Jungle after Plantera has been defeated.
On the Old-gen console version and Nintendo 3DS version, the Pygmy Staff must be in the player's inventory in order for the Witch Doctor to sell the item.

The Detonating Bubble is a projectile enemy fired by Duke Fishron. It can be destroyed with any weapon or damage -inflicting tool in one hit. Duke Fishron summons Detonating Bubbles by spraying a cluster of them at the player in his first stage, and summons them while spinning in circles in his second stage.

The Rod of Discord is a Hardmode tool that instantly teleports the player to the mouse cursor. Using the Rod of Discord costs no mana or ammunition ; however, each use inflicts the Chaos State debuff on the player for (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) 6 / (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) 9 seconds. Using the Rod while this debuff is active causes the player to lose health equal to (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) 1/7 / (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) 1/6 of their maximum health. On the Desktop version, Console version, and Mobile version, the Rod of Discord's teleport range is limited to 960 pixels (60 tiles) horizontally and 600 pixels (37.5 tiles) vertically from the player's center. The Rod of Discord has a 1/500 (0.2%) / 1/400 (0.25%) chance of being dropped by Chaos Elementals.
It can be upgraded into the Rod of Harmony (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) by throwing it into Shimmer after the Moon Lord has been defeated.
Passive AI is an AI type followed by all friendly NPCs and some critters. Goldfish is only in the passive AI type if it is raining.

The Papyrus Scarab is a Hardmode, post- Plantera accessory that combines the bonuses of the Necromantic Scroll and the Hercules Beetle. When equipped, it increases the damage of summon weapons by 15%, increases their knockback by 2, and increases the player's maximum number of minions by one.

The Antlion Larva is a pre-Hardmode enemy that is only spawned when Antlion Eggs are destroyed. Its speed, jump height, occurrence in numbers, and small size make it a significant threat in the early game.

Multiple Antlion Larvae can spawn from a single egg, which breaks when hit with any weapon or tool. Unlike the Alien Larva, Antlion Larvae will not grow into an Antlion, Antlion Charger, or Antlion Swarmer.
Sticky Dynamite is a powerful thrown explosive. Like other sticky explosives, it adheres to surfaces after being thrown rather than bouncing or rolling, but is otherwise identical to Dynamite.

Fireblossom Seeds are a type of seed that can be obtained from harvesting Fireblossoms while they are blooming or using the Staff of Regrowth on naturally grown Fireblossoms while they are fully grown. On the Desktop version, Console version, and Mobile version, a Fireblossom will bloom when the sun is setting if it is not raining, from 3:45 PM to 7:30 PM. On the Old-gen console version and Nintendo 3DS version, Fireblossom plants must be at least partially submerged in lava before they will bloom and yield seeds. Each plant will drop 1-3 Fireblossom Seeds when harvested while blooming.

Fireblossom Seeds can be placed on Ash Blocks, empty Clay Pots, or any types of Planter Boxes (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), even inside lava, and will grow into harvestable Fireblossoms. They will grow anywhere, not just in the Underworld, but will only yield seeds when blooming.
Like the Fireblossom, this item is not destroyed when coming into contact with lava, despite having a rarity of 00*.

The Black Belt is a Hardmode, post- Plantera accessory that grants a 1/10 (10%) chance to dodge an attack, including instances of damage taken from hazards such as traps and lava. A cloud of smoke surrounds the player when performing a dodge. The Black Belt has a 1/12 (8.33%) / 23/144 (15.97%) chance of being dropped by Bone Lees in the post-Plantera Dungeon.

Boots are footwear accessories that offer the player various movement bonuses when equipped, such as allowing them to sprint, walk on liquids, or briefly fly. Unlike wings, multiple different variants of boots can be equipped simultaneously.

Boreal Wood armor is an armor set consisting of the Boreal Wood Helmet, Boreal Wood Breastplate, and Boreal Wood Greaves. Like the Wood armor set, it is fairly weak in terms of defense, making it only useful very early on in the game.
Wearing the full set grants a basic 3 defense plus a set bonus of 1 defense, providing a total of 4 defense.
Crafting a full set requires a total of 75 Boreal Wood.

The Ice Slime is a pre-Hardmode enemy and a slime variant that spawns in the Snow biome during the daytime. Upon contact with the player, it has a chance to inflict the Chilled debuff, if the player is not already inflicted with the Frozen debuff.
Like most other slimes, the Ice Slime will be passive towards any player with the Royal Gel (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) accessory equipped.

The Gato Egg is a pet-summoning item that summons a Propeller Gato to follow the player around. The Gato Egg is dropped by Dark Mages during the Old One's Army event, with a 1/6 (16.67%) / 1/4 (25%) chance during Tier 1, and a 1/12 (8.33%) chance during Tier 3.
Argon Moss Brick is a type of brick made from Argon Moss that glows in the dark.
Aetherium Brick is a type of decorative brick. It emits light when placed.
The Gravedigger set is a vanity set consisting of the Gravedigger Hat and Gravedigger Coat.
These items are to be equipped in the Social Slots as they only provide a visual appearance. They are purchased from the Clothier for 20 GC (set) when he is in the Graveyard biome.

The Chromatic Cloak is a Hardmode accessory which allows for more controlled Shimmering. When equipped, touching Shimmer does not immediately inflict the Shimmering debuff, and the player can instead start Shimmering at any time by holding the ▼ Down key. However, after Shimmering starts, it cannot be interrupted anymore, not even by re-equipping the Chromatic Cloak.

While the Chromatic Cloak is equipped, being submerged in Shimmer is comparable to being submerged in water : the player's horizontal and vertical movement speed are slowed by the same amount, the Shimmer can be swam in using accessories such as Flippers, and the player will transform into Merfolk if wearing the Neptune's Shell or its upgrades. However, the player cannot drown in the Shimmer; the breath meter does not appear.

Pinky is a rare pre-Hardmode enemy and a slime variant that spawns in place of certain types of other slimes (see Notes section for details). Despite its small size, Pinky has more health and defense than nearly all other pre-Hardmode slimes, though it has one of the lowest values of damage and knockback resistance in the game. It is also the only source of Pink Gel (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions).
Like most other slimes, the Pinky will be passive towards any player with the Royal Gel (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) accessory equipped.
On Desktop, Console, Mobile, and 3DS, they can rarely be found carrying bonus drops, which the player receives upon the slime's death.

It is one of the few entities that can be detected by the Lifeform Analyzer (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) or its upgrades. Pinky requires 25 kills to be awarded completion of its Bestiary entry and corresponding banner, as opposed to the usual 50 kills.

The Bomb Fish is an explosive obtained through fishing. Depending to player's final Fishing Power, from 1 to 21 Bomb Fish can be fished up at a time. They act identically to Sticky Bombs, sticking to any blocks that they are thrown at.

The Chest Lock is a consumable item. Pressing the ⚒ Use / Attack button on certain types of Chests when holding it will turn the Chest into a locked Chest and consume the Chest Lock. The content of the Chest will not be affected by the conversion. Chests locked by this way work the same as the naturally generated locked Chests, requiring another respective key to unlock.

The Goblin Archer is a pre-Hardmode enemy that spawns during the Goblin Army event. It fires Wooden Arrows at players within its line of sight while stationary. Its attacks can be interrupted by knocking it back.

Grape Juice is a Hardmode food item that grants the Exquisitely Stuffed buff. This lasts for 16 minutes, but can be canceled at any time  by right-clicking the icon,  by selecting the icon using Cycle Next/Previous Buff and then pressing Remove Buff, or  by double-tapping the buff icon.
Like all other food items, Grape Juice can be placed on a Plate :

The Whoopie Cushion is a novelty item that makes a farting sound when used. It has no other functional effect. It can be crafted into a Fart in a Jar which can then be upgraded further. It has a (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) 1/50 (2%) / 1/25 (4%) or (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) 1/100 (1%) chance of being dropped by Giant Worms and Diggers in the Underground and Cavern layers.
Ancient Silver Brick Wall is a type of background wall crafted from Ancient Silver Bricks. Its appearance is based on the sprite of Silver Brick Wall prior to 1.2.

Sticky Bombs are a type of explosive crafted from Bombs and Gel. They can be used as a mining tool or a weapon, although generally the former. When used, a Sticky Bomb is thrown a few blocks away from the player and sticks to the first solid tile it touches (including a ceiling or a platform). If the tile it sticks to is removed by some means, it will fall until it hits another tile. After 3 seconds, it will explode, inflicting 100 points of damage to nearby enemies and destroying multiple blocks around it. The player can also inflict harm to themselves if not careful.
Sticky Bombs can destroy almost any block (with some exceptions), which can then be collected.

The Orichalcum Waraxe is a Hardmode axe that is obtainable after crafting a Mythril Anvil or an Orichalcum Anvil, and is the axe alternative to the Orichalcum Chainsaw. Along with its slightly weaker alternate the Mythril Waraxe, it is stronger than the Cobalt or Palladium Waraxe but weaker than the Adamantite or Titanium Waraxe which can be obtained later. Like all other axes and chainsaws, it is solely used to cut down trees, cacti, and Giant Glowing Mushrooms.
Its best modifier is Legendary. However, due to rounding, Legendary, Light, Deadly, Agile, Quick, and Nasty provide equal boosts to mining speed for this tool.
Fishing poles are tools used with bait for fishing.

The Royal Delight is a pet-summoning item that summons a pet Slime Prince which follows the player around. The pet resembles a miniature King Slime with blush and small dotted eyes. The Royal Delight has a 1/4 (25%) chance of being dropped by King Slime in Master Mode.

The Gnome is an uncommon pre-Hardmode enemy that spawns around the surface, and spawns more commonly in Living Trees. When it is not behind a background wall on the surface during the daytime, it will turn into a Garden Gnome which increases the luck of nearby players.

It is one of the few entities that can be detected by the Lifeform Analyzer or its upgrades. The Gnome requires 25 kills to be awarded completion of its Bestiary entry and corresponding banner, as opposed to the usual 50 kills.

The Flame Waker Boots are a vanity accessory obtained by opening Obsidian Crates or Hellstone Crates, found by fishing in Lava. They cause the player’s feet to leave trails of fire while moving on blocks. They are entirely cosmetic and provide no functional benefit of their own.

The Slimy Saddle is a pre-Hardmode mount-summoning item that summons a friendly Slime Mount. The Slime offers increased jump height (21 tiles) and movement speed (20 mph), decreases fall damage by half, and enables floating on water surfaces and continuous auto-jump by holding the ↷ Jump key. On the Desktop version, Console version, and Mobile version, landing on an enemy while riding this mount will deal 40 summon damage (excluding defense) and cause the player to bounce off them. The Slime Mount is considered a minion while calculating the damage of the bounce and benefits from effects that boost the damage of summons. The Slimy Saddle has a 1/4 (25%) chance of being dropped by King Slime and a 1/2 (50%) chance of being found in King Slime's Treasure Bag (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) in Expert Mode (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions).

The Flare Gun is a weapon that provides a ranged method of illuminating areas. It fires Flares, which provide light and stick to the blocks they hit. The Flare Gun is found randomly in Gold Chests underground.

Flares travel in a slight arc and stick to blocks (similar to Sticky Glowsticks), but have greater velocity and range. They are waterproof, and can be fired into and out of water. Once fired, Flares emit low-level, flickering, tinted light  that lasts for 10 minutes. They stick to the blocks they impacted and will function underwater. Flares cannot be recovered once they burn out.
When held, the muzzle of the Flare Gun will continually emit a flare effect, as long as at least one Flare is in the player's inventory.
The Flare Gun cannot be reforged, and therefore cannot have modifiers.
Ancient Cobalt Brick is a type of brick obtained by throwing Cobalt Brick into Shimmer. Its appearance is based on the sprite of Cobalt Brick prior to 1.2.
The Star Hairpin is a vanity item that can be purchased from the Traveling Merchant for 2 GC. It is worn in the helmet slot.
The Countercurse Mantra is an immunity accessory that combines the functions of the Megaphone and the Nazar. This item grants immunity to both the Silenced and Cursed debuffs.
It is one of the ingredients required to make the Ankh Charm, which is further required to make the Ankh Shield.

While the Countercurse Mantra is exclusive to Hardmode on the Old-gen console version and Nintendo 3DS version, it can be obtained in pre-Hardmode on the Desktop version, Console version, and Mobile version, as you can obtain the Megaphone by throwing the Nazar into Shimmer (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions).

The Mini Nuke II is a type of rocket ammunition. Unlike the Mini Nuke I, it destroys tiles. It is a direct upgrade to the Rocket IV, dealing more damage over a larger blast radius, but with lower knockback.
The Royal set is a Hardmode vanity set consisting of the Royal Tiara, Royal Blouse, and the Royal Dress. It is purchased from the Princess for 1 PC 50 GC (set).

The Pumpkin Scented Candle is a Hardmode, post- Plantera light pet-summoning item that spawns a miniature Pumpking named Jack 'O Lantern to follow the player around. The Pumpkin Scented Candle is dropped by the Pumpking in Master Mode with a 1/8 (12.5%) - 1/4 (25%) chance depending on the current wave.
Candelabras are a type of furniture and light source that emits light when placed on a flat surface such as blocks, platforms, and flat furniture items. It is not destroyed by water.
There are (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) 39 / (Old-gen console version) 23 / 12 craftable and 5 looted variations of the Candelabra.

The Paladin's Hammer is a Hardmode, post- Plantera boomerang with high velocity and knockback but low range. It has a 1/15 (6.67%) / 29/225 (12.89%) chance of being dropped by Paladins in the post-Plantera Dungeon.

Its best modifier is Godly or Demonic. Both modifiers increase the average damage output by the same amount. However, Ruthless might be preferred if the player already has very high critical strike chance.
The Cactus Sword is an early-game sword. It deals more damage compared to early weapons (dealing the same damage as the Tin Broadsword) and has more range.
Its best modifier is Legendary.

The Star Wrath is a Hardmode, post- Moon Lord sword which, as an indirect upgrade to the Starfury, causes three pink star projectiles to fall at the cursor whenever it is swung, each dealing the weapon's base damage. Unlike the Starfury's stars that become solid upon reaching open space, the Star Wrath's star projectiles solidify once they are within ten blocks above the player or at the cursor's altitude, at which point they will dissipate upon contact with enemies or solid blocks. The Star Wrath has a 2/9 (22.22%) chance of being dropped by the Moon Lord.
Its best modifier is Legendary.

The Steampunk set is a Hardmode vanity set which consists of the Steampunk Hat, Steampunk Shirt, and Steampunk Pants. It is purchased from the Steampunker for 4 GC 50 SC (set), during the full and waning moon phases.
These items are to be equipped in the Social Slots as they only provide a visual appearance.

The Spinal Tap is a pre-Hardmode, post- Skeletron whip crafted from Cobwebs and Bones. Like other whips, it causes minions and sentries to focus on the last-struck enemy and increases their damage against the target by 7.
If the Spinal Tap hits multiple targets in a single attack, the damage dealt by each consecutive hit will be reduced by 10%.
Its best modifier is Legendary.

The Ancient Horn is a Hardmode mount-summoning item that summons a rideable Basilisk Mount, which gives the player an additional jump and the ability to charge through enemies, damaging them in the process. The Ancient Horn has a 1/50 (2%) chance of being dropped by Basilisks.

The Basilisk mount provides accelerated land speed at 41 mph and provides increased jump height (14 tiles/28 feet), though is still hindered by water as usual. While mounted on the Basilisk, the player is immune to knockback and only takes 20% fall damage.

If the Basilisk is moving at a speed of least 21 mph, running through enemies inflicts 90 base damage, not counting enemy defense. This damage is considered summon damage, meaning that minion-enhancing items will improve it. Enemies that are damaged by this attack do not inflict contact damage on the player, but the player will suffer contact damage from enemies that survive it, if the hitbox of the player gets hit.
The mount emits a faint red glow from 27' underground downwards. This light does not grow stronger as the player descends, and its color is unaffected by dyes.
Ash Wood Wall is a type of background wall crafted using Ash Wood.

The Chlorophyte Shotbow is a Hardmode repeater crafted using Chlorophyte Bars. It shoots (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) 2-3 / (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) 2-4 arrows per shot but only consumes one arrow. Arrows fired with the Chlorophyte Shotbow cannot be recovered regardless of the type of arrow used.
Its best modifier is Unreal.

The Blend-O-Matic is a crafting station that is purchased from the Steampunker for 10 GC. On the Old-gen console and 3DS, it can only be purchased at night. Its sole purpose is to craft Asphalt Blocks which are used to run faster when walked on.

The Goblin Bomber Cap is an unobtainable item resembling the cap worn by Etherian Goblin Bombers. It only exists as an ID and image file in the game's code. Attempting to use third-party tools to obtain it will result in it instantly disappearing.
The Mug is a cup made of Glass. It can be used to craft Ale. It can be placed on a flat furniture item, where it functions as a Placed Bottle crafting station.

The Fried Egg is a food item that grants the Plenty Satisfied buff when consumed. This lasts for 14 minutes, but can be canceled at any time  by right-clicking the icon,  by selecting the icon using Cycle Next/Previous Buff and then pressing Remove Buff, or  by double-tapping the buff icon. The Fried Egg has a 1/30 (3.33%) chance of being dropped by Wall Creepers, Black Recluses, and Sand Poachers.
Like all other food items, the Fried Egg can be placed on a Plate :

The Proximity Mine Launcher is a Hardmode, post- Plantera launcher that fires mines that travel in a short arc, remaining dormant and semi-transparent until a player or enemy approaches, or until a minute passes, at which point they explode. The Proximity Mine Launcher can be purchased from the Cyborg for 35 GC.

The Proximity Mine Launcher uses rockets as ammunition. The mines are heavily affected by gravity and will only travel a short distance before dropping to the ground. The firing player will not trigger their detonation by getting close, although the firing player will take damage if they are within range of an exploding mine. On Desktop, Console, and Mobile, stationary mines will deal triple its base damage (240 damage). This does not apply to mines that are still moving, and only applies to enemies.
(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) The Cyborg uses the Proximity Mine Launcher to protect himself against nearby enemies.
Its best modifier is Unreal.
The Pearlwood Hammer is the strongest of the wood Hammers, though it is also the weakest hammer exclusive to Hardmode. It is statistically identical to the Silver Hammer.
Its best modifier is Legendary. However, due to rounding, Legendary, Light, Deadly, Agile, Quick, and Nasty provide equal boosts to mining speed for this tool.
The Copper Shortsword is an early-game metal shortsword. Its alternate ore counterpart is the Tin Shortsword.

On the Desktop, Console, Old-gen console, and Mobile versions, all newly created non- Journey Mode (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) characters will spawn with a Copper Shortsword in their first inventory slot, and it is possible that it can have a modifier already applied to it. On the 3DS, newly created players will spawn with a Wooden Sword instead of a Copper Shortsword. In Journey Mode, newly created characters will spawn with an Iron Shortsword instead of a Copper Shortsword.

Like all shortswords, the Copper Shortsword has a very limited range and attacks with a stabbing motion (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) at any direction / (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) horizontally in front of the player, instead of an arc. This makes it almost useless against flying or jumping enemies, although its high attack rate makes it somewhat effective against weaker fighter type enemies.
Its best modifier is Legendary.
The Rock Golem Head is a dual-purpose vanity and furniture item dropped by Rock Golems at a 1/10 (10%) chance. It can be worn or placed.

Flower Seeds can be planted in a placed Rock Golem Head. If left empty, wild grass plants will randomly grow out of it, provided the item is placed on the surface or in Space. The plant in a Rock Golem Head cannot be cut in the regular manner, e.g. via nearby swinging tools. Instead, it needs to be removed with a pickaxe or drill, or the Staff of Regrowth or Axe of Regrowth.
The Cobalt Naginata is a Hardmode spear. Its alternate ore counterpart is the Palladium Pike.

Its best modifier is Godly or Demonic. Both modifiers increase the average damage output by the same amount. However, Ruthless might be preferred if the player already has very high critical strike chance.

The Clay Pot is a furniture item in which a herb or flower seed can be planted. If left empty, wild grass plants will randomly grow out of it, provided the pot is placed on the surface or in Space. The plant in a Clay Pot cannot be cut in the regular manner, e.g. via nearby swinging tools. Instead, it needs to be removed with a pickaxe, a drill, the Staff of Regrowth, or the Axe of Regrowth (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions).

Swimming refers to the movement alteration a character is affected by when submerged in a liquid (water, honey, lava). By default, characters cannot swim; they sink to the bottom and can only jump when they reach it. Movement is slowed (especially in honey), and jumping acts as if the character were in the upper layers of the map, close to Space. While submerged, the character will also eventually run out of air. Some items grant the ability to swim, and equipment that grant flight (such as Rocket Boots and Wings) also work underwater.
Flipper Diving Helmet Diving Gear Neptune's Shell

The Desert Spirit is a Hardmode enemy that can be found in Corrupted or Crimson Underground Desert biomes. The Desert Spirit has an attack pattern that is unique compared to most enemies. Upon appearing near a player, it will cast a single Desert Spirit's Curse, a colored projectile that attempts to home in on the nearest player, phasing through blocks and slowly gaining speed. After a certain amount of time, it will duplicate and explode. The projectiles themselves do not deal any damage, but their explosions do. Similar to other casters, the Desert Spirit will finally teleport to a different location and repeat the process.

The Flaming Arrow is a type of arrow. It is an upgrade to the Wooden Arrow, dealing slightly more damage and having a chance to inflict the On Fire! debuff on enemies. It emits light when fired or dropped, making it useful for temporary lighting in a cave.

If a Flaming Arrow gets in contact with water, honey, or shimmer (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), it will no longer emit light or inflict the On Fire! debuff. Its sprite also becomes identical to the Wooden Arrow's sprite.

(Old-gen console and 3DS versions) Flaming Arrows have a chance to be recoverable after hitting a surface or a target. If they remained lit, they have a 1/9 (11.11%) chance to drop as Flaming Arrows and a 2/9 (22.22%) chance to drop as Wooden Arrows. Otherwise, they have a 1/3 (33.33%) chance to drop as Wooden Arrows.
The Face Monster is a pre-Hardmode enemy that can be found in the Crimson. It follows the Fighter AI, being able to open doors at any time. Like other Crimson enemies, it drops Vertebra fairly often.

The Snowball is a consumable ranged weapon that can be crafted from Snow Blocks. Snowballs can also be used as ammunition for the Snowball Cannon and (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) the Snowball Launcher.

The Salamander is a pre-Hardmode enemy found in the Cavern layer, and has nine color variants that all share identical stats and behavior. When a player is within its line of sight, the Salamander stays rooted in place and fires green spit projectiles that have a 2/3 (66.67%) chance to inflict the Poisoned debuff for 2-4 / 4-8 / 5-10 seconds.

Salamanders are unique in that their ability to spawn is connected to two other enemies: the Crawdad and the Giant Shelly. Of these three enemies, a world will choose two types that it can spawn, leaving the third inaccessible. Salamanders will never spawn in a world that features both Crawdads and Giant Shellies together. This is taken into account by the Bestiary progression logic (the missing enemy will register as unlocked when the other two exclusive creatures are unlocked) and the banner acquisition (any two of the trio's banners can be used to craft the banner of the missing member of the trio).

The Hellforge is a crafting station that incorporates the same functions as a regular Furnace, additionally being able to smelt Hellstone into Hellstone Bars. It is also used to craft the essential Adamantite / Titanium Forge in Hardmode.

Hellforges cannot be crafted, and are found in Ruined Houses in the Underworld. On the Desktop version, Console version, and Mobile version, Hellforges can only be collected with a Deathbringer or Nightmare Pickaxe or better (65% pickaxe power). Once placed at higher depths, they can be removed with any pickaxe.
The Destroyer Emblem is a Hardmode, post- Golem accessory that gives the player 10% increased damage and 8% increased critical strike chance.

The Ice Blade is a pre-Hardmode sword which occasionally fires an Ice Bolt projectile when swung. It costs no ammunition or mana, emits a small amount of light, deals the same damage as the sword, is not affected by gravity, and dissipates upon hitting an enemy or solid block. The Ice Blade also has a base 6% critical strike chance, as opposed to the usual 4%. The Ice Blade is found in Frozen Chests in the Ice biome, Frozen Crates (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), and Boreal Crates (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions).
Its best modifier is Legendary.

The Joja Cola is a food item that grants the Well Fed buff when consumed. This lasts for 2 minutes, but can be canceled at any time  by right-clicking the icon,  by selecting the icon using Cycle Next/Previous Buff and then pressing Remove Buff, or  by double-tapping the buff icon. It has a 1/8 (12.5%) chance of being fished up instead of a junk item when fishing.

When talking to the Dryad and holding a Joja Cola, the Dryad's " Status " option will be replaced by " Purify ". Upon selecting this option, the Dryad will summon a star-shaped portal with a Junimo pet jumping out of it after a brief delay. The pet will pull a Stardrop from the ground and then vanish, dropping the item for the player to collect. This process can be repeated an unlimited number of times.
Like all other food items, the Joja Cola can be placed on a Plate :

Webbed is a Hardmode debuff that immobilizes the player completely. It is only inflicted by the Black Recluse 's and Jungle Creeper 's web spit attack, an attack that they only use in Expert Mode. Unlike the Frozen or Stoned debuffs, it will instantly stop the player in place, preventing them from falling or sliding across the ground. While affected by the debuff, the player will be unable to use any items except for healing items.

The Stake Launcher is a Hardmode, post- Plantera repeater -like weapon which auto-fires Stakes as ammunition. Stakes are unaffected by gravity and pierce through up to nine enemies, dissipating upon hitting a tenth, while also traveling faster than most arrows. On the Desktop version, Console version, and Mobile version, the Stake Launcher applies a 10% damage penalty to the next hit for each enemy the Stake projectile pierces. The Stake Launcher has a base 14% critical strike chance as opposed to the usual 4%. Additionally, it receives a substantial damage boost of 1000% against Vampires.

The Stake Launcher is dropped by the Mourning Wood during the Pumpkin Moon event with a 2.86-20% (5-20%) chance depending on the current wave. When dropped, the Stake Launcher is always accompanied by 30 to 60 Stakes. Additional Stakes are sold by the Witch Doctor and Arms Dealer for 15 CC each while the Stake Launcher is in the player's inventory.
Its best modifier is Unreal.

The Warmth Potion is a buff potion which grants the Warmth buff when consumed. The buff reduces damage from cold-themed enemies (see below) by 30%. This lasts for 15 minutes, but can be canceled at any time  by right-clicking the icon,  by selecting the icon using Cycle Next/Previous Buff and then pressing Remove Buff,  by selecting the icon and canceling it in the equipment menu, or  by double-tapping the buff icon.

The Firecracker was an unobtainable thrown consumable weapon. It was intended to be dropped from the Red Envelope, another removed unimplemented item related to the removed unimplemented Chinese New Year seasonal event.
The Bone Arrow is a type of arrow purchased from the Skeleton Merchant for 15 CC each, during moon phases 1 (full), 2, 5 (new), and 6. Bone Arrows can only pierce one enemy.

The Defiled Crate is a Hardmode crate that can only be fished in The Corruption. Defiled Crates contain items found in standard crates, and additionally always drop an item normally obtained by destroying a Shadow Orb. Its pre-Hardmode counterpart is the Corrupt Crate.
The GPS is an informational accessory that enables an on-screen display of the player's current depth, lateral position, and time.
Depth is displayed as follows:

On the Desktop version, Console version, and Mobile version of the game, depth is measured in feet, with one tile equivalent to two feet. On the Old-gen console version, depth is measured in meters, with two tiles equivalent to one meter.

The Meatball is a pre-Hardmode flail crafted using Crimtane Bars and Tissue Samples. It is the equivalent of the Corruption's Ball O' Hurt (which is not crafted, but obtained by smashing a Shadow Orb).

Its best modifier is Godly or Demonic. Both modifiers increase the average damage output by the same amount. However, Ruthless might be preferred if the player already has very high critical strike chance.
The Putrid Scent is a Hardmode accessory which increases damage and critical strike chance by 5% and decreases aggro by 400. It has a 1/5 (20%) chance to be dropped by Corrupt Mimics.
It is unrelated to the Stinky debuff.
Bamboo furniture are furniture items crafted from Bamboo at a Sawmill. There are 20 different Bamboo furniture items.

The Ice Bat is a pre-Hardmode bat enemy that spawns in the Ice biome. Its icy nature causes struck players to be inflicted with the Chilled debuff and, more rarely, the Frozen debuff. It emits a very faint glow, which can sometimes reveal nearby caverns.

Ichor is a Hardmode crafting material dropped by Ichor Stickers in the Underground Crimson and the Tainted Ghoul (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) in the Crimson Underground Desert. It is also obtained from Hematic Crates (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions). It is used to craft many Ichor-related items. It is the Crimson counterpart to the Corruption's Cursed Flame.
Keys are a category of tools, most being used to open locked Chests. Apart from the Shadow Key, all keys are consumed upon use. Biome Keys can only be used once Plantera has been defeated.
Ancient Hellstone Brick Wall is a type of background wall crafted from Ancient Hellstone Bricks. Its appearance is based on the sprite of Hellstone Brick Wall prior to 1.2.
The Gold Mouse is a harmless critter. It is a golden recolor of the ordinary Mouse, with a 1/400 (0.25%) chance of spawning in place of the ordinary version.
The Gold Mouse has only 5 health and no defense, and can only be damaged by players.

The Gold Mouse can be caught with any Bug Net to be carried around in the inventory and released later, or crafted into animated decorative furniture (Gold Mouse Cage). Once crafted, the Gold Mouse cannot be released again, unless the furniture item is de-crafted via Shimmer (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions). The Gold Mouse itself or the crafted furniture can be sold for 10 GC.
It is one of the few entities that can be detected by the Lifeform Analyzer or its upgrades.

Herbs are plants used to craft potions. They can be found all across the world and can be harvested with almost any weapon or tool. Each herb will bloom when certain requirements are met. Herbs harvested while blooming will drop 1 herb item and 1-3 seeds of their kind; the seeds can be replanted to regenerate the supplies of herbs. If harvested with Staff of Regrowth or Axe of Regrowth (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), the amount of dropped herbs is increased to 1-2, and the amount of dropped seeds is increased to 1-5. Herbs appear randomly on their respective soil but can also be planted in that soil with their kind of seed, as well as in Clay Pots and Planter Boxes (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions).
Herbs can also be found in Herb Bags (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions). The Daybloom can additionally be dropped from Angry Dandelions (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions).
Herbs interact differently with liquids : only Fireblossom can grow in lava, and only Moonglow and Waterleaf can grow in water. No herb can grow in honey or shimmer.

The Apricot is a food and fruit item that grants the Well Fed buff when consumed. This lasts for 5 minutes, but can be canceled at any time  by right-clicking the icon,  by selecting the icon using Cycle Next/Previous Buff and then pressing Remove Buff, or  by double-tapping the buff icon.
It has a small chance of dropping when shaking a Forest tree.
Like all other food items, the Apricot can be placed on a Plate :

The Stardrop is a pet-summoning item that spawns a Junimo to follow the player around. When the player is far enough away or in midair, the Junimo twirls the leaf on its head like a propeller to fly after them. The Stardrop can be obtained by "purifying" a Joja Cola from the Dryad while the Joja Cola is selected in their hotbar.

The Burger is a food item that grants the Exquisitely Stuffed buff when consumed. This lasts for 8 minutes, but can be canceled at any time  by right-clicking the icon,  by selecting the icon using Cycle Next/Previous Buff and then pressing Remove Buff, or  by double-tapping the buff icon. The Burger has a 1/100 (1%) chance of being dropped by Crimeras and Eaters of Souls.
Like all other food items, the Burger can be placed on a Plate :
The Galaxy Pearl is a permanent booster item that permanently increases the player's luck by 0.03. It can only be used once per player and is obtained by throwing a Pink Pearl into Shimmer.

The Bowl of Soup is a food item crafted at the Cooking Pot. When consumed, it grants the (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) Plenty Satisfied buff for 8 minutes or the (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) Well Fed buff for 10 minutes.
Like all other food items, the Bowl of Soup can be placed on a Plate (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) :

The Paint Roller is a tool which is used to paint walls. It is purchased from the Painter for 1 GC. Its upgrade, the Spectre Paint Roller, grants a bonus to range. Using a roller requires paint to be in the player's inventory.
The Paint Roller cannot be reforged, and therefore cannot have modifiers.
The Bladetongue is a Hardmode autoswinging sword that can be rarely obtained by fishing in the Crimson biome in any layer.

Upon striking an enemy, it inflicts the Ichor debuff for 5-9 seconds and fires an ichor stream at a random angle in front of the player. The ichor stream deals 70% base damage and knockback (38 base damage and a knockback of 4.025 (Average)), pierces up to 5 enemies, and also inflicts the Ichor debuff for 3-7 seconds. The ichor stream can bounce on blocks up to 3 times and disappears either on hitting the fourth block or after approximately 2 seconds.
It is the Crimson counterpart to the Corruption 's Toxikarp and the Hallow 's Crystal Serpent.
Its best modifier is Legendary.
The Ruler is an autoswinging shortsword purchased from the Goblin Tinkerer for 10 SC.
Its best modifier is Legendary.

The Ichor Sticker is a Hardmode enemy that spawns in the Underground Crimson and floats around in the air. When tracking the player, it spits a stream of Ichor at them, similar to that of the Golden Shower. The stream inflicts the Ichor debuff for 15 / 30 / 37.5 seconds, lowering the player's defense by (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) 15 / (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) 20. Upon death, Ichor Stickers will also drop Ichor.

The Flying Dutchman is a Hardmode mini-boss that spawns during the Pirate Invasion event. The Flying Dutchman emits golden particles while hovering approximately 26 tiles above the player, and is armed with four cannons that fire explosive cannonballs toward the nearest player while occasionally spawning standard Pirate Invasion enemies that fall from the deck and onto solid ground. The boss will be defeated and drop loot upon depleting the health of all four cannons.

The Flying Dutchman does not disappear after the Pirate Invasion is over (though it will explode if it has not been engaged before the invasion ends), and defeating the Flying Dutchman will not end the invasion. Several Flying Dutchmen can appear during a single Pirate Invasion, or none at all. They only appear when the event progress has passed 50%, and where there is at least 40x30 tiles space.

Butterfly Jars are pieces of decorative furniture created by placing a Butterfly, captured with a Bug Net, inside of a Bottle. It functions the same way as a Cage for other critters. It has an animated sprite when placed down, and the butterflies will fly around inside the jars.
Krypton Moss Brick is a type of brick made from Krypton Moss that glows in the dark.

The Sticky Dirt Bomb is an explosive that, when thrown, will stick to blocks and explode after 3 seconds like a regular Sticky Bomb, with a radius of about 4 tiles. However, instead of destroying tiles, it will place Dirt Blocks in open space within a small radius. Existing blocks within the explosion radius will remain unaffected.
The Country Club set is a vanity set. It is purchased from the Golfer for 7 GC 50 SC (set). These items are to be equipped in the Social Slots as they only provide a visual appearance.

The Cursed Arrow is a Hardmode arrow which applies the Cursed Inferno debuff for 7 seconds upon contact with an enemy. Unlike Flaming Arrows, they do not go out when they hit water. They are the Corruption counterpart to the Crimson 's Ichor Arrows.

(Old-gen console and 3DS versions) As with most other arrows, Cursed Arrows have a chance not to break. When fired, they have a 1/6 (16.67%) chance to drop and can then be recovered. However, 2/3 (66.67%) of the time they will drop as a normal Wooden Arrow instead of a cursed one.

The Skull is a rare vanity item that has a 1/500 (0.2%) chance of being dropped by Skeletons and Spore Skeletons (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), which are found in the Cavern layer, or a 1/2500 (0.04%) chance by those spawned from a Skeleton Statue or a Bone Skeleton Statue (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions).
Adamantite Beam Wall is a type of wall crafted from Adamantite Beam.

The Skeleton Archer is a Hardmode enemy that sometimes spawns in the Cavern layer. They move fairly slow compared to other cave enemies. When the player is in their line of sight, they will stop moving and shoot Flaming Arrows at the player, which have a chance of inflicting the On Fire! debuff.

The Nebula Blaze is a Hardmode, post- Lunatic Cultist magic weapon which autofires pink, high-velocity projectiles that home in on enemies if they are nearby, with a 1/5 (20%) chance to fire a larger, faster blue projectile that has a higher velocity and deals 300% or three times the weapon's base damage (390 damage). The Nebula Blaze fires inaccurately, akin to the Chain Gun and similar weapons - however, its projectiles home in from a certain angle, similar to the Spectre Staff. When selected, it appears as a pink glow covering the player's hand, which leaves behind a pink particle trail as the player moves.
Its best modifier is Mythical.
The Gold Worm is a critter. It is a golden recolor of the ordinary Worm, with a 1/400 (0.25%) chance of spawning in place of the ordinary version.
The Gold Worm has only 5 health and no defense, and can be damaged by other enemies and players.

The Gold Worm can be caught with any Bug Net to be carried around in the inventory and released later, or crafted into animated decorative furniture (Gold Worm Cage). Once crafted, the Gold Worm cannot be released again, unless the furniture item is de-crafted via Shimmer (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions). The Gold Worm itself or the crafted furniture can be sold for 10 GC.
The Gold Worm can be used as bait for fishing, with 50% bait power.
Gold Worms have a 1/20 (5%) chance of being obtained from opening a Can Of Worms.
Uniquely, the Gold Worm has an exceptionally low chance of being consumed as bait of 1/20 (5%).
It is one of the few entities that can be detected by the Lifeform Analyzer or its upgrades.

The Aether is a mini-biome that can be found in the outer fifth of the world in the Underground or Cavern layers. It is generated once upon world creation and is always located on the same side of the world as the Jungle biome. The biome features a large pool of Shimmer in its center that is surrounded by a few Gem Trees. Faelings occasionally fly above the pool.
Players can also create artificial Aether biomes by placing Shimmer in the Underground or Cavern layers. An Aether biome requires at least 300 tiles of Shimmer.

While in the Aether, a unique background effect shows the star-filled sky of Space, with multicolored stars, blackening the entire background but the stars. This effect will also display over tiles that are in complete darkness.
The Teleportation Potion is a potion that teleports the user to a random location. It can either be crafted or found in Chests located in the Cavern layer.
In choosing a destination, the following rules apply:

The player will always be placed on top of a solid block and never inside blocks. The player can never be placed in front of a natural, below-surface Dungeon wall before Skeletron has been defeated. The player can never be placed in front of a natural, below-surface Lihzahrd Brick Wall (i.e., in the Jungle Temple) before Plantera has been defeated. The player cannot be placed in a location where they would take damage from any of the following environmental hazards directly: Thorny bushes Spikes or Wooden Spikes Meteorite, Hellstone, or Hellstone Bricks Lava Cactus plants in the Constant (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) and Get fixed boi (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) worlds Crispy Honey Blocks in the For the worthy (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) and Get fixed boi (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) worlds

The Lihzahrd Altar is found naturally placed in the final chamber of the Jungle Temple, and is used with a Lihzahrd Power Cell to summon Golem. Each summoning consumes one Lihzahrd Power Cell from the player's inventory.

Like Lihzahrd Bricks, the Lihzahrd Altar can only be removed with the Picksaw, Laser Drill (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), or Luminite Pickaxes (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions). Once picked up, the Lihzahrd Altar can be placed anywhere and used to summon Golem in any area, as long as Plantera has been defeated in the current world.
The Gold Butterfly is a harmless critter. It is a golden recolor of the ordinary Butterfly, with a 1/400 (0.25%) chance of spawning in place of the ordinary version.
The Gold Butterfly has only 5 health and no defense, and can be damaged by other enemies and players.

The Gold Butterfly can be caught with any Bug Net to be carried around in the inventory and released later, or crafted into animated decorative furniture (Gold Butterfly Jar). Once crafted, the Gold Butterfly cannot be released again, unless the furniture item is de-crafted via Shimmer (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions). The Gold Butterfly itself or the crafted furniture can be sold for 10 GC.
The Gold Butterfly can be used as bait for fishing, with 50% bait power.
It is one of the few entities that can be detected by the Lifeform Analyzer or its upgrades.

The Celebration Mk2 is a Hardmode, post- Moon Lord launcher that is an upgraded version of the Celebration. Upon use, it fires one of seven different special rocket types, regardless of the type of ammunition used. The fire rate of the rockets does not correspond to its stated use time, and instead corresponds to a use time of 8 (Insanely fast) and does not benefit from speed bonuses. While it retains the destructive properties of its ammunition, it cannot place or delete liquids with liquid rockets. The Celebration Mk2 also has a 1/2 (50%) chance to not consume ammo. The Celebration Mk2 has a 2/9 (22.22%) chance of being dropped by the Moon Lord.
Its best modifier is Unreal. Since it does not benefit from speed modifiers, Godly and Demonic provide the same DPS bonus as Unreal.

Furniture sets are groups of standard furniture items that each exhibit a distinct theme and are therefore similar in appearance and style. Most sets can be crafted or found naturally-placed in the world. Others may be dropped by enemies.
There are a total of 43 furniture sets available in the game.
The Swordfish is a pre-Hardmode spear obtainable through fishing in the Ocean biome.

Its best modifier is Godly or Demonic. Both modifiers increase the average damage output by the same amount. However, Ruthless might be preferred if the player already has very high critical strike chance.

The Mud Wall is a type of background wall which can be found naturally generated in the Jungle and occasionally the Underground Jungle, considered unsafe. It does not drop as an item when destroyed, and can only be obtained on Desktop, Console, and Mobile, via crafting. It is considered a safe wall when placed by the player.

If Mud Walls are sprayed with Dark Blue Solution they will turn into unsafe Mushroom Walls. If these Mushroom Walls are sprayed with Green Solution they will revert back into unsafe Mud Walls or unsafe Jungle Walls, this seemingly being determined by layer level.

The Luck Potions are three types of buff potions which grant the Lucky buff, increasing the player's luck. This lasts for 5-15 minutes, but can be canceled at any time  by right-clicking the icon,  by selecting the icon using Cycle Next/Previous Buff and then pressing Remove Buff, or  by double-tapping the buff icon.

Consuming a Lesser, regular, or Greater Luck Potion grants 5, 10, or 15 minutes of the Lucky buff, respectively. The buff is unique in that its effectiveness depends on the remaining duration, which is shown below:
The values do not stack, and the only difference between the Luck Potions is the duration of the effect:

Consuming a Lesser Luck Potion (5 minutes of Lucky) gives +0.1 luck for 5 minutes. Consuming a regular Luck Potion (10 minutes of Lucky) gives +0.2 luck for 5 minutes, then +0.1 luck for 5 minutes. Consuming a Greater Luck Potion (15 minutes of Lucky) gives +0.3 luck for 5 minutes, then +0.2 luck for 5 minutes, and then +0.1 luck for 5 minutes.

A consumable is an item that is removed from a player's inventory upon direct use. For items that are consumed from use of another item, see Ammunition. On the Old-gen console version and Nintendo 3DS version, some consumable items, like consumable weapons, may be recoverable as dropped items afterward in certain situations.
There are some consumables that only cause a cosmetic effect, such as the Sparkle Slime Balloon (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions). These have no effect on gameplay.

Note: This term is distinct from Category:Consumable items, which is a Terraria Wiki category encompassing all blocks and furniture that can leave the player's inventory via placement, but which are not necessarily used and destroyed.
The Vial of Venom is a Hardmode crafting material purchased from the Witch Doctor for 15 SC each, after Plantera has been defeated.

The Static Hook is a Hardmode grappling hook that fires up to two hooks which can be launched simultaneously, reaching up to 37.5 tiles (the longest reach of any hook). The Static Hook can be purchased from the Steampunker for 50 GC.

When a hook latches onto a block, the player will be immediately suspended at their current location, unaffected by gravity, momentum, or knockback. If a second hook is fired while in this state, the player will stay attached to the first until the second hook attaches, and will not move or fall by any means. Players can use the movement keys to retract or extend the hook manually, up to its full range. Movement keys correspond with direction, so pressing ▲ Up while directly under the grappling hook will move the player upwards, whereas pressing ◀ Left or ▶ Right will not move the player at all in this case.

The Titanium Repeater is a Hardmode repeater crafted solely using Titanium Bars. It is the best repeater obtainable without defeating a mechanical boss, after which the Hallowed Repeater becomes available.Its alternate ore counterpart is the Adamantite Repeater.
Its best modifier is Unreal.

The Angler Earring is an accessory that increases the player's current Fishing Power by 10 when equipped. The Angler Earring can be acquired as a 1/34 (2.94%) chance reward for completing a fishing quest for the Angler NPC, depending on the number of completed quests and other factors (for details, see Angler).

The Angler will not give the player an Angler Earring as a reward if they already have one in their inventory or in any of their portable storage items or loadouts. However, if the player has all of the Angler's fishing and informational accessories (or their upgrades like the Angler Tackle Bag and Fish Finder) in their inventories, this rule will be ignored.

Sluggy is one of three critters that occasionally spawn in the Jungle or Underground Jungle biome when a player breaks a background plant, the others being Grubby (more common) and Buggy (rarest). Sluggy has only 5 health and no defense, and can be damaged by other enemies and players.

Sluggy can be caught with any Bug Net to be carried around in the inventory and released later, or crafted into animated decorative furniture (Sluggy Cage). Once crafted,  Sluggy cannot be released again, unless the furniture item is de-crafted via Shimmer (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions).
Sluggy can be used as bait for fishing, with 25% bait power.
Sluggy can be spawned by the Buggy Statue, however statue-spawned critters cannot be caught with any Bug Net, and will disappear in a puff of smoke when the player attempts to do so.

Chains are used both for climbing and as components for various crafting recipes. They are used in crafting items such as the Grappling Hook, Sawmill, all types of watches, and chandeliers. Chains can be placed and used like Rope and offer the same ascent and descent speeds, although they cannot be turned into coils like Rope can. Placed Chains are background objects, and much like furniture, do not count as background walls in a house, are not suitable for NPCs, and cannot be actuated.
(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) Chains are not destroyed when dropped in lava, despite having a rarity of 00*.

The Aerial Bane is a Hardmode, post- Golem bow that converts any type of arrow into special Aerial Bane arrows each time the bow is fired. The Aerial Bane simultaneously fires six arrows arranged in a diagonal formation that deals 150% of the weapon's base damage (58 base damage) to airborne enemies. The bow determines whether an enemy is airborne or not by checking if there is a solid block within 12 tiles below the point of impact. As such, if a normally grounded enemy is more than 12 tiles above a solid block, it will be considered airborne and the Aerial Bane will inflict extra damage. The Aerial Bane's special arrows drop off sharply and will disappear in midair if they fall enough distance.

Upon hitting an enemy, the arrow splits into five separate arrows, which are angled downward in a symmetrical 90° spread with the centermost arrow being shot directly downward regardless of what angle the enemy was hit at. These five additional arrows will not split again and explode upon hitting an enemy or solid tile. The Aerial Bane also has a base 7% critical strike chance as opposed to the usual 4%. The Aerial Bane has a 1/4 (25%) of being dropped from Betsy during Tier 3 of the Old One's Army event.
Its best modifier is Unreal.

The Fruitcake Chakram is a boomerang -type weapon dropped from Presents obtained during the Christmas seasonal event, with a chance of 0.626% in pre-Hardmode and 0.584% in Hardmode. Unlike the Thorn Chakram, it will not bounce off of blocks.

Its best modifier is Godly or Demonic. Both modifiers increase the average damage output by the same amount. However, Ruthless might be preferred if the player already has very high critical strike chance.

The Stockade Crate is a Hardmode crate that can only be fished in the Dungeon after Skeletron has been defeated. Opening Stockade or Dungeon Crates is the only way to obtain the Golden Lock Box, and therefore any Dungeon-exclusive items normally found in Locked Gold Chests, once the Dungeon has been fully looted. Its pre-Hardmode counterpart is the Dungeon Crate.

Loki's set are vanity developer items that can be obtained rarely (5% chance) from Treasure Bags dropped from Hardmode bosses (except Queen Slime 's). It is the vanity set made for Loki, the Chief Strategy Officer at Re-Logic. Equipping the full set produces a pulsating effect similar to Adamantite armor, a glow similar to Spooky armor, and causes the armor to appear darker.
These items are to be equipped in the Social Slots as they only provide a visual appearance.
Loki's equipment also includes these non-vanity items, which will drop in addition to his clothing set:
Loki's Wings Loki's Dye

The Pearlwood Sword is an alternate version of the Wooden Sword made using Pearlwood from the The Hallow. It can only be naturally obtained in Hardmode because the Hallow biome only emerges after Hardmode is triggered.
Its best modifier is Legendary.

The Venom Bullet is a Hardmode, post- Plantera type of bullet and is one of six types of craftable ammunition made from Empty Bullets, which are sold by the Arms Dealer after Hardmode has been enabled. Venom Bullets inflict the Acid Venom debuff onto enemies for a duration of 10 seconds, and currently have the second highest base damage of all Bullets in the game, tied with Nano Bullets and surpassed only by Luminite Bullets (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), and inflict the Acid Venom debuff upon the target.
The cost of a stack of 50 Venom Bullets is 17 SC 50 CC, which is 35 CC per bullet. The cost of crafting 1000 Venom Bullets (20 stacks of 50) is 3 GC 50 SC.

Pearls are crafting materials obtained from opening Oysters, and are used solely to craft Luck Potions. Each of the three pearls have different rarities, with the rarer ones being crafted into stronger potions. Additionally, when the Pink Pearl is thrown into shimmer, it turns into a Galaxy Pearl. The player can only receive one pearl from each Oyster, with a 1/5 (20%) chance in total.
The Dead Man's Sweater is a vanity item that has a 1/3 (33.33%) chance of being found inside Dead Man's Chests. It appears to have many holes in it.

The Gray Grunt is a Hardmode, post- Golem enemy that spawns during the Martian Madness event. While outwardly similar to most Martian enemies, it is unique in that it is completely invulnerable to knockback. It appears to have grey skin and black eyes.

The Adamantite Pickaxe is a Hardmode pickaxe, and is the pickaxe alternative to the Adamantite Drill, having a slower mining speed but longer range and benefiting from mining speed bonuses. Its alternate ore counterpart, the Titanium Pickaxe, is faster than the Adamantite Pickaxe.
It can mine any block except Chlorophyte Ore and Lihzahrd Bricks.
Its best modifier is Legendary. However, due to rounding, Legendary, Light, Deadly, Agile, Quick, and Nasty provide equal boosts to mining speed for this tool.

The Shimmer Arrow is a type of ammunition that is obtained by throwing a Wooden or Hellfire Arrow into Shimmer. It functions like a normal arrow but flies upwards as if it experiences reversed gravity. Upon hitting something, it creates a small rainbow explosion visual effect.
The Gas Trap is a trap item obtained by throwing a Whoopie Cushion into Shimmer. It can also be activated from Chests in No traps and Get fixed boi worlds.

After being placed in a storage item, the Gas Trap will activate the next time that storage item is opened, dealing 20 / 40 / 60 damage to nearby players and 10 damage to nearby enemies, NPCs, and critters, and inflicting all entities within a small radius with the Poisoned debuff for 49 seconds / 1 minute 38 seconds / 2 minutes 3 seconds. The Gas Trap then becomes a Used Gas Trap and can only be refilled by throwing it into Shimmer, producing a new Gas Trap. Only one Gas Trap will be used at a time whenever a player opens a storage item if multiple are inside. A Gas Trap will not activate if the storage item it was placed in is opened in a singleplayer world while autopause is enabled.
The Super Healing Potion is a recovery potion that heals 200 health and inflicts Potion Sickness for 60 seconds when used. This duration can be reduced via the Philosopher's Stone or Charm of Myths.
Though their crafting cost is fairly significant, they are the highest tier of healing potion in the game. They are also always dropped by the Moon Lord.
It is the fourth and final tier of healing potion, succeeding the Lesser Healing Potion, Healing Potion, and Greater Healing Potion.

The Snowman Gangsta is a Hardmode enemy that spawns during the Frost Legion event. It moves by hopping toward the player while occasionally firing bullets at them at a slow rate, and can only shoot left or right.
The Guide to Critter Companionship is a pre-Hardmode tool that prevents the player's attacks from harming critters while inside their inventory. It can be purchased from the Zoologist for 5 GC.

Pressing ⚷ Open / Activate on the Guide to Critter Companionship in the player's inventory or hotbar will toggle it between the Guide to Critter Companionship and the Guide to Critter Companionship (Inactive), disabling its functions.

The Rainbow Crystal Staff is a Hardmode, post- Moon Lord sentry summon weapon. It can summon the Rainbow Crystal sentry, which lasts for 10 minutes, remains stationary, and does not count against the player's minion capacity. The Rainbow Crystal attacks enemies within its 62.5-tile range by firing spreads of three multicolored rays of light, which prioritize targeting the nearest enemy. Each of these beams then releases a twinkling star that produces a damaging explosion after a short delay. Unlike other sentry summons, the Rainbow Crystal floats in midair at the cursor position when summoned, rather than falling to the ground, similarly to the Lunar Portal Staff. The Rainbow Crystal Staff has a 2/9 (22.22%) chance of being dropped by the Moon Lord.

Its best modifier is Ruthless. The Mythical modifier provides the widest array of stat bonuses, but these primarily affect the initial summon rather than the resulting minion. Additionally, minions cannot deal critical hits. The only lasting advantage a Mythical Rainbow Crystal Staff has over a Ruthless one is knockback.

The Iron Crate is a pre-Hardmode crate that can be obtained by fishing in any biome, at any height. It is the middle tier of standard crate. Its Hardmode counterpart is the Mythril Crate (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions).
Copper Plating is a brick crafted at the Heavy Work Bench. Its alternate ore version is Tin Plating.
The Gold Shortsword is an early game metal shortsword. Its alternate ore counterpart is the Platinum Shortsword.

Like all shortswords, the Gold Shortsword has a very limited range and attacks with a stabbing motion at any direction on Desktop, Console, and Mobile, and horizontally in front of the player on Old-gen console and 3DS, instead of an arc. This makes it almost useless against flying or jumping enemies, although its high attack rate makes it somewhat effective against weaker fighter type enemies.
Its best modifier is Legendary.

Palm Wood furniture are furniture items crafted from Palm Wood, which can be obtained by cutting down Palm trees in the Ocean biome. There are 21 (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) / 11 (Old-gen console version) different Palm Wood furniture items.

Reflective Copper Dye is a dye acquired by giving a Strange Plant to the Dye Trader. When equipped, it will give the selected accessory/armor a copper-plated, "shiny" effect, reflecting the surrounding light around the player. The reflection is more pronounced the closer the player is to a light source. The dye will prioritize light from the sun when the player is outside. From some perspectives, the player may look 3D when this dye is equipped all over.

As with other reflective dyes, this dye is not animated when standing still, but the shading on a dyed piece of equipment will change according to the surrounding light, giving it the appearance of light reflecting off of a shining metallic object.
Wood Walls are a background wall made from Wood. Like other walls, it stops enemies from spawning when it is placed and can be used for houses.

Coralstone Blocks are decorative blocks. When placed, they can have one of the many kinds of coral on it. Much like Sunplate Blocks, Coralstone Blocks show a special, non-changing image if a square of nine or more are put next to each other. In this case, the image is a coral that looks much like a sponge.
On Old-gen console version and Nintendo 3DS version, they have a chance to be awarded from the Angler.

The Release Lantern is a consumable light source sold by the Party Girl for 1 SC each during a Lantern Night. When used, it releases a lantern that will float up into the air before disappearing after 16 seconds. It closely resembles the lanterns seen in the background of Lantern Nights and also travels in the direction of the wind.

The Pulse Bow is a unique Hardmode bow that auto-fires a high-velocity glowing light blue bolt, which is unaffected by gravity, will pierce enemies, can ricochet, and flies for 3.5 seconds (about 480 tiles) before dissipating. The blue bolts can pierce or ricochet five times in total, dissipating upon the sixth hit. Each ricochet causes the bolt to pierce one less enemy and vice versa. Like other bows and repeaters, it can use any arrow type as ammunition. However, the Pulse Bow converts all arrows into its special bolt. Normal effects of various arrow types are canceled, except when using their damage statistic. The Pulse Bow also has a base 11% critical strike chance as opposed to the usual 4%.

The Pulse Bow can be purchased from the Traveling Merchant for 45 GC : on the Desktop version, Console version, and Mobile version it is available after defeating all three mechanical bosses, while on the Old-gen console version, it is available after defeating Plantera.
(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) The Traveling Merchant will use it for self-defense once a world is in Hardmode.
Its best modifier is Unreal.

The Scarab Bomb is a sticky thrown explosive used for mining large shafts. Once stuck to a block, it will explode after 3 seconds, creating a 21-tile long and 3-tile wide shaft facing directly away from the player. It can be crafted, found in Oasis Crates, Mirage Crates, Sandstone Chests, or Pots in the Underground Desert.
The Crystal Block Wall is a type of Wall that can be crafted with Crystal Blocks. It has a purple-blue color, along with a dark tone.
The Cyan Beetle is a rare pre-Hardmode enemy that spawns in the Ice biome in the Cavern Layer. When killed, it will always drop the Cyan Husk, which can be used to craft Cyan Dye.
It is one of the few entities that can be detected by the Lifeform Analyzer (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) or its upgrades.
The Combat Wrench is a pre-Hardmode, post- Skeletron boomerang which has a 1/8 (12.5%) chance of being dropped by the Mechanic. It will pierce multiple targets before returning.

Its best modifier is Godly or Demonic. Both modifiers increase the average damage output by the same amount. However, Ruthless might be preferred if the player already has very high critical strike chance.

Snow Cloud is a type of block that can be crafted at a Sky Mill from Cloud blocks in the Snow biome. Snow Cloud blocks cause purely decorative snowflakes to appear beneath them, continuing for about 8 tiles and then fading away for 5 more. Landing on Snow Clouds will not inflict fall damage.
In drunk worlds, Snow Clouds are generated naturally as part of snow-themed Floating Islands.

The Flask of Gold is a Hardmode flask that causes melee weapons and whips (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) to inflict the Midas debuff for 2 seconds on enemies hit. Melee weapons that fire projectiles will also inflict the debuff on enemies hit by the projectiles (except for the Flairon 's bubbles).

The Flask of Gold cannot be used in conjunction with other flasks, and using it will remove any existing flask effects. (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) Like all other flasks, the effect will not be canceled when the player dies.

The Cluster Rocket II is a type of rocket ammunition. Unlike the Cluster Rocket I, it destroys tiles. Unique from other rockets, cluster rockets shoot out shrapnel that create several secondary explosions which deal half of the base damage. These secondary explosions will destroy additional tiles.
Cluster Rocket IIs can be purchased from the Cyborg for 15 SC each during a Blood Moon or Solar Eclipse after the Martian Madness event has been defeated.
The Martian Engineer is a Hardmode, post- Golem enemy that appears during the Martian Madness event. Martian Engineers have the ability to build Tesla Turrets around them.

The Goblin Mask is an unimplemented item resembling an Etherian Goblin mask. It only exists as an ID and image file in the game's code. It presumably would be available as part of the Dungeon Defenders 2 crossover. Attempting to use third-party tools to obtain it will result in it instantly disappearing.
Nebula furniture can be made from Nebula Bricks using the Ancient Manipulator. There are 20 different Nebula furniture items.

Furniture is a class of items that can be placed on blocks, or hung from them, usually to become background objects that characters can move over and through. Some are functional, such as crafting stations, Chests, Beds, mechanisms, and light sources (among others), while many are mainly decorative. Most furniture items are sorted into sets. Furniture is acquired through crafting, by collecting furniture items that appear naturally in the world, dropped by Pirates, or purchasing from NPCs. Most placed furniture can be freed with a pickaxe.
Although primarily decorative, when placed, the Pink Vase, Mug, and various cups also serve as a Placed Bottle crafting station.
Items that must be hung from "ceiling" blocks (the underside of blocks) cannot be hung from platforms, unless said platform is hammered into its lowered position.
Lava will dislodge most placed furniture, with the exception of pumps, statues, Ash Wood furniture, and Obsidian furniture found in the Ruined Houses of the Underworld.
Although furniture can not be actuated in-game, if done through the use of external Map viewers that have world editing feature, they still work, i.e. beds can still be slept in.

The Golden Bug Net is an upgraded version of the Bug Net and Lavaproof Bug Net. It functions similarly, being a swung tool that captures critters, but is larger, faster, and can destroy any tiles that weapons can destroy (like tall grass, vines, or fully grown Pumpkins), and also allows the player to catch Underworld critters (Lavaflies, Hell Butterflies, and Magma Snails). The Golden Bug Net has a base 1/80 (1.25%) chance of being obtained from the Angler as a reward for completing fishing quests.
Stardust furniture can be made from Stardust Bricks using the Ancient Manipulator. There are 20 different Stardust furniture items.

The Suspicious Looking Tentacle is a Hardmode, post- Moon Lord light pet-summoning item that spawns the Suspicious Looking Eye, a small tentacled floating eye that provides cyan light and follows the player. The Suspicious Looking Tentacle is always dropped from the Moon Lord 's Treasure Bag in Expert Mode.

In addition to providing light, the Suspicious Looking Tentacle senses nearby NPCs, enemies, treasure (Pots, Chests, etc.), and ores within a 17-tile radius. This is shown via its pupil and iris pointing in the direction of the entity sensed, as well as expanding for treasure and contracting for enemies. The eye will also sparkle when nearby ores and treasures are detected.

The Toy Tank is a Hardmode, post- Plantera mount-summoning item that summons a rideable Santank Mount. The mount is notable for having a double jump as well as two auto-targeting weapons attached; a front-facing machine gun and a homing rocket launcher. The Toy Tank is dropped by Santa-NK1 during the Frost Moon event in Master Mode with a 6.25-25% chance depending on the current wave.

The maximum movement speed of the mount is 41 mph, and it takes about 1.5 seconds to reach top speed. The maximum jump height is 12 tiles without a double jump, or 26 tiles with the double jump when timed right. The double jump can be stacked with other double jump accessories. The Santank is 2 tiles wide and 3 tiles tall, meaning that it does not change the player's height and makes it easier to travel through narrower corridors than with larger mounts such as the Unicorn Mount and Pirate Ship Mount.

The Santank's two attached weapons only fire if there are enemies in front of the player. The machine gun's bullets deal 100 base damage and are fired in a spread of 22.9°, making the weapon somewhat inaccurate. The homing rockets are initially fired directly upwards, deal 120 base damage, and seek the closest target after being fired, including targets that are outside the mount's initial detection range (e.g. enemies behind the player). The damage of the projectiles does not scale with any damage bonuses the player has, but their critical strike chance is affected by the player's ranged critical strike chance. The machine gun fires a bullet every 0.17 seconds (i.e. 6 shots per second), while the rocket launcher fires a rocket every 0.67 seconds.

The Brain Suckler is a Hardmode, post- Lunatic Cultist flying enemy that spawns in the area of the Nebula Pillar during the Lunar Events. It latches onto the player's head, dealing large amounts of damage at a steady rate, while also inflicting the Obstructed debuff for the remainder of the time it is on the player. The debuff causes the player's screen to darken significantly, except for a small area around the player, similar to the Blackout debuff. It additionally has the effect of Bleeding, preventing natural health regeneration.

The Sandstone Chest is a storage item found in the Underground Desert. They are usually found in Underground Cabins but may also uncommonly generate by themselves. Sandstone Chests can also be crafted.

Squire armor is a Hardmode armor set purchased from the Tavernkeep for 450000* 45 in total after defeating any mechanical boss, and provides summon as well as melee damage bonuses. The set consists of the Squire's Great Helm, Squire's Plating, and Squire's Greaves.
A full set of Squire armor provides the following stats:
+58 defense +15% melee damage +30% summon damage +15% melee critical strike chance +15% movement speed +2 HP /second health regeneration +2 sentry slots

Additionally, wearing the full set will increase the velocity of the projectiles of the Ballista sentry summons and will increase the maximum number of enemies that can be pierced by them from 3 to 6. It also grants the wearer the Ballista Panic! buff upon taking any damage, which further increases the fire rate of all Ballista sentries summoned by the player for 5 seconds.
The Valhalla Knight armor can be considered a direct upgrade of the Squire armor.

The Mana Flower is a pre-Hardmode accessory that reduces mana usage by 8%, and enables auto-consumption of any mana-restoring potions in the player's inventory when mana is depleted. The Mana Flower stacks with other mana cost-reduction items, including Nature's Gift. It is crafted at the Tinkerer's Workshop.
Enemy banners are functional furniture items that can be placed on the underside of blocks. They are dropped by most enemies and a few critters.

On the Desktop version, Console version, and Mobile version, when placed, enemy banners provide a Banner buff to any players standing within a rectangular area of 170x125 tiles centered on the banner. The buff grants players +50%/ +100% damage inflicted with all damage to the corresponding enemy and −25%/ −50% damage taken from attacks by the enemy. The banners of Old One's Army enemies will apply a weaker banner buff to the respective enemy, granting the players +10%/ +20% damage inflicted and −5%/ −10% damage taken.
Multiple banners of the same type will not grant stacked buffs. Multiple different banner types in the vicinity will however all take effect, and consolidate into a single buff icon.

On the Desktop version, Console version, and Mobile version, an enemy banner automatically appears in the player's inventory upon reaching certain kill count (50 by default) of that enemy in a particular world. If the player's inventory is full, the banner will be dropped to the ground at the player's location instead. Additionally, a status message saying " <Player name> has defeated the n-th <enemy name>! " appears, with n being the respective multiple of 50 by default. Not all enemy banners require 50 kills to obtain; see below for a list of these banners. On the Old-gen console version and Nintendo 3DS version, any enemy banner has a 1/200 (0.5%) chance of dropping from its corresponding enemy.

There are a total of 301 enemy banners: 120 pre-Hardmode, 175 Hardmode, and 6 unobtainable. Out of these, 118 belong to event enemies (28 pre-Hardmode and 90 Hardmode) and 12 to Old-gen console and 3DS -exclusive enemy variants (7 pre-Hardmode and 5 Hardmode).

On the Desktop version, Console version, and Mobile version, there are a total of 283 obtainable enemy banners. On the Nintendo 3DS version, there are a total of 118 obtainable enemy banners. On the Old-gen console version, there are a total of 97 obtainable enemy banners.

The Tentacle Spike is a pre-Hardmode sword dropped by Eaters of Souls, Devourers, Crimeras, Face Monsters, and Blood Crawlers with a 1/525 (0.19%) chance. On The Constant seed, the drop chance is increased to a 1/100 (1%) chance.

Similarly to the Daybreak and Bone Javelin, the Tentacle Spike embeds Tentacle Spike projectiles into an enemy once per hit, with each spike dealing 3 damage per second. These spikes last for 9 seconds and can stack up to 5 times on each target, leading to a total of 15 damage every second with all spikes embedded.
Its best modifier is Legendary.

The Bacon is a food item that grants the Exquisitely Stuffed buff when consumed. This lasts for 24 minutes, but can be canceled at any time  by right-clicking the icon,  by selecting the icon using Cycle Next/Previous Buff and then pressing Remove Buff, or  by double-tapping the buff icon. The Bacon has a 1/15 (6.67%) chance of being dropped by all Pigron variants, and a 5/192 (2.6%) chance of being dropped from Pigronatas.
Like all other food items, the Bacon can be placed on a Plate :

The Spiked Slime is a slime summoned by King Slime in Expert Mode alongside Blue Slimes, becoming more common as the boss loses health. Like the Spiked Ice Slime and Spiked Jungle Slime, it has the ability to shoot spike projectiles at the player.
