Each piece has a (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) 1/40 (2.5%) / (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) 1/20 (5%) chance to be dropped by Rain Coat Zombies.
The Terrarium is an item used to make Cages for critters caught with the Bug Net, Lavaproof Bug Net (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), or Golden Bug Net (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions).

(Old-gen console and 3DS versions) Cages cannot be opened, broken, or crafted back into their ingredients, so once a critter is crafted into a cage with the Terrarium, that particular critter can no longer be released.
The Loom is a crafting station used to craft Silk, as well as some items that require Silk as an ingredient. It can sometimes be found in Underground Cabins.

Red Acid Dye is a dye acquired as a random reward from the Dye Trader for giving him a Strange Plant. When equipped in a dye slot, it applies a dark red rippling effect that pulses outward, similar to Acid Dye and Blue Acid Dye. Items dyed by it can be seen in the dark but do not emit light.

The Void Bag is a portable storage item that grants the player access to the Void Vault anywhere. When used, it will summon a temporary portal which lasts for 3 minutes, and pressing ⚷ Open / Activate on the portal opens the player's Void Vault inventory. The Void Bag is never consumed and can be used limitlessly.
Pressing ⚷ Open / Activate on the Void Bag item in the inventory turns it into the Closed Void Bag. Pressing the button again opens the Void Bag again.

When opened, the Void Vault storage will effectively act as the player's secondary inventory, which automatically stores items collected after the player's main inventory is full, indicated by a purple mask on the pickup text. Additionally, it also allows the player to interact with the items inside it as if they were in the main inventory without opening the Void Vault storage interface.

When closed, the Void Bag functions similarly to the Money Trough, only acting as a regular portable storage item. This will prevent it from picking up items when the player has a full inventory, and it loses the function of the secondary inventory.

The Antlion is a pre-Hardmode enemy found in Deserts during the day and in Underground Deserts at any time. It remains stationary with its head sticking out of the ground, turns its head towards the player when they are within its line of sight, and fires Sand Ball projectiles at them once every 3.33 seconds. It can only launch projectiles at an upward angle (within about 45° to the left and right), so players that are approaching from lower ground are usually out of its line of fire. Sand Balls turn into Sand Blocks upon hitting an object, and will gather on the ground, similarly to the projectiles fired by the Sandgun.
On the Old-gen console version and Nintendo 3DS version, the Albino Antlion variant also appears.

The Meat Grinder is a Hardmode crafting station used to craft Flesh Blocks and Lesion Blocks. It has a 1/200 (0.5%) chance of being dropped by several Crimson and (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) Corruption enemies.

Flesh and Lesion Blocks can be used as building materials, and crafted into flesh-/lesion-themed walls and furniture via the Decay Chamber / Flesh Cloning Vat. As a result, the Meat Grinder is of little use without them.
Hive is a block type that Bee Hives are made from. Upon mining it may either turn into liquid honey, spawn in a Bee, or simply drop like a regular item.
(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) Hive Blocks can also be acquired by dropping Honey Blocks or Crispy Honey Blocks into Shimmer.

Hive blocks can only be placed using a Hive Wand, consuming Hive blocks from the player's inventory. (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) Hive blocks count towards the requirements of a Jungle biome.

The Coin Ring is a Hardmode accessory created by other accessories exclusively dropped from pirate enemies during Pirate Invasion. It combines the effect of Gold Ring and Lucky Coin, which increases the pickup range for coins, and causes enemies to occasionally drop 1 to 10 more coins when hit and grants +0.05 luck.

The Mysterious Portal instantly opens at the start of the Old One's Army event. Two Mysterious Portals will spawn at a minimum of 61 tiles and a maximum of 120 tiles away from the Eternia Crystal Stand on both sides, and they cannot be destroyed conventionally by the player. They are responsible for spawning all the enemies during the event, and will only despawn upon the event's completion or failure.

Sandstone Blocks are found naturally placed in the Underground Desert biome. Like Sand and Hardened Sand, they are corruptable blocks in Hardmode, and have Corruption, Crimson, and Hallowed counterparts: Ebonsandstone, Crimsandstone, and Pearlsandstone respectively.
The Sandstone Block can be crafted into Smooth Sandstone, which then can be crafted into various furniture items.
Cosmic Ember Brick Wall is a type of background wall crafted from Cosmic Ember Bricks.
The Kimono is a vanity item purchased from the Traveling Merchant for 1 GC.

The Potato Chips are a food item that grant the Well Fed buff when consumed. This lasts for 25 minutes, but can be canceled at any time  by right-clicking the icon,  by selecting the icon using Cycle Next/Previous Buff and then pressing Remove Buff, or  by double-tapping the buff icon. The Potato Chips have a 1/75 (1.33%) chance of being dropped by Crawdads, Giant Shellies, and Salamanders.
Like all other food items, the Potato Chips can be placed on a Plate :
The Vital Crystal is a permanent booster item that permanently increases the player's health regeneration. It can only be used once per player and is obtained by throwing a Life Crystal into Shimmer.

Pure biomes are biomes that are technically considered the default biome setting of an area in a world. An area is always considered one of the pure biomes (depending on height) if there are no other biomes occupying the location.
The following biomes are considered pure biomes: Space, Forest, Underground, and Cavern.
The Platinum Watch is a high-tier watch. Its alternate ore counterpart is the Gold Watch.

When equipped in an accessory slot or simply held in the inventory, a clock will appear in the upper-right corner of the playing screen, revealing the in-game time accurate to the last minute. A minute of Terraria game time is equivalent to a second of real-world time.

The Platinum Watch (or Gold Watch) is one of the three parts necessary to make the GPS, with the others being the Compass and the Depth Meter, and as such is a required ingredient in crafting the Shellphone (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions). The Platinum Watch can also be used to craft the 1 Second Timer.

The Steampunker is a Hardmode NPC vendor who sells the Clentaminator, various furniture crafting stations, and other steampunk-themed items. She will move in once the following criteria have been met:
There is an available vacant house. One of the mechanical bosses (The Twins, The Destroyer, or Skeletron Prime) have been defeated.
On the Desktop version, Console version, and Mobile version, the Steampunker will attack nearby enemies using a Clockwork Assault Rifle and High Velocity Bullets for defense.

Team Platforms are decorative platforms purchased from the Traveling Merchant for 1 SC each. They are available in six different colors, each representing one of the six team colors selectable in the player's inventory, including white for the neutral team.

Unlike Team Dye and Team Hair Dye, these platforms have no special function and are always the same color. The Traveling Merchant will only ever sell one color of Team Platform at a time, along with the Team Block of the same color, meaning that multiple visits will be required to collect all colors.
Shrimp are a type of fishing catch which are found uncommonly by fishing in the Ocean in the Sky or Surface layers. Their sole use is to craft Cooked Shrimp.

The Shackle is an accessory that grants 1 point of defense. It is dropped by most kinds of Zombies with a 1/50 (2%) chance. Shackles may be useful early in the game when only few accessories are available. Typically, they should be replaced with more valuable accessories once out of free slots.
Vases are non-craftable furniture items. They can be found either in the Dungeon or the Underworld and can be mined with any pickaxe or drill.

The Sweetheart Necklace is an accessory which releases a concentrated burst of bees and grants the player the Panic! and (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) Honey buffs when damaged, increasing movement speed by 100% for (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) 8 / (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) 5 seconds and (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) health regeneration for 5 seconds.

The Palladium Repeater is a Hardmode repeater crafted solely using Palladium Bars. It is one of the first repeaters that can be obtained once entering Hardmode. Its alternate ore counterpart is the Cobalt Repeater.
Its best modifier is Unreal.

The Water Walking Potion is a buff potion which grants the Water Walking buff when consumed. The buff allows the player to walk on liquids (water, lava, honey, and shimmer (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions)), and allows them to sink in liquids by pressing ▼ Down. This lasts for (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) 10 minutes / (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) 5 minutes, but can be canceled at any time  by right-clicking the icon,  by selecting the icon using Cycle Next/Previous Buff and then pressing Remove Buff,  by selecting the icon and canceling it in the equipment menu,  by double-tapping the buff icon, or  by canceling the buff from the buffs screen.
In addition to being crafted, Water Walking Potions can be found in pots, chests, and crates.

The Harpy is a pre-Hardmode flying enemy that spawns in Space and at high altitudes, typically around Floating Islands. Prior to Hardmode, they cannot spawn in the central vertical section of the map, which is around one-tenth the width of the entire map. This restriction is removed in Hardmode. They move following the Bat AI, and fire slow-moving blue feather projectiles in inaccurate bursts of three.
Up to seven Harpies can exist on-screen during the day, ten at night, and fifteen during a Blood Moon.

The Ichor Bullet is a type of Hardmode bullet used as ammunition by guns. Ichor Bullets inflict the Ichor debuff onto enemies for 10 seconds, decreasing the enemy's defense by (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) 15 / (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) 20 points, which effectively can increase the damage from the bullet by up to (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) 8 / (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) 10 from its base value of 13, totaling the effective damage up to (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) 21 / (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) 23. They are the Crimson counterpart to the Corruption 's Cursed Bullets.

The Slice of Hell Cake is a pet-summoning item that spawns a Baby Imp pet to follow the player around. When the player is far enough away or in midair, the Baby Imp will spread its arms and fly to catch up to the player. The Slice of Hell Cake has a 1/10 (10%) chance of being found in Shadow Chests and a 1/20 (5%) chance of being found in Obsidian Crates and Hellstone Crates.

The Vampire is a Hardmode enemy that spawns during the Solar Eclipse event. It will transform into a bat if the player is above it or far enough away from it, and attempts to fly near the player at high speed before turning back into a humanoid. It inflicts the Bleeding debuff upon contact with the player for 5-7 / 10-14 / 12.5-17.5 seconds, and is one of the most dangerous enemies during a Solar Eclipse.

Demonite Ore is a pre-Hardmode ore. It is the Corruption counterpart to the Crimson 's Crimtane Ore and will not appear naturally in Crimson worlds. It can be found very rarely in small veins underground in worlds that contain Corruption, however the only usable quantities come from bosses, namely Eater of Worlds, and from the Eye of Cthulhu in worlds naturally containing Corruption. Demonite Ore emits a faint blue glow when placed, similar to Crimtane Ore's faint red glow.
The pickaxe power required to mine Demonite Ore changes with location. When below 0ft in elevation, a Gold Pickaxe or better is needed, otherwise any pickaxe can be used.

Beetle Endurance is a buff granted to the player wearing a full set of Beetle armor with the Shell equipped. The player has to avoid being hit for a few seconds for the buff to start building up, one beetle each level. It takes about 3 seconds of not getting hit to gain an extra beetle. Each beetle adds 15% damage reduction, going up to 45%. If the player is hit at any moment, the total damage of the hit will be reduced by that amount and one beetle will disappear, reducing the buff by one tier.
The Master Gamer's set is a vanity set consisting of the Master Gamer's Jacket and the Master Gamer's Pants. They are purchased from the Traveling Merchant for 10 GC (set).

The Starlight is a Hardmode, post- Plantera melee weapon that rapidly fires short-range light beams, which pierce an unlimited number of enemies at no mana or ammo cost when the ⚒ Use / Attack button is held. The Starlight also has a base 14% critical strike chance as opposed to the usual 4%. The Starlight has a 1/4 (25%) chance of being dropped by the Empress of Light.
Its best modifier is Legendary.
Martian Conduit Plating is a post- Golem block dropped by most enemies during the Martian Madness event, and is used to create a variety of space- or Martian-themed furniture.
Like Spooky Wood, it can only be obtained during its respective event; it can only be crafted by uncrafting its platforms and wall.
When placed in dark areas, the block has a notable pulsating light effect.
Crafting all pieces of furniture requires 161 Martian Conduit Plating blocks.

Wisp Dye is a Hardmode, post- Plantera dye obtained from the Dye Trader when turning in a Strange Plant. It causes equipment it is applied to to gain a solid bright cyan texture with no animation. It is based off the light pet summoned by the Wisp in a Bottle.
Several explosives, like Dynamite and Bombs, break placed objects when they explode. This page lists explosion-proof objects, i.e., objects that will remain placed when an explosion occurs.

Although these objects are themselves impervious to explosions, they will not shield other objects from explosions. Explosions will destroy any vulnerable objects within their radius, even if explosion-proof blocks are in the way.

The Actuator is a mechanism item purchased from the Mechanic for 10 SC each, or harvested from sand, lava, or Dead Man's Chest traps. It has to be connected with wiring to function. When activated, the tile it is on toggles between active and inactive state, effectively allowing any block to be toggled like active or inactive stone blocks. Like wire, Actuators are normally invisible and only become visible when a mechanism item is selected.
The following items interact with Actuators:

They can be removed with the Wire Cutter or The Grand Design (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions). They can be placed with The Grand Design (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions). The Presserator automatically places Actuators on objects when placing them, if the player has any. The Actuation Rod can toggle any Actuator within a limited range without requiring wire.

Living Flame Dye is a Hardmode dye acquired by giving a Strange Plant to the Dye Trader. It can only be obtained after defeating a mechanical boss. Upon application, the dye will cause all items in the slot equipped to change colors to a fiery red, with a yellow-to-red rippling effect. Additionally, any items affected by this dye will flash upon taking damage.
The Gold Pickaxe is an early-game pickaxe. Its alternate ore counterpart is the Platinum Pickaxe.

The Gold Pickaxe is able to mine blocks and ores weaker than Ebonstone, Crimstone, Hellstone, and Pearlstone (which requires a pickaxe with at least 65% pickaxe power, e.g. a Nightmare Pickaxe). Most notably, it can mine Meteorite.
(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) The Gold Pickaxe is able to mine Obsidian.
Its best modifier is Light for harvesting purposes and Legendary for combat purposes.
The Witch set is a vanity set. It has a 2/57 (3.51%) chance to be obtained from a Goodie Bags during the Halloween seasonal event. It consists of a Witch Hat, Witch Dress and Witch Boots.
These items are to be equipped in the Social Slots as they only provide a visual appearance.
The Cochineal Beetle is a rare pre-Hardmode enemy that spawns in the Cavern layer. It drops the Red Husk, which can be used to make Red Dye.
It is one of the few entities that can be detected by the Lifeform Analyzer (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) or its upgrades.

Shadowflame is a debuff that prevents health regeneration and causes the afflicted NPC to lose 15 health per second. If affected by the Oiled debuff, they will take an additional 25 damage per second, totaling 40 damage per second. No enemies can inflict this debuff.
The Bone Pickaxe is a pre-Hardmode pickaxe.

On the Desktop version, Console version, and Mobile version, it can mine all ores up to Demonite and Crimtane Ore. It has a 1/20 (5%) chance of being dropped by Undead Miners, which are uncommon enemies found in the Cavern layer. On the Old-gen console version and Nintendo 3DS version, it can mine all ores up to Meteorite. It has a 1/50 (2%) chance of being dropped by Undead Miners.

It is tied with the Silver Pickaxe as the fastest pre-Hardmode pickaxe by mining speed, but has higher pickaxe power equal to that of the Gold Pickaxe, allowing it to mine Meteorite and destroy Dirt Blocks in a single hit. It is the fastest pickaxe for mining weak blocks, such as Dirt and Snow Blocks, until Hardmode.
Its best modifier is Light for harvesting purposes and Legendary for combat purposes.
Pumpkin Wall is a background wall made from Pumpkins.

The Ice Boomerang is a pre-Hardmode boomerang that behaves like a regular Wooden Boomerang, but is faster and emits light. On Desktop, Console, and Mobile, it can also inflict the Frostburn debuff for 3 seconds. The Ice Boomerang has a 1551/10000 (15.51%) chance of being found inside Frozen Chests in the Ice biome, as well as a 1/6 (16.67%) chance of being obtained from Frozen (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) and Boreal Crates (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions).

Its best modifier is Godly or Demonic. Both modifiers increase the average damage output by the same amount. However, Ruthless might be preferred if the player already has very high critical strike chance.

The Adhesive Bandage is an immunity accessory that grants the player immunity to the Bleeding debuff. It has a 1/100 (1%) / 1/50 (2%) chance to drop from Rusty Armored Bones, Werewolves, and Angler Fish.
It is one of the ingredients required to make the Medicated Bandage, which is a crafting material required to make the Ankh Charm, an accessory further required to make the Ankh Shield.

While the Adhesive Bandage is exclusive to Hardmode on the Old-gen console version and Nintendo 3DS version, it can be obtained in pre-Hardmode on the Desktop version, Console version, and Mobile version by throwing a Bezoar into Shimmer.

Summon weapons are a type of weapon that spawns secondary characters that will aid the player during battle by automatically attacking enemies within range. They cannot be hurt or killed, and deal summon damage.

The characters spawned by most summon weapons fall into one of two categories: minions and sentries. Minions are mobile characters that follow the player, while sentries remain stationary. Additionally, the set bonuses of the Stardust armor, Chlorophyte armor, and Forbidden armor will summon an entity to fight for the player in a manner similar to minions.

Whips (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) are related weapons that deal summon damage without summoning any minions. Hitting an enemy with a whip causes a player's minions and sentries to target it immediately.
There are 47 summon weapons on the Desktop version, Console version, and Mobile version, 11 on the Old-gen console version, and 5 on the Nintendo 3DS version.

Water is an abundant liquid. It is found in nearly any biome in pools of various sizes, and forms the large Oceans on either side of a map. It is less abundant in Deserts, and absent in The Underworld (where it evaporates if made to flow there). Water is only found above a certain depth, beneath which lava pools tend to appear instead. It flows more freely than lava and honey. Each biome has its own unique water color, which can be changed using water fountains.

Candles, most Torches, and Flaming Arrows do not emit light underwater, but Glowsticks and some other light sources do. Most Torches are knocked free when water touches them, with the exception of Cursed, Ichor, and Coral Torches.

Upon submersion, a player's breath meter will display, indicating their remaining breathing time before drowning damage will be incurred. The point where a player is considered submerged, for purposes of the breath meter, is one pixel above the eyes.

If the player's feet are in at least one tile of water, movement is hindered noticeably. Certain accessories or potions can boost player movement through liquids, enable swimming, or even allow walking along its surface. Players cannot swim by default. Projectiles move slower through water than air.
In Expert Mode (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), entering water in a Snow biome will give the player the Chilled debuff, which slows their movement speed.

A body of water will also break the player's fall upon impact and negate any fall damage. If the player has the Water Walking buff or one of the accessories that allow walking on water, this will also negate fall damage by landing on the water's surface.

The Water Gun is a novelty item that sprays a stream of water which inflicts the Wet debuff on players, enemies, and NPCs for 30 seconds. The Water Gun can be used limitlessly and does not consume any ammunition or mana. It is purchased from the Traveling Merchant for 1 GC 50 SC and also has a 1/3 (33.33%) chance to be dropped by Jungle Mimics (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), which spawn in Celebrationmk10 (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) and Get fixed boi (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) worlds.
The Water Gun cannot be reforged, and therefore cannot have modifiers.

Flesh furniture are furniture items crafted from Flesh Blocks, which in turn are crafted from Crimstone Blocks at a Meat Grinder, and are themed after The Crimson. There are (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) 20 / (Old-gen console version) 16 / (3DS version) 13 different Flesh furniture items.

The Moon Charm is a Hardmode accessory that, when equipped during nighttime, transforms the player into a werewolf and applies the Werewolf buff, which provides several stat bonuses. Additionally, the Moon Charm replaces the sound the player makes when damaged with the hurt sound https://terraria.wiki.gg/wiki/File:NPC_Hit_6.wav that regular Werewolf enemies also have. The Werewolf buff does not pacify Werewolf enemies or make the player immune to damage from them. Although the regular Werewolf enemy is colored blue, the player Werewolf will be colored brown. The Moon Charm has a 1/60 (1.67%) chance of being dropped by Werewolves.
The Werewolf buff provides the player with these bonuses:

+2% melee critical strike chance +5.1% melee damage +5.1% melee speed +5% movement speed +3 defense Slightly increased jump height and jump speed +0.5 HP regeneration per second (similar to the Band of Regeneration, but with half the speed)
The Mythril Sword is a Hardmode broadsword. Its alternate ore counterpart is the Orichalcum Sword.
Its best modifier is Legendary.
The Jellyfish Banner is an uncommon enemy banner dropped from Blue, Pink, and Green Jellyfish with a 1/200 (0.5%) chance. It is purely for decoration.

The Tiki Totem is a Hardmode pet-summoning item that spawns a Tiki Spirit that floats and spins above the player's head. Unlike most pets, it will not teleport to the player when the player moves too quickly for it to keep up; it will simply float straight towards the player. The Tiki Totem is purchased from the Witch Doctor for 2 PC when he is spoken to in the Jungle biome during Hardmode.

The Hero's set is a vanity set composed of the Hero's Hat, the Hero's Shirt, and the Hero's Pants. The set's color is green on the Desktop version, Console version, Mobile version, and Nintendo 3DS version and purple on the Old-gen console version. The pieces can be crafted from 20 Silk, requiring 140 Cobwebs, and three items of thread each:
(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) 3 Green Thread, requiring 9 Jungle Grass Seeds (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) 3 Purple Thread, requiring 9 Mushroom Grass Seeds
In order to craft an entire set, a total of 420 Cobwebs and 27 Jungle (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) / Mushroom Grass Seeds (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) are necessary.
These items are to be equipped in the Social Slots as they only provide a visual appearance.

The Frostbrand is a Hardmode sword which intermittently fires a blue Frost Bolt projectile when swung which inflicts the Frostbite debuff for a duration of 4 seconds. It costs no ammunition or mana, emits light, deals the same damage as the sword, is not affected by gravity, and can pierce twice, dissipating upon hitting a third enemy or a solid block. The Frostbrand has a 19/60 (31.67%) chance of being dropped by Ice Mimics.
Its best modifier is Legendary.

Ghostar's set are vanity developer items that can be obtained rarely (5% chance) from Treasure Bags dropped from Hardmode bosses (except Queen Slime 's). It is the vanity set made for Ghostar, a former production assistant at Re-Logic.
These items are to be equipped in the Social Slots as they only provide a visual appearance.
Ghostar's equipment also includes a non-vanity item, which will drop in addition to her clothing set:
Ghostar's Infinity Eight

The Possessed is a Hardmode enemy that spawns during the Solar Eclipse event. Despite not resembling one, she acts similarly to spider enemies such as Wall Creepers, Blood Crawlers, Black Recluses, and Jungle Creepers, climbing on background walls when able to and walking on the ground at all other times. While climbing on walls, The Possessed seems to have an increased movement speed, similar to the other enemies that share this wall-climbing trait, and gains complete immunity to knockback. Additionally, it has been repeatedly observed that the Possessed can build up enough momentum to move at blinding speeds. Rarely, this can result in The Possessed phasing through obstacles such as walls or doors.

Obsidian is a unique pre-Hardmode ore which is created when Water and Lava collide, at which point it forms placed blocks of Obsidian which can be mined and collected. Though Obsidian is considered an ore and is gathered similarly, it has no bar form of its own (although it is used to craft Hellstone Bars).
Mining Obsidian requires a pickaxe with at least 55% pickaxe power (the Gold Pickaxe and its counterpart, the Platinum Pickaxe, are the weakest pickaxes able to do so).
If the player lacks a viable pickaxe, Explosives can also be used to obtain Obsidian.

The Super Star Shooter is a Hardmode ranged weapon that, as a direct upgrade to the Star Cannon, consumes Fallen Stars as ammunition by firing them in a straight line. The star projectiles are unaffected by gravity, pierce an unlimited number of enemies, and summon bright white streaks of light which slash into damaged enemies, dealing an additional 75% of the weapon's damage (45 base damage). Star projectiles dissipate into light-emitting particles upon impacting a solid block or after traveling for one minute.
Its best modifier is Unreal.
Resource Packs are add-on files which allow players to customize the game's sprites, musics, sound effects and translations.

Gem staves are magic weapons that fire a brightly glowing projectile traveling at medium speed. There are 7 types corresponding to the 7 different gems. Higher-tier gem staves are capable of piercing one enemy. All gem staves, except the Amber Staff, are crafted from gems and bars at the Iron or Lead Anvil.
The Actuation Rod is a post- Skeletron, craftable tool which allows directly switching the states of Actuators without having to activate them via wire. It is compatible with Smart cursor.

The Faeling is a flying critter which naturally spawns in the Aether. Most critters that come into contact with Shimmer will also transform into Faelings. Faelings can pass through blocks and try to fly away from the player if they get too close.
The Faeling has only 5 health and no defense, and can be damaged by other enemies and players.

The Faeling can be caught with any Bug Net to be carried around in the inventory and released later, or crafted into animated decorative furniture (Faeling in a Bottle). Once crafted, the Faeling cannot be released again, unless the furniture item is de-crafted via Shimmer (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions).
The Jack 'O Lantern Mask is a vanity item for the helmet slot. It is dropped by Headless Horsemen during the Pumpkin Moon event with a 0.71%-5% (1.25%-5%) chance depending on the current wave.

The Martian Walker is a Hardmode, post- Golem enemy that spawns during the Martian Madness event. It appears as a large tripod enemy that moves at a very fast pace, and has the ability to fire blue Laser Rays at the player, with a maximum fire rate of once every 0.12 seconds (7 ticks) or 8.6 shots per second. These traits combined with its amount of health and its resistance against knockback can make this enemy somewhat difficult to defeat.

The Skeleton Commando is a rare Hardmode, post- Plantera enemy that spawns in the Dungeon after Plantera is defeated. It slowly approaches the player, and, upon getting within their line of sight, stops in place before firing Rockets that explode upon contact with the player or with solid blocks.
It is one of the few entities that can be detected by the Lifeform Analyzer (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) or its upgrades.
Skeleton Commandos spawn most often in areas of the Dungeon backed by brick walls. They can also spawn in other areas, but with a significantly reduced chance.

The Scythe was an unobtainable weapon in the 1.2 update. It was entirely removed from the Desktop version in the 1.2.4 update although it still exists as an unobtainable item in the Nintendo 3DS version.

The Zombie Arm is a pre-Hardmode sword that deals slightly higher damage than a Tungsten Broadsword, but has less range, knockback, and speed. The Zombie Arm has a 1/250 (0.4%) chance of being dropped by Zombies, Frozen Zombies, and Raincoat Zombies.
Its best modifier is Legendary.

Stardust Dye is a Hardmode, endgame dye crafted using Stardust Fragments obtained from the Stardust Pillar from the Lunar Events. It gives a fade bluish-white color, and it gives a white sparkling effect on the dyed armor pieces and accessories.

The Sky Crate is a pre-Hardmode crate that can only be fished in Space [a], e.g. in Floating Lakes. It contains items found in standard crates and always contains an item normally found in Skyware Chests (with the exception of the Sky Mill). Its Hardmode counterpart is the Azure Crate.
Ancient Silver Brick is a type of brick obtained by throwing Silver Brick into Shimmer. Its appearance is based on the sprite of Silver Brick prior to 1.2.

The Spectre Pickaxe is a Hardmode, post- Plantera pickaxe.  It has a mining range boost of three blocks, giving it a long range compared to most pickaxes.  It can mine any block except Lihzahrd Bricks. Unlike most Hardmode pickaxes, this one has no drill counterpart.
Its best modifier is Legendary. However, due to rounding, Legendary, Light, Deadly, Agile, Quick, and Nasty provide equal boosts to mining speed for this tool.

The Geode is a rare consumable that can be thrown with the ⚒ Use / Attack button, causing them to drop different two types of gems upon impact with blocks. The amount of gems varies from 3 to 6. The Geode has a 1/20 (5%) chance of being dropped by Granite Elementals and Granite Golems.

The Blue Armored Bones is a Hardmode, post- Plantera enemy that spawns in the Dungeon after Plantera is defeated. Similar to Angry Bones, they come in multiple varieties and follow the Fighter AI. They also have a 1/2 (50%) chance to inflict the Broken Armor debuff for 10 / 20 / 25 seconds.
Blue Armored Bones spawn most often in areas of the Dungeon backed by brick walls. They can also spawn in other areas, but with a significantly reduced chance.
The Orange Bloodroot is a type of plant that grows from dirt ceilings in the underground and cavern layers. Its sole purpose is to make Orange Dye.
Antlion Eggs are background objects that are found in naturally-generated clusters in the Underground Desert. They spawn an Antlion Larva when hit with nearly any tool, weapon, or projectile.

The Archery Potion is a buff potion which grants the Archery buff when consumed. The buff increases the damage of arrow -firing weapons by (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) 10% / (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) 20%, as well as the velocity of arrows by 20%. This lasts for 8 minutes (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) / 4 minutes (Old-gen console and 3DS versions), but can be canceled at any time  by right-clicking the icon,  by selecting the icon using Cycle Next/Previous Buff and then pressing Remove Buff,  by selecting the icon and canceling it in the equipment menu,  by double-tapping the buff icon, or  by canceling the buff from the buffs screen.
The Yellow Marigold is a type of plant that grows above-ground on grass in the Forest biome. Its sole purpose is to make Yellow Dye.
Palm Wood Wall is a background wall made from Palm Wood.
Lesion furniture are furniture items crafted from Lesion Blocks at a Decay Chamber, which in turn are crafted from Ebonstone at a Meat Grinder. There are 20 different Lesion furniture items.
The Sand Slime is a pre-Hardmode enemy and a slime variant that spawns in the Underground Desert. It can be recognized by its sandy color and texture.
Sand Slimes can drop a Slime Staff at slightly higher odds than nearly all other slimes, excluding Pinky.
Like most other slimes, the Sand Slime will be passive towards any player with the Royal Gel accessory equipped.

Bottomless Buckets are tools that are capable of placing an infinite amount of liquids by pressing the ⚒ Use / Attack button. There are four different types of Bottomless Buckets, one for each type of liquid: Bottomless Water Bucket, Bottomless Lava Bucket, Bottomless Honey Bucket, and Bottomless Shimmer Bucket.

Bottomless Buckets can be used limitlessly and are never depleted. They are also slightly faster at placing liquids when compared to standard buckets (especially when moving the cursor around while placing).

Lihzahrd furniture are furniture items crafted from Lihzahrd Brick, obtained from the Jungle Temple. There are (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) 19 / (Old-gen console version) 15 / (3DS version) 3 different Lihzahrd furniture items.
Note: A Work Bench ((Old-gen console and 3DS versions) and Chest) is available for this set, but is found in the Jungle Temple only and cannot be crafted.
Mythril Ore is a Hardmode ore that appears in the world every two out of three Demon Altars or Crimson Altars that have been destroyed. Note that its equivalent, Orichalcum Ore, may spawn instead.
Mythril Ore is found throughout the Cavern layer as well as in most Hardmode crates. It requires a pickaxe power of 110 to mine (Cobalt / Palladium pickaxe or better, or any drill).

The Angler is a unique NPC concerned exclusively with fishing. He does not sell anything, but rather assigns quests to players. Quest objectives generally involve catching him rare fish from particular biomes or layers, for which he offers various rewards. He will move in once the following criteria have been met:

There is an available vacant house. Rescuing him as the Sleeping Angler, who can be encountered randomly in the Ocean biome on Sand Blocks or on the surface of the water. Interacting with him in this state with ⚷ Open / Activate will wake him. If the Sleeping Angler is killed, he will still be able to respawn afterwards; if the Angler NPC is killed, he will move in again after some time as long as there are vacant houses.
He will throw Frost Daggerfish at nearby enemies when threatened, dealing 10 / 15 / 17 damage at the start of the game.
Additionally, he will gain various stat increases as the player progresses.
The Sleeping Angler is one of the few entities that can be detected by the Lifeform Analyzer (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) or its upgrades.
The Amethyst Staff is a pre-Hardmode magic weapon, and is the first and weakest tier of gem staff. It fires a non-piercing purple bolt.
(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) Its best modifier is Mythical.

(Old-gen console and 3DS versions) Its best modifier is Godly or Demonic. Both modifiers increase the average damage output by the same amount. It cannot get the Mythical or Masterful modifiers due to its low mana cost.

The term character or avatar refers to the figure controlled by the player through the game controls. All of Terraria 's gameplay revolves around actions performed by the character, and the camera is nearly always locked to place the character in the middle of the screen.
The term player is often used as a synonym with character, but may also refer to the person accessing the game if the topic is unrelated to character mechanics.

Only one character can be played at a given time (in similar fashion to how the player may only access one world at a time), but the player is free to create as many characters as they desire. Characters are not locked to worlds, hence it is, for instance, possible to start playing in a new world with a powerful character from another world.

Items held in any part of the character's inventory (including slots for equipment, armor, ammo, and dyes), or any of the personal portable storage items, are all stored with the character, who will bring them to whatever world they enter.
The Nightmare Pickaxe is a post- Eater of Worlds pickaxe. Its Crimson counterpart is the Deathbringer Pickaxe.

On the Desktop version, Console version, and Mobile version, the Nightmare Pickaxe can mine any blocks and ores weaker than Dungeon Bricks (which requires a pickaxe with at least 100% pickaxe power, e.g. a Molten Pickaxe). Most notably, it can mine Ebonstone, Crimstone, Hellstone, and Pearlstone.
On the Old-gen console version and Nintendo 3DS version, the Nightmare Pickaxe can also mine Dungeon Bricks.
Its best modifier is Light for harvesting purposes and Legendary for combat purposes.
The Summer Hat is a vanity item equipped in the Social Helmet Slot. It is purchased from the Clothier for 1 GC, during the day.
The Frog Gear is an accessory that combines the effects of the Frog Leg, Flipper, and Tiger Climbing Gear.

The Titan Glove is a Hardmode accessory that doubles player-inflicted melee knockback. The Titan Glove has a (Desktop, Console, Mobile and 3DS versions) 1/6 (16.67%) / (Old-gen console version) 1/7 (14.29%) chance of being dropped by Mimics.
(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) It increases the size of melee weapons by 10%.
The Crystal Serpent is a Hardmode magic weapon that can be rarely obtained by fishing in the Hallow biome in any layer.

When used, it fires a magical pink charge that shatters into 3-5 smaller sparks upon impact with an enemy or solid block, each of which deals 80% base damage and knockback (32 base damage and a knockback of 3.52 (Weak)). These sparks are affected by gravity and ricochet against solid blocks, lasting one second before disappearing. When fired at a one-block-thick wall, one of the splash projectiles has a chance of passing through to the other side.
It is the Hallowed counterpart to the Corruption 's Toxikarp and the Crimson 's Bladetongue.
Its best modifier is Mythical.
The Frog is a harmless critter that spawns on the surface Jungle at any time. When in water, frogs will swim along the water's surface. Frogs will occasionally croak when nearby.
The Frog has only 5 health and no defense, and can be damaged by other enemies and players.

The Frog can be caught with any Bug Net to be carried around in the inventory and released later, or crafted into animated decorative furniture (Frog Cage). Once crafted, the Frog cannot be released again, unless the furniture item is de-crafted via Shimmer (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions).
The Frog can be spawned by the Frog Statue, however statue-spawned critters cannot be caught with any Bug Net, and will disappear in a puff of smoke when the player attempts to do so.

On the Desktop version, Console version, and Mobile version, there is a 1/400 (0.25%) chance for a Gold Frog to spawn in place of an ordinary one. There is also a 1/30 (3.33%) chance to spawn a Mystic Frog (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) in place of an ordinary one.

The Flinx Staff is a pre-Hardmode summon weapon that summons a Flinx minion. Upon hitting an enemy, it bounces off creating a small puff of blue smoke where it immediately tries to hit the enemy again. Sometimes it will not bounce far enough away from the enemy, and will deal damage two times within just a few frames. If the player gets too far away, goes behind a wall, or flies up in the air, the Flinx will fly quickly towards the player, moving through any obstacles in the way. Like other minions, the summoned Flinx is invincible and follows the player until they die, summon a replacement minion, cancel the buff, or leave the world.
Visually, the minion looks like a purple-colored Snow Flinx with a bun of fur behind its head.

Its best modifiers are Mythical, Furious, or Godly. Due to its low base damage, all damage-improving modifiers +10% or greater improve its damage by the same amount. A Ruthless Flinx Staff has no lasting advantage over one with other modifiers, as it deals less knockback.
Solar Brick Wall is a background wall made from Solar Bricks.

The Prismatic Lacewing is a rare Hardmode, post- Plantera flying critter and boss-summoning item that spawns on the surface Hallow after Plantera has been defeated. Prismatic Lacewings disappear almost instantaneously when spawned in any other biome, and only spawn in the Hallow between dusk (7:30 PM) and midnight (12:00 AM). When killed by a player, it summons the Empress of Light ; death from non-player sources will generally not result in summoning. Only one Prismatic Lacewing can be naturally spawned at a time.
The Prismatic Lacewing can be caught with Bug Net, Lavaproof Bug Net, and Golden Bug Net. Releasing it from the inventory (with ⚒ Use / Attack) and killing it will still summon the Empress of Light.
It is one of the few entities that can be detected by the Lifeform Analyzer or its upgrades.

Lucy the Axe is a pre-Hardmode axe that has the unique ability of occasionally displaying a line of dialogue depending on certain player actions. Lucy the Axe also has a base 14% critical strike chance, as opposed to the usual 4%. Lucy the Axe has a 1/4 (25%) chance of being dropped by Deerclops.
Its best modifier is Light for harvesting purposes and Legendary for combat purposes.
The Violet Husk is a dye material that is dropped by Lac Beetles, which only spawn in the Underground Jungle. Its sole purpose is to make Violet Dye.

The Molotov Cocktail is a consumable ranged weapon with a relatively short throwing arc. Upon hitting a solid object or enemy, it will explode and release Molotov Fire projectiles, which can pierce up to 2 targets, hitting a total of 3 targets. These smaller projectiles deal damage and inflict the On Fire! debuff on enemies for 3-6 seconds. Its high damage and ability to inflict fire damage make it a powerful early- to mid- pre-Hardmode weapon.

Frozen furniture are furniture items crafted from Ice Blocks at a Ice Machine, which can be found randomly in Frozen Chests. There are (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) 20 / (Old-gen console version) 15 different Frozen furniture items.

The Flipper Potion is a buff potion which grants the Flipper buff when consumed. The buff allows the player to move horizontally and vertically through water, lava, and honey without slowing down, and also allows the player to swim without equipping any swimming accessories, such as the Flipper. This lasts for 8 minutes, but can be canceled at any time  by right-clicking the icon,  by selecting the icon using Cycle Next/Previous Buff and then pressing Remove Buff,  by selecting the icon and canceling it in the equipment menu, or  by double-tapping the buff icon.

The Giant Bow is a festive vanity item that has a 1/20 (5%) chance to drop during Christmas by Present Slimes, which visually have a large bow on. The Bow itself is red, but it can drop from any of the four colors of Present Slime.
When worn in the helmet slot, a bow appears on top of the player's head.
Emotes are small, temporary, animated sprites that appear inside chat bubbles above an entity. They can be used by players, town NPCs, and enemies.

The Palladium Drill is a Hardmode drill, and is the drill alternative to the Palladium Pickaxe. In comparison to the Palladium Pickaxe, the drill is faster. But, unlike pickaxes, drills cannot be reforged with speed modifiers and are not boosted by Mining Speed bonuses.

The Palladium Drill can mine any block with the exception of Adamantite Ore, Titanium Ore, Chlorophyte Ore, and Lihzahrd Bricks. It is capable of mining Adamantite Ore and Titanium Ore on the Nintendo 3DS version.

(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) Its best modifier is Godly or Demonic. Both modifiers increase the average damage output by the same amount. However, Ruthless might be preferred if the player already has very high critical strike chance.

(Old-gen console and 3DS versions) Its best modifier is Demonic, as it does not have any knockback and thus cannot get modifiers that affect it, and furthermore cannot get modifiers that affect its speed, either.

The Picksaw is a Hardmode, post- Golem pickaxe and axe that has a (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) 1/4 (25%) / 1/3 (33.33%), or (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) 1/8 (12.5%) chance of being dropped by Golem. It can mine all blocks in the game.
Its best modifier is Legendary. However, due to rounding, Legendary, Light, Deadly, Agile, Quick, and Nasty provide equal boosts to mining speed for this tool.

The Golfer is an NPC vendor who sells golfing -related items. More items will be unlocked as the player's golf score increases, including clubs, trophies, and paintings. He will move in once the following criteria are met:

There is an available vacant house. Rescuing him as the Golfer Rescue, who can be rarely encountered in the Underground Desert. Interacting with him in this state with ⚷ Open / Activate will free him. If the stationary Golfer is killed, he will still be able to respawn afterwards; if the Golfer NPC is killed, he will move in again after some time as long as there are vacant houses.
The Golfer will attack nearby enemies with his golf balls to defend himself.
He is one of the few entities that can be detected by the Lifeform Analyzer or its upgrades.

The Pew-matic Horn is a pre-Hardmode gun that converts bullets into randomized items fired as projectiles. These projectiles fly in an arc, quickly lose their horizontal speed once shot, are heavily affected by gravity, and dissipate upon contact with an enemy or surface. The damage each bullet will deal changes depending on the visual appearance of the projectile being fired. The type of bullet used does not change the projectiles fired by this weapon. The Pew-matic Horn has a 1/4 (25%) chance of being dropped by Deerclops.
Its best modifier is Unreal.

The Hallowed Jousting Lance is a Hardmode melee weapon. When attacking using ⚒ Use / Attack, the lance will extend, and holding ⚒ Use / Attack will keep it extended at a fixed angle. The damage and knockback will increase depending on the player's movement speed, making mounts, sprinting accessories, or dash abilities (such as those granted by Shield of Cthulhu, Tabi / Master Ninja Gear, or Solar Flare armor) useful for maximizing damage. When the player takes damage, the Hallowed Jousting Lance will stop being active.
It is the upgrade of the Jousting Lance and the precursor to the Shadow Jousting Lance.

Its best modifier is Godly or Demonic. Both modifiers increase the average damage output by the same amount. However, Ruthless might be preferred if the player already has very high critical strike chance.

The Life Preserver is a wall decoration acquired by finishing Angler quests. It is rewarded with a (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) 1/70 (1.43%) / (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) 1/100 (1%) chance.
The Demon Horns are a vanity item purchased from the Traveling Merchant for 2 GC 50 SC.

The Bee Keeper is a pre-Hardmode sword that has a 9/10 (90%) chance of inflicting the Confused debuff to damaged enemies for a 2-second duration and summons 1-3 friendly bee projectiles per enemy struck. The bee projectiles deal 1/3 (33.33%) of the weapon's base damage ((Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) 10 / (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) 7 base damage), and have an additional 1/2 (50%) to deal 1 extra damage. Friendly bees will home in on their closest target and pierce an unlimited number of enemies before dissipating after a 10-second duration, after ricocheting off solid blocks three separate times, or immediately upon contact with water or lava. The Bee Keeper has a 1/3 (33.33%) chance to drop from the Queen Bee.
Its best modifier is Legendary.

The Hexxed Branch is a Hardmode, post- Plantera mount-summoning item that summons a rideable Tree Mount, a ground-based mount that is unable to fly. Upon moving at full speed, the Tree Mount briefly emits an orange ring and deals 120 base summon damage to enemies upon contact. The Hexxed Branch is dropped by the Mourning Wood in Master Mode with a 1/8 (12.5%) - 1/4 (25%) chance depending on the current wave.
Certain NPCs will sell special items if they are spoken to within a specific biome. This is a complete list of all such items.
The Gold Bird is a harmless critter. It is a golden recolor of the ordinary Bird, with a 1/400 (0.25%) chance of spawning in place of the ordinary version.
The Gold Bird has only 5 health and no defense, and can be damaged by other enemies and players.

The Gold Bird can be caught with any Bug Net to be carried around in the inventory and released later, or crafted into animated decorative furniture (Gold Bird Cage). Once crafted, the Gold Bird cannot be released again, unless the furniture item is de-crafted via Shimmer (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions). The Gold Bird itself or the crafted furniture can be sold for 10 GC.
It is one of the few entities that can be detected by the Lifeform Analyzer or its upgrades.

Amethyst is a gem found within the Underground and Cavern layers of a world. They are obtained by breaking special blocks that have noticeable purple gemstones embedded in it. They can also be extracted from Silt, Slush, or Desert Fossil by putting them in an Extractinator. Rarely, Amethyst can be found in bulk in its own Gemstone Cave mini biome, or in one that contains all of the other gems as well (besides Amber). Out of all available gems, Amethyst is the least valuable gem.

On the Desktop version, Console version, and Mobile version, they can be crafted back into their Stone Block forms at a Heavy Work Bench in a Graveyard biome, and can be obtained by cutting down a Amethyst Gem Tree. They also have a 2/7 (28.57%) chance to be dropped by Geodes.
Like all other gems, Amethyst can be placed on blocks.

Grubby is one of three critters that occasionally spawn in the Jungle or Underground Jungle biome when a player breaks a background plant, the others being Sluggy (rarer) and Buggy (rarest). Grubby is the most common of the three. Grubby has only 5 health and no defense, and can be damaged by other enemies and players.

Grubby can be caught with any Bug Net to be carried around in the inventory and released later, or crafted into animated decorative furniture (Grubby Cage). Once crafted,  Grubby cannot be released again, unless the furniture item is de-crafted via Shimmer (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions).
Grubby can be used as bait for fishing, with 15% bait power.
Grubby can be spawned by the Buggy Statue, however statue-spawned critters cannot be caught with any Bug Net, and will disappear in a puff of smoke when the player attempts to do so.
The Mechanical Battery Piece is one of three parts needed to craft the Minecart Upgrade Kit, and is always dropped from Skeletron Prime 's Treasure Bag in Expert Mode.

The Monokuma set is a vanity set exclusive to the Japanese Console and Wii U versions of Terraria that looks like the character of the same name from the video game franchise Danganronpa. It consists of Monokuma Head, Monokuma Body, and Monokuma Legs.
The Reflective Shades are a Hardmode immunity accessory which combines the functions of the Blindfold and the Pocket Mirror, granting immunity to the Darkness and Stoned debuffs.
They are one of the ingredients required to make the Ankh Charm, which is further required to make the Ankh Shield.

Tin Brick is a type of Brick and an aesthetic building material made from Tin Ore. In some worlds it can also be harvested from Jungle Shrines. Like the ore it is made of, placed Tin Bricks will sparkle. As tin becomes fairly useless early in the game, this is an inexpensive ore brick to build with. Despite being made of Tin, it has no sell value, as with most other blocks. Tin Plating is also available as a decorative block, with the same ingredients and color but a different texture.
Threads are crafting materials used primarily in vanity items.

Black Thread and Pink Thread are purchased from the Clothier. Green Thread (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) and Purple Thread (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) are crafted. White Thread is crafted, and is only available in the Japanese Console version. White Thread replaces Green Thread in all Japanese Console crafting recipes. The Japanese Nintendo 3DS version has Purple Thread as in the US.
The Armored Viking is a Hardmode enemy found in the Ice biome. It is similar to the Undead Viking, but has greatly increased defense, damage and health.
The Tax Collector is a Hardmode NPC who taxes other housed NPCs to earn coins for players. He will move in once the following criteria have been met:

There is an available vacant house. Rescuing him by throwing Purification Powder onto a Tortured Soul, a rare enemy that only spawns in The Underworld after the Wall of Flesh has been defeated. After this is done, the Tortured Soul will transform into the Tax Collector. If the Tortured Soul is killed, he will still be able to respawn afterwards; if the Tax Collector NPC is killed, he will move in again after some time as long as there are vacant houses.

When the Tax Collector is present, 50 CC will be earned per real-world minute (each in-game hour), for each NPC that has a house (including the Tax Collector himself but excluding the Old Man, Traveling Merchant, Skeleton Merchant, and town pets). The Tax Collector stores these funds, up to 25 GC. These stats are doubled in Celebrationmk10 and Get fixed boi worlds (i.e. 1 SC per NPC and 50 GC maximum). Speaking to him will reveal the amount stored thus far, and offer the " Collect " option to collect the funds. His tax limit (as well as his current funds and how much he collects per minute) varies depending on his current happiness ; thus, how much he earns per minute will be between 33 CC and 66 CC, while his limit will be between 16 GC 66 SC 66 CC and 33 GC 33 SC 33 CC.
Unlike other town NPCs, the Tax Collector is immune to lava, likely due to being spawned from a Tortured Soul.
The Tax Collector will attack nearby enemies with his Classy Cane, for which he has a 1/8 (12.5%) chance of dropping upon death.

The Blood Squid is a flying Hardmode enemy summoned by the Dreadnautilus during a Blood Moon. It resembles a regular Squid, but is larger, redder-colored, and has multiple eyes on its body, similar to the Drippler. The Dreadnautilus always summons Blood Squids in groups of three.

The Blood Squid attempts to close in on the player before firing a single red Blood Shot projectile at the player, similar to the Dreadnautilus's own Blood Shots, but with higher damage. Like the Dreadnautilus, it recoils after each shot. The shots are inaccurate, which means that its shots could miss even if the player is standing still.
The Slime Block is a type of block crafted using the Solidifier. Walking or landing on Slime Blocks produces droplet particles.

The Ice Queen is a Hardmode, post- Plantera mini-boss that spawns during the Frost Moon event. She is the event's final enemy and can move freely through blocks. She is the equivalent to the Pumpking from the Pumpkin Moon, being the Frost Moon's most powerful enemy, coming in at the last waves of the event, and being the event's only flying boss.
Defeating the Ice Queen during the Frost Moon event will add 150 / 300 / 375 points to the final score, giving the most number of points for any enemy in the event.

The R.E.K. 3000 is a post- Skeletron informational accessory which provides information about the number of nearby enemies, the player's enemy kill count, and nearby rare creatures. It combines the functionalities of its ingredients, the Radar, Tally Counter, and Lifeform Analyzer.

The Sextant is an informational accessory that displays the current moon phase. The Sextant can be received as a 1/34 (2.94%) chance reward for completing a fishing quest for the Angler NPC, depending on the number of completed quests and other factors (for details, see Angler).

The Angler will not give the player a Sextant as a reward if they already have one in their inventory or in any of their portable storage items or loadouts. However, if the player has all of the Angler's fishing and informational accessories (or their upgrades like the Angler Tackle Bag and Fish Finder) in their inventories, this rule will be ignored.

The Sextant is one of the three parts necessary to make the Fish Finder, with the others being the Weather Radio and the Fisherman's Pocket Guide, and as such is a required ingredient in crafting the Shellphone.
The Tattered Wood Sign is a placeable item that functions like the regular Sign. It can be crafted from wood when the player is near a Work Bench in the Graveyard mini-biome.

The Sparkle Slime Balloon is a Hardmode novelty consumable item. When thrown at players, enemies, critters, or NPCs, it will inflict the Sparkle Slime debuff, causing them to become tinted purple and drip with pink slime for 30 seconds. This debuff is only cosmetic and deals no damage. The Diva Slime spawns and moves in after throwing or discarding a Sparkle Slime Balloon into Shimmer.
Queen Slime always drops 25-75 / 25-74 Sparkle Slime Balloons upon her defeat, and they are also dropped by Jungle Mimics, which spawn in Celebrationmk10 and Get fixed boi worlds.

The Hook of Dissonance is a Hardmode grappling hook that fires a single hook that reaches 30 tiles; when the hook attaches to a block, it will instantly teleport the user to the hook's position if the path to the hook is wide enough to fit a player. The Hook of Dissonance has a 1/3 (33.33%) / 1/2 (50%) chance of being dropped by Queen Slime.

The Magical Harp is a Hardmode magic weapon that autofires ricocheting, piercing projectiles that graphically resemble purple musical notes. Each projectile lasts for about four seconds before dissipating and will both ricochet and pierce enemies an unlimited number of times until this time limit is reached. (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) The Magical Harp's musical notes gain a 5% damage penalty for each enemy hit. Notes produce a reasonable amount of purple light and are not affected by gravity.

The speed of each note can be controlled by clicking closer or further away from the character: Closer clicks fire slower-moving notes, and further clicks fire faster notes. The speed at which each note travels does not affect its lifespan; all last about four seconds. The Magical Harp also plays sound while firing that resembles plucked strings, with a pitch that correlates to the weapon's firing speed: firing slowly produces lower-pitched sounds, and faster firings produce higher-pitched sounds.
(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) Its best modifier is Mythical.
(Old-gen console and 3DS versions) Its best modifier is Demonic or Deadly for damage output, or Mystic for mana conservation because it cannot get modifiers that affect knockback.

The Water Sphere is a projectile NPC that is fired by the Dark Casters in a volley of three, before teleporting to a different location and firing another volley. It moves steadily in a straight line at 31 mph, passes through blocks unimpeded, and emits a fair amount of light. It can be easily destroyed by hitting it with any weapon or tool capable of dealing damage.
The Soul Scythe was an unobtainable weapon exclusive to the Desktop version. It was removed entirely in the 1.2.2 update.
Arcane Rune Wall is a background wall that is purchased from the Traveling Merchant for 2 SC 50 CC each. It is one of the few animated walls, as the runes displayed change every few seconds.

The Hemogoblin Shark is a Hardmode enemy that can be spawned by fishing in water during a Blood Moon. When the bobber dips and the player attempts to reel in a fish, a Hemogoblin Shark or another enemy has a chance to spawn within a few tiles of the bobber in place of a fish. The Hemogoblin Shark can move extraordinarily fast on land, swim quickly in water, jump very high, and can fire a barrage of Blood Shot projectiles.

It is one of the few entities that can be detected by the Lifeform Analyzer or its upgrades. The Hemogoblin Shark requires 25 kills to be awarded completion of its Bestiary entry and corresponding banner, as opposed to the usual 50 kills.

The World Feeder is a Hardmode worm -like enemy which spawns in The Corruption, and can be considered the Hardmode counterpart of the Devourer, though it is not as common and has an eyeball on every segment of its body. Loot is dropped from the head segment, so it can get stuck and buried deep in blocks if one of the main body parts is killed first.

Ropes are placeable items that primarily provide quick vertical mobility. They can be placed adjacent to blocks in any direction, or in midair where background walls are present. Once placed, Ropes are used by pressing ▲ Up or ▼ Down while moving over them. Streamers and Chains operate identically to Rope, but cannot be crafted into Rope Coils.
All Rope variants operate identically, but Silk and Web Ropes are immune to falling lava, as opposed to normal and Vine Ropes, which will be dislodged similarly to Torches.
All ropes are acquired in different ways:

Rope can be found randomly in Chests and Pots, as a bonus drop (Desktop, Console, Mobile and 3DS versions) from slimes, or purchased from the Merchant and Skeleton Merchant for 10 CC each. Vine Rope is acquired by destroying vines while the Guide to Plant Fiber Cordage is equipped. Silk Rope is crafted from one Silk at the Loom. Web Rope is crafted from one Cobweb by hand.

Visually, the player appears to move along a Rope using a mechanical tool with wheels, as though they were riding a rail. This tool appears automatically when using Rope, does not exist as a separate item, and is available from the beginning of the game.

Vertical movement speed on a Rope equals that of a free fall, though moving down via the Rope and hitting the ground does not cause fall damage. Horizontal movement is also possible by placing adjacent Rope horizontally, but is much slower. Rope can be placed atop any existing placed Rope, which extends the total length of the rope downward without the player having to be at the bottom of the Rope column.
All Rope types can be crafted into their respective Rope Coils, consumable items useful for placing Ropes in inaccessible locations.

Mud Blocks are a very common block type that comprises the majority of the Jungle, Underground Jungle, and Glowing Mushroom biome. It also generates in irregular patches in the Cavern layer. Mud Blocks may be covered by Jungle grass, Mushroom grass, (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) Corrupt grass, or Crimson grass on any side, which can be planted with Jungle Grass Seeds, Mushroom Grass Seeds, (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) Corrupt Seeds, and Crimson Seeds. Only Jungle grass and Mushroom grass are incapable of growing on Dirt Blocks.
Bernie's Button is a Hardmode, post- Plantera pet-summoning item that summons a Bernie pet to follow the player around. Bernie's Button can be purchased from the Princess for 25 GC.

The Paladin is a rare, resilient Hardmode, post- Plantera enemy that spawns in the Dungeon after Plantera is defeated. It is immune to knockback and attacks by rapidly throwing hammer projectiles which can pass through blocks and inflict extreme damage.

It is one of the few entities that can be detected by the Lifeform Analyzer (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) or its upgrades. The Paladin requires 25 kills to be awarded completion of its Bestiary entry and corresponding banner, as opposed to the usual 50 kills.
Paladins spawn most often in areas of the Dungeon backed by brick walls. They can also spawn in other areas, but with a significantly reduced chance.

The Demon Conch is a rare pre-Hardmode tool obtainable by fishing in lava. When used, it teleports the player to the center of the Underworld. Like the Magic Mirror, it can be used infinitely at no cost, making it a viable alternative to using conventional hellevators.

The Unholy Arrow is a type of arrow. The Unholy Arrow can pierce up to 4 targets, hitting a total of 5 targets. The damage of the Unholy Arrow decreases by 5% for each target it pierces. Against enemies with multiple segments, like the Eater of Worlds, a single Unholy Arrow can damage multiple segments. (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) A fired Unholy Arrow has a 1/4 (25%) chance of being recoverable after hitting an enemy or block.

In addition to being crafted, Unholy Arrows are dropped by the Eye of Cthulhu in worlds that generated with Corruption. Furthermore, they can be purchased from the Arms Dealer at night for 40 CC once the Eater of Worlds or Brain of Cthulhu has been defeated. After activating Hardmode, they become available during the day as well.

The Luminite Drills are four tools, all of which have the same stats. The four types are the Vortex Drill, Nebula Drill, Solar Flare Drill, and the Stardust Drill, each themed after a different Celestial Pillar.

Unlike all other drills, Luminite Drills can be reforged with size and speed modifiers, but this is made irrelevant by the fact that they cannot benefit from them, thus, a drill with Deadly or Light mines just as fast as one with no modifier.

Their best modifier is Godly or Demonic. Both modifiers increase the average damage output by the same amount. However, Ruthless might be preferred if the player already has very high critical strike chance.
This is a list of potions that grant buffs. Also see Flasks.
The Snow Hat is a vanity item dropped from Presents obtained during the Christmas event, with a chance of 1.08% in pre-Hardmode and 1.001% in Hardmode.

The Twinkle Popper is a Hardmode, post- Lunatic Cultist enemy that spawns in the area of the Stardust Pillar during the Lunar Events. In addition to dealing contact damage, the Twinkle Popper can attack the player by vomiting up smaller enemies called Twinkles, which run around and can explode into a fountain of damaging sparkles when close to the player or after enough time has passed.

The Pirate Map is a Hardmode event-summoning item used to summon a Pirate Invasion. The Pirate Map has a 1/100 (1%) chance of dropping from most enemies killed in the surface Ocean biome during Hardmode (see Notes for more details).
In order for it to be used, at least one player must have 200 health or more.

Chlorophyte Ore is a Hardmode ore found in the Underground Jungle that is used to craft Chlorophyte Bars. When Hardmode starts, Mud Blocks located near Jungle grass blocks (i.e., most often only in the Underground Jungle) will begin to convert themselves into Chlorophyte Ore. A pickaxe or drill with at least 200% pickaxe power is required to mine it, meaning it requires the Pickaxe Axe or Drax at the very least, whose materials require defeating all three mechanical bosses (although on 3DS, the Drax can sometimes be found in Shadow Chests).

Chlorophyte Ore will slowly spread itself by converting adjacent Mud and Jungle grass blocks into more Chlorophyte Ore, growing to large deposits over time. Chlorophyte Bricks also have the ability to spread Chlorophyte Ore. This growing feature allows Chlorophyte Ore to be "replanted" and artificially seeded for a nearly renewable source of Chlorophyte. On the Desktop version, Console version, and Mobile version, Chlorophyte will also attempt to spread by converting nearby Dirt Blocks to Mud, as well as blocks of Corrupt, Crimson, Hallowed, and regular grass to Jungle grass.

Chlorophyte Ore can only spread and convert blocks if it is in or below the bottom half of the Underground layer (in a regular world). It can only spread itself to directly adjacent tiles (and only if there is not too much Chlorophyte nearby already) and can only convert tiles up to five tiles away.

The Land Mine is a unique Hardmode, post- Plantera placeable item. They remain dormant once placed, until a character touches them or they are activated by Wire, at which point they explode, dealing 250 damage. They are purchased from the Demolitionist for 5 GC each, after Plantera and at least one Pirate Invasion have been defeated. In the Old-gen console version, Land Mines can be purchased before Plantera is defeated, but only at night ; once Plantera is defeated, they will be available at all times.

The Flask of Party is a flask that causes melee weapons and whips (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) to create bursts of confetti when hitting enemies. The confetti is purely cosmetic and does not provide damage bonuses. Melee weapons that fire projectiles will also create confetti when the projectiles hit enemies (except for the Flairon 's bubbles).

The Flask of Party cannot be used in conjunction with other flasks, and using it will remove any existing flask effects. (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) Like all other flasks, the effect will not be canceled when the player dies.

Loadouts are a feature that allows the player to conveniently and quickly switch between three sets of armor and accessories, as well as the corresponding dyes and vanity/social slots. They are available to players immediately upon character creation and do not need to be unlocked.

The Inner Tube is an accessory that causes the player to float on the surface of liquids instead of sinking to the bottom. The effect can be temporarily negated by holding ▼ Down. The Inner Tube has a 9/40 (22.5%) chance of being found in Water Chests, Ocean Crates, and Seaside Crates.
The Inner Tube's effects are replaced with the Flipper 's effect if the player is holding a Trident. Neptune's Shell and its derivative accessories will override the Inner Tube's effects entirely.

The Magic Mirror is a unique tool that returns a player to their spawn point. When used, a short animation plays before it instantly teleports the user to their set spawn point; if the player has previously used a Bed they will appear in front of it, but if no valid Bed is found the player will instead return to the world's spawn point. This teleportation occurs at no cost, and can be repeated indefinitely without consuming the mirror.
The Ice Mirror (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) is a variation on the Magic Mirror. Aside from appearance, it is identical to an ordinary Magic Mirror in every capacity.

Magic Mirrors can be found in Chests generated in the Underground and Cavern layers. Ice Mirrors can be found in Frozen Chests generated in the Ice biome. The Magic Mirror is also part of the equipment new Journey Mode (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) characters receive in their inventory.

The Magic Mirror and Ice Mirror can be combined with the PDA (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) to craft the Cell Phone (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), and as such is a necessary ingredient in crafting the Shellphone (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions).
The Nurse set is a vanity set that resembles the Nurse 's clothes. It is sold by the Arms Dealer during Halloween for 9 GC (set). It consists of the Nurse Hat, Nurse Shirt, and Nurse Pants.
These items are to be equipped in the Social Slots as they only provide a visual appearance.
The Silly Tied Bundle of Balloons is an animated novelty furniture item crafted from green, purple, and pink Silly Tied Balloons, which can be purchased during a Party from the Party Girl.

The Luminite Arrow is a Hardmode, post- Moon Lord arrow. When fired, it is followed by a bolt projectile after about 0.5 seconds. The arrows and lasers have a fast velocity and can pierce through three enemies, dissipating upon impact of the fourth.

The Cluster Rocket I is a type of rocket ammunition. Unlike the Cluster Rocket II, it does not destroy tiles. Unique from other rockets, cluster rockets shoot out shrapnel that create several secondary explosions which deal half of the base damage.
It can be purchased from the Cyborg for 7 SC 50 CC each after completing the Martian Madness event.

The Hanging Brazier is a placeable decorative furniture item. It can only be placed on the ceiling, and breaking one of the blocks above it will drop the item. The Hanging Brazier is a valid light source for NPC housing.

The Eye of the Golem is a Hardmode, post- Golem accessory that grants +10% critical strike chance. It has a (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) 1/7 (14.29%) / (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) 1/8 (12.5%) chance of being dropped by Golem.

Tables are a type of furniture which can be placed on the ground, commonly used in conjunction with chairs. They count as a flat surface item, which is one of the required elements in order to make a house. They can also form a crafting station when combined with a chair.

There are (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) 43 craftable tables, and 6 tables that must be looted from specific areas within the world. Some tables can also be found in Underground Cabins, in which they follow the theme of the cabin they are in.
The Sapphire Robe is an armor item that can be worn in the shirt slot. It is part of the Wizard set and is the third weakest type of gem robe.

Wearing the Wizard Hat alongside the Sapphire Robe provides a set bonus of +10% magic critical strike chance, whereas wearing a Magic Hat alongside it provides a set bonus of +60 mana. Any leg-slot equipment can be worn with these set bonuses remaining intact.

The Cannon is a Hardmode placeable furniture / weapon, purchased from the Pirate for 25 GC. Once placed, it can be fired by pressing ⚒ Use / Attack key on it with a Cannonball in hand, by pressing the Auto Select key with a Cannonball in the player's inventory, or tapping the Cannon with a Cannonball in hand. In either case, the Cannonball is consumed, and the Cannon fires an arcing Cannonball that does not destroy blocks and explodes upon contact with a solid block or after piercing three enemies.

The angle of a placed Cannon can be adjusted by pressing ⚷ Open / Activate key on either side of the Cannon to rotate it in that direction, or tapping the side of the Cannon. There are 9 possible orientations and it cannot fire downward, though the arcing trajectory of the Cannonballs can be used to hit targets below the emplacement. Each rotation tilts the Cannon by one step (22.5°).

(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) The Cannon can also be triggered by wire. Depending on where the wire is connected, it will either shoot a Cannonball (with a cooldown of 0.5 seconds) or rotate toward the side the wire is on. Cannonballs fired in this way are mostly aesthetic, dealing no damage or knockback, but will still trigger a Teal Pressure Pad if it hits one.

The Wooden Arrow is the most basic type of arrow. It can be used as ammunition for all types of bows and is also the base of the crafting recipes for several more powerful arrow types. Wooden Arrows can be crafted, found in Pots and Chests, dropped by Pincushion Zombies, and purchased from the Merchant for 5 CC each. They can also be purchased from the Skeleton Merchant (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) during moon phases 3, 4, 7, and 8.

When shot with certain bows, regular Wooden Arrows will transform into another special projectile (such as the Molten Fury, which will transform them into a version of Flaming Arrows). Some other bows, such as the Pulse Bow (Desktop, Console, Old-gen console and Mobile versions), convert any type of arrow to their special variant.

Nebula armor is a Hardmode, post- Moon Lord armor set that provides magic weapon boosts. It is currently the final magic set available on the Desktop version, Console version, and Mobile version. Crafting the full set requires a total of 36 Luminite Bars (144 Luminite) and 45 Nebula Fragments.
The set consists of the Nebula Helmet, Nebula Breastplate, and Nebula Leggings.
A full set of Nebula armor provides the following bonuses:
+60 maximum mana +26% magic damage +16% magic critical strike chance −15% mana usage +10% movement speed

Equipping the full set grants a chance that special "booster" items will appear when striking enemies with magic weapons. Each booster grants a buff that lasts 8 seconds and causes a spark effect to float around the player. When a booster item is picked up while an identical buff is already in effect, it stacks with the previous buff, for up to 3 stacked boosts. Every 8 seconds, one stacked booster expires and the buff decreases by one level. Booster items float in the air and have a greater pickup range than most items.

In multiplayer, any player can pick up these booster items and benefit from their buffs, even if they are not wearing Nebula armor. Additionally, picking up a booster item will grant nearby players (within a 43.75-tile radius) one instance of the buff. If the player acquiring the booster is on a team, only other players within that team will obtain the buff; otherwise, unaffiliated players will spread the buff to all other nearby players upon obtaining a booster.
Crystal furniture are furniture items crafted from Crystal Blocks, which in turn are crafted from Crystal Shards and Stone Blocks at Hardmode Forges. There are 20 different Crystal furniture items.

The Void Vault is a placeable portable storage item that extends the player's inventory in a manner similar to the Piggy Bank, Safe, and Defender's Forge. Like all other storage items, the Void Vault provides 40 slots of storage.

The Void Vault can also be accessed via the Void Bag, similar to the way a player can access the Piggy Bank using a Money Trough.
