When the player's inventory is full and a Void Bag is present in the inventory, newly collected items are placed in the Void Vault (indicated by purple pickup text). If the Void Bag in the player's inventory is opened, it also allows the player to interact with the items inside the Void Vault as if they were in the main inventory without opening the storage interface. See Void Bag § Notes for details.
Shimmering is a unique debuff. It is inflicted when an entity is submerged in Shimmer, or when the player's fishing pole's bobber touches Shimmer.

When an non-player entity is inflicted with the debuff, they will start turning transparent and become completely invisible, then become more and more opaque. If it has any special transmutations, it will transform into the respective entity/item when it is almost invisible. Entities that are immune to this debuff will not gain these effects.

When a player is inflicted with the debuff, they will enter a Shimmering state, which will make them unable to move or use items, become invincible to non-boss attacks, and start going down through all solid tiles that intersect with the player, until they reach a 2x3 opening or the Underworld layer. There is also an "unstuck" mechanic to prevent the player from being in the Shimmering state for too long.
See Notes for details about the effects of Shimmering.

Equipping the Chromatic Cloak will grant the player a more controllable Shimmering. They will not be inflicted with Shimmering instantly when touching Shimmer, and instead they can enter the Shimmering state at anytime by holding ▼ Down. However, after entering the Shimmering state, there is no other way to interrupt it, not even re-equipping the Chromatic Cloak.

Bosses are aggressive, resilient enemies intended to offer a substantial challenge to players. Defeating a boss is usually instrumental in advancing the game in some way or another, such as granting the player a new material for a pickaxe of a higher tier. Each has its own particular way of being summoned. For example, most bosses have associated summoning items that can be used to spawn them manually under certain conditions, while there are others that will appear after the player interacts in a certain way with the environment. Event bosses only appear during their respective events and leave when the event ends. Mini-bosses appear only during special events, expressing the same amount of difficulty as many normal bosses. The health of bosses has a huge range: In Classic Mode it ranges from 1,000 to 145,000.

Most bosses and mini-bosses can pass through blocks of all types, with the exception of King Slime, Queen Slime (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), Lepus (3DS version), Turkor the Ungrateful's (3DS version) body, and the Flying Dutchman (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions).

For all non-event bosses, with the exception of the Lunatic Cultist (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), status messages appear when that boss is about to spawn or has already spawned. Upon spawning, its particular theme music plays. During events, bosses and mini-bosses can appear multiple times and have no distinct spawn message. In the case of wave events like the Pumpkin Moon, Frost Moon, and Old One's Army (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), status messages that appear at the start of each wave can indicate whether or not a certain boss or mini-boss will appear. Defeating a non-event boss concludes with a congratulatory message and several reward items.

On the Desktop version, Console version, and Mobile version, bosses appear on the minimap, each with a unique map icon and boss health bar that appear on the screen. The boss health bar only shows the health of the most recently-attacked boss if there are multiple. On the Old-gen console version, bosses appear as the standard purple blob that signifies enemies.
There are 8 pre-Hardmode bosses, 10 Hardmode bosses, 14 event bosses, and 1 secret world seed boss.

The Banana Split is a food item that grants the Plenty Satisfied buff when consumed. This lasts for 10 minutes, but can be canceled at any time  by right-clicking the icon,  by selecting the icon using Cycle Next/Previous Buff and then pressing Remove Buff, or  by double-tapping the buff icon. The Banana Split has a 1/50 (2%) chance of being dropped by Antlions, Antlion Chargers, and Antlion Swarmers.
Like all other food items, the Banana Split can be placed on a Plate :

The Floret Protector set is a vanity set consisting of the Floret Protector Helmet, the Floret Protector Shirt, and the Floret Protector Pants. It is one of the six sets that were added as part of the Journey's End Vanity Contest ; the original concept was submitted by yikescloud.
These items are to be equipped in the Social Slots as they only provide a visual appearance.
Gold armor is the fourth armor set in the game.

It takes a total of (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) 75 / (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) 90 Gold Bars to craft a full suit, or (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) 300 / (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) 360 Gold Ores.
It consists of a Gold Helmet, Gold Chainmail and Gold Greaves.

The Ancient Gold Helmet is functionally identical to the Gold Helmet. The two helmets are interchangeable, with no bonus loss. The Ancient Gold Helmet has a 1/100 (1%) chance of being dropped by Skeletons and Spore Skeletons (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), and can also be obtained by dropping a Gold Helmet into Shimmer (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions).
A full set grants a basic 13 defense plus a set bonus of 3 defense, which equals a total of 16 defense.

Lunar Fragments are Hardmode, post- Lunatic Cultist crafting materials dropped by the Celestial Pillars during the Lunar Events. There are four distinct types of fragments, each dropped by, and corresponding to, one of the Celestial Pillars. They are primarily used at the Ancient Manipulator crafting station to craft several powerful late-game items, including armor, weapons, tools, wings, and others.

In addition to being dropped, a single fragment can be crafted by combining one of each of the other three types. For example, if a player were missing a Solar Fragment but had a surplus of all the other types, they could combine a Vortex Fragment, Nebula Fragment, and Stardust Fragment into one Solar Fragment. This is done at the Ancient Manipulator.
The Fake Unicorn Horn is a vanity accessory purchased from the Traveling Merchant for 2 GC 50 SC.

The Pharaoh's set is a vanity set consisting of the Pharaoh's Mask and the Pharaoh's Robe. It can be found in chests in Pyramids. On the Desktop version, Console version, and Mobile version, it can also be obtained by throwing a Sandstorm in a Bottle and a Flying Carpet into Shimmer to get each respective vanity piece.
These items are to be equipped in the Social Slots as they only provide a visual appearance.

The BBQ Ribs are a Hardmode food item that grant the Exquisitely Stuffed buff when consumed. This lasts for 24 minutes, but can be canceled at any time  by right-clicking the icon,  by selecting the icon using Cycle Next/Previous Buff and then pressing Remove Buff, or  by double-tapping the buff icon. The BBQ Ribs have a 1/21 (4.76%) chance of being dropped by Skeleton Commandos, Skeleton Snipers, and Tactical Skeletons, and a 1/7 (14.29%) chance of being dropped by Paladins.
Like all other food items, the BBQ Ribs can be placed on a Plate :

The Ball O' Hurt is a pre-Hardmode flail that emits small particles similar to those of other objects in the Corruption. The Ball O' Hurt has a 1/5 (20%) chance of being obtained from destroying Shadow Orbs found in the Corruption or a 1/5 (20%) chance from Corrupt Crates (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) and Defiled Crates (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), which are fished in the Corruption.
It is particularly useful when fighting worm-type enemies or the Eater of Worlds boss, since it does relatively constant damage to the multiple segments.

Its best modifier is Godly or Demonic. Both modifiers increase the average damage output by the same amount. However, Ruthless might be preferred if the player already has very high critical strike chance.

The Steak is a food item that grants the Exquisitely Stuffed buff when consumed. This lasts for 16 minutes, but can be canceled at any time  by right-clicking the icon,  by selecting the icon using Cycle Next/Previous Buff and then pressing Remove Buff, or  by double-tapping the buff icon. The Steak has a 1/100 (1%) chance of being dropped by The Possessed and a 1/10 (10%) chance of being dropped by Undead Miners.
Like all other food items, the Steak can be placed on a Plate :
The Marble Block is a natural block found in Marble Caves. It can be crafted into Smooth Marble Blocks in order to craft the Marble-themed furniture set.
The Adamantite Glaive is a Hardmode spear. Its alternate ore counterpart is the Titanium Trident.

Its best modifier is Godly or Demonic. Both modifiers increase the average damage output by the same amount. However, Ruthless might be preferred if the player already has very high critical strike chance.

The Crawltipede is a Hardmode, post- Lunatic Cultist, worm enemy that spawns in the area of the Solar Pillar during the Lunar Events. Uniquely, it has no visible health bar, and its tail is the only segment that is vulnerable to attacks, which takes 10x damage. It flies directly at airborne players and deals high damage while ignoring players on the ground. The Crawltipede's primary role seems to be forcing the player to stay near the ground, opening them up to melee attacks from the other Solar Pillar enemies.

The Shuriken is a consumable ranged weapon. It can pierce up to 3 targets, hitting a total of 4 targets. Shurikens can be found in Pots and Chests around the world, and can be purchased from the Merchant for 15 CC each.
(Old-gen console and 3DS versions) Shurikens have a 1/2 (50%) chance of being retrievable again after use, even if they have hit enemies.

The Heavy Work Bench is a crafting station used to make various building materials, decorative items and mechanisms. It is not an upgrade for the standard Work Bench, nor does it qualify as a flat surface item for NPC housing.
The Zoologist is an NPC vendor who sells animal-related items and vanity. She will move in once the following criteria have been met:
There is an available vacant house. The Bestiary has been filled to at least 10% (54 entries).
She sells a large variety of vanity items, in addition to many mounts and pets, critter-themed accessories, and the Universal Pylon, depending on the Bestiary's completion percentage.

The Zoologist will transform into a werefox during a full moon or Blood Moon. Apart from having a different sprite and quotes, there is no difference between her normal and transformed state. When transformed, the Zoologist's minimap icon also does not change, and she will revert to normal at dawn (4:30 AM).
The Zoologist will attack nearby enemies with her claws to defend herself. The color of the claw attack turns from green to red when she is transformed.

The Bunny Hood is a vanity headgear item. It has a 1/75 (1.33%) chance of being dropped by Corrupt Bunnies and Vicious Bunnies (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions). On the Nintendo 3DS version, it can also be dropped by Diseaster Bunnies or Lepus.
The Ammo Box is a furniture item. It can be purchased (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) from the Arms Dealer for 10 GC in Hardmode.

Placing and pressing ⚷ Open / Activate on the Ammo Box grants the Ammo Box buff, which provides ranged weapons with a 1/5 (20%) chance per shot not to consume ammunition. On the Desktop version, Console version, and Mobile version, this lasts until the player dies or leaves the world. On the Old-gen console version, it lasts for 10 minutes. On all versions, the buff can be canceled at any time  by right-clicking the icon,  by selecting the icon using Cycle Next/Previous Buff and then pressing Remove Buff,  by selecting the icon and canceling it in the equipment menu, or  by double-tapping the buff icon.

Unlike equipment buff items, the Ammo Box must be placed in order to activate the buff. It can be mined with a pickaxe or drill and picked up again, even while the buff is active, which will not cancel the buff. Placement is only dependent on an adequate space of 2x2 tiles being available.

Banners are decorative furniture items that can be placed on the underside of blocks. Many are found naturally-placed in various biomes. There are also four crafted banners (Red, Green, Blue, and Yellow). Banners can be hung off of blocks and off of platforms which are in (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) any position / (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) their bottom position (after being struck three times with a hammer).

Faction flags are banners found in the Dungeon. In post- Plantera worlds, the faction flags found hanging in a particular Dungeon area correspond to the background wall type (brick, slab, or tile), both of which signify the types of enemies that will spawn there. See Hardmode Dungeon for more info.
There are a total of 23 decorative banners: 4 crafted, 6 faction flags, 3 Floating Island, 6 Underworld, 3 Pyramid, and 1 dropped from the Dark Mage during the Old One's Army event.

The Sun Stone is a Hardmode, post- Golem accessory which has a (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) 1/7 (14.29%) / (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) 1/8 (12.5%) chance of being dropped by Golem. It grants the same stat bonuses as the Moon Stone ; however, these bonuses only activate during the day.
The stat bonuses are:
+10% melee speed +10% damage (all types) +2% critical strike chance +1 HP/s health regeneration +4 defense +15% mining speed +0.5 summon knockback

The Flame Trap is a trap found naturally in the Jungle Temple. When activated, it fires a jet of fire, which has a range of 20 (47) tiles, and can pierce an infinite number of targets. It has a cooldown of (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) 3.33 seconds / (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) 3 seconds between firings. The flame deals 80 / 160 / 240 damage to players (40 damage to NPCs, enemies, and critters).
(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) Flame Traps can be rotated 90° with a hammer.
(Old-gen console and 3DS versions) Unlike Lihzahrd Bricks, breaking Flame Traps does not require the Picksaw.
Status messages display as chat lines in the lower-left of the game screen when certain conditions apply.

They all have one of the 7 colors that the game uses and a player can replicate them in chat using this formula [c/XXXXXX:]. Write the desired text to color after the colon and enter a hexadecimal color code in the place of "XXXXXX". For more see Announcement Box.

Wet is a visual flavor debuff which causes water to drip down the character model. This debuff can be inflicted on any enemy, NPC, or player. The debuff does not cause any damage. Being inflicted with the debuff triggers the effects of the Cute Fishron (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) being underwater.

Shields are a type of defensive accessory. The shields shown on this page slightly increase the player's defense. Most shields can grant immunity to knockback and synergize with the Brand of the Inferno (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) and Sergeant United Shield (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions).

The Spider Egg is a Hardmode, post- Plantera pet-summoning item that spawns a Pet Spider to follow the player around. The Pet Spider climbs on background walls and has similar behavior to the Spider AI. When the player is far enough away or in midair, the Pet Spider rides on a white spiderweb, as if it were standing on a wall, to keep up with the player. The Spider Egg is dropped by the Pumpking during the Pumpkin Moon event with a 2.5-12.5% (6.25-12.5%) chance depending on the current wave.

Tiki armor is a Hardmode post- Plantera armor set purchased from the Witch Doctor for 1 PC 50 GC (set). On the Old-gen console version and Nintendo 3DS version, the Pygmy Staff must be in the player's inventory in order for the Witch Doctor to sell the armor.
A full set of Tiki armor provides the following benefits:
+35 defense +4 minion slots +30% summon damage (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) +30% whip range
With all pieces equipped, an additional 4 minions can be summoned (for a total of 5).

The Ice Wall is a type of background wall which can be found naturally generated in the Ice biome, considered unsafe. It does not drop as an item when destroyed, and can only be obtained on Desktop, Console, and Mobile, via crafting. It is considered a safe wall when placed by the player.

The Imp Staff is a pre-Hardmode summon weapon that spawns a miniature Flying Imp minion that follows the player around and shoots fireballs at enemies. The Imp's fireballs always inflict the On Fire! debuff for 3-6 seconds, and travel in a straight line, piercing up to 4 enemies. Like other minions, the summoned Imp is invincible and follows the player until they die, summon a replacement minion, cancel the buff, or leave the world.

(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) Its best modifiers are Mythical, Furious, or Godly. Rounding reveals that these modifiers provide the same increase to damage as the Ruthless modifier, increasing it from 17 to 20.

(Old-gen console version) Its best modifier is Ruthless. The Mythical modifier provides the widest array of stat bonuses, but these primarily affect the initial summon rather than the resulting minion. Additionally, minions cannot deal critical hits. The only lasting advantage a Mythical Imp Staff has over a Ruthless one is knockback.

The Shimmer Slime is a pre-Hardmode enemy and a slime variant that cannot be found naturally, and is instead created when most varieties of slimes come into contact with Shimmer. Shimmer Slimes have the ability to reflect projectiles, similarly to Shimmer itself. For the complete list, see the list of reflected projectiles.
Like most other slimes, the Shimmer Slime will be passive towards any player with the Royal Gel accessory equipped.

The Tattered Bee Wing is a rare Hardmode crafting material dropped by Moss Hornets with a (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) 1/100 (1%) / (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) 1/150 (0.67%) chance. It is used solely to craft Bee Wings.
On the Desktop version, Console version, and Mobile version, at least one mechanical boss must be defeated before it will drop.
The Tungsten Bar is an early-game metal bar, used to create the Tungsten tier of equipment. Its alternate ore version is the Silver Bar. It can also be placed on the ground, like furniture.

The Obsidian Shield is a shield and immunity accessory made from the Cobalt Shield and Obsidian Skull, and combines their functionality as well as their defense boosts. It grants immunity from knockback, as well as immunity from the Burning debuff, and provides 2 defense.

The Etherian Javelin is an unobtainable item resembling the weapons used by Etherian Javelin Throwers. It only exists as an ID and an image in the game's files. Attempting to use third-party tools to obtain it will result in it instantly disappearing.

The Gray Zapinator is a pre-Hardmode -only magic weapon that can be purchased from the Traveling Merchant for 17 GC. It is only available once the Eye of Cthulhu, Eater of Worlds, Brain of Cthulhu, Queen Bee, or Skeletron has been defeated. Unlike the Zapinator, the Gray Zapinator does not autofire. Meteor armor 's set bonus will reduce the mana cost of the Gray Zapinator (and Orange Zapinator) to 0, although the stated mana cost will not change.

The weapon fires a blue laser beam that behaves very erratically. Upon striking an enemy, the projectile slows down by 40%, decreases its current damage and knockback by 10%, and can choose from an assortment of special effects as described below. The laser beam will disappear after hitting eight enemies or after 60 seconds.
Its best modifier is Mythical.
The Scorpion and Black Scorpion are harmless critters that are most commonly found in a Desert. For detailed spawning conditions, see Notes.
Scorpions have only 5 health and no defense, and can be damaged by other enemies and players.

Scorpions can be caught with any Bug Net to be carried around in the inventory and released later, or crafted into animated decorative furniture (Scorpion / Black Scorpion Cage). Once crafted, the Scorpions cannot be released again, unless the furniture item is de-crafted via Shimmer (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions).
Scorpions can be used as bait for fishing, with 10% (regular) / 15% (black) bait power.
Scorpions can be spawned by the Scorpion Statue, however statue-spawned critters cannot be caught with any Bug Net, and will disappear in a puff of smoke when the player attempts to do so.

The Falcon Blade is a pre-Hardmode sword that has very short range but has high attack speed and decent knockback, which makes it useful until late pre-Hardmode. On the Desktop version, Console version, and Mobile version, the Falcon Blade is capable of autoswing. The Falcon Blade has a 38/625 (6.08%) chance of being obtained from Iron Crates and a 299/5000 (5.98%) chance from Mythril Crates (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions).
Its best modifier is Legendary.

Sofas are vanity furniture items. There are currently (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) 38 / (Old-gen console version) 21 craftable sofas and 5 noncraftable sofas. All are functionally identical, and differ only in their appearance. Sofas count as a comfort item, which is one of the required elements in order to make a house for an NPC.

(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) Players can sit in sofas by pressing the ⚷ Open / Activate button on them. Players can choose to sit on the left, middle, or right positions, and thus up to 3 players can sit on a sofa at a time. Sitting on sofas gives a boost to health regeneration, similar to chairs and beds.

The Bee is a small pre-Hardmode flying enemy that usually appears in the Underground Jungle. They can be spawned by the Queen Bee, and will also appear when destroying Bee Hives and occasionally when mining Hive blocks (which are mainly found in Bee Hive biomes). They attack by flying into their target, dealing contact damage. In Expert Mode (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), Bees will inflict players with the Poisoned debuff for 2-6 / 2.5-7.5 seconds.

On the Desktop version, Console version, and Mobile version, Bees can also damage other enemies. Bees can select any enemy (except themselves and the Queen Bee) or the player as their target, and they always attack the nearest target. Bees deal 100% of their contact damage to the target but will also take 100% of contact damage from said target.

The Solar Eruption is a Hardmode, post- Lunatic Cultist melee weapon that fires a long whipsword from the player's position. The whipsword moves in a narrow arc in the direction of the cursor before quickly retracting. It can pass through blocks and pierce infinitely. The whipsword creates a solar explosion upon damaging an enemy, dealing damage and inflicting the Daybroken debuff, which deals 100 damage per second for a duration of 5 seconds, displayed in increments of 25 damage. Enemies that die while afflicted with the debuff inflict it onto nearby enemies.

Its best modifier is Godly or Demonic. Both modifiers increase the average damage output by the same amount. However, Ruthless might be preferred if the player already has very high critical strike chance.

Prismites are a type of Hardmode fish which are found rarely by fishing in the Hallow in any layer. They are used to craft Seafood Dinners (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) and Lifeforce Potions.

The Palladium Waraxe is a Hardmode axe that is obtainable after defeating the Wall of Flesh, and is the axe alternative to the Palladium Chainsaw. It is one of the earliest available axe tools upon entering Hardmode, as is its slightly weaker alternate the Cobalt Waraxe. Like all other axes and chainsaws, it is solely used to cut down trees, cacti, and Giant Glowing Mushrooms.
Its best modifier is Legendary. However, due to rounding, Legendary, Light, Deadly, Agile, Quick, and Nasty provide equal boosts to mining speed for this tool.

The Fungi Bulb is an uncommon enemy found in Glowing Mushroom biomes above the surface. During Hardmode, they can also appear in Underground Glowing Mushroom biomes. The Fungi Bulb follows the plant behavior akin to the Man Eater, but is less aggressive. Unlike its tougher Hardmode variant, the Giant Fungi Bulb, it does not fire spore projectiles.

The Molten Quiver is a Hardmode accessory that has the same effects as the Magic Quiver with the addition of turning Wooden Arrows into Flaming Arrows when fired from a bow. Unlike the general ranged damage bonuses, it only boosts the damage of the weapons and does not affect damage of the ammo.

Knockback is a basic mechanism in Terraria whereby players and enemies are repelled in the opposite direction of an attack. Most weapons and environment objects that cause damage also cause knockback, to varying degrees. Some enemies are immune to knockback, particularly bosses and other enemies that travel through blocks, like worms and Man Eaters. Some enemies also have varying degrees of knockback resistance.

The player can become immune to knockback by equipping the Cobalt Shield, Paladin's Shield, or any of their upgrades, or by grappling on any surface using any hook. Wearing the full Gladiator armor (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) set also grants the player knockback immunity.

Player-inflicted knockback can be increased by various modifiers, the Titan Glove accessory and its upgrades, the Titan Potion, and the Shroomite and Vortex armors' (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) stealth effects. Critical hits increase the inflicted knockback by 40%. Enemies that are afflicted with Cursed Inferno receive 10% more knockback.
The Ivy Chest is a chest storage item found only in Jungle Shrines and Living Mahogany Trees in the Underground Jungle.

A Crimson Heart is a floating, pulsing, red, heart-shaped background object found deep in the branches of the Crimson. A world with Crimson features several Crimson Hearts, and destroying at least three of them (in a single world) is usually a crucial step in game advancement. This can be done using any hammer or explosives. Crimson Hearts release a fair amount of their own flickering light, similar to Crimson Altars. They are the Crimson counterpart to the Corruption 's Shadow Orbs.

Crimson Hearts are usually located at the ends of the branches that split from the main circular room of a Crimson area, surrounded by Crimstone Blocks. In order to reach them, the player may use a Deathbringer Pickaxe or better pickaxe, explosives, or Purification Powder.

The Milkyway Weaver is a Hardmode, post- Lunatic Cultist, worm enemy that spawns in the area of the Stardust Pillar during the Lunar Events. It is similar to the Solar Pillar 's Crawltipede, in that it is completely unaffected by gravity and floats freely through the air. However, it is much smaller than the Crawltipede, targets players anywhere instead of only in the air, and rather than its tail, its head is its only vulnerable part.

While the Milkyway Weaver attacks primarily by trying to charge towards the player to inflict contact damage, it slows down once every seven seconds. During this time, it charges for five seconds while emitting an increasingly bright blue glimmer before summoning an enemy affiliated with the Stardust Pillar in a constellation pattern, similar to the Stardust Pillar's own summoning attack. When summoning enemies, the Milkyway Weaver follows the same criteria as the Stardust Pillar, meaning it can only spawn other Milkyway Weavers, Star Cells, and Flow Invaders.

Food items are buff potions which grant the Well Fed, Plenty Satisfied, or Exquisitely Stuffed buffs. They can be placed on Plates (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) and cancel the Hunger (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) debuff in the The Constant (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) and Get fixed boi (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) seeds. Statue -spawned enemies will never drop food.

Food generally encompasses drinks as well, such as the Lemonade (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) or Milkshake (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions). However, Ale, Eggnog (Desktop, Console, Old-gen console and Mobile versions), and Sake (Desktop, Console, Old-gen console and Mobile versions) are not considered food items, as they cause different buffs and do not cancel The Constant's Hunger debuff. They can still be placed on Plates nonetheless.
The Firecracker is a Hardmode whip. Like other whips, it causes minions and sentries to focus on the last-struck enemy.
If the Firecracker hits multiple targets in a single attack, the damage dealt by each consecutive hit will be reduced by 33%.

The Firecracker also inflicts the Hellfire debuff for 4 seconds to all targets struck. When a minion or sentry attacks an enemy marked by the Firecracker, a small explosion will occur, and the enemy takes 2.75x the damage from the minion or sentry's attack. The explosion also hits nearby enemies for 1.75x the damage. The mark can only be applied to one enemy per strike, and will not repeat itself until the enemy is struck again. The Firecracker has a 1/4 (25%) chance of being dropped by the Wall of Flesh.
Its best modifier is Legendary.
The Red Husk is a dye material that is dropped by Cochineal Beetles. Its sole purpose is to make Red Dye.

Ammunition items (or ammo) are consumable items fired by ranged weapons. To fire a weapon that requires ammunition, a compatible ammunition type must be present in the player's inventory. The ammunition will be taken from the first stack of suitable ammunition, checked in the following order: The four dedicated ammo slots of the inventory from top to bottom, then the main inventory from the top row (hotbar) to the bottom row, going from left to right within each row.

Each type of ammunition adds its damage, velocity, and knockback to the base value of the weapon that fires it. These stats of the ammunition item are also affected by bonuses from equipments and buffs.

Some weapons, armor, accessories, and buffs offer a chance for each shot to "conserve" ammo, firing a shot as usual without consuming the ammunition. If multiple such items and/or buffs are active, their respective chances to conserve ammo are combined. See ammo conservation for detailed calculation.

The Lightning Aura Rod, Cane, and Staff are special sentry summon weapons. They can summon the Lightning Aura sentry, which lasts for 10 minutes, remains stationary, and does not count against the player's minion capacity. Each Lightning Aura sentry consists of a circle with a radius of 9 tiles, centered on the base, that damages enemies repeatedly as they move through it. The Rod is sold by the Tavernkeep for 50000* 5, the Cane for 150000* 15, and the Staff for 600000* 60.

Lightning Aura weapons completely ignore enemy defenses by adding half the enemy's original defense (i.e. before defense is reduced by certain debuffs) to the weapon's damage. The Lightning Aura Staff, for example, always inflicts around 34 damage on any enemy, regardless of its defense stat. This is separate from and applied before armor penetration, which potentially increases the damage even further. Additionally, Lightning Aura sentries can only gain 50% damage bonus from summon tag damage bonuses from whips.

The Rod is always available. The Cane becomes available after defeating one mechanical boss, and the Staff becomes available after defeating Golem. The three different versions cause an identical effect, but with varying statistics, with the Staff being the most expensive and the most powerful.

These weapons cannot be used outside of the Old One's Army event until the event has been successfully completed. Completing the event on any difficulty allows Rods, Canes, and Staves alike to be used outside of the event.

During the Old One's Army event, Etherian Mana can be collected, which allows the placement of multiple Lightning Auras that remain permanently until the event is over. Etherian Mana cannot be used outside the event.

Lightning Aura sentries are boosted by the Monk armor and Shinobi Infiltrator armor set bonuses, which increase their attack rate and allow them to deal critical hits. These weapons will have a fixed 1/6 (16.67%) (Monk armor) or 1/4 (25%) (Shinobi Infiltrator armor) chance to deal critical strike. This critical strike is determined separately from the summon tag critical chance (from Morning Star or Kaleidoscope), meaning that these two critical strike chances are two independent events instead of additive values. The Shinobi Infiltrator armor also increases the size of the Lightning Aura's circle.
For the rod and cane, their best modifiers are Mythical, Furious, or Godly.

For the staff, its best modifier is Ruthless. The Mythical modifier provides the widest array of stat bonuses, but these primarily affect the initial summon rather than the resulting minion. Additionally, minions cannot deal critical hits. The only lasting advantage a Mythical Lightning Aura sentry summons has over a Ruthless one is knockback.

The Silver Bow is a strong, mid-tier bow crafted solely using Silver Bars. Its sole purpose is to fire arrows from a distance to deal damage to enemies.Its alternate ore counterpart is the Tungsten Bow.

Its best modifier is Demonic, as it does not have any knockback and thus cannot get modifiers that affect it. (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) It can also get the Deadly modifier, which, while the Demonic modifier may provide the greatest damage per hit, grants a higher increase to the overall DPS.

Secret world seeds are world seeds which have been discovered as secret easter eggs that generate worlds with strange or unique features. Unlike regular world seeds - which only affect the usual world structure - secret seeds can produce worlds with characteristics that would not be attainable through normal world generation (i.e., they can affect the game's mechanics while playing in that world). For instance, they may change enemy statistics and behavior, item drops, graphics, theme music, and more.

Secret seeds use unique world-generating mechanics that differ from normal seeds. Using a secret seed overrides the normal use of seeds as a source of randomness and two worlds created via the same secret seed will not necessarily be identical.
There are currently eight different secret seeds.
Worm Tooth is a crafting material dropped by Devourers in The Corruption. Unlike most Corruption items, it does not have a Crimson equivalent.

The Fog Machine is a placed novelty mechanism that produces a fog cloud around it. It can be activated and deactivated via wire, but is always on by default when first placed. The fog is purely visual, has no functional effect, and can be produced infinitely at no cost. When Fog Machines are placed next to each other and are active, the fog gets thicker which makes it harder to see through. The Fog Machine is purchased from the Party Girl for 4 GC at night.

The Cloud Wall is a type of background wall which can be found naturally generated on Floating Islands. It drops as an item when destroyed, and can also be obtained via crafting. It is always considered a safe wall.
Vortex furniture can be made from Vortex Bricks using the Ancient Manipulator. There are 20 different Vortex furniture items.

Solar Fragment Blocks are blocks made from Solar Fragments which are dropped by the Solar Pillar. The blocks have a crystal-like appearance with intense shades of yellow, red, and orange. They can be crafted with the Ancient Manipulator. Walls cannot be crafted with them.
The Palm Wood Bow is similar to the original Wooden Bow, but it has improved damage and a higher velocity.

Its best modifier is Demonic, as it does not have any knockback and thus cannot get modifiers that affect it. (Old-gen console version) It can also get the Deadly modifier, which, while the Demonic modifier may provide the greatest damage per hit, grants a higher increase to the overall DPS.
Rich Mahogany armor is an armor set consisting of the Rich Mahogany Helmet, Rich Mahogany Breastplate, and Rich Mahogany Greaves.

It is slightly more defensive than normal Wood armor, although it is a bit more difficult to obtain, since it requires the player to go to the Jungle, which can be problematic for unprepared early characters.
Wearing a full set grants a basic 3 defense plus a set bonus of 1 defense, which equals a total of 4 defense.
Crafting a full set requires a total of 75 Rich Mahogany.

The Sugar Cookie is a food item that grants the (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) Exquisitely Stuffed / (Old-gen console version) Well Fed buff when consumed. This lasts for (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) 4 minutes / (Old-gen console version) 15 minutes, but can be canceled at any time  by right-clicking the icon,  by selecting the icon using Cycle Next/Previous Buff and then pressing Remove Buff,  by selecting the icon and canceling it in the equipment menu, or  by double-tapping the buff icon. The Sugar Cookie can be dropped from Presents obtained during the Christmas seasonal event, with a chance of 3.601% in pre-Hardmode and 3.361% in Hardmode.
Like all other food items, the Sugar Cookie can be placed on a Plate (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) :
The Mechanical Wheel Piece is one of three parts needed to craft the Minecart Upgrade Kit, and is always dropped from The Twins ' Treasure Bag in Expert Mode.

The Cobalt Waraxe is a Hardmode axe that is obtainable after defeating the Wall of Flesh, and is the axe alternative to the Cobalt Chainsaw. Like all other axes and chainsaws, it is solely used to cut down trees, cacti, and Giant Glowing Mushrooms.
Its best modifier is Legendary. However, due to rounding, Legendary, Light, Deadly, Agile, Quick, and Nasty provide equal boosts to mining speed for this tool.

The Sink is a type of furniture item and crafting station. It does not fulfill a house 's flat surface or comfort item requirement, however, it can be used to craft items that require water as a crafting station.
There are currently 44 Sink types, all being functionally identical.

The Wooden Crate is a pre-Hardmode crate that can be obtained by fishing in any biome, at any height. It is the lowest tier of standard crate, having the least value if sold directly. Its Hardmode counterpart is the Pearlwood Crate (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions).

(Old-gen console and 3DS versions) While a Wooden Crate nominally offers the least valuable rewards, it is the only crate tier which drops ores. As such, it is one of the few sources for "alternate" ores on these versions.

Pizza is a food item that grants the Exquisitely Stuffed buff when consumed. This lasts for 8 minutes, but can be canceled at any time  by right-clicking the icon,  by selecting the icon using Cycle Next/Previous Buff and then pressing Remove Buff, or  by double-tapping the buff icon. Pizza has a 1/50 (2%) chance of being dropped by Hoplites and Medusas.
Like all other food items, Pizza can be placed on a Plate :

The Magic Conch is a tool that teleports the player to the Ocean that is furthest away from them. Like the Magic Mirror and Demon Conch, it can be used limitlessly. The Magic Conch can be found in Sandstone Chests in the top 4/7ths of the Underground Desert and Oasis Crates and Mirage Crates obtained from fishing in the Oasis.

Gel Dye is a Hardmode dye acquired by giving a Strange Plant to the Dye Trader. It is received as a random reward. When equipped, the Gel Dye produces an effect similar to that of the Slime debuff caused by the Slime Gun.

The Leaf Blower is a Hardmode, post- Plantera magic weapon that rapidly fires a barrage of leaf projectiles in a semi-randomized spread, which begin swerving slightly after traveling about 15 tiles. The leaves do not pierce enemies. The Leaf Blower has a (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) 1/7 (14.29%) / (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) 1/6 (16.67%) chance of being dropped by Plantera.
(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) Its best modifier is Mythical.

(Old-gen console and 3DS versions) Its best modifier is either Masterful for mana conservation or Godly / Demonic for higher damage output. It cannot get the Mythical modifier due to its low mana cost.
Panda Ears are a vanity item purchased from the Traveling Merchant for 2 GC 50 SC.
Bars are crafting materials generally crafted from mined ores at a Furnace. Crafting most ore-related items requires that raw ores are first crafted into bars.

There are (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) 23 / (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) 21 different types of bars. Obtaining most of these only requires their respective ores as crafting ingredients. Hellstone, Spectre, and Shroomite Bars are exceptions that require a secondary material in addition. Hallowed Bars are not crafted but are instead dropped by the mechanical bosses. Some bars may also be obtained randomly from crates. On the Desktop version, Console version, and Mobile version, all bars that have a counterpart can be converted to their counterpart using the Chlorophyte Extractinator.
The Palm Wood Hammer is a hammer in the Palm Wood set. It has more power than the standard Wooden Hammer and, like all hammers, it can be used to remove background walls or shape blocks.
Its best modifier is Light for harvesting purposes and Legendary for combat purposes.

Waterleaf is a type of herb which appears as a small, turquoise-colored sprout. It grows naturally on Sand and Pearlsand Blocks, but will never spawn in the Ocean biome. Waterleaf can be harvested with virtually any weapon or tool, and can be planted manually using Waterleaf Seeds in Clay Pots and Planter Boxes (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), or on suitable soil tiles.

Waterleaf blooms (Desktop, Console, Old-gen console and Mobile versions) when it is raining / (3DS version) when partially submerged in water. Its blooming is indicated by turquoise leaves and little water particles emitted. Harvesting blooming Waterleaf yields 1 Waterleaf item and 1-3 Waterleaf Seeds. Harvesting mature or blooming Waterleaf with the Staff of Regrowth or Axe of Regrowth (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) yields 1-2 Waterleafs and 1-5 Waterleaf Seeds instead. Note that these tools can only directly harvest mature stage herbs planted on soil ; see Herbs § Growth for details.
Both Waterleaf and Waterleaf Seeds have a chance to be obtained from the Herb Bag (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions).

The Chlorophyte Partisan is a Hardmode spear crafted using Chlorophyte Bars. It beats all of the "standard" ore spears, dealing 1 more damage than the second-best of the standard Hardmode ore spears, the Titanium Trident, and dealing equal damage to the Adamantite Glaive, but having a faster use time. When thrust, it emits a cloud of spores from the tip of the spear at the apex of the thrust, which looks exactly the same as the Chlorophyte Saber 's projectile. The cloud travels a short distance in the direction the spear was thrust before fading out, penetrates solid blocks, and can damage an unlimited number of enemies. Unlike the Chlorophyte Saber, its spores deal knockback.

Its best modifier is Godly or Demonic. Both modifiers increase the average damage output by the same amount. However, Ruthless might be preferred if the player already has very high critical strike chance.

The Brain of Cthulhu is a pre-Hardmode, Crimson -themed boss resembling a large, flying brain. It can be summoned when three Crimson Hearts are destroyed in a Crimson world, or when a player uses a Bloody Spine anywhere in the Crimson or Underground Crimson biome.

Fighting the Brain of Cthulhu and its attendant Creepers is the only way to obtain Tissue Samples, and is one of the ways to obtain usable quantities of Crimtane Ore. Defeating the Brain of Cthulhu for the first time also allows the Tavernkeep (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) NPC to spawn as the Unconscious Man, (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) and allows meteorites to land.
The Brain of Cthulhu is the Crimson counterpart to the Corruption 's Eater of Worlds. Unlike its Corruption counterpart, it does not have a mechanical equivalent in Hardmode.

While the Brain of Cthulhu is alive, the music Boss 3 https://terraria.wiki.gg/wiki/File:Music-Boss_3.mp3 will play. When Otherworldly music (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) is enabled, the track Boss 1 (Otherworldly) https://terraria.wiki.gg/wiki/File:Music-Boss_1_(Otherworldly).mp3 will play instead.

The Sharkron Balloon is an accessory that combines the effects of the Tsunami in a Bottle and the Balloon Pufferfish. It boosts jump height by 33% and jump speed by 30% increasing your first jump's height to ~10½ blocks (~75% increase), and provides a double jump that now goes 13 blocks, for a total height of 23½ blocks.
Jump height is oddly reduced when underwater, reducing your total underwater height from 17½ blocks (8 blocks + 9½ blocks from Tsunami jump) to 15 blocks (7 blocks + 8 blocks from Tsunami jump).
It can be combined with a Lucky Horseshoe at a Tinkerer's Workshop to make a Pink Horseshoe Balloon.
The Stinkbug Blocker and Ghostly Stinkbug Blocker are furniture items. When placed in a valid house, they will prevent NPCs from moving in.

The Ghostly Stinkbug Blocker is completely invisible when placed and can only been seen if the player has the Spectre Goggles equipped or if they are near an activated Echo Chamber similar to Echo Blocks.

The Jungle Crate is a pre-Hardmode crate that can only be fished in the Jungle. It contains items found in standard crates and always contains an item normally found in Ivy Chests within Jungle Shrines or Living Mahogany Trees. Its Hardmode counterpart is the Bramble Crate.

Black Fairy Dust is a crafting material used solely used to craft Tattered Fairy Wings. It is dropped by the Pumpking during the Pumpkin Moon event with a 2.5-12.5% (6.25-12.5%) chance depending on the current wave.

Autoswing (also known as auto-swing, autofire, auto-fire, or auto-use) is a property that can apply to usable items, such as weapons, tools and blocks, wherein the item is automatically reused (or swung) while the ⚒ Use / Attack key/button is held down. In contrast, weapons without autoswing require that the player repeatedly clicks or presses ⚒ Use / Attack in order to continue attacking.
On this wiki, items with autoswing will feature the icon in the top-right corner of the infobox.

The Clumsy Balloon Slime is a rare entity that can be found in the Space layer. It resembles a slime attached to a balloon, floating around midair. It does not damage the player, nor does it take damage from any source. The player can break its balloon with any weapons, tools, projectiles, etc., and then it will transform into the Clumsy Slime. Afterwards, the Clumsy Balloon Slime will no longer spawn.
If the Clumsy Slime is killed, it will respawn naturally without the need to break another Clumsy Balloon Slime's balloon. Only one Clumsy Balloon Slime can be alive at a time.
It is one of the few entities that can be detected by the Lifeform Analyzer or its upgrades.
The Obsidian Skull Rose is an immunity accessory crafted from the Obsidian Skull and Obsidian Rose that combines their functionality, granting immunity to fire blocks and reduced damage from lava.
The Obsidian Skull Rose can be worn in a Social Accessory Slot as a vanity item.
The Orichalcum Halberd is a Hardmode spear. Its alternate ore counterpart is the Mythril Halberd.

Its best modifier is Godly or Demonic. Both modifiers increase the average damage output by the same amount. However, Ruthless might be preferred if the player already has very high critical strike chance.

The Smoothie of Darkness is a food item that grants the Well Fed buff when consumed. This lasts for 20 minutes, but can be canceled at any time  by right-clicking the icon,  by selecting the icon using Cycle Next/Previous Buff and then pressing Remove Buff, or  by double-tapping the buff icon.
Like all other food items, the Smoothie of Darkness can be placed on a Plate :
The Dao of Pow is a Hardmode flail that has a 4/5 (80%) chance of inflicting the Confused debuff for 2-4 seconds upon striking an enemy.

Its best modifier is Godly or Demonic. Both modifiers increase the average damage output by the same amount. However, Ruthless might be preferred if the player already has very high critical strike chance.

The Shrimp Po' Boy is a food item that grants the Plenty Satisfied buff when consumed. This lasts for 18 minutes, but can be canceled at any time  by right-clicking the icon,  by selecting the icon using Cycle Next/Previous Buff and then pressing Remove Buff, or  by double-tapping the buff icon. The Shrimp Po' Boy has a 1/50 (2%) chance of being dropped by Sharks and Crabs.
Like all other food items, the Shrimp Po' Boy can be placed on a Plate :

The Lead Bow is a low tier bow crafted using Lead Bars. It is stronger than the lowest tier of ore bows, the Copper Bow and Tin Bow. Like the other bows, its sole purpose is to fire arrows from a distance to damage enemies. Its alternate ore counterpart is the Iron Bow.

Its best modifier is Demonic, as it does not have any knockback and thus cannot get modifiers that affect it. (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) It can also get the Deadly modifier, which, while the Demonic modifier may provide the greatest damage per hit, grants a higher increase to the overall DPS.
Cthulhu is a fictional cosmic entity originally devised by author H. P. Lovecraft as an evil god from beyond the human universe. The creature remains a popular element of Lovecraftian horror today.

- According to the Terraria lore pages, Cthulhu sought to bring about destruction and domination in the world of Terraria, before an ancient race of Dryads waged war against it and crippled it by ripping out its organs. Cthulhu then retreated to the moon to heal and prepare for its next attack. While Cthulhu in this form never makes an appearance in Terraria, a number of enemies and items include direct and indirect references to Cthulhu, and the Moon Lord is heavily implied to be the weakened form of Cthulhu.

The Tree set is a vanity set consisting of the Tree Mask, Tree Shirt, and Tree Trunks. It is dropped from Presents obtained during the Christmas event, with a chance of 1.08% in pre-Hardmode and 1.001% in Hardmode. Its male and female variants look identical.
These items are to be equipped in the Social Slots as they only provide a visual appearance.

The Zephyr Fish is a pet-summoning item that spawns the Zephyr Fish pet to follow the player around. (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) The pet will not teleport to the player when it is far away, unlike most other pets. The Zephyr Fish is rarely caught from fishing in any body of water. The chance to catch it is 2/3125 (0.06%) with 50% Fishing Power and 4/3125 (0.13%) with 100% Fishing Power.

The Flying Snake is a flying enemy that spawns in the Jungle Temple and behaves similarly to a bat. The only spawning requirement appears to be that the player stands in front of natural Lihzahrd Brick Walls.

The Zenith is a Hardmode, post- Moon Lord melee weapon crafted using a variety of swords obtained throughout the game's progression. It fires fast-moving sword sprites of itself and its component swords towards the cursor in a curved, ellipse path circling back to the player. The sword sprites can pass through solid blocks, and every sword except the first one homes in on enemies within a 20-tile radius of their path. The Zenith has a base 14% critical strike chance as opposed to the usual 4%.
Its best modifier is Legendary.
The Titanstone Block is a building material crafted from Stone Blocks and Titanium Ore. It is the Titanium equivalent of a brick.

The Plum is a food and fruit item that grants the Well Fed buff when consumed. This lasts for 5 minutes, but can be canceled at any time  by right-clicking the icon,  by selecting the icon using Cycle Next/Previous Buff and then pressing Remove Buff, or  by double-tapping the buff icon.
It has a small chance of dropping when shaking a Boreal tree.
Like all other food items, the Plum can be placed on a Plate :

The Cursed Skull (and Dragon Skull (Old-gen console and 3DS versions)) is a pre-Hardmode flying enemy that spawns in the Dungeon. It is similar to the Meteor Head, with high damage, slow speed, and the ability to travel through tiles. It floats slowly towards the player, occasionally stopping to float in a circle around them for a while, before suddenly lunging forward to attack, similar to the Eye of Cthulhu. Upon striking a player, the Cursed Skull has a 1/3 (33.33%) chance of inflicting the Cursed debuff for 4 / 8 / 10 seconds. This renders the player unable to use items, including weapons, potions, and hooks, making it very difficult to avoid taking further damage.
Cursed Skulls spawn most often in areas of the Dungeon backed by brick walls. They can also spawn in other areas, but with a significantly reduced chance.

Candy Cane Blocks are blocks that are dropped in stacks of 20-49 from Presents obtained during the Christmas event, with a chance of 16.803% in pre-Hardmode and 15.683% in Hardmode. They have no value other than as building material, and in crafting Candy Cane Wall. Despite them both being Candy Cane Blocks, they do not "merge" when placed next to each other.

Wrenches are tools for placing Wires, which are used to connect mechanisms together, such as a trap with a Pressure Plate. There are four different wrenches: the Red Wrench, Green Wrench, Blue Wrench, and Yellow Wrench (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), each placing its respective color of Wire. All wrenches are purchased from the Mechanic for 2 GC each.

All Wrenches use the same ordinary Wire item as ammunition, but the color of wrench used will determine the color of Wire when placed. The colors all function identically but can be placed so as to overlap or intersect each other without interfering with each other. Junction Boxes (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) can further be used to keep intersecting Wire paths of the same color from interfering with each other.
All four wrenches can be combined to make a Multicolor Wrench (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), a single tool that can place Wire of any color.
Ordinary wrenches cannot be used to remove placed Wires. Instead, a Wire Cutter or one of its derivatives is required. All Wire colors become the same ordinary Wire item again when freed.

The Ancient set is a Hardmode vanity set which consists of the Ancient Headdress, Ancient Garments and Ancient Slacks. These items are to be equipped in the Social Slots as they only provide a visual appearance.

The Giant Bat is a Hardmode bat enemy that spawns in the Cavern layer. It can inflict the Confused debuff for 5 / 10 / 12.5 seconds, causing the game controls to reverse. It also has a 1/10 (10%) chance to inflict the Feral Bite debuff in Expert Mode (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) for 30-90 seconds. It appears much bigger than a normal Cave Bat.

The Magnet Sphere is a Hardmode, post- Plantera magic weapon that casts a glowing, slow-moving cyan sphere, which travels in a straight line, unimpeded by liquids or other non-solid obstacles in its path and (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) can bounce off tiles. The sphere will rapidly shoot instantaneous, non-piercing beams at the closest enemy as it travels through the air, and disappears if it has been in the air for more than 15 (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) / 11 (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) seconds or has traveled 52 tiles. If the player casts another sphere while there is already one in the air, the previous one will fade away. The Magnet Sphere has a 1/300 (0.33%) / 599/90000 (0.67%) chance of being dropped by Blue Armored Bones, Rusty Armored Bones, and Hell Armored Bones in the post-Plantera Dungeon.

Its best modifier is Ruthless. The Mythical modifier provides the widest array of stat bonuses, but the only stats that improve damage output are damage and critical chance. Switching to a different magic weapon causes existing projectiles to use that weapon's critical chance instead, meaning that the Magnet Sphere's DPS is optimized with the Ruthless modifier when used in the intended way.

The Cultist set is a vanity set purchased from the Clothier for 20 GC (set) after the Lunatic Cultist has been defeated. Its appearance is based on the clothing worn by Cultists, but its design is different from the robes worn either by normal Lunatic Devotees or the Lunatic Cultist itself. These items are to be equipped in the Social Slots as they only provide a visual appearance.

The Solar Cultist set consists of the Solar Cultist Hood and the Solar Cultist Robe, which are sold during the day. The Lunar Cultist set consists of the Lunar Cultist Hood and the Lunar Cultist Robe, which are sold during the night.
The Sharpening Station is a furniture item found naturally generated in Underground Cabins in the Underground Jungle. In Hardmode, it is also sold by the Merchant for 10 GC.

Placing and pressing ⚷ Open / Activate on the Sharpening Station grants the Sharpened buff, which increases armor penetration while holding a melee weapon by 12. This lasts until the player dies or leaves the world, but can be canceled at any time  by right-clicking the icon,  by selecting the icon using Cycle Next/Previous Buff and then pressing Remove Buff, or  by double-tapping the buff icon.

Unlike equipment buff items, the Sharpening Station must be placed in order to activate the buff. It can be mined with a pickaxe or drill and picked up again, even while the buff is active, which will not cancel the buff. Placement is only dependent on an adequate space of 3x2 tiles being available.

The Calming Potion is a buff potion which grants the Calm buff when consumed. The buff reduces the enemy spawn rate by (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) 39% / (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) 17%, and the maximum number of enemies on-screen is reduced by (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) 40% / (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) 20%. This lasts for (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) 12 minutes / (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) 8 minutes, but can be canceled at any time  by right-clicking the icon,  by selecting the icon using Cycle Next/Previous Buff and then pressing Remove Buff,  by selecting the icon and canceling it in the equipment menu,  by double-tapping the buff icon, or  by canceling the buff from the buffs screen.
The Broken Hero Sword is a Hardmode, post- Plantera crafting material. It has a 1/4 (25%) / 7/16 (43.75%) chance of being dropped by Mothrons.
It is not a weapon itself, and therefore can neither be swung, reforged, or placed on a Weapon Rack.
Arrow Signs are furniture items used in Golfing. They are purely decorative and come in a regular and a painted variety. They are both purchased from the Golfer for 20 SC each.
It is possible to turn the orientation of arrows with a right-click (⚷ Open / Activate) into 8 different directions.

The Yellow Willow Sapling is a seed purchased from the Zoologist once the Bestiary is 30% complete (162 entries). When planted, it grows into a Yellow Willow tree, which is a tree that can also spawn naturally in the forest. Its appearance is decorative and it functions identically to regular forest trees.

The Shadow Candle is a furniture item that can be placed or held to nullify the enemy spawn reduction benefits of towns in the area. When placed, it grants nearby players the Shadow Candle debuff. The debuff is applied to any players standing within a rectangular area of 170x125 tiles centered on a Shadow Candle. Holding a Shadow Candle does not cause the debuff icon to display, but still causes an identical effect. In order to be considered "holding" the candle, it must be in the player's hotbar and currently selected; merely being in a player's inventory will not suffice.
Pressing ⚷ Open / Activate on a placed Shadow Candle will turn it off. Shadow Candles that are turned off will not activate the Shadow Candle debuff.

The Kwad Racer Drone is a Hardmode, post- Plantera novelty item purchased from the Cyborg for 10 GC. Pressing the ⚒ Use / Attack button while selected in the hotbar summons a harmless drone that can be controlled by the ▲ Up, ◀ Left, and ▶ Right buttons. Pressing ⚒ Use / Attack again or switching to another item instantly destroys the drone. The player appears to wield a remote control when the drone is in use.
The player is locked in place while the drone is active. Equipping the FPV Goggles will center the camera on the drone.

The Creeper is a pre-Hardmode eyeball-like enemy that is spawned along with the Brain of Cthulhu in a group of 20 (40 if in a For the worthy world). They orbit the Brain of Cthulhu at high speeds and follow it wherever it teleports to, acting as a shield of sorts. Creepers do not respawn once they are killed. All Creepers must be destroyed first before the Brain of Cthulhu becomes vulnerable to attacks.
Creepers have a 1/2 (50%) chance to drop a Heart if the player is below full health.

The Obsidian Lock Box is a grab bag item which is always obtained from Obsidian and Hellstone Crates. It always contains one rare item normally found in locked Shadow Chests in the Underworld. It requires a Shadow Key to be in the player's inventory to open the box, which can be found in locked Gold Chests or Golden Lock Boxes in the Dungeon.
The Guy Fawkes Mask is a head piece vanity item. It is purchased from the Clothier during Halloween for 3 GC.

The Froggle Bunwich is a food item that grants the Plenty Satisfied buff when consumed. This lasts for 6 minutes, but can be canceled at any time  by right-clicking the icon,  by selecting the icon using Cycle Next/Previous Buff and then pressing Remove Buff, or  by double-tapping the buff icon.
Like all other food items, the Froggle Bunwich can be placed on a Plate :
The Lever is a 2x2 activation mechanism purchased from the Mechanic for 30 SC. It can activate Statues, lights, etc. via ⚷ Open / Activate.
The Lever can be placed on any flat surface, the same as furniture, including on platforms. It can also be placed on background walls.

Despite its depiction as a switch with two positions, the Lever does not need to act as an on/off mechanism. When wired to Dart Traps, for example, activating the Lever will always cause the trap to shoot, the same as a Pressure Plate would, no matter which position the Lever happens to be in.

The Leech is a pre-Hardmode worm enemy spawned by the Wall of Flesh. Multiple Leeches are released from the Wall's mouth, first in groups of 3-4. The groups grow larger and more frequent as the boss takes damage. The Wall of Flesh will eventually release them in a continuous stream.

Granite is a block found underground in Granite Caves. It can be crafted into Smooth Granite Blocks at a Work Bench in order to craft the Granite-themed furniture set. In addition to being found in placed form, it can also drop from Granite Elementals and Granite Golems.

Most NPCs are given names randomly chosen from respective lists. This page lists all possible names for each NPC. This list is provided primarily to help Mobile version players with older devices identify NPCs that are waiting to move in, as old Mobile status messages provide only names without specifying the NPC type.

An existing NPC's name is fixed and will not change according to current language settings or Resource Pack (Desktop version). The only way to change an existing NPC's name is kill them to let them respawn with another name.
Use the browser's "find" feature (usually Ctrl + F) to search for a name and see which NPC type it belongs to.

The Guardian Golem is a Hardmode, post- Golem light pet-summoning item that spawns a Toy Golem light pet upon being used or equipped. When the player is far enough away or in midair, the Toy Golem emits a rocket exhaust to catch up to them. The Guardian Golem has a 1/4 (25%) chance of being dropped by Golem in Master Mode.

The Angry Tumbler is a pre-Hardmode enemy that spawns in the Desert during a Sandstorm. It attacks by rolling towards the player, moving at very high speeds when rolling with in the direction of the Mighty Wind. Combined with its considerable contact damage, this makes the Angry Tumbler difficult to deal with for new players.

The Magic Power Potion is a buff potion which grants the Magic Power buff when consumed. The buff increases magic damage by 20%. This lasts for 4 minutes (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) / 2 minutes (Old-gen console and 3DS versions), but can be canceled at any time  by right-clicking the icon,  by selecting the icon using Cycle Next/Previous Buff and then pressing Remove Buff,  by selecting the icon and canceling it in the equipment menu,  by double-tapping the buff icon, or  by canceling the buff from the buffs screen.

The Toolbelt is an accessory item purchased from the Goblin Tinkerer for 10 GC that increases the range of block placement by one tile, although it does not increase block mining range. The effect stacks with that of the Builder buff, Toolbox, and Extendo Grip or Architect Gizmo Pack.
The True Excalibur is a Hardmode sword that is a direct upgrade to the Excalibur. It is one of the ingredients necessary to craft the Terra Blade.

The True Excalibur possesses a stronger version of the Excalibur's effect, adding an additional pink aura past the existing yellow aura from its predecessor, which both follow along the sword's swing arc to increase its effective range. When the sword or its auras strike enemies, a bright pink and yellow flash is created.
Its best modifier is Legendary.

Gemcorns are a type of seed whose saplings grow into gem trees, and can be crafted from an Acorn and any Gem. Natural Gem Trees can be found in the Underground and Cavern layer, although they are rare. Generally speaking, chopping down a Gem Tree will yield 7-48 Stone Blocks, 0-11 Gemcorns of the tree's type, and 0-24 Gems of the tree's type (each tile of the tree has a 1/10 (10%) chance of dropping a gem, otherwise dropping 1-2 Stone Blocks, and every non-barren leaf/branch tile additionally has a 1/2 (50%) chance to drop another Gemcorn. See Growth section for detailed info.)
The Ghost is a pre-Hardmode enemy that spawns in the Cavern and Underground layers during the Halloween seasonal event.
On the Desktop version, Console version, and Mobile version, Ghosts will also spawn in the Graveyard mini-biome, regardless of time, and have a chance to spawn when breaking Tombstones.

Ghosts behave like Wraiths, hovering above the ground and passing through solid tiles to reach the player. In order for Ghosts to travel up to players, they must have a solid block to pass through, or else they will stay hovering just above the ground.

Jellyfish are enemies found in water. When underwater, they attack by propelling themselves towards the player in short bursts. When outside of water, they will be unable to move or pursue the player in any way. Jellyfish are able to jump out of the water to attack players, often leaving them stranded on land. Most varieties of Jellyfish produce light, making them easy to spot in dark areas. There are currently 5 Jellyfish variants, 3 of which only appear during Hardmode.

In Expert Mode (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), Jellyfish will periodically become electrified (except for Fungo Fish), making them invincible for the duration of the attack. A Jellyfish will constantly maintain its speed while electrified unless it comes into contact with a wall or the water's surface. If the player attacks a Jellyfish with a sword while it is electrified (or any other swung item that deals direct damage, such as most tools), the player will be hurt by 1.3x contact damage of the Jellyfish. This also applies to projectile contact weapons (spears, shortswords, Solar Eruption, Sleepy Octopod, Sky Dragon's Fury, and whips).

The Forbidden Fragment is a Hardmode crafting material which is always dropped by Sand Elementals, which spawn during Sandstorms in the Desert. To craft all items that require this material, 6 Forbidden Fragments are required.

The Arctic Diving Gear is an accessory which is crafted by combining the Jellyfish Diving Gear and Ice Skates at a Tinkerer's Workshop. It combines the swimming and breathing effects of the Diving Gear with the underwater lighting effect of the Jellyfish Necklace (in the Desktop version, Console version, and Mobile version, it gives a very faint glow out of water and honey and its brightness is significantly increased when submerged), as well as the enhanced mobility on ice effect of the Ice Skates. In addition to combining these effects into a single accessory, it has the unique ability of preventing the Chilled debuff when touching water in Snow or Ice biomes in Expert Mode (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions).

The Frog Flipper is an accessory crafted from a Frog Leg and a Flipper. It combines the abilities of these two items, increasing the player's jump speed and safe falling distance, allowing auto-jump, and giving the player the ability to swim.

The Hallowed Prism Wall, Hallowed Cavern Wall, Hallowed Shard Wall, and Hallowed Crystalline Wall are types of background walls which can be found naturally generated in the Underground Hallow, considered unsafe. They do not drop as an item when destroyed, and can only be obtained on the Desktop, Console, and Mobile, via crafting. They are considered safe walls when placed by the player.

The Dark Harvest is a Hardmode, post- Plantera whip which, upon striking an enemy, applies an aura of dark energy to the target. When a minion or sentry damages an enemy afflicted with a dark aura, the aura creates an explosion of dark energy, dealing 10 damage to the afflicted target as well as nearby enemies. Nearby enemies do not need to be tagged by the Dark Harvest for the secondary damage to occur. This effect can pass through solid blocks, is not affected by any damage bonuses, and has 50 armor penetration.

Striking an enemy with the Dark Harvest will also grant the Harvest Time buff, which increases attack speed by 35% for 3 seconds. The buff's duration can be refreshed by hitting enemies with the Dark Harvest again, which also reapplies the dark aura effect to damaged enemies. Like other whips, it causes minions and sentries to focus on the last-struck enemy.

If the Dark Harvest hits multiple targets in a single attack, the damage dealt by each consecutive hit will be reduced by 10%. The Dark Harvest is dropped by the Pumpking during the Pumpkin Moon event with a 2.5-12.5% (6.25-12.5%) chance depending on the current wave.
Its best modifier is Legendary.
The Amber Staff is a pre-Hardmode magic weapon and shares the fifth tier of gem staff with the Ruby Staff, as both have identical stats. It autofires an orange bolt that can pierce one enemy.
Its best modifier is Mythical.

The Cursed Bullet is a type of Hardmode bullet used as ammunition by guns. Enemies struck by Cursed Bullets are always inflicted with the Cursed Inferno debuff for 7 seconds, which causes damage over time that cannot be extinguished by water (unlike the On Fire! debuff). They are the Corruption counterpart to the Crimson 's Ichor Bullets. Cursed Bullets have high base damage for bullets, though they lack any other effects (such as piercing with Meteor Shots or splash damage like what Crystal Bullets have).

Princess Fish are a type of Hardmode fish which are found uncommonly by fishing in the Hallow in any layer. They are used to craft Love Potions and Seafood Dinners (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions).
The Guide to Environmental Preservation is a pre-Hardmode tool that prevents the player's attacks from breaking plants while inside their inventory. It can be purchased from the Dryad for 5 GC.

Pressing ⚷ Open / Activate on the Guide to Environmental Preservation in the player's inventory or hotbar will toggle it between the Guide to Environmental Preservation and the Guide to Environmental Preservation (Inactive), disabling its functions.

The Goblin Tech is an informational accessory that displays the most valuable item nearby, the player's current DPS, and the player's speed. It combines the functionalities of its ingredients, the Stopwatch, DPS Meter, and Metal Detector.
Lock on or Target Lock is a mechanic which allows players to automatically target enemies, bosses, and critters.
The Chlorophyte Greataxe is a Hardmode axe that is obtainable after defeating all three mechanical bosses, and is the axe alternative to the Chlorophyte Chainsaw. It is crafted from Chlorophyte Bars.
Its best modifier is Legendary. However, due to rounding, Legendary, Light, Deadly, Agile, Quick, and Nasty provide equal boosts to mining speed for this tool.

Pots are common items generated at world creation in random areas. When broken with any weapon or tool, they will drop coins and/or random common items. Pots cannot be picked up, never respawn, and cannot be crafted, even with Ecto Mist.

The Pin Wheel is a novelty furniture. When placed, the wheel spins if it is windy, with its spin speed depending on the current wind speed in the area. It is purchased from the Merchant for 20 SC during the Windy Day event.

The Fisherman's Pocket Guide is an informational accessory that displays the player's current Fishing Power. The Fisherman's Pocket Guide can be received as a 1/34 (2.94%) chance reward for completing a fishing quest for the Angler NPC, depending on the number of completed quests and other factors (for details, see Angler).

The Angler will not give the player a Fisherman's Pocket Guide as a reward if they already have one in their inventory or in any of their portable storage items or loadouts. However, if the player has all of the Angler's fishing and informational accessories (or their upgrades like the Angler Tackle Bag and Fish Finder) in their inventories, this rule will be ignored.

The Fisherman's Pocket Guide is one of the three parts necessary to make the Fish Finder, with the others being the Sextant and the Weather Radio, and as such is a required ingredient in crafting the Shellphone.

Sprinting accessories are accessories which allow the player to gain a speed boost after running for a certain distance continuously. The player's speed will continue increasing until maximum speed is attained. Being in the air while running will not cancel the speed boost as long as the player runs in one direction, but it will not continue to build unless the player is on the ground or using a flight accessory which increases the player's speed while in the air. Grappling hooks, dashes, and other items can be used to jump start this sprint effect.

Unless the Cobalt Shield is equipped (or another item that cancels knockback), hitting an enemy will interrupt the speed boost. However, using an enemy's knockback to kickstart the sprint is an impractical but effective method, particularly with a Panic Necklace.
All of the accessories which grant the sprinting effect are boots. These are the items which will provide this effect:

Escargot is a food item that grants the Plenty Satisfied buff when consumed. This lasts for 10 minutes, but can be canceled at any time  by right-clicking the icon,  by selecting the icon using Cycle Next/Previous Buff and then pressing Remove Buff, or  by double-tapping the buff icon.
Like all other food items, the Escargot can be placed on a Plate :

The Enchanted Nightcrawler is a critter that appears as a pink and sparkly Worm. Enchanted Nightcrawlers can spawn naturally during a Meteor Shower when few clouds are in the sky (such as during a Lantern Night), can be obtained by crafting, and also have a 3/10 (30%) chance of being obtained from a Can Of Worms. The Enchanted Nightcrawler has only 5 health and no defense, and can be damaged by other enemies and players.

The Enchanted Nightcrawler can be caught with any Bug Net to be carried around in the inventory and released later, or crafted into animated decorative furniture (Enchanted Nightcrawler Cage). Once crafted, the Enchanted Nightcrawler cannot be released again, unless the furniture item is de-crafted via Shimmer (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions).
The Enchanted Nightcrawler can be used as bait for fishing, with 35% bait power.

The Silly Sunflower set is a vanity set which consists of the Silly Sunflower Petals, Silly Sunflower Tops and Silly Sunflower Bottoms. They are purchased from the Clothier for 9 GC (set) while a Party is active.
These items are to be equipped in the Social Slots as they only provide a visual appearance.

The Underground Crimson is a biome. It is the underground version of the surface -level Crimson, appearing at and below the Cavern layer. Just like the surface Crimson, it is mainly composed of Crimstone and spreads to nearby tiles. Although it is available in pre-Hardmode, most of its exclusive contents will only appear during Hardmode. After the Wall of Flesh is defeated for the first time, a diagonal stripe of Crimson is generated, creating additional Underground Crimson biome.

(Old-gen console and 3DS versions) Small pockets of Underground Crimson can be created through the breaking of Crimson Altars, which can convert a single random Stone Block in the world into Crimstone upon destruction.

The Underground Crimson does not suppress the spawn of other underground and cavern enemies. During Hardmode, all enemies killed in the Underground Crimson have a 1/5 (20%) / 9/25 (36%) chance to drop a Soul of Night.
Note: Most characteristics of the surface Crimson also apply to the Underground Crimson. See The Crimson for more extensive information.
The Doctor's set is a vanity set which consists of the The Doctor's Shirt and The Doctor's Pants. They are purchased from the Clothier for 40 GC (set) in total, during Waning Gibbous.
These items are to be equipped in the Social Slots as they only provide a visual appearance.

The Pirate Captain is a Hardmode enemy which appears during the Pirate Invasion event. Upon being within line of sight of the player, he attacks using an assault rifle-like gun that shoots at a speed comparable to the Minishark, then stops to fire a single cannonball from its underbarrel mounted cannon while stationary. The cannonball has a short range and detonates upon impact with blocks, much like those fired from the Flying Dutchman (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), and deals immense amounts of damage.
On the Desktop version, Console version, and Mobile version, a Pirate's Curse will be spawned when a Pirate Captain is killed. It will slowly drift towards the player through walls much like Wraiths.

He is one of the few entities that can be detected by the Lifeform Analyzer (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) or its upgrades. The Pirate Captain requires 25 kills to be awarded completion of his Bestiary entry and corresponding banner, as opposed to the usual 50 kills.

Get fixed boi is a secret world seed that combines many of the features of the other secret world seeds. It has also been referred to by Re-Logic in update changelogs and in the source code as Everything and Zenith, and is generally considered to be the most challenging secret world seed.
The following seeds can be used to generate a Get fixed boi world (case-insensitive):
