If there is a ceiling, it must be at least 16 tiles above the floor. There must be no wall right on top of the floor for them to spawn, but there can be wall behind the floor and from 1 tile above it. They will grow only when there is a flat patch of 5 blocks. They will grow at least 2 tiles from each other.

The Slime Crown is a boss-summoning item used to summon King Slime. It appears as a small Blue Slime wearing a crown and can be used instantaneously to spawn King Slime in any location, who can otherwise spawn randomly at any time without the use of a summoning item (though only in the outer sixths of the map, laterally).

Gold Ore is an early game ore which spawns in the Underground and Cavern layers. Its primary use is to make Gold Bars, which can be used to make the Gold tier of equipment, as well as crowns, Thrones, and several other items. The equivalent of Gold Ore is Platinum Ore, which will sometimes replace Gold in a world. (Desktop, Console, Mobile and 3DS versions) Gold Ore has a small chance to appear as a bonus drop from slimes.
Raynebro's set is a vanity set consisting of Raynebro's Hood, Raynebro's Hoodie, and Raynebro's Pants. It is purchased from the Traveling Merchant for 3 GC (set).
These items are to be equipped in the Social Slots as they only provide a visual appearance.
The Breaker is a Demonite -tier hammer. Its Crimson counterpart is Flesh Grinder.
Its best modifier is Legendary. However, due to rounding, Legendary, Light, Deadly, Agile, Quick, and Nasty provide equal boosts to mining speed for this tool.

The Yelets is a Hardmode yoyo that has a 1/200 (0.5%) chance to drop from any enemy killed in the Jungle and Underground Jungle, including in the Jungle Temple, after one of the mechanical bosses has been defeated.
It has a spin duration of 14 seconds and can reach up to 18 tiles.

Its best modifier is Godly or Demonic. Both modifiers increase the average damage output by the same amount. However, Ruthless might be preferred if the player already has very high critical strike chance.
The Tin Hammer is a hammer. Like all hammers, it is used to remove background walls and create sloped tiles and half tiles. Its alternate ore counterpart is the Copper Hammer.
Its best modifier is Legendary. However, due to rounding, Legendary, Light, Deadly, Agile, Quick, and Nasty provide equal boosts to mining speed for this tool.

The Orichalcum Pickaxe is a Hardmode pickaxe and is the pickaxe alternative to the Orichalcum Drill, having a slower mining speed but longer range and benefiting from mining speed bonuses. Its alternate ore counterpart, the Mythril Pickaxe, is slightly weaker than the Orichalcum Pickaxe.
It can mine any block except Chlorophyte Ore and Lihzahrd Bricks.
Its best modifier is Legendary. However, due to rounding, Legendary, Light, Deadly, Agile, Quick, and Nasty provide equal boosts to mining speed for this tool.

Shifting Sands Dye is a Hardmode dye acquired by giving a Strange Plant to the Dye Trader. When applied, it gives the item an appearance similar to falling sand. It can be used to craft Shifting Pearlsands Dye when one acquires Crystal Shards.

The Storm Diver is a Hardmode, post- Lunatic Cultist enemy that spawns in the area of the Vortex Pillar during the Lunar Events. Storm Divers wield a type of ranged weapon that is able to fire tight spreads of projectiles, similar to the Tactical Shotgun. Storm Divers are also able to glide and hover with what appear to be jetpacks. They appear to have mud-colored skin, a green glass helmet, cyan-colored claws, cyan lights, and an alien-like shotgun.

The Full Moon Squeaky Toy is a Hardmode pet-summoning item that spawns a Baby Werewolf pet to follow the player around. When the player is far enough away or in midair, the Baby Werewolf flies after them by flapping its arms, mimicking a bird-like creature. The Full Moon Squeaky Toy can be purchased from the Zoologist during a Hardmode Blood Moon for 30 GC.

Silly Balloons are blocks that can be purchased during a Party from the Party Girl for 1 SC each. When a single one is placed, it has a round appearance, just like Bubbles and Smoke Blocks. When balloons of the same color are placed together in groups, they connect to make a seemingly single larger balloon block. If placed adjacent to balloon blocks of other colors, they do not connect, and each will remain a single round balloon.
In a similar way to Pink Slime Blocks, landing on any silly balloon block negates fall damage and causes the player to bounce. Silly Balloons can also be used to craft balloon furniture.

Queen Slime is an early- Hardmode, Hallow -themed boss. Her appearance is that of a massive, translucent pink slime wearing a silver crown and engulfing a colorful crystal. Fighting Queen Slime is not required for game progression - much like her pre-Hardmode counterpart, King Slime - but her defeat may reward the player with useful items.

While Queen Slime is alive, her exclusive music Queen Slime https://terraria.wiki.gg/wiki/File:Music-Queen_Slime.mp3 will play. When Otherworldly music (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) is enabled, the track Boss 2 (Otherworldly) https://terraria.wiki.gg/wiki/File:Music-Boss_2_(Otherworldly).mp3 will play instead.

Santa-NK1 is a Hardmode, post- Plantera mini-boss that spawns during the Frost Moon event. When below half health, the face and beard of the Santa mask are torn apart to reveal a rather morbid mechanical skull underneath.
Defeating Santa-NK1 during the Frost Moon event will add 100 / 200 / 250 points to the final score.
The Bunny set is a vanity set composed of the Bunny Tail and Bunny Ears. It can be purchased from the Zoologist during a First Quarter Moon for 6 GC (set).

The Brain Scrambler is a Hardmode, post- Golem enemy that appears during the Martian Madness event. It fires green laser projectiles, at a maximum fire rate of once every 0.67 seconds (40 ticks), which have a chance to inflict the Confused debuff.

Flight allows players to move freely in the air for a certain duration and can be granted using either the Rocket Boots, Wings or certain Mounts. While wings and faster mounts can only be acquired during Hardmode, Rocket Boots and Honeyed Goggles can be used to achieve limited flight early on.
The Soaring Insignia accessory can be paired along wings and rocket boots to grant infinite flight time.

The Copper Bow is a Pre-Hardmode low tier bow made solely out of Copper Bars. Its basic function is to fire Arrows from a distance to deal damage to enemies. Its alternate ore counterpart is the Tin Bow.

Its best modifier is Demonic, as it does not have any knockback and thus cannot get modifiers that affect it. (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) It can also get the Deadly modifier, which, while the Demonic modifier may provide the greatest damage per hit, grants a higher increase to the overall DPS.

The Obsidian Swordfish is a Hardmode spear. It has the second-highest base damage of any spear (beaten only by the North Pole). However, it is very short compared to other Hardmode spears. It is obtained via fishing in lava, by (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) using any lava fishing method (including lava bait or Lavaproof Fishing Hook) during Hardmode, or (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) only by using the Hotline Fishing Hook.

The Obsidian Swordfish has an extraordinarily high base critical strike chance of 24% as opposed to the usual 4%. This gives it not only the highest base critical strike chance of any melee weapon, but also the second highest of any weapon, tied with the Sky Fracture (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), Stellar Tune (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), and the Staff of Earth (on the Desktop version, Console version, and Mobile version), and surpassed only by the Sniper Rifle.

Its best modifier is Godly or Demonic. Both modifiers increase the average damage output by the same amount. However, Ruthless might be preferred if the player already has very high critical strike chance.
A Blood Moon is an event that takes place over the course of an entire night, from 7:30 PM to 4:30 AM, affecting only the surface layer.

Blood Moons are signaled by the status message " The Blood Moon is rising... ". All of the water in the world, even in the Underground and Cavern layers, will turn blood-red for the duration of the event, including rain and the moon itself. (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) A red filter will also be applied to the screen when the player is on the surface.
The event will spawn regular nighttime enemies as well as new, more dangerous enemies in large numbers, while also changing their behavior and spawning conditions (see below).

(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) During a Blood Moon, the ability to speed up time by sleeping in a bed is disabled, but time can still be sped up using an Enchanted Sundial or Enchanted Moondial. Also, the player's Fishing Power is increased by 1.1 times. However, fishing could also spawn unique enemies, the Surly Slime town pet, and a few other unique items.

The Possessed Armor is a Hardmode enemy which spawns on the surface at night, and underground at any time. It walks quickly and casts a motion blur similar to that of the Shadow armor. It can always open doors, regardless of whether or not there is a blood moon.

Crowno's set are vanity developer items that can be obtained rarely (5% chance) from Treasure Bags dropped from Hardmode bosses (except Queen Slime 's). It is the vanity set made for Crowno, an artist that develops graphics for Terraria.
These items are to be equipped in the Social Slots as they only provide a visual appearance.
Crowno's equipment also includes a non-vanity item, which will drop in addition to his clothing set:
Crowno's Wings

The Wormhole Potion is a potion which allows a player to instantly teleport to another team member's location in multiplayer, done by selecting their player icon in the full-screen map (accessible by pressing the Toggle Full Map key) once consumed. It is only possible to teleport to players of the same team, and the teleport will be announced in a status message. It is not possible to use Wormhole Potions if the player has the minimap disabled.

In addition to being crafted, Wormhole Potions can be found in pots and have a small chance to appear as a bonus drop from slimes, but only in multiplayer. Note that other players do not have to be online for Wormhole Potions to drop, so just selecting multiplayer and hosting the game can allow them to drop. Wormhole Potions are still craftable in single-player worlds.

The Campfire is a placed furniture item that emits light and provides the Cozy Fire buff to players in its vicinity. A Campfire can be turned off by pressing the ⚷ Open / Activate on the object or by sending it a wire signal, and can be toggled back on again the same way. It is also used to cook a Marshmallow on a Stick.

The Cozy Fire buff increases nearby players' current health regeneration rate by 10% and adds an additional constant 0.5 health per second. The buff is applied to all players who are within a rectangular area of 170x125 (Desktop version, Console version, Mobile version) / 100x84 (Old-gen console version, Nintendo 3DS version) tiles centered on the Campfire, similar to the Heart Lantern. The regeneration buffs from both items will stack together to provide a greater regeneration boost, and being within range of these items can also help to counteract the effects of damaging debuffs (such as Poisoned and On Fire!).
The Fireplace operates similarly and provides the same Cozy Fire buff, but cannot cook a Marshmallow on a Stick.

Blue Berries are a dye material that can be collected from any Grass block by destroying a blueberry bush with a Pickaxe or Drill. Its sole purpose is to make Blue Dye. Placed Blue Berries have the appearance of a blueberry bush.

Lemonade is a food item that grants the Well Fed buff when consumed. This lasts for 10 minutes, but can be canceled at any time  by right-clicking the icon,  by selecting the icon using Cycle Next/Previous Buff and then pressing Remove Buff, or  by double-tapping the buff icon.
Like all other food items, the Lemonade can be placed on a Plate :

The Music Box is a Hardmode accessory and furniture item that can be purchased from the Wizard for 10 GC. When the Music Box is equipped in an accessory slot, it will record the currently playing in-game music after a randomized delay. This includes tracks being played by other Music Boxes. Once recorded, it will change into one of the Music Boxes listed below. A record sound https://terraria.wiki.gg/wiki/File:Item_166.wav alerts the player about a completed recording. Most Music Box variants can only be obtained by recording in-game music with the exception of Music Box (Journey's End), which can be bought directly from the Princess for 10 GC after defeating the Moon Lord.
A recorded Music Box can be played back in one of two ways:
Equipping it as an accessory. Placing it as furniture and activating it, either by the ⚷ Open / Activate button or with wires.
Recorded Music Boxes can be reverted into blank ones through Shimmer transmutation.
There are 88 different Music Boxes available.

The Sakura Sapling is a seed purchased from the Zoologist once the Bestiary is 30% complete (162 entries). When planted, it grows into a Sakura tree, which is a tree that can also spawn naturally in the forest. Its appearance is decorative and it functions identically to regular forest trees.

The Marble Wall is a type of background wall which can be found naturally generated in Marble Caves, considered unsafe. It does not drop as an item when destroyed. It can also be generated as part of an Underground Cabin in a Marble Cave, considered safe. It is also considered a safe wall when placed by the player.
The Plan is a Hardmode immunity accessory which combines the functions of the Fast Clock and the Trifold Map, granting immunity to the Slow and Confusion debuffs.
It is one of the ingredients required to make the Ankh Charm, which is further required to make the Ankh Shield.

Space is the layer making up the top of the world, above the Surface. Gravity is decreased in Space, which means the player can jump higher and will fall slower, similar to the Featherfall effect. The sky is dark and stars are visible, even when the sun is still up. There are no naturally occurring blocks or objects in Space, although Floating Island or Living Tree parts may extend into it.
Despite being at such high altitudes, players that enter Space do not experience any consequences. They will neither incur the Suffocation debuff nor will the breath meter appear.

Fallen Stars spawn in Space and can appear inside structures made at high altitudes. Harpies and, in Hardmode, Wyverns and Arch Wyverns (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) spawn in Space. Additionally, Martian Probes (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) are more likely to spawn in Space and common enemies such as slimes and Zombies can also appear in Space, given a viable area to spawn on.
The Forest Pylon (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) can be used in Space.

Multiplayer is a game mode in which Terraria can be played with or against other remote players online. Multiplayer worlds are cooperative by default, with player versus player (PvP) available for activation once multiplayer is entered.

The War Table Banner is a decorative banner obtained by defeating the Dark Mage in the Old One's Army event. During the last Tier 1 wave, it has a 50% / 100% chance to drop; during the fourth and sixth Tier 3 waves, it has a 12.5% / 25% chance to drop. The Dark Mage drops 4 banners at a time.
Cryocore Brick Wall is a type of background wall crafted from Cryocore Bricks.

Deathweed Seeds are a type of seed that can be obtained from harvesting Deathweeds while they are blooming or using the Staff of Regrowth on naturally grown Deathweeds while they are fully grown. A Deathweed plant only blooms during Blood Moons, and Full Moons (only Blood Moons in Old-gen console version and Nintendo 3DS version). Its blooming state can be identified by the sickly red pods on its leaves. Each plant will drop 1-3 Deathweed Seeds when harvested while blooming.

Deathweed Seeds can be placed on Corrupt and Crimson grass, Ebonstone and Crimstone Blocks, empty Clay Pots, or any types of Planter Boxes (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), and will grow into harvestable Deathweeds. They will grow anywhere, not just in the evil biomes, but will only yield seeds when blooming.

The Glowing Snail is an uncommon critter that only spawns in Glowing Mushroom biomes. It is also quite large compared to its normal counterpart. The Glowing Snail has only 5 health and no defense, and can be damaged by other enemies and players.

The Glowing Snail can be caught with any Bug Net to be carried around in the inventory and released later, or crafted into animated decorative furniture (Glowing Snail Cage). Once crafted, the Glowing Snail cannot be released again, unless the furniture item is de-crafted via Shimmer (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions).
The Glowing Snail can be used as bait for fishing, with 15% bait power.
The Glowing Snail can be spawned by the Snail Statue, however statue-spawned critters cannot be caught with any Bug Net, and will disappear in a puff of smoke when the player attempts to do so.

The Fuzzy Carrot is a mount-summoning item that summons a rideable Bunny Mount. It has a top speed of 40 mph. The Fuzzy Carrot is obtained from the Angler as a reward for completing his 5th fishing quest.
The Scarlet Macaw and Blue Macaw are critters that spawn in the Jungle during the daytime.
Macaws have only 5 health and no defense, and can be damaged by other enemies and players.

Macaws can be caught with any Bug Net to be carried around in the inventory and released later, or crafted into animated decorative furniture (Scarlet / Blue Macaw Cage). Once crafted, the Macaws cannot be released again, unless the furniture item is de-crafted via Shimmer (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions).
Macaws can be spawned by the Macaw Statue, however statue-spawned critters cannot be caught with any Bug Net, and will disappear in a puff of smoke when the player attempts to do so.

The Enchanted Sword is a pre-Hardmode sword which occasionally fires an Enchanted Beam projectile when swung. It costs no ammunition or mana, deals the same damage as the sword, is not affected by gravity, and dissipates upon hitting an enemy or solid block. Both the sword and its projectiles produce lingering particles that emit large amounts of light.

The Enchanted Sword can be obtained by destroying an "enchanted sword in stone" background object, which can be found in random locations underground and in Enchanted Sword Shrines (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions). Destroying this background object has a 49/50 (98%) chance to drop an Enchanted Sword. The Enchanted Sword also has a 1/30 (3.33%) and 1/15 (6.67%) chance to be found in Golden and Titanium Crates respectively.
Its best modifier is Legendary.
The Ogre is a Hardmode mini-boss that spawns in the Old One's Army event during wave 7 in Tier 2, and waves 5 and 6 in Tier 3.

Luck is a hidden statistic that influences the random nature of various activities in Terraria. There are various ways to increase and decrease this statistic, such as buff potions and Torch placement. Players can estimate their luck value by speaking to the Wizard.

Luck influences many of Terraria's randomly-chosen items and events, such as the chances of item drops, rare enemy and critter spawns, certain town NPCs ' first appearances, or the Traveling Merchant 's inventory items.

The Celestial Wand is a pet-summoning item that spawns Estee to follow the player around. When the player is far enough away, Estee will emit a beam trail while flying at high speed in order to catch up to them, which resembles that of a Fallen Star. The Celestial Wand can be purchased from the Traveling Merchant for 1 PC, and is always sold alongside the Star Princess set.

The Rocket Launcher is a Hardmode, post- Plantera launcher that fires explosive rockets. The rockets fired by the Rocket Launcher are not affected by gravity and leave a trail of gray and orange smoke before exploding upon impact. Additionally, on the Desktop version, Console version, and Mobile version, rockets deal 200% or double the weapon's base damage (110 damage) upon directly hitting a target. The Rocket Launcher has a 1/18 (5.56%) / 35/324 (10.8%) chance of being dropped by Skeleton Commandos in the post-Plantera Dungeon.
(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) Its best modifier is Unreal.

(Old-gen console and 3DS versions) Its best modifier is Godly or Demonic. Both modifiers increase the average damage output by the same amount. However, Ruthless might be preferred if the player already has very high critical strike chance.

Fogbound Dye is a dye purchased from the Dye Trader while in a Graveyard (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) for 7 GC 50 SC. When equipped, it reduces the color saturation of the item and gives it a grayer tone, with a fog-like effect overlaying on top of the item.
The Stinger is a crafting material used in various Jungle-themed crafting recipes. It is obtained from Spiked Jungle Slimes, Hornets, and Moss Hornets found in the Underground Jungle biome.
Excluding the consumable items, crafting all items requires 58 Stingers.

The Sharkron is a Hardmode enemy fired by Duke Fishron 's Sharknado and Cthulhunado attacks. They will first spawn from within the Sharknado or Cthulhunado, staying inside it for some time before being launched directly at the player. They travel in an arc, descending at a slower speed after reaching maximum height. They are killed instantly upon impact with blocks.
Despite being shark-related, Sharkrons do not move faster in water.
The Medicated Bandage is an immunity accessory that combines the functions of the Adhesive Bandage and the Bezoar. This item grants immunity to any Bleeding and Poison debuffs.
It is one of the ingredients required to make the Ankh Charm, which is further required to make the Ankh Shield.

While the Medicated Bandage is exclusive to Hardmode on the Old-gen console version and Nintendo 3DS version, it can be obtained in pre-Hardmode on the Desktop version, Console version, and Mobile version, as it is possible to obtain the Adhesive Bandage by throwing the Bezoar into Shimmer (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions).

Movement speed is one of the player's stats and affects how quickly they can travel around. Many features can affect movement speed, such as Movement Accessories, Wings, Mounts, Minecarts and Liquids, along with certain Buffs, Debuffs, Armor and other hazards such as Ice Blocks and Cobwebs. Movement speed can be broken down into horizontal movement, which is the most affected component by most sources, and vertical movement, which is mostly affected by Wings and Movement Accessories.

Cenx's set are vanity developer items that can be obtained rarely (5% chance) from Treasure Bags dropped from Hardmode bosses (except Queen Slime 's). It is one of two vanity sets made for Cenx, the Creative Director on Terraria. Equipping the full set produces pink glowing particles when the player is near a light source. These items are to be equipped in the Social Slots as they only provide a visual appearance.
Cenx's equipment also includes a non-vanity item, which will drop in addition to her clothing set:
Cenx's Wings

Cenx's Dress set, another vanity set created for Cenx, has the same chance of being dropped by Treasure Bags. One bag will never contain all of Cenx's items, due to there being two sets. They will always, however, contain Cenx's Wings and Cenx's Tiara.

The Bat Hook is a rare pre-Hardmode grappling hook that fires a single hook which reaches 31.25 tiles at maximum length, and has the longest reach of all pre-Hardmode hooks. The Bat Hook has a 149/22500 (0.66%) chance of being obtained from Goodie Bags.
On Old-gen console and 3DS, the Bat Hook has a pull-in speed of 16 and a hook velocity of 15.5. This is the fastest pull-in speed of any hook in the game.

On the Desktop version, Console version, and Mobile version, the Bat Hook has a pull-in speed of 13 and a hook velocity of 13.5, which still makes it a very fast hook that can be acquired in the early game. However, some players may find a multi-hook (such as the Ivy Whip) preferable.
Ancient Obsidian Brick Wall is a type of background wall crafted from Ancient Obsidian Bricks. Its appearance is based on the sprite of Obsidian Brick Wall prior to 1.2.

The Ancient Vision is a Hardmode, post- Golem enemy that can spawn during the Lunatic Cultist boss encounter. It is only summoned if a player attacks a duplicate of the Lunatic Cultist while a Phantasm Dragon is still alive. The Ancient Vision attacks by repeatedly charging at the player horizontally, back and forth, similar to Mothron 's charge attacks. The Ancient Vision leaves behind afterimages as it flies.

The Magma Skull is a pre-Hardmode immunity accessory that grants the player immunity from blocks that inflict the Burning debuff and grants immunity to lava for 7 seconds. The Magma Skull can also be worn in a Social Accessory Slot as a vanity head item.

The Ham Bat is a Hardmode sword that gains slightly increased damage if a food buff is active; see the table on the right. It has a 1/25 (4%) chance of being dropped by Pigrons. In a Constant world, the drop chance is increased to 1/10 (10%).

Killing an enemy with the Ham Bat grants the Hearty Meal buff, which increases the player's health regeneration by 3 per second. This lasts for 7 seconds, but can be canceled at any time  by right-clicking the icon,  by selecting the icon using Cycle Next/Previous Buff and then pressing Remove Buff, or  by double-tapping the buff icon. Hearty Meal will not stack upon killing another enemy; the duration instead resets.
Its best modifier is Legendary.
Fruits are a subcategory of food. All fruits are acquired by shaking various types of trees.
Copper armor is an armor set that is one of the most simply craftable armor sets in the game. It consists of a Copper Helmet, Copper Chainmail and Copper Greaves.
Its alternate ore counterpart is the Tin armor.

It takes a total of (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) 48 / (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) 60 Copper Bars to craft a full suit, or (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) 144 / (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) 180 Copper Ores.

The Giant Flying Fox is a Hardmode bat enemy that spawns only on the surface of the Jungle at night, in addition to the common Jungle Bats and in place of the Derplings that spawn during the day. In Expert Mode, it can inflict the Feral Bite debuff. Giant Flying Foxes can deal significant damage to a player, and without any knockback resistance, can push players down Jungle caves. They pose a significant threat to early Hardmode characters.

The Rolling Cactus is a placeable object that behaves similarly to the Boulder. Rolling Cacti are naturally generated all throughout the Underground Desert but do not respawn once they have been activated. It is stationary when placed, and begins to move when hit by projectiles, pickaxes, or drills, or when the blocks under it are mined or hammered. Its roll direction is determined by whether its horizontal position in the world is an odd or even number, regardless of the slope of the surface it is on (unless it is blocked on one side by blocks, in which case it rolls in the other direction).
When both blocks under a Rolling Cactus are removed or hammered into a half-block, it will drop vertically until it hits a surface, then bounce and roll.

A Rolling Cactus projectile pierces an unlimited number of entities. When a Rolling Cactus that has already started rolling falls onto a lower surface, it maintains its forward momentum while bouncing back up, releasing 3-5 Rolling Cactus Spikes that travel in random directions. Hitting a vertical obstacle also releases Spikes, but destroys the Rolling Cactus. A Rolling Cactus' movement is affected by liquids, and it can roll uphill.

A stationary Rolling Cactus deals 25 damage when a player touches it. A Rolling Cactus projectile deals 70 / 140 / 210 damage to players (35 damage to NPCs, enemies, and critters) and inflicts a knockback value of 10 (Extremely strong) upon contact. Rolling Cactus Spikes deal 60 / 120 / 180 damage to players (30 damage to NPCs, enemies, and critters), inflict a knockback value of 2 (Very weak), pierce entities, and break upon contact with solid tiles.

The Treasure Magnet is a post- Skeletron accessory which increases the pickup range of items from 2.625 tiles to 12 tiles while equipped. When an item is within its range, before directly flying to the player, it will hover a few blocks off the ground. The Treasure Magnet has a 1/5 (20%) chance of being found in Shadow Chests in the Underworld, as well as a 1/5 (20%) chance of being found in Obsidian Lock Boxes obtained from Obsidian Crates and Hellstone Crates.
The Bezoar is an immunity accessory that grants the player immunity to the Poisoned debuff. It has a 1/100 (1%) / 1/50 (2%) chance to drop from Hornets, Moss Hornets, and Toxic Sludges.
It is one of the ingredients required to make the Medicated Bandage, which is a crafting material required to make the Ankh Charm, an accessory further required to make the Ankh Shield.

The Moth is a rare Hardmode enemy that spawns in the Underground Jungle. It flies around very slowly, and upon seeing the player, will direct its attention towards them and attempt to deal contact damage. Upon killing a Moth, there is a chance that it will drop Butterfly Dust, which is solely used to craft Butterfly Wings. On the Desktop version, Console version, and Mobile version, the Butterfly Dust can only drop once any mechanical boss has been defeated in the current world.

It is one of the few entities that can be detected by the Lifeform Analyzer (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) or its upgrades. The Moth requires 25 kills to be awarded completion of its Bestiary entry and corresponding banner, as opposed to the usual 50 kills.

The Spiked Jungle Slime is a pre-Hardmode enemy and a slime variant that spawns in the Underground Jungle. It fires Jungle Spikes at the player which have a chance to inflict the Poisoned debuff. In Expert Mode (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), it can also fire five Jungle Spikes at once around itself in a short range.
Like most other slimes, the Spiked Jungle Slime will be passive towards any player with the Royal Gel (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) accessory equipped.

Slime Rain is a minor event that consists of frequent spawns of Green, Blue, and Purple Slimes, and rarely Pinky. It occurs randomly, signaling its beginning with the status message " Slime is falling from the sky! ". Slime Rain continues until 150 slimes have been defeated, at which point King Slime will spawn. If King Slime has previously been defeated in the world, he will spawn after only 75 slimes have been defeated. The event ends shortly after he is defeated or despawns. All slimes spawned during the event will exhibit hostile behavior towards the player when spawned, unlike naturally spawned slimes.

While a Slime Rain is active, Green, Blue, and Purple Slimes will appear to fall in the background. The event can last anywhere from 9 to 15 in-game hours. If the player fails to defeat 150 / 75 slimes by the end of the Slime Rain, the status message " Slime has stopped falling from the sky. " will appear and the Slime Rain will end naturally without King Slime spawning. The event does not end if the player leaves the world.

The Cascade is a pre-Hardmode -only, post- Skeletron yoyo and is the most powerful yoyo available in pre-Hardmode. Upon striking enemies, it has a 1/3 (33.33%) chance to inflict the On Fire! debuff for 1-4 seconds. The Cascade has a 1/400 (0.25%) chance of being dropped by any enemy in or near The Underworld after Skeletron has been defeated. Once Hardmode begins, it will no longer drop, as the stronger Hel-Fire will drop instead.
It has a spin duration of 13 seconds and can reach up to 14.5 tiles.

Its best modifier is Godly or Demonic. Both modifiers increase the average damage output by the same amount. However, Ruthless might be preferred if the player already has very high critical strike chance.

The Lichen Stone Wall, Leafy Jungle Wall, Ivy Stone Wall, and Jungle Vine Wall are types of background walls which can be found naturally generated in the Underground Jungle, considered unsafe. They do not drop as an item when destroyed, and can only be obtained on the Desktop, Console, and Mobile, via crafting. They are considered safe walls when placed by the player.
The Tavernkeep is a unique NPC vendor who only accepts Defender Medals as currency for most items instead of coins. He will move in once the following criteria have been met:

There is an available vacant house. Rescuing him as the Unconscious Man, who can be encountered in any layer once the Eater of Worlds or Brain of Cthulhu has been defeated. Interacting with him in this state with ⚷ Open / Activate will wake him. If the Unconscious Man is killed, he will still be able to respawn afterwards; if the Tavernkeep NPC is killed, he will move in again after some time as long as there are vacant houses.

The Tavernkeep sells sentry summon weapons which are associated with the Old One's Army event, and at first, can only be used within that event. They function elsewhere only after the event is completed once successfully. Each of the Tavernkeep's sentry summon weapons come in three tiers: rod, cane, and staff, with the staff being the most expensive and the most powerful. The armor he sells also associates each sentry type with a specific class: Ballista for melee or tank-style users, Flameburst for magic users, Explosive Trap for rangers, and Lightning Aura for "speedy melee" (or summoners).

When the player selects the " Eternia Crystal " option for the first time, the Tavernkeep will give the player 10 Defender Medals for free. All future Defender Medals must be earned by either defeating the Old One's Army outright or by clearing its later waves.

The Tavernkeep throws mugs of Ale at nearby enemies to defend himself when threatened, dealing 24 / 36 / 42 damage at the start of the game. As players progress he will gain various stat increases. The Tavernkeep also has a 1/6 (16.67%) chance of dropping the Ale Tosser upon death.
The Unconscious Man is one of the few entities that can be detected by the Lifeform Analyzer or its upgrades.

The Chlorophyte Claymore is a Hardmode sword which occasionally fires a Chlorophyte Orb projectile when swung. It costs no ammunition or mana, deals the same damage as the sword, can pierce an infinite number of enemies, and dissipates upon hitting a solid block. The Chlorophyte Claymore is the slower but more powerful sword of the two that can be crafted from Chlorophyte Bars, with the other being the Chlorophyte Saber.

The Chlorophyte Orb behaves the same way as the Magic Dagger, but has a larger hitbox. Like the Magic Dagger, the orb travels in a straight line at a constant speed for a short distance before dropping steeply and falling faster. Upon impact, the orb implodes and emits a light, sparkly-green particle effect.
Its best modifier is Legendary.

The Aglet is an accessory that  increases the player's movement speed by 5%. It can be found in surface Chests, Wooden Crates and Pearlwood Crates (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions). On the Desktop version, Console version, and Mobile version, it is also sold by the Skeleton Merchant for 2 GC 50 SC during a New Moon.
The Tungsten Shortsword is an early game metal shortsword. Its alternate ore counterpart is the Silver Shortsword.

Like all shortswords, the Tungsten Shortsword has a very limited range and attacks with a stabbing motion at any direction on Desktop, Console, and Mobile, and horizontally in front of the player on Old-gen console and 3DS, instead of an arc. This makes it almost useless against flying or jumping enemies, although its high attack rate makes it somewhat effective against weaker fighter type enemies.
Its best modifier is Legendary.

The Chlorophyte Bullet is a Hardmode type of bullet that is capable of homing into enemies, turning sharply in midair and even curving instantly around to hit enemies behind the player. They will home in on the closest target first but if that one is killed, any remaining airborne pellets will change targets, going after the next one. Chlorophyte Bullets will also produce a momentary streak effect that emits a large amount of green light.

The Angler Tackle Bag is an accessory that combines the functionality of its components: the Angler Earring 's +10 boost to Fishing power, the Tackle Box 's chance to not consume bait, and the unbreakable quality of the High Test Fishing Line.

The Angler Tackle Bag's increase in fishing power stacks with that of the Angler Earring and Lavaproof Tackle Bag, granting a total boost of +30 if all three are equipped. The decreased chance to consume bait does not stack with that of the Tackle Box or the Lavaproof Tackle Bag.
Living Leaf Wall is a type of wall. Like other player-crafted walls, it can be used for valid housing.

The Celebration is a Hardmode, post- Golem launcher that fires two firework rocket projectiles at once (but only consumes one unit of rocket) that travel a short distance before exploding. The Celebration can be purchased from the Party Girl for 80 GC.
Its best modifier is Unreal.

The Brain of Confusion is a pre-Hardmode accessory that, upon taking damage while equipped, nearby enemies have a 3/5 (60%) chance of receiving the Confused debuff for at minimum 1.5 seconds. The chance, duration, and area of effect of the debuff are based on the amount of damage taken.

Furthermore, the player wielding it has a 1/6 (16.67%) chance of dodging an attack, which inflicts the Cerebral Mindtrick debuff on them for four seconds. Despite being a debuff, it increases critical strike chance and summon damage by 10%. While the debuff is active, the player cannot dodge another attack. The Brain of Confusion is always dropped from the Brain of Cthulhu 's Treasure Bag in Expert Mode.

The Chlorophyte Extractinator is a Hardmode, post- mechanical bosses upgrade to the Extractinator. It is an item that converts Silt, Slush, and Desert Fossils into more valuable items such as ores, coins, and gems, as well as fishing trash into low level bait. The Chlorophyte Extractinator converts items faster, and can produce Hardmode ores ; it can also exchange Glowing Mosses into all kinds of mosses (except Helium Moss), instead of only regular ones.

It can also turn the Corruption, Crimson, and Hallow variants of most blocks into their normal variants. Alongside this, it can also be used to convert ores/bars into their alternate ore types (such as Tin being converted into Copper), and Dungeon Bricks into their variants.

To use the Chlorophyte Extractinator, it first needs to be placed in the world. Afterward, suitable blocks need to be consumed (with the ⚒ Use / Attack key) directly on the Chlorophyte Extractinator within its 3x3 frame. Holding the Auto Select key and clicking on the Chlorophyte Extractinator will automatically insert extractable items from the player's inventory without having to pick them up manually.

The Titanium Pickaxe is a Hardmode pickaxe and the pickaxe alternative to the Titanium Drill, having a slower mining speed but longer range and benefiting from mining speed bonuses. Its alternate ore counterpart, the Adamantite Pickaxe, is slightly weaker than the Titanium Pickaxe.
It can mine all blocks except Chlorophyte Ore and Lihzahrd Bricks.
Its best modifier is Legendary. However, due to rounding, Legendary, Light, Deadly, Agile, Quick, and Nasty provide equal boosts to mining speed for this tool.

The Lucky Horseshoe is an accessory that negates fall damage and grants +0.05 luck (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions). The Lucky Horseshoe has a (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) 1/4 (25%) / (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) 1/3 (33.33%) chance of being found inside Skyware Chests on Floating Islands, as well as a 1/4 (25%) chance of being obtained from Sky Crates (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) and Azure Crates (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions).
Gold Starry Wall is a background wall made from Gold Starry Blocks. It is one of only a few animated background walls.

Souls are Hardmode crafting materials dropped by enemies. There are a total of 6 types of souls. The most common ones are the Souls of Light and Night, which are dropped in the Cavern layer of Underground Hallow and Underground Corruption / Crimson, respectively. For detailed info about the condition of enemies dropping these souls, see Notes. Most of the remaining souls drop from the mechanical bosses.
The Crimtane Brick Wall is a type of Wall made from Crimtane Brick. It has a red and black appearance.

Crimstone Brick is a type of brick. Unlike its raw block counterpart, the Crimstone Block, it does not spread the Crimson, nor does it turn the area into a Crimson biome, thus making it a safe construction material for NPC houses and other structures. Its Corruption counterpart is Ebonstone Brick.
Lava Moss Brick is a type of brick that glows in the dark, similar to how the Lava Moss glows. It will always glow with the same coloration regardless of the paint that is applied to it.

The Shark Bait is a pet-summoning item that summons a pet Shark Pup. When underwater, the Shark Pup swims around freely. When out of water, it is encased in a bubble. When the player is too far away, the Shark Pup will move swiftly toward them. The Shark Bait has a 1/2 (50%) chance of being found in Water Chests and a 1/10 (10%) chance of being found in Ocean and Seaside Crates.

The Karate Tortoise set is a vanity set that can be obtained from Goodie Bags during Halloween, with a 2/57 (3.51%) chance. It consists of a Karate Tortoise Mask, Karate Tortoise Shirt and Karate Tortoise Pants. Its male and female variants look identical.
These items are to be equipped in the Social Slots as they only provide a visual appearance.

The Bubblegum Block is a building material crafted from Stone Blocks and Orichalcum Ore. When placed, it resembles Stone Blocks coated with bubblegum. It is essentially the Orichalcum Ore's equivalent of a brick.

Rain is an event that occurs randomly [a] and affects all surface biomes for its duration. It can last anywhere between 8 minutes [b] and 61 minutes 30 seconds [c] (potentially spanning both day and night portions); the average duration is 19 minutes 50 seconds [d]. When a player is in a Snow biome during Rain, it appears as a Blizzard, causing snowfall volume to increase. (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) Additionally, a special visual effect is displayed during Blizzards.

Rain is primarily an aesthetic effect, only visible on the surface : It displays Rain/Blizzard graphics, darkened ambient sun/moon light, increased cloud cover, and altered music. There are, however, some functional effects.

The event spawns variants of some regular enemies, but also a few unique enemies, and certain critters behave differently. Some comical effects include Zombies wearing raincoats, slimes carrying umbrellas, and Goldfish walking upright on land, using their tail fins to casually shuffle about (swimming Goldfish will exit water and walk, and walking Goldfish will also spawn on land).

On the Desktop version, Console version, and Mobile version, Rain has three different variations; Light Rain, regular Rain, and Heavy Rain. The heavier the rainfall, the dimmer the sunlight will be, with Heavy Rain causing noticeable darkness. These variations are only graphical, can be detected with a Weather Radio, and can change multiple times throughout a single downpour. (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) If a Windy Day occurs at the same time as regular or Heavy Rain, it will result in a Thunderstorm.
On the Desktop version, Console version, and Mobile version, the chance for Rain to occur can be boosted by killing regular Ladybugs.
Rain does not produce new water tiles, nor does it cause existing water levels to rise, and it has no effect on lava or honey tiles.
Other effects include the following:

There is a +20% Fishing Power bonus in all liquid bodies during Rain. Waterleaf blooms. Worms spawn frequently in Forest biomes. NPCs remain in their houses, as if it were night. (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) The player character will squint in Blizzards if they are outside.

Obsidian furniture can be found in, and looted from, Ruined Houses in the Underworld (with the exception of the chest and sink, which are crafted), which makes them non-renewable per world. Placed Obsidian furniture is not destroyed upon contact with Lava.
Spectre armor is a Hardmode, post- Plantera armor set that offers magic weapon boosts.
The set consists of the Spectre Robe and Spectre Pants, as well as two different headpieces, the Spectre Hood and the Spectre Mask.

Equipping the full set causes small white orbs to manifest whenever the player hits an enemy with a magic weapon. The effect of these orbs depends on the headpiece option chosen: The Spectre Mask causes the orbs to act as homing projectiles, while the Spectre Hood causes the orbs to travel to a player, healing them.

Spectre Mask set bonus: Homing orb projectiles spawn when dealing magic damage to an enemy, which attack nearby enemies, or the same enemy. The orbs deal 100% of the damage dealt by the magic weapon fired, before it is doubled by a critical hit (if a critical hit deals 200 damage, the orb will have 100 base damage). The orb projectile itself can deal critical hits.

Spectre Hood set bonus: Lifesteal orbs spawn when dealing magic damage to an enemy, which fly to the player and restore health by 20% of damage done (e.g. dealing 50 magic damage heals 10 health). In multiplayer, the player with the lowest health on the team is healed instead. Equipping the full set with the Spectre Hood incurs a 40% magic damage decrease.

Crafting a full set with one headpiece requires 54 Spectre Bars (27 Ectoplasm and 270 Chlorophyte Ore). The full set with both headpieces requires 66 Spectre Bars (33 Ectoplasm and 330 Chlorophyte Ore).

The Ghost set is a vanity set. It has a 2/57 (3.51%) chance to drop from Goodie Bags during Halloween. It consists of a Ghost Mask and Ghost Shirt. When a player wearing it is killed, the set parts float down into the ground and the player's severed remains do not appear. The set also becomes transparent, possibly meaning the player becomes a ghost, however the set parts are still separated.
These items are to be equipped in the Social Slots as they only provide a visual appearance.

The Frog Webbing is an accessory crafted from a Frog Leg and a Tiger Climbing Gear. It combines the abilities of these two items, increasing the player's jump speed and safe falling distance, allowing auto-jump, and granting enhanced mobility on walls.

The Stardust Cell Staff is a Hardmode, post- Lunatic Cultist summon weapon that summons a Stardust Cell (a minion version of the Star Cell enemy) that can perform ranged attacks and will teleport to enemies out of range. Like other minions, the summoned Stardust Cell is invincible and follows the player until they die, summon a replacement minion, cancel the buff, or leave the world.

The Stardust Cell's ranged attack consists of firing a Stardust Cell Shot, a miniature version of itself, at an enemy target. The mini-cell damages and attaches itself to the target, and then deals 20 damage per second for 5 seconds. A maximum of 10 mini-cells can attach to one target at the same time, for a maximum of 200 damage per second. Internally, the enemy is inflicted with the Celled debuff during this time, which has no other effects beyond the damage over time. Additionally, the Stardust Cell will occasionally fire an extra shot at any target the player is attacking, without interrupting its standard rate of fire, even if it is already currently attacking that target. After teleporting to an enemy, a Stardust Cell will also instantly fire a mini-cell.

Its best modifier is Ruthless. The Mythical modifier provides the widest array of stat bonuses, but these primarily affect the initial summon rather than the resulting minion. Additionally, minions cannot deal critical hits. The only lasting advantage a Mythical Stardust Cell Staff has over a Ruthless one is knockback.

Will's set are vanity developer items that can be obtained rarely (5% chance) from Treasure Bags dropped from Hardmode bosses (except Queen Slime 's). It is the vanity set made for Phlebas, an artist who formerly developed graphics for Terraria. Equipping the full set produces a glow effect similar to Spooky armor and grants an after-image movement effect similar to Ninja armor.
These items are to be equipped in the Social Slots as they only provide a visual appearance.
Will's equipment also includes a non-vanity item, which will drop in addition to his clothing set:
Will's Wings

The Apple is a food and fruit item that grants the Well Fed buff when consumed. This lasts for 5 minutes, but can be canceled at any time  by right-clicking the icon,  by selecting the icon using Cycle Next/Previous Buff and then pressing Remove Buff, or  by double-tapping the buff icon.
It has a small chance of dropping when shaking a Forest tree.
Like all other food items, the Apple can be placed on a Plate :

The Frozen Crown is a Hardmode, post- Plantera pet-summoning item that spawns a miniature Ice Queen pet to follow the player around. The Frozen Crown is dropped by the Ice Queen in Master Mode with a 1/8 (12.5%) - 1/4 (25%) chance depending on the current wave.

The Crimstone Wall is a type of background wall which can be found naturally generated in The Crimson, considered unsafe. It does not drop as an item when destroyed, and can only be obtained on Desktop, Console, and Mobile, via crafting. It is considered a safe wall when placed by the player.
The Clentaminator / Terraformer (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) (using Red Solution) and Blood Water convert Stone Walls to unsafe Crimstone Walls.
Crimstone Walls can spread The Crimson to nearby pure walls. See Biome spread for further information.

Platinum Brick is a type of Brick and an aesthetic building material. Like the ore it's made of, placed Platinum Bricks will sparkle. Despite being made of Platinum, it has no sell value. It can be crafted into Platinum Brick Walls.
Red Snappers are a type of fish which are found commonly by fishing in the Ocean in the Sky or Surface layers. They are used to craft Cooked Fish and Sashimi.

Luminite Axes are tools which are currently unobtainable. The four types are the Solar Flare Axe, Vortex Axe, Nebula Axe, and the Stardust Axe, each themed after a different Celestial Tower. They are all unable to be crafted, and instead the player must craft the Luminite Hamaxes. Even with Terrasavr and some other inventory editors, they seem to disappear, leaving an empty slot.
Their best modifier is Light for harvesting purposes and Legendary for combat purposes.

The Gemstone Walls are types of background walls. Except for the Amber Stone Wall, they can be found naturally generated in Gemstone Caves, considered unsafe. They do not drop as an item when destroyed, and can only be obtained on the Desktop, Console, and Mobile, via crafting. They are considered safe walls when placed by the player.

The Sandstone Wall, Ebonsandstone Wall, Crimsandstone Wall, and Pearlsandstone Wall are types of background walls which can be found naturally generated in the Underground Desert, considered unsafe. Underground Deserts generate by default the normal Sandstone Sand Wall which may be converted into the respective variant if exposed to the Corruption, Crimson, or Hallow. Converted Sandstone Walls may further spread conversion to other walls; see Biome spread for more information. Unsafe Sandstone Walls do not drop as items when destroyed, and can only be obtained via crafting. They are considered safe walls when placed by the player.
The Treacherous Sandstone Wall is an item that places an unsafe Sandstone Wall. It is visually identical and is obtained by throwing a Sandstone Wall into Shimmer.

The Chair is a type of furniture item that can be placed on the ground. They count as a comfort item, which is one of the required elements in order to make a house suitable for an NPC. In combination with a Work Bench or a Table, they also form minor crafting stations.
(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) Players can sit in chairs by using ⚷ Open / Activate on them and get a boost on health regeneration, similar to beds and sofas. NPCs can sit on chairs too.
All chairs are 1 tile wide, 2 tiles high, and must be placed on top of a solid block or platform.

Also see Throne, which also fulfills a house's comfort item requirement. Including the Throne and Bar Stool, there are (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) 47 / (Old-gen console version) 28 / (3DS version) 25 varieties of chairs.

The Frost Daggerfish is a consumable ranged weapon. It can pierce up to 2 targets, hitting a total of 3 targets. Depending to player's final Fishing Power, from 7 to 137 Frost Daggerfish can be fished from lakes in Snow biomes at a time. When thrown, the Frost Daggerfish acts similarly to Shurikens or Throwing Knives, flying in an arc and then spinning to the ground, where they break upon impact and cannot be recovered.
The Angler uses Frost Daggerfish to defend himself against nearby enemies.

The Stellar Tune is a Hardmode, post- Plantera magic weapon that fires pairs of star-shaped projectiles that travel in a wave-like pattern toward the cursor and home in on enemies, travel through solid blocks, and explode in a small radius upon impact. Star projectiles will have their damage reduced by 25% (down to 63 base damage) when the line of sight between the player and the projectiles' point of impact is obstructed. It also plays an acoustic guitar chord when fired based on the distance between the player and the cursor (in a similar fashion to the Magical Harp). There are a total of six chords, and each one spans about a four-block distance from the player, except for the last one, which is played at a distance of 21 blocks or more.

The distance from the player to the cursor also controls the speed at which projectiles are fired. However, if the star projectiles are seeking an enemy, they will instead determine their speed based on the distance between them and their target. The Stellar Tune also has a base 24% critical strike chance as opposed to the usual 4%. The Stellar Tune has a 1/50 (2%) / 1/20 (5%) chance of being dropped by the Empress of Light.
Its best modifier is Mythical.

The Venom Dart Trap is a Hardmode trap that fires a venomous dart when triggered via wire. It is a direct upgrade to the Dart Trap. It has a cooldown period of 3 1/3 seconds between firings. The darts deal 60 / 120 / 180 damage to players and 30 damage to NPCs, enemies, and critters, as well as inflicting Acid Venom for 5 / 10 / 12.5 seconds to players (75/ 150 / 187.5 damage) and 5 seconds of Acid Venom to NPCs, enemies, and critters (150 damage).
Venom Dart Traps can be rotated 90° with a hammer.
Venom Dart Traps do not generate naturally, and can only be obtained via crafting.

The Goblin Thief is a pre-Hardmode enemy that spawns during the Goblin Army event. It follows the typical Fighter AI but moves at a higher speed than similar enemies. Approximately one out of every six goblins will be a Thief (15.8% chance to spawn).

Goblin Thieves are between the Goblin Peon and the Goblin Warrior in terms of difficulty. They can jump quite high and can open Tall Gates (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) faster than other fighters. Uniquely, they destroy doors instead of just opening them.
Bee armor is an armor set which offers minion boosts. It is one of 3 minion-boosting armors available prior to Hardmode.
A full set of Bee armor provides the following benefits:
+13 defense +23% summon damage +2 minion slots
Crafting a full set requires a total of 30 Bee Wax. Bee Wax is always dropped by Queen Bee in stacks of 14-26 / 16-29 ; crafting the entire set therefore requires defeating Queen Bee twice.

The Goblin Peon is a pre-Hardmode enemy that spawns during the Goblin Army event. It is the event's most basic enemy and follows the Fighter AI. Approximately one out of every five goblins will be a Peon (17.8% chance to spawn). It has the unique ability to destroy doors that are in its way (destroyed doors drop as collectible items).
The Goblin Peon is only two tiles tall (instead of the 3-tile player height) and can fit through smaller gaps in the player's walls.

An invincibility frame (also known as immune frame, immunity frame, or invulnerability frame, sometimes abbreviated to iframe or i-frame) is a brief period of time during which an entity cannot take any damage. It is usually granted immediately after taking damage.

The general purpose of invincibility frames is to prevent an entity from taking too much damage from continuous or rapidly repeated damage sources. For instance, a player submerged in lava would take damage from it every tick, i.e. 60 times per second. Instead, they receive an invincibility frame after taking damage which renders them temporarily invincible to further damage for a very short time.
Players in particular are also granted invincibility frames under a few other conditions, not just taking damage.

Blinkroot Seeds are a type of seed that can be obtained from harvesting Blinkroots while they are blooming or using the Staff of Regrowth on naturally grown Blinkroots while they are fully grown. A Blinkroot plant switches between its blooming and non-blooming state at random. Its blooming state can be identified by the yellow dots on the ends of its fronds and the blinking light it emits. Each plant will drop 1-3 Blinkroot Seeds when harvested while blooming.

Blinkroot Seeds can be placed on Dirt and Mud Blocks, empty Clay Pots, or any types of Planter Boxes (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), and will grow into harvestable Blinkroots. They will grow anywhere, not just in the Underground, but will only yield seeds when blooming.

The Nectar is a pet-summoning item that spawns a Baby Hornet pet to follow the player around. This pet will not teleport to the player when it is far away. The Nectar has a 1/15 (6.67%) / 1/9 (11.11%) chance of being dropped by the Queen Bee.
Silly Tied Balloons are animated novelty furniture items that can be purchased during a Party from the Party Girl for 10 SC each.

The Mysterious Tablet is a background object which spawns at the entrance of the Dungeon after Golem is defeated. Players cannot interact with it in any way, as it serves only as a graphical prop for the Cultists ' ritual and the spawning of the Lunatic Cultist.

The Mysterious Tablet spawns surrounded by four initially passive Cultists, two of them being Lunatic Devotees and the others being Cultist Archers. Once all four Cultists are killed, the Lunatic Cultist spawns, destroying the Tablet and starting its boss fight.

The Mysterious Tablet will respawn (including the Cultists) after 12 minutes (12 in-game hours), if the player runs away or dies during the Lunatic Cultist fight, when all four Celestial Pillars are destroyed, or when the world is closed and restarted. Restarting the world can be the fastest option to reset the Tablet and the Cultists to their original state.

The Moss Hornet is a Hardmode flying enemy similar to the pre-Hardmode Hornet, being encountered in the Underground Jungle biome and requiring blocks of Jungle Grass in order to spawn. Compared to the more random flying patterns of pre-Hardmode Hornets, Moss Hornets act more aggressively, hovering closer to the player's position and shooting their stingers in rapid bursts. The stingers have a 1/3 (33.33%) chance to inflict the Poisoned debuff to the player for 10 seconds. In Expert Mode (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), the chance is 1/3 (33.33%) for 20 seconds and 2/3 (66.67%) for 2-10 seconds. They cannot be destroyed with weapons and travel at about the same speed as the darts from a Dart Trap.

Moss Hornets have a (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) 1/100 (1%) / (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) 1/150 (0.67%) chance to drop the Tattered Bee Wing. On the Desktop version, Console version, and Mobile version, the Tattered Bee Wing will only drop once any mechanical boss has been defeated in the current world.

Hardmode, true to its name, is a more difficult version of the initial world. A world permanently changes into Hardmode after the Wall of Flesh is defeated for the first time, granting players new challenges and much more content to explore.
Enabling Hardmode in a world is necessary for game progression, as several new bosses leading up to the game's final boss only become available to fight in this world state.
On the Nintendo 3DS version, when the Wall of Flesh is defeated, a pop-up box will briefly appear describing Hardmode while the world is being converted.
The Tin Shortsword is an early game metal shortsword. Its alternate ore counterpart is the Copper Shortsword.

Like all shortswords, the Tin Shortsword has a very limited range and attacks with a stabbing motion at any direction on Desktop, Console, and Mobile, and horizontally in front of the player on Old-gen console and 3DS, instead of an arc. This makes it almost useless against flying or jumping enemies, although its high attack rate makes it somewhat effective against weaker fighter type enemies.
Its best modifier is Legendary.

Lazure's set are vanity developer items that can be obtained rarely (5% chance) from Treasure Bags dropped from Hardmode bosses (except Queen Slime 's). It is the vanity set made for Lazure, a former artist at Re-Logic.
These items are to be equipped in the Social Slots as they only provide a visual appearance.
Lazure's equipment also includes these non-vanity items, which will drop in addition to his clothing set:
Lazure's Barrier Platform Valkyrie Yoyo

The Vampire Knives are a Hardmode, post- Plantera melee weapon that rapidly fires a spread of 4 to 8 red knife projectiles at a maximum spread of approximately 45°. They are not affected by gravity. After traveling 28 tiles, they will spin and fade, their damage decreasing gradually. They will dissipate after another 26 tiles (54 tiles total range). Upon enemy hits, red knives cause a lifesteal effect which heals the player by 7.5% of the damage dealt (rounded down). The Vampire Knives are always found in the Dungeon 's Crimson Chest, which can only be unlocked with a Crimson Key after Plantera has been defeated.

Its best modifier is Godly or Demonic. Both modifiers increase the average damage output by the same amount. However, Ruthless might be preferred if the player already has very high critical strike chance.

The Regal Delicacy is a Hardmode pet-summoning item that spawns a pet Slime Princess which follows the player around. The pet resembles a miniature Queen Slime with blush, small, dotted eyes, and a tiny mouth. The Regal Delicacy has a 1/4 (25%) chance of being dropped by Queen Slime in Master Mode.

The Snake Charmer's Flute is a pre-Hardmode tool that places a pot from which a snake rises. Once the snake reaches its full height of 100 tiles or touches a block, it stops rising and becomes climbable like a rope. Blocks can also be placed next to the snake once it has fully extended. The snake and the pot disappear after approximately 25 seconds, and it also produces a small amount of light. The Snake Charmer's Flute can be found in Sandstone Chests in the top 4/7ths of the Underground Desert and in Oasis Crates and Mirage Crates obtained from fishing in the Oasis.

The Golden Delight is a food item that grants the Exquisitely Stuffed buff when consumed. This lasts for 48 minutes, but can be canceled at any time  by right-clicking the icon,  by selecting the icon using Cycle Next/Previous Buff and then pressing Remove Buff, or  by double-tapping the buff icon. It is crafted at the Cooking Pot with any gold critter.
Like all other food items, the Golden Delight can be placed on a Plate :

The Staff of the Frost Hydra is a Hardmode post- Plantera sentry summon weapon. It can summon the Frost Hydra sentry, which lasts for (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) 10 minutes / (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) 2 minutes, remains stationary, and does not count against the player's minion capacity. The Frost Hydra will fire ice pellets at enemies within 60 tiles. It will automatically angle its head up and down, and turn left and right, to target enemies in any direction. On Desktop version, Console version, and Mobile version, its projectiles can pierce twice, hitting up to 3 enemies, and applying a 15% damage penalty to the next hit for each enemy a projectile pierces, as well as inflict the Frostbite debuff. On the Old-gen console version and Nintendo 3DS version, its projectiles cannot pierce nor inflict any debuff.

The Frost Hydra can be summoned anywhere on the visible screen, even if blocks completely separate the player from the point clicked. It cannot, however, be summoned in the air, and will instead appear on the closest block or platform below the summoning point. The Staff of the Frost Hydra is always found in the Dungeon 's Ice Chest, which can only be unlocked with a Frozen Key after Plantera has been defeated.

Its best modifier is Ruthless. The Mythical modifier provides the widest array of stat bonuses, but these primarily affect the initial summon rather than the resulting minion. Additionally, minions cannot deal critical hits. The only lasting advantage a Mythical Staff of the Frost Hydra has over a Ruthless one is knockback.
The Fire Gauntlet is a Hardmode accessory that boosts melee weapons in the following ways:
Both the weapon sprite and projectile emit orange light particles that gives off light

They cause the (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) Hellfire / (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) On Fire! debuff (does not apply in PvP) +100% knockback (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) +12% / (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) +9% damage (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) +12% / (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) +9% attack speed (also applies to whips) (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) They gain autoswing (also applies to whips) (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) +10% size on some melee weapons
On the Desktop version, Console version, and Mobile version, the Fire Gauntlet is only available after defeating all three mechanical bosses.

The Gladius is a shortsword dropped by Hoplites with a 1/20 (5%) chance. It is one of the strongest shortswords in the game, surpassing the highest pre-Hardmode tier ore-based shortswords (Platinum Shortsword and Gold Shortsword).
Unlike other shortswords, it attacks three times in quick succession per use, with slightly varying angles with each stab.
Its best modifier is Legendary.
Potted Lava Plants are placeable furniture items. They have 1/2 (50%) chance of being dropped when opening an Obsidian Crate or Hellstone Crate.
They give off a considerable amount of light but do not count as light sources for NPC housing. They cannot be switched on or off using wiring.
Ash Wood armor is a pre-Hardmode armor set, and is the most powerful wooden armor set available in pre-Hardmode. Crafting the full set requires a total of 75 Ash Wood.
The set consists of the Ash Wood Helmet, the Ash Wood Breastplate, and the Ash Wood Greaves.
A full set of Ash Wood armor provides the following bonuses:
+7 defense Halves the contact damage of lava from 80 to 40. Halves the duration of the On Fire! debuff from contact with lava from 7 / 14 / 17.5 seconds to 3.5 / 7 / 8.75 seconds.

The Flask of Ichor is a Hardmode flask that causes melee weapons and whips (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) to inflict the Ichor debuff for 10-19 seconds on enemies hit. Melee weapons that fire projectiles will also inflict the debuff on enemies hit by the projectiles (except for the Flairon 's bubbles).

The Flask of Ichor cannot be used in conjunction with other flasks, and using it will remove any existing flask effects. (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) Like all other flasks, the effect will not be canceled when the player dies.
The Flask of Ichor will inflict the Ichor debuff in PvP scenarios.

The Pirate's Curse is a Hardmode enemy that spawns during the Pirate Invasion event when a Pirate Captain is defeated. It can fly and move through blocks. It is completely unaffected by all traps, making it difficult to avoid in automated farms.
If the player dies, it will momentarily hover and despawn.

The Endurance Potion is a buff potion which grants the Endurance buff when consumed. The buff reduces damage taken by 10%. This lasts for 4 minutes, but can be canceled at any time  by right-clicking the icon,  by selecting the icon using Cycle Next/Previous Buff and then pressing Remove Buff,  by selecting the icon and canceling it in the equipment menu,  by double-tapping the buff icon, or  by canceling the buff from the buffs screen.
The Switch is an activation mechanism purchased from the Mechanic for 20 SC. It can also be found in the Dungeon connected to Chain Lanterns, where it can be harvested with a Pickaxe or Drill.
The Switch can be placed on top or on the sides of blocks, or on the sides of Wooden Beams or trees. Switches can also be placed on background walls. It is activated by right-clicking on it.

Despite its name, the Switch does not need to act as an on/off mechanism. When wired to Dart Traps, for example, right-clicking the Switch will always cause the Trap to shoot, the same as a Pressure Plate would, no matter which position the switch happens to be in.

The Sandgun is a pre-Hardmode ranged weapon that uses Sand, Pearlsand, Ebonsand, or Crimsand as its ammunition, firing sand ball projectiles that are affected by gravity. After hitting an entity or object, if the hit location is not occupied, the sand ball will turn into the respective kind of Sand Block, otherwise it will disappear. When Pearlsand, Ebonsand, or Crimsand Blocks are used as ammo, the sand ball's base damage will be increased by 5, and it will be able to pierce an unlimited number of targets. All variants of Sand Blocks have the default damage value of −1, reducing the Sandgun's actual damage by 1.
Its best modifier is Unreal.

The Gingerbread Cookie is a food item that grants the (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) Exquisitely Stuffed / (Old-gen console version) Well Fed buff when consumed. This lasts for (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) 4 minutes / (Old-gen console version) 15 minutes, but can be canceled at any time  by right-clicking the icon,  by selecting the icon using Cycle Next/Previous Buff and then pressing Remove Buff,  by selecting the icon and canceling it in the equipment menu, or  by double-tapping the buff icon. The Gingerbread Cookie can be dropped from Presents obtained during the Christmas seasonal event, with a chance of 3.601% in pre-Hardmode and 3.361% in Hardmode.
Like all other food items, the Gingerbread Cookie can be placed on a Plate (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) :

Ancient Shadow armor is an armor set that reproduces the pre- 1.0.3 Shadow armor design, and is otherwise identical in all ways to the current Shadow armor set. Each piece is interchangeable with the equivalent Shadow armor piece, while still granting the same set bonus.

When the full set is equipped, the player will emit purple bubbles, and create a semi-transparent after-image effect behind themselves when moving. This effect appears to be clones of the player. These clones do not appear to have bodies inside of the armor, as there is no face prevalent.
Each piece has a 1/525 (0.19%) chance of being dropped by an Eater of Souls.

Stained Glass are a group of walls made from combining gems with Glass Walls. They work like the normal Glass Wall besides changing the color of the sunlight to match that of the stained glass. Multicolored Stained Glass causes sunlight to shift through the color spectrum in a similar manner to Rainbow Brick, although dimmer.

Chasms are deep tunnels found in The Corruption or The Crimson. They generally begin at surface openings, and are lined with a thick layer of Ebonstone / Crimstone, respectively. They tend to reach depths around where the Cavern layers begin. Large clusters of Corruption/Crimson enemies tend to spawn and collect in these cavities.
The Krampus is a Hardmode, post- Plantera enemy that begins to spawn during wave 8 of the Frost Moon event.
Defeating a Krampus during the Frost Moon event will add 10 / 20 / 25 points to the final score.

The Titanium Drill is a Hardmode drill, and is the drill alternative to the Titanium Pickaxe. In comparison to the Titanium Pickaxe, the drill is faster. But, unlike pickaxes, drills cannot be reforged with speed modifiers and are not boosted by Mining Speed bonuses.
It can mine all blocks except Chlorophyte Ore and Lihzahrd Bricks.

(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) Its best modifier is Godly or Demonic. Both modifiers increase the average damage output by the same amount. However, Ruthless might be preferred if the player already has very high critical strike chance.

(Old-gen console and 3DS versions) Its best modifier is Demonic, as it does not have any knockback and thus cannot get modifiers that affect it, and furthermore cannot get modifiers that affect its speed, either.

A Tombstone is a furniture item that drops when a player dies. It can then be retrieved and used much like a sign or as a form of decoration. By default, it contains the death message generated based on how the player died. On the Desktop version, Console version, and Mobile version, Tombstones created will show the real-life date the player died.

Upon death, a Tombstone will bounce around until it lands on a suitable 2-tile wide surface, where it will place itself. If a Tombstone cannot find a place to land (due to lack of suitable space), it cannot be retrieved and will eventually despawn. Two Tombstones cannot land on each other.
Variants are chosen randomly upon death. Golden Tombstones drop when the player had more than 10 GC in their inventory.

On the Desktop version, Console version, and Mobile version, having 4-8 Tombstones placed in close proximity will gradually darken and desaturate the environment. Five or more Tombstones placed in close proximity will generate a Graveyard mini-biome. Breaking a Tombstone may spawn a Ghost off-screen.

The Strange Looking Tombstone is a 3DS -exclusive Tombstone variant dropped when the Worm Pet is active at death. Its tooltip is "A Tombstone that kinda looks like a worm, right?". It can be re-placed after being mined.

In Hardcore, Tombstones cannot be easily obtained because death is permanent. Instead, on the Desktop version, Console version, and Mobile version, NPCs in worlds with Hardcore characters will drop Tombstones when they are killed. Variants are still chosen randomly; all NPCs drop a normal Tombstone except the Merchant and Tax Collector who drop a golden variant.

In For the worthy (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) and Get fixed boi (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) worlds, the Tombstone projectiles will deal damage to players. The amount of damage is currently unknown.
(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) Because Tombstones create Graveyards, and mark a place where a player had died, they are highlighted by Dangersense Potions.

Abigail's Flower (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) can be uncommonly found as a plant growing on grass near a placed Tombstone, regardless of world progression. Its spawn chance is increased in a Constant world.

The Sand Elemental is a rare Hardmode enemy that spawns in the Desert during Sandstorms. She attacks by summoning three Ancient Storms randomly around the general location of the player, which each lasts 5 seconds. The distance between them varies, and they remain stationary for their lifespan. The Sand Elemental cannot travel through blocks and flies in a non-linear pattern. She attempts to move toward the player and travels faster as her health is depleted. She has a guaranteed chance to drop a Forbidden Fragment, the main ingredient for the Forbidden armor, Spirit Flame, and Sandstorm in a Bottle.

She is one of the few entities that can be detected by the Lifeform Analyzer or its upgrades. The Sand Elemental requires 25 kills to be awarded completion of her Bestiary entry and corresponding banner, as opposed to the usual 50 kills.
Potted Trees are Hardmode decorative items purchased from the Dryad for 3 GC each.

The Buccaneer set is a vanity set which consists of the Buccaneer Bandana, the Buccaneer Tunic and the Buccaneer Pantaloons. These items are to be equipped in the Social Slots as they only provide a visual appearance.
They can be obtained as a rare drop from any Pirate Invasion enemy, except the Pirate Captain and Parrots.

The Spear Trap is a trap found naturally in the Jungle Temple and, rarely, outside the Temple's door. When activated, it launches a spear in a straight line that can pierce an infinite number of targets and retracts upon hitting a solid block or reaching its maximum range of 19.5 tiles. It has a cooldown of (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) 1.5 seconds / (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) 2 seconds between firings. The spear deals 120 / 240 / 360 damage to players (60 damage to NPCs, enemies, and critters).
(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) Spear Traps can be rotated 90° with a hammer.
(Old-gen console and 3DS versions) Unlike Lihzahrd Bricks, breaking Spear Traps does not require the Picksaw.

The Slime Banner is an uncommon enemy banner that is dropped from most slimes, with a 1/200 (0.5%) chance. It is purely for decoration.
The banner itself appears to be four Blue Slimes lined up.

Solar Dye is a Hardmode, endgame dye crafted from Solar Fragments dropped by the Solar Pillar from the Lunar Events. The dye gives a golden, metallic hue and a slight pulsating effect to anything used with it, similar to the Reflective Dyes obtainable from the Dye Trader 's Strange Plants quest. Unlike the Metallic dyes, however, items dyed with Solar Dye do not appear to dynamically reflect light, and have the same appearance regardless of the player's proximity to light sources. Also unlike the metallic dyes, dyed items periodically glow (without casting light).

The Martian Uniform set is a vanity set consisting of the Martian Uniform Helmet, Martian Uniform Torso, and Martian Uniform Pants. Each piece has a chance to drop from Martian enemies during the Martian Madness event.
These items are to be equipped in the Social Slots as they only provide a visual appearance.
The Shroomite Plating Wall is a type of wall made from Shroomite Plating.

D-Town's set are vanity developer items that can be obtained rarely (5% chance) from Treasure Bags dropped from Hardmode bosses (except Queen Slime 's). It is the vanity set made for D-Town, the Business Director at Re-Logic. Equipping the full set produces a pulsating effect similar to Adamantite armor, as well as a glow effect similar to Spooky armor.
These items are to be equipped in the Social Slots as they only provide a visual appearance.
