D-Town's equipment also includes a non-vanity item, which will drop in addition to his clothing set:
D-Town's Wings

Crafting is the process of combining materials ("ingredients") into new items. It is one of the primary means of creating new weapons and tools and is thus generally indispensable for game progress. The entirety of an item's ingredients is called its recipe.

Crafting is done through the crafting bar, visible on the left side of the interface below the player's inventory, which presents all craftable items available to the player. Items will only appear in this list if the player has the ingredients in their inventory. Pressing the ⚒ Use / Attack / ⚷ Open / Activate button on an item in the list will consume its required ingredients and place the item on the cursor, from which it can be placed in the inventory. Holding the ⚒ Use / Attack / ⚷ Open / Activate button to craft a stackable item will begin to repeatedly produce the item until the stack is filled. Crafting takes no time, though there is a very small delay between the creation of items in a stack. The longer the button is held, the shorter this delay.

While many items can be crafted using only the materials in their recipes, most will require a crafting station to make their recipe available. Items that require a station will appear in the crafting bar while the player stands near the required item, requiring no interaction with the station. In this way, a player may craft from multiple nearby stations at once.

The Deadly Sphere is a Hardmode, post- Plantera enemy that spawns during the Solar Eclipse event. Upon spawning, it flies randomly in the direction of the player until it is within close enough proximity while traveling through blocks. Upon noticing the player, the Deadly Sphere grows spikes and begins to spin before rapidly charging toward them indefinitely while attempting to remain directly on top of them. While attacking the player, they are unable to charge through blocks.
Marble furniture are furniture items crafted from Smooth Marble Blocks, which in turn are crafted from Marble Blocks at a Work Bench. There are 20 different Marble furniture items.
The Honeyfall Wall is one of only a few animated background wall types. It depicts flowing honey.

Accessories are equipable items that can provide stat boosts and/or special abilities, such as limited flight. Accessories must be placed in a character's equip accessory slots to work, with the exception of some informational accessories which work simply by being in a character's inventory.

In Journey (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) and Normal mode worlds it is possible to benefit from five accessories simultaneously (given there are no override effects - for example, it is not possible to use more than one wings accessory at the same time). In Expert Mode (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) a sixth slot is obtainable by consuming a Demon Heart. Ultimately, Master Mode (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) includes a sixth slot by default which, when combined with a Demon Heart, provides seven slots. Neither the Demon Heart slot nor the Master Mode slot is functional in Normal mode worlds, and both will only function when the difficulty is set to the corresponding level in Journey Mode worlds.

No duplicate accessories may be equipped, but the Tinkerer's Workshop can combine many accessories together into new accessories with multiple effects. For example, Hermes Boots (or another similar accessory) and Rocket Boots can be crafted into Spectre Boots. Conversely, throwing combined accessories into the Shimmer will transform them into the base components used to craft them.
Each accessory slot also has a respective vanity slot (as well as a dye slot) which allows a character to equip twice the amount of accessories for cosmetic or storage purposes.

(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) Each accessory slot also has a toggleable button (/), which toggles the visibility of the corresponding accessory. This only affects the character's appearance, the effects of the accessories are still applied.
Most shields, a type of accessory, can synergize with the Brand of the Inferno (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) to block attacks, granting the Striking Moment buff.

The Lawn Mower is a tool that can be purchased from the Golfer for 1 GC and mows normal and Hallowed grass. Mowed grass has a different texture, reduces enemy spawn chance, prevents tall grass from growing, and allows Golf Balls to travel on top of it with unhindered movement while golfing. The Lawn Mower deals a fixed 8 classless damage to entities only while the player is moving forwards, is not in the air, and is not grappled. When it is used on grass other than normal and hallowed, it only removes weeds and flowers.

The Blowpipe is a pre-Hardmode ranged weapon that auto-fires Seeds and darts as ammunition. When a Blowpipe is in a player's inventory, there is a chance that any vegetation growing on normal grass, in Clay Pots, and in Planter Boxes (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) will yield some Seeds. Flowers typically drop 4 Seeds at a time, while tall grass typically drops 1-2 Seeds.
The Blowpipe can be found randomly in Wooden Chests near the Surface or in the Underground layer.
Its best modifier is Unreal.

The Sergeant United Shield is a Hardmode boomerang that automatically homes in on nearby enemies and will attempt to hit up to four additional enemies before returning to the player. However, it will never hit an enemy more than once per throw and only one can be thrown at a time. Additionally, it allows the player to "parry" incoming damage when equipped with a shield (including the Sergeant United Shield itself, while it is not thrown).

While holding the Sergeant United Shield, pressing the ⚷ Open / Activate button will cause the player to raise the shield and brace for the next attack. When timed correctly, just before taking a hit, the enemy 's attack will be parried, which negates the contact damage being dealt to the player, deals 200% of the contact damage of the attacking enemy, inflicts a knockback value of 5 (Average), and grants the player 30 invincibility frames (60 with the Cross Necklace equipped). Successfully parrying an attack also grants the Striking Moment buff, causing the next melee-based attack to deal 500% or five times its usual base damage for the next five seconds. Alternatively, if the shield is held in place, 20 defense is temporarily gained; this lasts until the shield is once again lowered.
The Sergeant United Shield is rarely sold by the Traveling Merchant for 35 GC.

Its best modifier is Godly or Demonic. Both modifiers increase the average damage output by the same amount. However, Ruthless might be preferred if the player already has very high critical strike chance.

The Bone Helm is a pre-Hardmode accessory that summons Shadow Hand projectiles to damage enemies. These Shadow Hands spawn a distance from enemies before flying at them, piercing anything in their path including through blocks. Their flight behavior mirrors the Shadow Hands found in the Deerclops fight, either flying straight or swerving harshly in flight. The Bone Helm is always dropped from Deerclops ' Treasure Bag in Expert Mode.

Toilets are furniture items which can be placed on the ground. They are functionally similar to chairs, and count as comfort items for NPC house requirements. In combination with a Work Bench or a Table, they also form minor crafting stations. Only the Toilet and Golden Toilet are considered as a valid crafting station.

(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) Toilets act as mechanisms that can be activated via wire, which makes them appear to explosively eject sewage. This effect is purely a novelty visual. Ejected sewage on the ground fades after a few seconds. They can also be used to make Poo by sitting on it with any tier of Well Fed active. The amount of Poo dropped is based on the tier of the buff and its duration.

(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) Similarly to chairs, toilets can be sat on by pressing the ⚷ Open / Activate button on them. While sitting on any toilet (except the Golden Toilet), the player's Fishing Power is increased by 5.
There are currently (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) 45 / (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) 2 toilets.

Critters are harmless characters that do not interact with the player in any way, except in that they can be killed by both players and enemies. All critters have 5 health and serve as ambient entities. Most critters can be summoned by means of a statue, but will otherwise spawn randomly in any environment that supports them.

Most critters can be caught with a Bug Net, except Dolphins (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), Mystic Frogs (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) and Sea Turtles (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions). Additionally, critters from The Underworld can only be caught with a Golden Bug Net (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) or Lavaproof Bug Net (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions). When caught, the critter can be carried around the player's inventory (or placed in storage), and can be released again by being used like any other item. On Desktop, Console, and Mobile, critters spawned from statues cannot be caught; attempting to do so will cause the critter to disappear in a puff of smoke.

Most caught critters can be used as fishing bait and crafted into food. All caught critters can be caged to create animated display furniture. Once crafted, the critter cannot be released, unless the cage is de-crafted via Shimmer (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions). Most critters are caged in Terrariums, however Butterflies, Fireflies and Lightning Bugs are caged in Bottles, and both Goldfish and Pupfish are caged in Bottled Water. Bottled Fireflies and Lightning Bugs also function as valid light sources.

On Desktop, Console, and Mobile, some critter types have a rare golden variation that has a 1/400 (0.25%) chance of spawning instead of a normal one, and can be detected by the Lifeform Analyzer. Visual identification is helped by the sparkles they emit when alive in the world.

(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) To fill out Bestiary entries for critters, they do not need to be killed. Rather, the player just needs to get in close proximity of the critter, a distance of roughly 15 tiles, and that will count towards the bestiary entry.

On Desktop, Console, and Mobile, naturally spawned critters (i.e. not released by players or spawned by statues) have 1.5 seconds of invincibility after spawning, to prevent accidental kills of critters spawning from tiles (e.g. Worms and Grasshoppers).
There are currently (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) 86 / (Old-gen console version) 28 / (3DS version) 8 different critters.
The Lawn Flamingo is a decorative furniture item that can be placed and serves no purpose other than as decoration. It can be purchased from the Traveling Merchant for 5 GC.

The Crimera is a common pre-Hardmode flying enemy that spawns predominantly in the Crimson. It is the Crimson counterpart to the Corruption 's Eater of Souls, and behaves in the same manner, attacking by flying toward the player while circling them at a distance before periodically rushing in.
Similar to Eater of Souls, Crimera can appear in three size variants: Little Crimera, Crimera, and Big Crimera, each with corresponding health, damage, and defense.

The Frozen Crate is a pre-Hardmode crate that can only be fished in the Snow and Ice biome. Frozen Crates contain items found in standard crates, and always contain one item normally found in Frozen Chests. Its Hardmode counterpart is the Boreal Crate.

Medusa is a Hardmode enemy found near Marble Caves. She is a relatively fast-moving melee attacker who has the unique ability to inflict the Stoned debuff through her gaze. This debuff deals 20 / 40 / 60 damage to the player and turns the player to stone:

The player will be unable to move or use items for the duration of the debuff, similar to the Frozen debuff. Fall damage-negating accessories are disabled, fall damage is increased, and the minimum distance for fall damage to occur is reduced.

The debuff's onset is marked by Medusa's snake hair (as well as Medusa herself) lashing out red tongues, accompanied by a unique noise and particle effect, giving players notice before they are petrified. Players can avoid getting Stoned by facing the other direction when the animation completes, or by having Medusa's line of sight blocked by solid blocks.
The less health Medusa has, the faster she will move, similar to Mummies. Her speed increases linearly from 8 mph at full health to 18 mph just before dying.
She is one of the few entities that can be detected by the Lifeform Analyzer or its upgrades.
The Treasure Hunter set is a vanity set. It consists of a Treasure Hunter Shirt and Treasure Hunter Pants. It has a 2/57 (3.51%) chance of being obtained from opening Goodie Bags.
These items are to be equipped in the Social Slots as they only provide a visual appearance.

The Metal Detector is an informational accessory that detects valuable objects, including ores, chests, Life Crystals, and Life Fruit, within a rectangular area of 170x125 tiles centered on the player. The Metal Detector has a 1/2 (50%) / 100% chance of being dropped by Nymphs, a rare cavern enemy.

The Metal Detector displays the specific type of what was detected, for instance, " Chlorophyte detected nearby! " When multiple valuables are detected, only the one with the highest value is noted. Like most informational accessories, it does not directly reveal the location or direction of the detected object.
The Metal Detector is one of the three parts necessary to make the Goblin Tech, with the others being the Stopwatch and the DPS Meter, and as such is a required ingredient in crafting the Shellphone.

Christmas is a seasonal event that occurs from December to around early January. During Christmas, Presents can be dropped by any enemy (1/13 (7.69%) chance), except for enemies spawned by statues. Hearts are also replaced by Candy Canes, and Mana Stars are replaced with Sugar Plums.

During Hardmode, one of the items a Present can contain is the Snow Globe, which summons the Frost Legion. Defeating the Frost Legion allows the Santa Claus NPC to spawn, if valid housing is available, but only during the Christmas season.
The duration of the event depends on the game platform :

(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) Reaching wave 15 of the Frost Moon will unlock one in-game day and night of the Christmas event, regardless of the date. After this in-game day and night ends, a message pops up in the bottom left saying, " The spirit of Christmas fades... "

Orichalcum armor is a Hardmode armor set and is the counterpart to Mythril armor. Like all Hardmode ore armors, Orichalcum armor has three different headwear options, allowing players to focus on magical, melee, or ranged combat, and each with a corresponding set bonus. Crafting a one-helmet set requires 54 Orichalcum Bars or 216 Orichalcum Ore. Crafting all five pieces requires 78 Orichalcum Bars or 312 Orichalcum Ore.

Whenever the player strikes an enemy while wearing a full set, a flower petal is summoned at the edge of the screen and shoots horizontally to the other end of the screen. The flower petal will always be aimed at the enemy that triggered it, but it will damage any other enemy that it goes through. The flower petal deals 36 base damage and can pierce, causing damage to multiple foes in a line with a single attack. Petals travel very fast (123 mph) and pass through solid blocks and liquids with ease. There is a cooldown of 0.33 seconds before another flower petal can be summoned, meaning that this set bonus adds roughly 100 DPS.
The Snail is a rather rare critter that spawns in the Underground and Cavern layer. The Snail has only 5 health and no defense, and can be damaged by other enemies and players.

The Snail can be caught with any Bug Net to be carried around in the inventory and released later, or crafted into animated decorative furniture (Snail Cage). Once crafted, the Snail cannot be released again, unless the furniture item is de-crafted via Shimmer (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions).
The Snail can be used as bait for fishing, with 10% bait power.
The Snail can be spawned by the Snail Statue, however statue-spawned critters cannot be caught with any Bug Net, and will disappear in a puff of smoke when the player attempts to do so.
Pedguin's set is a vanity set. Corrupt and Vicious Penguins have a 1/50 (2%) chance to drop one piece of the set.

The Cursed Sapling is a Hardmode, post- Plantera pet-summoning item that spawns a Cursed Sapling to follow the player around. It appears as a small, dark blue tree stump with a jagged head, a jack-o-lantern face, and roots on which it walks. The Cursed Sapling is dropped by the Mourning Wood during the Pumpkin Moon event with a 2.86-20% (5-20%) chance depending on the current wave.
Active Stone Blocks and Inactive Stone Blocks are blocks that act as mechanisms. A given pair behave as a single block whose presence can be switched "on" or "off" using wire and a trigger.

When triggered, an Active Stone Block becomes an Inactive Stone Block, and vice versa. Wires must pass through all Active/Inactive Stone Blocks that are to be triggered, and the wires must connect to a trigger, such as a pressure plate, Switch, or timer. These blocks are useful for creating traps, floodgates, hidden passages, drawbridges (e.g. over water, lava, or empty space), skybridges, and much more.

An Active Stone Block is a foreground object. This means it looks and behaves as an ordinary Stone Block, inhibits movement, allows entities to stand or walk on it, blocks light, and can stop liquids. An Inactive Stone Block is a background object. While still visible, it looks like darker Stone Block, and behaves like furniture. It is essentially empty space, allowing the passage of players, items, liquids, light, etc.

Both the Active and Inactive versions can be crafted. Players will usually want to craft the Active version, as the Inactive blocks cannot be placed next to each other without the support of other adjacent foreground blocks. Active blocks do not have this shortcoming, and switching them to Inactive afterwards using wires will still have the same outcome.
Placing Active Stone Blocks, switching them to Inactive with wiring, then mining them and picking them up again, will yield Inactive blocks, and vice versa.

Active/Inactive Stone Blocks occur naturally in Boulder traps found in the Cavern layer, where Active blocks that are wired to pressure plates suspend a Boulder in the ceiling. An enemy or player walking on the plate cause the Active blocks to turn Inactive, allowing the Boulder to fall through and damage any player below it.

The Bone Glove is a pre-Hardmode accessory that throws ricocheting crossbones every time a weapon is used, at a maximum of once per second. The crossbones projectiles ricochet off walls three times or pierce two enemies before being destroyed, deal 25 classless damage, and additionally have 25 armor penetration. The Bone Glove is always dropped from Skeletron 's Treasure Bag in Expert Mode.

The Cursed Dart is a type of Hardmode dart used with the Blowgun, Blowpipe, Dart Pistol, and the Dart Rifle. When fired, small flame projectiles called "Cursed Dart Flame" drip from the dart as it flies, each dealing 80% base damage and 50% knockback of the Cursed Dart. The flames fall straight downwards and land on solid blocks, lingering for 2 seconds before disappearing. The flames can pierce up to 2 targets, hitting a total of 3 targets. The falling flames and the darts themselves inflict the Cursed Inferno debuff on enemies for 3-6 seconds. The dripping cursed flame ability makes it effective for fighting large numbers of enemies or multi-part enemies. It is the Corruption 's counterpart to the Crimson 's Ichor Dart.
Pearlstone Brick Walls are a type of wall crafted from Pearlstone Bricks. Like most walls, they will stop enemy spawning, and can be used for NPC houses.

The Tropical Smoothie is a food item that grants the Well Fed buff when consumed. This lasts for 20 minutes, but can be canceled at any time  by right-clicking the icon,  by selecting the icon using Cycle Next/Previous Buff and then pressing Remove Buff, or  by double-tapping the buff icon.
Like all other food items, the Tropical Smoothie can be placed on a Plate :
The Hat Rack is a decorative furniture item that can be used to display up to two helmet-slot armor and vanity items, as well as dyes.

Items can be placed on a Hat Rack by pressing the ⚷ Open / Activate button on it, which opens a small set of inventory -like slots beneath the player's main inventory. There are two slots for two helmets, in addition to an associated dye slot underneath each one. Placing items in these slots immediately displays them on the Hat Rack. Items placed in the left slot are displayed on the upper part of the Hat Rack, while items placed in the right slot are displayed on the lower part. Items cannot be displayed on the middle, top part.
The Wizard's Hat is a Hardmode vanity item purchased from the Wizard during Halloween for 3 GC.

The Alchemy Table is a post- Skeletron crafting station used to craft potions. It works almost identically to Placed Bottles when crafting potions, except that it has a 1/3 (33.33%) chance of not consuming ingredients. It can be found randomly in the Dungeon and can also be obtained by fishing in the Dungeon. They also count as a flat surface item, which is one of the required elements in order to make a house.

When a potion is crafted with the Alchemy Table, there is a 1/3 (33.33%) chance for each ingredient not to be consumed. There is a separate probability check for each of the ingredients used in making the potion, including each of those in a stack. This is effective for gaining more value out of alchemy ingredients, especially of those that are hard to obtain.

The Demon is a pre-Hardmode enemy found in The Underworld. It attacks by summoning volleys of four spinning purple blades that gradually accelerate toward the player, which are similar to those fired by the Demon Scythe that it has a chance to drop. These blades deal high damage and have a chance to inflict the Darkness debuff for 15 / 30 / 37.5 seconds and are stopped by any block, but cannot be destroyed with weapons.
Like other Underworld enemies, the Demon is immune to lava. A rarer variation of the Demon is the Voodoo Demon.
The Silver Watch is a mid-tier watch. Its alternate ore counterpart is the Tungsten Watch.

When equipped in an accessory slot or simply held in the inventory, a clock will appear in the upper-right corner of the playing screen, revealing the in-game time accurate to the last half an hour. Half an hour of Terraria game time is equivalent to half a minute of real-world time. The Silver Watch can be used to craft the 3 Second Timer.

Pink Gel is a rare crafting material dropped by Pinky in stacks of 25-50. It is primarily used to craft "bouncy" versions of certain consumable items, as well as Restoration Potions. "Bouncy" items act like their normal variants, but bounce more times and more vigorously before losing momentum.
Crafting one of each item requires 22 Pink Gel, meaning that killing a single Pinky is sufficient to craft all items at least once.
The Black Graduation set is a Hardmode vanity set consisting of the Black Graduation Cap and the Black Graduation Gown. They are purchased from the Clothier for 20 GC (set) during a Waxing Gibbous.
These items are to be equipped in the Social Slots as they only provide a visual appearance.

Shiverthorn is a type of herb which appears as an icy-blue flower. It grows naturally on Snow and Ice Blocks of any type. Shiverthorn can be harvested with virtually any weapon or tool, and can be planted manually using Shiverthorn Seeds in Clay Pots and Planter Boxes (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), or on suitable soil tiles.

Shiverthorn blooms randomly, and unlike other herbs, remain bloomed permanently thereafter. Its blooming is indicated by a glowing particle effect. Harvesting blooming Shiverthorn yields 1 Shiverthorn item and 1-3 Shiverthorn Seeds. Harvesting mature or blooming Shiverthorn with the Staff of Regrowth or Axe of Regrowth (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) yields 1-2 Shiverthorns and 1-5 Shiverthorn Seeds instead. Note that these tools can only directly harvest mature stage herbs planted on soil ; see Herbs § Growth for details.
Both Shiverthorn and Shiverthorn Seeds have a chance to be obtained from the Herb Bag (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions).
The Flinx Fur Coat is a pre-Hardmode armor piece. When equipped, it gives the player an additional minion slot, and increases summon damage by 5%.
The Snowfall Block is an animated block type. It is one of the few items that uses the Crystal Ball as a crafting station.

The Honey Comb is a pre-Hardmode accessory which, when equipped, spawns 1-3 (or 1-4 with a Hive Pack (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) equipped) bee projectiles which attack nearby enemies each time the player takes damage. On the Desktop version, Console version, and Mobile version, it also grants the Honey buff for 5 seconds after being damaged. The Honey Comb has a 1/3 (33.33%) chance to be dropped by the Queen Bee.

The Bouncy Bomb is an explosive crafted from a Bomb and a Pink Gel. It bounces off surfaces before exploding. It can be used as a mining tool or a weapon, although generally the former. When used, it is thrown a few blocks away from the player.
After 3 seconds, it will explode, inflicting 100 points of damage to nearby enemies and destroying multiple blocks around it. The player can also inflict harm to themselves if they are not careful.

Bombs can destroy almost any block, with some exceptions, which can then be collected. They can also be thrown through one-block thick walls, like some other tossables. Additionally, Bombs also work underwater.

The Shiny Red Balloon is an accessory that increases the player's jump height by 33% and jump speed by 30%, increasing the height that the player can jump from 6 blocks (12 feet) to ~10½ blocks (21 feet), effectively a ~75% boost. However, it oddly reduces jump height when underwater, from 8 blocks (16 feet) to ~7 blocks (14 feet). The Shiny Red Balloon has a (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) 1/4 (25%) / (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) 1/3 (33.33%) of being found inside Skyware Chests on Floating Islands, as well as a 1/4 (25%) chance of being obtained from Sky Crates (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) and Azure Crates (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions).
The Shiny Red Balloon stacks with other jump-boosting accessories:

The Cloud in a Bottle's double-jump height is increased from 5 blocks (10 feet) to 9 blocks (18 feet), for a total jump height of 19½ blocks (39 feet). The Blizzard in a Bottle's double-jump height is increased from 8 blocks (16 feet) to 14½ blocks (29 feet), for a total jump height of 25 blocks (50 feet). The Sandstorm in a Bottle's double-jump height is increased from 14½ blocks (29 feet) to 26½ blocks (53 feet), for a total jump height of 37 blocks (74 feet). The Fart in a Jar's double-jump height is increased from 10½ blocks (21 feet) to 18½ blocks (37 feet), for a total jump height of 29 blocks (58 feet). The Tsunami in a Bottle's double-jump height is increased from 7 blocks (14 feet) to 12 blocks (24 feet), for a total jump height of 23½ blocks (47 feet). With the Rocket / Spectre Boots, flight is accelerated, making the same flight time carry the player higher and/or farther. The Frog Leg jump bonus stacks additively with the Shiny Red Balloon bonus, letting the first jump reach 16½ blocks (33 feet). With wings, flight time is increased.
However, the Honey Balloon and Balloon Pufferfish do not stack with the Shiny Red Balloon; they all grant the same benefits.
The Flesh Knuckles are a Hardmode accessory that increases the player's defense by 8 and aggro by 400. Flesh Knuckles have a 1/5 (20%) chance of being dropped by Crimson Mimics.
Seasonal events are annual occurrences activated depending on the platform/device's date setting. While active, a seasonal event may offer new season-appropriate items or character spawns.

The Clothier's set is a vanity set consisting of the Red Hat, Clothier's Jacket (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) and Clothier's Pants (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions). These items are to be equipped in the Social Slots as they only provide a visual appearance.
The Red Hat will always drop from the Clothier NPC. The other parts of the set are sold by the Clothier for 3 GC each, during Halloween.

The Wooden Bow is the weakest bow in the game, dealing 4 base damage plus the damage of the arrow being fired. It is very cheap to make, and is therefore usually the first ranged weapon a player will acquire.

Its best modifier is Demonic, as it does not have any knockback and thus cannot get modifiers that affect it. (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) It can also get the Deadly modifier, which, while the Demonic modifier may provide the greatest damage per hit, grants a higher increase to the overall DPS.

The Corrupt Growth Wall, Corrupt Mass Wall, Corrupt Pustule Wall, and Corrupt Tendril Wall are types of background walls which can be found naturally generated in the Underground Corruption, considered unsafe. They do not drop as an item when destroyed, and can only be obtained on the Desktop, Console, and Mobile, via crafting. They are considered safe walls when placed by the player.

The Gold Ring is a Hardmode accessory that greatly increases the pickup range for coins. It has a 1/500 (0.2%) chance to be dropped by pirates (except Parrots) during Pirate Invasions, with a 1/125 (0.8%) chance from the Pirate Captain. It also has a 1/15 (6.67%) chance to be dropped by the Flying Dutchman (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions).
The increase in pickup range is 21.875 tiles, extending the base range of 2.625 tiles to 24.5 tiles. This effect does not stack with that of any of the Gold Ring's upgrades.
The Hand Warmer is an immunity accessory that grants the player immunity to the Chilled and Frozen debuffs. It is obtained from Presents, with a chance of 0.62% in pre-Hardmode and 0.58% in Hardmode.

Slush Blocks are blocks that appear naturally in Ice biomes. They are subject to gravity and will fall if the blocks supporting them are removed, dealing damage to any player or enemy they fall on (similar to Sand and Silt).

Slush can be placed in an Extractinator or Chlorophyte Extractinator to be converted into various valuable materials, including gems, coins, ores, and very rarely, the Amber Mosquito pet summoning item.

The Flameburst Rod, Cane, and Staff are special sentry summon weapons. They can summon the Flameburst Tower sentry, which lasts for 10 minutes, remains stationary, and does not count against the player's minion capacity. Each Flameburst Tower fires fireballs at approaching enemies, which are non-piercing but can cause splash damage on impact and have a chance to inflict the On Fire! or Hellfire debuff. Unlike other projectile sentries, the Flameburst Tower is unable to aim and shoot upward at an angle greater than 45°; flying enemies are therefore ignored when they fly above it. The Rod is sold by the Tavernkeep for 50000* 5, the Cane for 150000* 15, and the Staff for 600000* 60.

The Rod is always available. The Cane becomes available after defeating one mechanical boss, and the Staff becomes available after defeating Golem. The three different versions cause an identical effect, but with varying statistics, with the Staff being the most expensive and the most powerful.

These weapons cannot be used outside of the Old One's Army event until the event has been successfully completed. Completing the event on any difficulty allows Rods, Canes, and Staves alike to be used outside of the event.

During the Old One's Army event, Etherian Mana can be collected, which allows the placement of multiple Flameburst Towers that remain permanently until the event is over. Etherian Mana cannot be used outside the event.

Flameburst Tower sentries are boosted by the Apprentice armor and Dark Artist armor set bonuses, which dramatically increase their range, field of view, and projectile velocity. The Dark Artist armor will also boost the explosion radius of the sentries' projectiles.

Their best modifier is Ruthless. The Mythical modifier provides the widest array of stat bonuses, but these primarily affect the initial summon rather than the resulting minion. Additionally, minions cannot deal critical hits. The only lasting advantage a Mythical Flameburst sentry summons has over a Ruthless one is knockback.

Yoraiz0r's Spell is a developer wing. Like other developer wings, Yoraiz0r's Spell is acquired along with Yoraiz0r's set, which is obtained through Hardmode Treasure Bags in Expert Mode (except Queen Slime 's).

Yoraiz0r's Spell is unique in that it functions as wings but displays no wing or other item graphic. It instead displays a rocket effect similar to the Rocket Boots, while still offering controlled flight, as well as glide time after flight time has been exhausted. It also offers the ability to hover at a fixed height via the ▼ Down + ↷ Jump keys.

Chilled is a debuff usually inflicted by enemies found in the Snow biome. In Expert Mode (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), it is also caused by touching water or Shimmer (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) located in a Snow biome. The debuff can be prevented by equipping a full set of Snow armor, with the Hand Warmer, or, on the Desktop version, Console version, and Mobile version, the Ankh Shield. Additionally, Arctic Diving Gear will protect the player from the Expert Mode liquid effect, but not other sources of Chilled. Like the Slow debuff, it reduces the player's speed, but not as severely.
Most enemies that can inflict Chilled can also inflict the Frozen debuff.
Honey furniture are furniture items crafted from Honey Blocks, which are formed when water comes into contact with honey, at a Honey Dispenser. There are 20 different Honey furniture items.

The Oyster is a consumable grab bag item, which when opened with ⚷ Open / Activate from within the player's inventory, contains a Shucked Oyster, and has a 1/5 (20%) chance to drop (in order of increasing rarity) a White, Black, or Pink Pearl. Oysters can be acquired by fishing in the Desert biome, but it must not overlap with Corruption or Crimson.

The Vortex Beater is a Hardmode, post- Lunatic Cultist gun that fires bullets at a very high rate and in an inaccurate manner, similar to the Gatligator, but within approximately a 25° angle rather than the Gatligator's 45° firing pattern. Additionally, it fires homing, explosive Vortex Rockets every 0.583 seconds, which have a base damage of the weapon's damage + 20 (50 + 20 = 70 base damage), and a base knockback of 1.25x the weapon's knockback (2.5 (Very weak)). The rocket's explosions do not harm the player. The Vortex Beater also has a 2/3 (66.67%) chance to save ammo.
Its best modifier is Unreal. Since it does not benefit from speed modifiers, Godly and Demonic provide the same DPS bonus as Unreal.
The Magic Cuffs are a pre-Hardmode accessory which increases maximum mana by 20 and restores mana when the wearer is damaged.

Mana restored is equal to the damage of the attack before factoring defense and damage reduction effects. Damage from drowning and debuffs does not trigger this effect, while damage from falling will. This effect does not stack with the mana restoration effect of the Celestial Cuffs.

The Green Horseshoe Balloon is an accessory that grants immunity to fall damage, increases jump height by 33%, jump speed by 30%, grants a double jump, and grants +0.05 luck. The height of the first jump is increased from 6 blocks to 10.5 blocks (~75% increase), while the double jump's height is increased from 10.5 blocks to 18.5 blocks, reaching a total of 29 blocks with both jumps. The double jump also makes a fart sound.
Jump height is oddly reduced when underwater, to 18 blocks (7 blocks + ~11 blocks from Fart jump).

Solutions are a type of ammunition used solely by the Clentaminator and Terraformer (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions). Each solution will convert certain blocks and walls to other blocks and walls, creating and/or destroying different biomes in the process. There are (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) 8 / (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) 5 different solutions. (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) 7 / (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) 4 of them are sold by the Steampunker, who sells different solutions based on certain conditions, and one is sold by the Truffle, who always sells it.
Solutions cannot be purchased in Don't dig up (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) and Get fixed boi (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) worlds.
The Funeral set is a vanity set consisting of the Funeral Hat, Funeral Coat, and Funeral Pants.
These items are to be equipped in the Social Slots as they only provide a visual appearance. They are purchased from the Clothier for 30 GC (set) when he is spoken to in the Graveyard biome.
The Tungsten Broadsword is an early game metal broadsword. Its alternate ore counterpart is the Silver Broadsword.
Like all broadswords, this sword has an arc motion, which is more useful for killing flying and jumping enemies than shortswords.
Its best modifier is Legendary.

Work Benches are a type of furniture and crafting station required to craft many essential early-game items. They are also one possible way to fulfill a house 's flat surface item requirement. Bottles, Pink Vases, and Mugs can be placed on it and used as a Placed Bottle for crafting potions. The Work Bench is the first crafting station the player can make in the game, and one of the first items overall.

There are (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) 44 types of Work Benches which can be crafted, and 7 types which must be picked up from areas such as the Dungeon. Some Work Benches can also be found in Underground Cabins, in which they follow the theme of the cabin they are found in.

Chat is the system by which players in a multiplayer game can communicate. On Desktop version, Chat messages received are shown near the bottom left corner of the screen. Players can press ↵ Enter to open the chat box, type a message, then press ↵ Enter again to send it. It is also possible to cut, copy and paste entire messages being entered, using Ctrl + X, Ctrl + C, and Ctrl + V respectively. The alternative shortcuts ⇧ Shift + Delete, Ctrl + Insert and ⇧ Shift + Insert, respectively, also work.
The following are the keys used for opening chat on other game platforms:
Xbox: LB + D-pad down.
While the chat box is open, a log of received messages is shown. Up to 500 messages can be remembered, and the ↑ and ↓ arrow keys scroll through the history.

Tags can be used to format messages, allowing the player to change text color or even post game objects. This can be used to send items in chat. To do this, have the inventory open before opening the chat box, and hold Alt while clicking an item in the main inventory to enter it into the message.
The server admin can use the "say" command to chat with their players from the console.
The chat display is functional in single player. It can still be used to enter messages or commands, though it is mainly used to display status messages, e.g. the beginning of an event or boss fight.
The Prince set is a Hardmode vanity set consisting of the Prince Uniform, Prince Cape, and the Prince Pants. It is purchased from the Princess for 1 PC 50 GC (set).
These items are to be equipped in the Social Slots as they only provide a visual appearance.

Reflective Metal Dye is a dye acquired by giving a Strange Plant to the Dye Trader. When equipped, it will give the selected accessory/armor a black, "shiny" effect, reflecting the surrounding light around the player. The reflection is more pronounced the closer the player is to a light source. The dye will prioritize light from the sun when the player is outside. From some perspectives, the player may look 3D when this dye is equipped all over.

As with other reflective dyes, this dye is not animated when standing still, but the shading on a dyed piece of equipment will change according to the surrounding light, giving it the appearance of light reflecting off of a shining metallic object.

The Torch God is an event that is initiated by clustering a large number of torches underground. It consists of dodging projectiles, and survivors are rewarded with the Torch God's Favor, an item which grants the player the option for their torches to automatically match the biome they are in. Making sure torches match the biome type they are in will positively influence the player's luck in most areas.

The event can begin once at least 101 torches of any type are placed in close proximity below the surface layer in any biome. It is possible for the event to start with less than 101 torches placed if the player is moving, due to the game's calculation incorrectly counting some torches more than once. The Torch God event cannot take place for any character who has already consumed the Torch God's Favor or has one in their inventory.

As the Torch God begins, torch flames shoot off at the player as projectiles, one at a time. They are fired in a random order, at a rate of 3 projectiles per second, and deal 40 / 80 / 120 base damage. Projectiles can pass through blocks to reach the player, but they can collide with blocks again after passing the player. Each torch shoots one projectile and extinguishes itself afterward, as if it was switched off via wire. For the entire duration of the event, the player is inflicted with the Blackout debuff, significantly reducing their vision.

The Torch God ends once all nearby torches have been spent, to a maximum of 200 attacks. If at least 95 torches fired, the player is rewarded with the Torch God's Favor item. All torches re-light when the event ends. If the player dies or leaves underground, the event ends early and nothing is awarded; if the player moves into an area without torches, the event will also end early, however the Torch God's Favor will be awarded if at least 95 torches fired.

While the event is active, the music Boss 3 https://terraria.wiki.gg/wiki/File:Music-Boss_3.mp3 will play. When Otherworldly music is enabled, the track Wall of Flesh https://terraria.wiki.gg/wiki/File:Music-Wall_of_Flesh_(Otherworldly).mp3 will play instead.

Reef furniture are furniture items crafted from Reef Blocks, which in turn are crafted from Stone Blocks, Coral and Seashells when near water or at a sink. There are 20 different Reef furniture items.

The Mudstone Brick (Mudstone Block on Old-gen console) is a type of brick made from Stone Blocks and Mud Blocks. It can also be obtained from Jungle Shrines. It is brown in color with a Stone-like texture.

The Cool Whip is a Hardmode whip. Upon striking an enemy, the Cool Whip inflicts the Frostbite debuff for 4 seconds and grants the A Nice Buff buff, which creates a temporary floating snowflake projectile that chases nearby enemies for 3 seconds, dealing 15 damage and applying 20 ticks of local immunity frames upon contact. The summoned snowflake has 30 armor penetration and is not affected by damage bonuses outside of banners. If a snowflake is already summoned, attacking with the whip will reset its timer instead of creating a new one.
Like other whips, it causes minions and sentries to focus on the last-struck enemy and increases their damage against the target by 6.
If the Cool Whip hits multiple targets in a single attack, the damage dealt by each consecutive hit will be reduced by 30%.
Its best modifier is Legendary.
Hair Dyes are consumable items sold by the Stylist NPC. When used, they replace a player's hair color with a dynamic effect.

The Pixie is a Hardmode enemy that spawns frequently in the Hallow at the surface layer. Pixies hover a limited height aboveground, emitting a fair amount of flickering light, and can inflict the Slow or Silenced debuffs upon contact. They always drop Pixie Dust, a common Hardmode crafting material.

The Extractinator or Silt Extractinator is an item that converts Silt, Slush, and Desert Fossils into more valuable items such as ores, coins, and gems. On the Desktop version, Console version, and Mobile version, it can also convert Glowing Mosses into all kinds of regular mosses, and fishing trash into low level bait.

It can be obtained from multiple sources, with a 4.9% chance of spawning in Frozen Chests, a 5% chance of spawning in Gold Chests in the Underground and Cavern layers, and a 1.86% chance of being dropped by opening Wooden Crates. Underground Cabins in the Underground Desert (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) also have a chance to contain an Extractinator as part of the random decor.

To use the Extractinator, it first needs to be placed in the world. Afterward, suitable blocks need to be consumed (with the ⚒ Use / Attack key) directly on the Extractinator within its 3x3 frame. Holding the Auto Select key and clicking on the Extractinator will automatically insert extractable items from the player's inventory without having to pick them up manually.

Feeding blocks to the Extractinator is the only way to obtain Amber Mosquitoes, and, along with opening crates, the only reliable way to obtain a world's alternative pre-Hardmode ores. This is a great way to obtain ore and coins in the early game.

The Goblin Warlock is a Hardmode enemy that rarely spawns during the Goblin Army event. Because of her high stats and relatively high difficulty compared to other goblins, she will present a challenge for new Hardmode players. Defeating her, however, rewards the player with weapons that are themed after Shadowflame, all of which accordingly inflict the Shadowflame debuff.

The Goblin Warlock initially seems to behave like a typical Fighter AI enemy, though once she is close enough to the player, she will summon a Shadowflame Apparition above herself before flying directly upwards. She will not stop her ascent until she is above the player, at which point she will then dash over towards the player's current position before slowly gliding towards the ground in a somewhat rectangular flight pattern. The Goblin Warlock also flies towards the player if they move too far away from her and passes through any solid blocks in her path. If she is hovering at any time, she will fire Chaos Balls approximately once every half-second, which can be destroyed by any weapon or projectile.

She is one of the few entities that can be detected by the Lifeform Analyzer or its upgrades. The Goblin Warlock requires 25 kills to be awarded completion of her Bestiary entry and corresponding banner, as opposed to the usual 50 kills.

The Tungsten Axe is an early game axe, being stronger than both the Iron and Lead Axe, and weaker than both the Gold and Platinum Axe. It has an alternative version, the Silver Axe. Like all axes, it is used to cut down trees, cacti, and Giant Glowing Mushrooms.
Its best modifier is Light for harvesting purposes and Legendary for combat purposes.

The Spaghetti is a food item that grants the Exquisitely Stuffed buff when consumed. This lasts for 8 minutes, but can be canceled at any time  by right-clicking the icon,  by selecting the icon using Cycle Next/Previous Buff and then pressing Remove Buff, or  by double-tapping the buff icon. Spaghetti has a 1/50 (2%) chance of being dropped by Granite Elementals and Granite Golems.
Like all other food items, the Spaghetti can be placed on a Plate :

The Huntress's Buckler is a Hardmode shield accessory that increases the player's maximum number of sentries by one and increases summon damage by 10%. The Huntress's Buckler is dropped by Ogres during the Old One's Army event with a 1/6 (16.67%) / 1/4 (25%) chance during Tier 2, and a 1/12 (8.33%) chance during Tier 3.

Capes are vanity accessories which provide no stats or bonuses. Most are purchased from the Traveling Merchant, though the Hunter Cloak (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) can also be purchased from the Clothier and the Prince Cape (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) is exclusively sold by the Princess (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions).

Living Mahogany Trees are large tree-shaped structures generated at world creation in the Underground Jungle. The trunk of a Living Mahogany Tree is hollow, and (unlike Living Trees) always contains an Ivy Chest at its base.
Lead armor is the 4th weakest metal armor set. It consists of a Lead Helmet, Lead Chainmail and Lead Greaves.
Its alternate ore counterpart is the Iron armor.

It takes a total of (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) 60 / (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) 75 Lead Bars to craft a full suit, or (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) 180 / (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) 225 Lead Ores.
A full set grants 8 defense plus a set bonus of 3 defense, which equals a total of 11 defense.

The Last Prism is a Hardmode, post- Moon Lord magic weapon that fires several colored beams of light that converge into one focused beam as it charges, dealing massive damage. It has one of the highest base DPS in the game at the cost of rapidly consuming mana. The Last Prism has a 2/9 (22.22%) chance of being dropped by the Moon Lord.

The Last Prism projects six rainbow-colored beams that deal individual damage as they begin to rotate, then spin faster as they converge into one concentrated beam. This process takes exactly 3.365 seconds, with each beam continuing to deal the weapon's full base damage. The fully-converged beam deals three times the weapon's base damage, or 300 damage per hit. Unlike most piercing attacks, the weapon hits 12 times per second (every 5 game ticks). The mana cost will increase exponentially as the beam converges.

Due to its high mana cost (72 mana per second; 12 mana 6 times per second when fully charged), players will struggle to maintain the beam for more than 5-6 seconds. Usage of the Mana Flower, Magic Cuffs, Nebula armor, and a large supply of Super Mana Potions with the Last Prism is recommended.
Its best modifier is Mythical.

The Underground Corruption is a biome. It is the underground version of the surface -level Corruption, appearing at and below the cavern layer. Just like the surface Corruption, it is mainly composed of Ebonstone and spreads to nearby tiles. Although it is available in pre-Hardmode, most of its exclusive contents will only appear during Hardmode. After the Wall of Flesh is defeated for the first time, a diagonal stripe of Corruption is generated, creating additional Underground Corruption biome.

(Old-gen console and 3DS versions) Small pockets of Underground Corruption can be created through the breaking of Demon Altars, which can convert a single random Stone Block in the world into Ebonstone upon destruction.

The Underground Corruption does not suppress the spawn of other underground and cavern enemies. During Hardmode, all enemies killed in the Underground Corruption have a 1/5 (20%) / 9/25 (36%) chance to drop a Soul of Night.
On the Nintendo 3DS version, the Underground Corruption music is replaced by the Underground Crimson music.
Note: Most characteristics of the surface Corruption also apply to the Underground Corruption. See The Corruption for more extensive information.

The Nebula Arcanum is a Hardmode, post- Lunatic Cultist magic weapon that fires a swirling purple orb when used. The orb will slowly home in on enemies and bounce off tiles, hitting three times before exploding into several smaller projectiles. All three hits do not have to be on the same target, as it will continue to home in on other enemies in range if its target dies before the third hit. If the projectile does not hit enemies three times, it will explode after 11 seconds.

As the main orb remains active, it also produces additional, smaller orb projectiles that orbit around it, each of which passes through tiles and pierces an unlimited number of enemies. A maximum of eight of these projectiles can be summoned per orb. Two to three of these projectiles appear per second for the first half of the projectile's lifetime and disappear at the same rate as it approaches its detonation.
Its best modifier is Mythical.

The Hunter Cloak is a vanity item sold by the Clothier for 15 GC when the player has an accumulated golf score of 2000 or more. It is also occasionally sold by the Traveling Merchant, regardless of golf scores.

The Wooden Boomerang is the lowest tier of boomerang. It is found in Wooden Chests located on the surface and within the underground layer. It can also be purchased from the Skeleton Merchant (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) for 1 GC during a full moon.
(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) It can be upgraded into the Enchanted Boomerang with a Fallen Star.

Its best modifier is Godly or Demonic. Both modifiers increase the average damage output by the same amount. However, Ruthless might be preferred if the player already has very high critical strike chance.

The Flairon is a Hardmode flail that repeatedly fires a ball-and-chain up to around 25 tiles from the player while releasing homing bubble projectiles that damage enemies. The flail's head resembles Duke Fishron and emits a homing, non-piercing bubble once every 1/15th of a second while it is deployed. The Flairon has a 1/5 (20%) chance of being dropped by Duke Fishron.

The Flairon is a launched flail, that, despite its appearance, is more similar in function to the Chain Knife, the KO Cannon, and the Golem Fist. It is not affected by gravity, does not remain deployed when holding the ⚒ Use / Attack button, and cannot be swung around. Rather, holding the ⚒ Use / Attack button causes it to auto-fire repeatedly, returning and re-firing when it impacts a block or enemy, or when it reaches its maximum range.

Its best modifier is Godly or Demonic. Both modifiers increase the average damage output by the same amount. However, Ruthless might be preferred if the player already has very high critical strike chance.

Spooky furniture are furniture items crafted from Spooky Wood, which can be obtained by defeating Splinterling and Mourning Wood during the Pumpkin Moon event. There are 18 (20 (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions)) different Spooky furniture items.
The Cobalt Sword is a Hardmode broadsword. Its alternate ore counterpart is the Palladium Sword.
Its best modifier is Legendary.
The Beanie is a vanity item purchased from the Clothier for 1 GC, while living in the Snow biome.

Jim's set are vanity developer items that can be obtained rarely (5% chance) from Treasure Bags dropped from Hardmode bosses (except Queen Slime 's). It is the vanity set made for Jimmarn, an artist who develops graphics for Terraria. Equipping the full set produces a glow effect similar to Spooky armor and grants an after-image movement effect similar to Ninja armor.
These items are to be equipped in the Social Slots as they only provide a visual appearance.
Jimmarn's equipment also includes a non-vanity item, which will drop in addition to his clothing set:
Jim's Wings

The Coin Gun is a Hardmode ranged weapon that uses coins as ammunition, which affects its damage and velocity depending on the type of coin fired. The weapon itself has 0 base damage, with the entirety of its damage value stemming from the coins used to fire it. Coin projectiles dissipate upon hitting an enemy or solid block and cannot be retrieved once fired. The Coin Gun is dropped very rarely ((Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) 1/4000 (0.025%) / (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) 1/8000 (0.0125%) chance) by regular Pirate Invasion enemies, excluding the Parrot. The Coin Gun's drop chance from Pirate Captains is quadrupled ((Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) 1/1000 (0.1%) / (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) 1/2000 (0.05%) chance) and increased again from the Flying Dutchman (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) (1/50 (2%) chance).
(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) The Coin Gun cannot be reforged, and therefore cannot have modifiers.

(Old-gen console and 3DS versions) The Coin Gun cannot receive any modifiers that increase damage, so the modifier that boosts its DPS the most is Agile (+12% speed [a], +3% critical strike chance). Zealous (+5% critical strike chance) serves as the most ammo-efficient option, dealing the highest amount of damage per coin fired.
The Tattered Cloth is a crafting material dropped by Goblin Scouts. It is used solely to craft the Goblin Battle Standard.
Deerclops is a pre-Hardmode boss encountered in the Snow biome. Fighting Deerclops is not required for game progression, but defeating it rewards the player with coins and other useful items.

While Deerclops is alive, its exclusive music Deerclops https://terraria.wiki.gg/wiki/File:Music-Deerclops.mp3 will play. When Otherworldly music (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) is enabled, the track Boss 2 (Otherworldly) https://terraria.wiki.gg/wiki/File:Music-Boss_2_(Otherworldly).mp3 will play instead.
The Reaver Shark is a pickaxe available through fishing in the Ocean.
On the Desktop version, Console version, and Mobile version, it can mine Demonite and Crimtane Ore, and Obsidian.
On the Old-gen console and 3DS versions, it can mine Hellstone, which would otherwise require fighting the Eater of Worlds or Brain of Cthulhu to craft the Nightmare or Deathbringer Pickaxe.
Its best modifier is Light for harvesting purposes and Legendary for combat purposes.
The Tin Bow is a low tier bow crafted solely using Tin Bars. Its sole purpose is to fire arrows from a distance to hit enemies. Its alternate ore counterpart is the Copper Bow.

Its best modifier is Demonic, as it does not have any knockback and thus cannot get modifiers that affect it. (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) It can also get the Deadly modifier, which, while the Demonic modifier may provide the greatest damage per hit, grants a higher increase to the overall DPS.

The Wall Creeper is a pre-Hardmode enemy that can be found in and around Spider Nests in the Cavern layer, mostly during pre-Hardmode. Wall Creepers are spider-like enemies capable of climbing background walls as well as (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) through platforms, but revert to acting like fighter enemies when there are no background walls for them to climb on.

Bait is a group of items that is mandatory for fishing. When a fishing pole is cast, at least one bait item must be in the player's inventory ; otherwise, nothing can be caught. Fishing poles will cast their lines with no baits, but there will be no "bites" and no catches. The bait item is only consumed once the player reels in the line with a catch on the hook. It is not consumed upon the player casting the line or the line being reeled in with no catch. Even when the player does reel in a fish, there is only a chance that the bait will be consumed.
There are several items that can serve as bait, and they must be obtained in different ways depending on the type:

Most critters that are invertebrates (insects, scorpions, snails, worms) can be used as bait, and must be caught with the Bug Net, Lavaproof Bug Net (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), or Golden Bug Net (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions). The Truffle Worm is unique in that it is only used for summoning Duke Fishron. It cannot be used for ordinary fishing. The Magma Snail (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), Hell Butterfly (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), and Lavafly (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) can only be caught with a Lavaproof Bug Net or Golden Bug Net. When used as bait, they have the special property of allowing the player to fish in lava. Blue, Green, and Pink Jellyfish bait items are unrelated to the Jellyfish enemies. They are themselves caught via fishing.

Apprentice Bait, Journeyman Bait, and Master Bait are acquired as rewards for completing quests for the Angler NPC, as well as from crates. Master Bait is also dropped by Jungle Mimics (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions).
The Lac Beetle is a rare pre-Hardmode enemy that spawns in the Underground Jungle. When killed, it will drop the Violet Husk, which can be used to make Violet Dye.
It is one of the few entities that can be detected by the Lifeform Analyzer (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) or its upgrades.

The Anchor is a Hardmode flail which acts in a similar fashion to the Harpoon, firing a large anchor projectile in an arc. The projectile remains attached to the player via a rope and is heavily affected by gravity. It returns upon reaching a maximum distance or impacting a tile or enemy and damages any enemies in its return path. The Anchor has a 3.78% chance of being found in Pearlwood Crates (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) or a 1/25 (4%) chance of being found in (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) Wooden Crates which are obtained from fishing after the Wall of Flesh has been defeated.

Its best modifier is Godly or Demonic. Both modifiers increase the average damage output by the same amount. However, Ruthless might be preferred if the player already has very high critical strike chance.

The Mirage Crate is a Hardmode crate that can only be fished in the Desert biome. Mirage Crates contain items found in standard crates, and always contain one item normally found in a Sandstone Chest in the Underground Desert. It has a texture resembling that of the Forbidden armor. Its pre-Hardmode counterpart is the Oasis Crate.

The Lavaproof Tackle Bag is an accessory that combines the functionalities of its components: the Angler Earring 's 10% boost to fishing power, the Tackle Box 's chance not to consume bait, the unbreakable quality of the High Test Fishing Line, and the ability to fish in lava from the Lavaproof Fishing Hook.

The Lavaproof Tackle Bag's increase in fishing power stacks with that of the Angler Earring and the Angler Tackle Bag, granting a total boost of 30% if all three are equipped. The decreased chance to consume bait does not stack with that of the Tackle Box or the Angler Tackle Bag.
The Blue Graduation set is a Hardmode vanity set consisting of the Blue Graduation Cap and the Blue Graduation Gown. They are purchased from the Clothier for 20 GC (set) during a Waning Crescent.
These items are to be equipped in the Social Slots as they only provide a visual appearance.
Spooky armor is a Hardmode, post- Plantera summoner armor set. Crafting the full set requires a total of 750 Spooky Wood.
The set consists of the Spooky Helmet, Spooky Breastplate, and Spooky Leggings.
The full set grants the following effects while equipped:
+30 defense +4 minion slots +58% summon damage +20% movement speed A glowing effect around the player. This effect is purely visual.

Cobwebs are crafting materials used to craft Silk and other items. Cobwebs can also be placed. Placed Cobwebs catch players who fall into them and reset fall damage. They break after a short time when a player is stuck in them, and they can also be harvested instantly with any weapon or swung tool.

Cobwebs are commonly found in underground areas in clusters of 5 or more alongside the edges of walls or ceilings, and are guaranteed to drop a Cobweb item when broken. They are also found in large quantities in Spider Nests, where they regrow over time; however, Cobwebs found there only have a 1/4 (25%) chance to drop when broken.

(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) In Expert Mode Don't dig up and Get fixed boi worlds, web spit attack from Black Recluses and Jungle Creepers can randomly place Cobwebs in a 13x13 rectangular area centered on the location where Web Spit projectiles disappear.

The Zombie Elf is a Hardmode, post- Plantera enemy that spawns during the Frost Moon event. They are the most basic fighter-type enemy that spawns during the event, and despite being relatively easy to hold off, they still deal heavy contact damage.
Defeating a Zombie Elf during the Frost Moon event will add 1 / 2 / 2.5 points to the final score.
All Zombie Elf varieties require 100 kills to be awarded completion of their Bestiary entry and corresponding banner, as opposed to the usual 50 kills.
Spooky Wood Wall is a type of background Wall that resembles Wood Wall in texture, but tinted purple. It can be crafted from Spooky Wood.

The Houndius Shootius is a pre-Hardmode sentry summon weapon. It can summon the Houndius Shootius sentry, which lasts for 10 minutes, remains stationary, and does not count against the player's minion capacity. The Houndius Shootius shoots small fireballs at enemies from its floating eyeball that dissipate upon hitting an enemy or surface. The eyeball will always gaze toward the nearest player unless an enemy is close enough to attack, in which case it will gaze toward the targeted enemy. When used, the sentry will attempt to be summoned at the cursor, however, if used while the cursor is midair, the sentry will spawn on the closest blocks directly downwards of the cursor. The Houndius Shootius has a 1/4 (25%) chance of being dropped by Deerclops.
Its best modifiers are Mythical, Furious, or Godly. Rounding reveals that these modifiers provide the same increase to damage as the Ruthless modifier, increasing it from 24 to 28.
The Berserker's Glove is a Hardmode accessory crafted from the Power Glove and Flesh Knuckles, granting the abilities of both. It grants the following:
+8 defense +12% increased melee speed +100% increased melee knockback +10% increased melee weapon size +400 aggro Autoswing for melee weapons and whips
The Universal Pylon is a Hardmode, post- Moon Lord pylon obtained by completing 100% of the Bestiary, at which point it will be sold by the Zoologist for 1 PC.
It can be placed anywhere, and used in any biome. Unlike other pylon variants, it does not require a nearby NPC to function. Only one Universal Pylon can be placed in a world.

The Clown is an uncommon Hardmode enemy that only appears during Blood Moons. Although it has a chance to inflict the Confused debuff upon contact with the player, its primary weapons are yellow Happy Bombs, which are thrown in an arc, bounce off surfaces, and deal high damage but do not destroy tiles. On the Desktop version, Console version, and Mobile version, Clowns can also throw Chattering Teeth Bombs.
Once the player has defeated at least one Clown in a world, the Clothier will start selling the Clown set.

It is one of the few entities that can be detected by the Lifeform Analyzer (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) or its upgrades. The Clown requires 25 kills to be awarded completion of its Bestiary entry and corresponding banner, as opposed to the usual 50 kills.
The Pixel Box is a mechanism that can be bought from the Mechanic for 2 SC. When activated, it looks fully illuminated but does not emit light.

Pixel Boxes can be placed anywhere, even if a wall is not present, similarly to Logic Gates. They are always placed in the deactivated state. If a wire to the left or right of the Pixel Box is turned on, the Pixel Box will turn off. If a wire below or above the Pixel Box is turned on at the same time, however, the Pixel Box will turn on. Turning on the wire only below or above will have no effect. Wires must be placed on the Pixel Box in order for them to function.

The Bee Cloak is a Hardmode accessory that combines the effects of the Star Cloak and the Honey Comb. When the player is injured, three stars will fall on the player's current location and bees are released.
